1742 LogSetNextTextDecoration("---", NULL);
1743 RenderTextEllipsis(window->DrawList, label_pos, ImVec2(bb.Max.x, bb.Max.y + style.ItemSpacing.y), bb.Max.x, label, label_end, &label_size);
1744 }
1745 else
1746 {
1747 if (g.LogEnabled)
1748 LogText("---");
1749 if (separator_thickness > 0.0f)
1750 window->DrawList->AddLine(ImVec2(sep1_x1, seps_y), ImVec2(sep2_x2, seps_y), separator_col, separator_thickness);
1751 }
1752}
1753
1754void ImGui::SeparatorText(const char* label)
1755{
1756 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
1757 if (window->SkipItems)
1758 return;
1759
1760 // The SeparatorText() vs SeparatorTextEx() distinction is designed to be considerate that we may want:
1761 // - allow separator-text to be draggable items (would require a stable ID + a noticeable highlight)
1762 // - this high-level entry point to allow formatting? (which in turns may require ID separate from formatted string)
1763 // - because of this we probably can't turn 'const char* label' into 'const char* fmt, ...'
1764 // Otherwise, we can decide that users wanting to drag this would layout a dedicated drag-item,
1765 // and then we can turn this into a format function.
1766 SeparatorTextEx(0, label, FindRenderedTextEnd(label), 0.0f);
1767}
1768
1769// Using 'hover_visibility_delay' allows us to hide the highlight and mouse cursor for a short time, which can be convenient to reduce visual noise.
1770bool ImGui::SplitterBehavior(const ImRect& bb, ImGuiID id, ImGuiAxis axis, float* size1, float* size2, float min_size1, float min_size2, float hover_extend, float hover_visibility_delay, ImU32 bg_col)
1771{
1772 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
1773 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
1774
1775 if (!ItemAdd(bb, id, NULL, ImGuiItemFlags_NoNav))
1776 return false;
1777
1778 // FIXME: AFAIK the only leftover reason for passing ImGuiButtonFlags_AllowOverlap here is
1779 // to allow caller of SplitterBehavior() to call SetItemAllowOverlap() after the item.
1780 // Nowadays we would instead want to use SetNextItemAllowOverlap() before the item.
1781 ImGuiButtonFlags button_flags = ImGuiButtonFlags_FlattenChildren;
1782#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
1783 button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_AllowOverlap;
1784#endif
1785
1786 bool hovered, held;
1787 ImRect bb_interact = bb;
1788 bb_interact.Expand(axis == ImGuiAxis_Y ? ImVec2(0.0f, hover_extend) : ImVec2(hover_extend, 0.0f));
1789 ButtonBehavior(bb_interact, id, &hovered, &held, button_flags);
1790 if (hovered)
1791 g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredRect; // for IsItemHovered(), because bb_interact is larger than bb
1792
1793 if (held || (hovered && g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame == id && g.HoveredIdTimer >= hover_visibility_delay))
1794 SetMouseCursor(axis == ImGuiAxis_Y ? ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeNS : ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeEW);
1795
1796 ImRect bb_render = bb;
1797 if (held)
1798 {
1799 float mouse_delta = (g.IO.MousePos - g.ActiveIdClickOffset - bb_interact.Min)[axis];
1800
1801 // Minimum pane size
1802 float size_1_maximum_delta = ImMax(0.0f, *size1 - min_size1);
1803 float size_2_maximum_delta = ImMax(0.0f, *size2 - min_size2);
1804 if (mouse_delta < -size_1_maximum_delta)
1805 mouse_delta = -size_1_maximum_delta;
1806 if (mouse_delta > size_2_maximum_delta)
1807 mouse_delta = size_2_maximum_delta;
1808
1809 // Apply resize
1810 if (mouse_delta != 0.0f)
1811 {
1812 *size1 = ImMax(*size1 + mouse_delta, min_size1);
1813 *size2 = ImMax(*size2 - mouse_delta, min_size2);
1814 bb_render.Translate((axis == ImGuiAxis_X) ? ImVec2(mouse_delta, 0.0f) : ImVec2(0.0f, mouse_delta));
1815 MarkItemEdited(id);
1816 }
1817 }
1818
1819 // Render at new position
1820 if (bg_col & IM_COL32_A_MASK)
1821 window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(bb_render.Min, bb_render.Max, bg_col, 0.0f);
1822 const ImU32 col = GetColorU32(held ? ImGuiCol_SeparatorActive : (hovered && g.HoveredIdTimer >= hover_visibility_delay) ? ImGuiCol_SeparatorHovered : ImGuiCol_Separator);
1823 window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(bb_render.Min, bb_render.Max, col, 0.0f);
1824
1825 return held;
1826}
1827
1828static int IMGUI_CDECL ShrinkWidthItemComparer(const void* lhs, const void* rhs)
1829{
1830 const ImGuiShrinkWidthItem* a = (const ImGuiShrinkWidthItem*)lhs;
1831 const ImGuiShrinkWidthItem* b = (const ImGuiShrinkWidthItem*)rhs;
1832 if (int d = (int)(b->Width - a->Width))
1833 return d;
1834 return (b->Index - a->Index);
1835}
1836
1837// Shrink excess width from a set of item, by removing width from the larger items first.
1838// Set items Width to -1.0f to disable shrinking this item.
1839void ImGui::ShrinkWidths(ImGuiShrinkWidthItem* items, int count, float width_excess)
1840{
1841 if (count == 1)
1842 {
1843 if (items[0].Width >= 0.0f)
1844 items[0].Width = ImMax(items[0].Width - width_excess, 1.0f);
1845 return;
1846 }
1847 ImQsort(items, (size_t)count, sizeof(ImGuiShrinkWidthItem), ShrinkWidthItemComparer);
1848 int count_same_width = 1;
1849 while (width_excess > 0.0f && count_same_width < count)
1850 {
1851 while (count_same_width < count && items[0].Width <= items[count_same_width].Width)
1852 count_same_width++;
1853 float max_width_to_remove_per_item = (count_same_width < count && items[count_same_width].Width >= 0.0f) ? (items[0].Width - items[count_same_width].Width) : (items[0].Width - 1.0f);
1854 if (max_width_to_remove_per_item <= 0.0f)
1855 break;
1856 float width_to_remove_per_item = ImMin(width_excess / count_same_width, max_width_to_remove_per_item);
1857 for (int item_n = 0; item_n < count_same_width; item_n++)
1858 items[item_n].Width -= width_to_remove_per_item;
1859 width_excess -= width_to_remove_per_item * count_same_width;
1860 }
1861
1862 // Round width and redistribute remainder
1863 // Ensure that e.g. the right-most tab of a shrunk tab-bar always reaches exactly at the same distance from the right-most edge of the tab bar separator.
1864 width_excess = 0.0f;
1865 for (int n = 0; n < count; n++)
1866 {
1867 float width_rounded = ImTrunc(items[n].Width);
1868 width_excess += items[n].Width - width_rounded;
1869 items[n].Width = width_rounded;
1870 }
1871 while (width_excess > 0.0f)
1872 for (int n = 0; n < count && width_excess > 0.0f; n++)
1873 {
1874 float width_to_add = ImMin(items[n].InitialWidth - items[n].Width, 1.0f);
1875 items[n].Width += width_to_add;
1876 width_excess -= width_to_add;
1877 }
1878}
1879
1880//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
1881// [SECTION] Widgets: ComboBox
1882//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
1883// - CalcMaxPopupHeightFromItemCount() [Internal]
1884// - BeginCombo()
1885// - BeginComboPopup() [Internal]
1886// - EndCombo()
1887// - BeginComboPreview() [Internal]
1888// - EndComboPreview() [Internal]
1889// - Combo()
1890//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
1891
1892static float CalcMaxPopupHeightFromItemCount(int items_count)
1893{
1894 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
1895 if (items_count <= 0)
1896 return FLT_MAX;
1897 return (g.FontSize + g.Style.ItemSpacing.y) * items_count - g.Style.ItemSpacing.y + (g.Style.WindowPadding.y * 2);
1898}
1899
1900bool ImGui::BeginCombo(const char* label, const char* preview_value, ImGuiComboFlags flags)
1901{
1902 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
1903 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
1904
1905 ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags backup_next_window_data_flags = g.NextWindowData.HasFlags;
1906 g.NextWindowData.ClearFlags(); // We behave like Begin() and need to consume those values
1907 if (window->SkipItems)
1908 return false;
1909
1910 const ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
1911 const ImGuiID id = window->GetID(label);
1912 IM_ASSERT((flags & (ImGuiComboFlags_NoArrowButton | ImGuiComboFlags_NoPreview)) != (ImGuiComboFlags_NoArrowButton | ImGuiComboFlags_NoPreview)); // Can't use both flags together
1913 if (flags & ImGuiComboFlags_WidthFitPreview)
1914 IM_ASSERT((flags & (ImGuiComboFlags_NoPreview | (ImGuiComboFlags)ImGuiComboFlags_CustomPreview)) == 0);
1915
1916 const float arrow_size = (flags & ImGuiComboFlags_NoArrowButton) ? 0.0f : GetFrameHeight();
1917 const ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
1918 const float preview_width = ((flags & ImGuiComboFlags_WidthFitPreview) && (preview_value != NULL)) ? CalcTextSize(preview_value, NULL, true).x : 0.0f;
1919 const float w = (flags & ImGuiComboFlags_NoPreview) ? arrow_size : ((flags & ImGuiComboFlags_WidthFitPreview) ? (arrow_size + preview_width + style.FramePadding.x * 2.0f) : CalcItemWidth());
1920 const ImRect bb(window->DC.CursorPos, window->DC.CursorPos + ImVec2(w, label_size.y + style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f));
1921 const ImRect total_bb(bb.Min, bb.Max + ImVec2(label_size.x > 0.0f ? style.ItemInnerSpacing.x + label_size.x : 0.0f, 0.0f));
1922 ItemSize(total_bb, style.FramePadding.y);
1923 if (!ItemAdd(total_bb, id, &bb))
1924 return false;
1925
1926 // Open on click
1927 bool hovered, held;
1928 bool pressed = ButtonBehavior(bb, id, &hovered, &held);
1929 const ImGuiID popup_id = ImHashStr("##ComboPopup", 0, id);
1930 bool popup_open = IsPopupOpen(popup_id, ImGuiPopupFlags_None);
1931 if (pressed && !popup_open)
1932 {
1933 OpenPopupEx(popup_id, ImGuiPopupFlags_None);
1934 popup_open = true;
1935 }
1936
1937 // Render shape
1938 const ImU32 frame_col = GetColorU32(hovered ? ImGuiCol_FrameBgHovered : ImGuiCol_FrameBg);
1939 const float value_x2 = ImMax(bb.Min.x, bb.Max.x - arrow_size);
1940 RenderNavCursor(bb, id);
1941 if (!(flags & ImGuiComboFlags_NoPreview))
1942 window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(bb.Min, ImVec2(value_x2, bb.Max.y), frame_col, style.FrameRounding, (flags & ImGuiComboFlags_NoArrowButton) ? ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersAll : ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersLeft);
1943 if (!(flags & ImGuiComboFlags_NoArrowButton))
1944 {
1945 ImU32 bg_col = GetColorU32((popup_open || hovered) ? ImGuiCol_ButtonHovered : ImGuiCol_Button);
1946 ImU32 text_col = GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text);
1947 window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(value_x2, bb.Min.y), bb.Max, bg_col, style.FrameRounding, (w <= arrow_size) ? ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersAll : ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersRight);
1948 if (value_x2 + arrow_size - style.FramePadding.x <= bb.Max.x)
1949 RenderArrow(window->DrawList, ImVec2(value_x2 + style.FramePadding.y, bb.Min.y + style.FramePadding.y), text_col, ImGuiDir_Down, 1.0f);
1950 }
1951 RenderFrameBorder(bb.Min, bb.Max, style.FrameRounding);
1952
1953 // Custom preview
1954 if (flags & ImGuiComboFlags_CustomPreview)
1955 {
1956 g.ComboPreviewData.PreviewRect = ImRect(bb.Min.x, bb.Min.y, value_x2, bb.Max.y);
1957 IM_ASSERT(preview_value == NULL || preview_value[0] == 0);
1958 preview_value = NULL;
1959 }
1960
1961 // Render preview and label
1962 if (preview_value != NULL && !(flags & ImGuiComboFlags_NoPreview))
1963 {
1964 if (g.LogEnabled)
1965 LogSetNextTextDecoration("{", "}");
1966 RenderTextClipped(bb.Min + style.FramePadding, ImVec2(value_x2, bb.Max.y), preview_value, NULL, NULL);
1967 }
1968 if (label_size.x > 0)
1969 RenderText(ImVec2(bb.Max.x + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x, bb.Min.y + style.FramePadding.y), label);
1970
1971 if (!popup_open)
1972 return false;
1973
1974 g.NextWindowData.HasFlags = backup_next_window_data_flags;
1975 return BeginComboPopup(popup_id, bb, flags);
1976}
1977
1978bool ImGui::BeginComboPopup(ImGuiID popup_id, const ImRect& bb, ImGuiComboFlags flags)
1979{
1980 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
1981 if (!IsPopupOpen(popup_id, ImGuiPopupFlags_None))
1982 {
1983 g.NextWindowData.ClearFlags();
1984 return false;
1985 }
1986
1987 // Set popup size
1988 float w = bb.GetWidth();
1989 if (g.NextWindowData.HasFlags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasSizeConstraint)
1990 {
1991 g.NextWindowData.SizeConstraintRect.Min.x = ImMax(g.NextWindowData.SizeConstraintRect.Min.x, w);
1992 }
1993 else
1994 {
1995 if ((flags & ImGuiComboFlags_HeightMask_) == 0)
1996 flags |= ImGuiComboFlags_HeightRegular;
1997 IM_ASSERT(ImIsPowerOfTwo(flags & ImGuiComboFlags_HeightMask_)); // Only one
1998 int popup_max_height_in_items = -1;
1999 if (flags & ImGuiComboFlags_HeightRegular) popup_max_height_in_items = 8;
2000 else if (flags & ImGuiComboFlags_HeightSmall) popup_max_height_in_items = 4;
2001 else if (flags & ImGuiComboFlags_HeightLarge) popup_max_height_in_items = 20;
2002 ImVec2 constraint_min(0.0f, 0.0f), constraint_max(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX);
2003 if ((g.NextWindowData.HasFlags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasSize) == 0 || g.NextWindowData.SizeVal.x <= 0.0f) // Don't apply constraints if user specified a size
2004 constraint_min.x = w;
2005 if ((g.NextWindowData.HasFlags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasSize) == 0 || g.NextWindowData.SizeVal.y <= 0.0f)
2006 constraint_max.y = CalcMaxPopupHeightFromItemCount(popup_max_height_in_items);
2007 SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(constraint_min, constraint_max);
2008 }
2009
2010 // This is essentially a specialized version of BeginPopupEx()
2011 char name[16];
2012 ImFormatString(name, IM_ARRAYSIZE(name), "##Combo_%02d", g.BeginComboDepth); // Recycle windows based on depth
2013
2014 // Set position given a custom constraint (peak into expected window size so we can position it)
2015 // FIXME: This might be easier to express with an hypothetical SetNextWindowPosConstraints() function?
2016 // FIXME: This might be moved to Begin() or at least around the same spot where Tooltips and other Popups are calling FindBestWindowPosForPopupEx()?
2017 if (ImGuiWindow* popup_window = FindWindowByName(name))
2018 if (popup_window->WasActive)
2019 {
2020 // Always override 'AutoPosLastDirection' to not leave a chance for a past value to affect us.
2021 ImVec2 size_expected = CalcWindowNextAutoFitSize(popup_window);
2022 popup_window->AutoPosLastDirection = (flags & ImGuiComboFlags_PopupAlignLeft) ? ImGuiDir_Left : ImGuiDir_Down; // Left = "Below, Toward Left", Down = "Below, Toward Right (default)"
2023 ImRect r_outer = GetPopupAllowedExtentRect(popup_window);
2024 ImVec2 pos = FindBestWindowPosForPopupEx(bb.GetBL(), size_expected, &popup_window->AutoPosLastDirection, r_outer, bb, ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy_ComboBox);
2025 SetNextWindowPos(pos);
2026 }
2027
2028 // We don't use BeginPopupEx() solely because we have a custom name string, which we could make an argument to BeginPopupEx()
2029 ImGuiWindowFlags window_flags = ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove;
2030 PushStyleVarX(ImGuiStyleVar_WindowPadding, g.Style.FramePadding.x); // Horizontally align ourselves with the framed text
2031 bool ret = Begin(name, NULL, window_flags);
2032 PopStyleVar();
2033 if (!ret)
2034 {
2035 EndPopup();
2036 IM_ASSERT(0); // This should never happen as we tested for IsPopupOpen() above
2037 return false;
2038 }
2039 g.BeginComboDepth++;
2040 return true;
2041}
2042
2043void ImGui::EndCombo()
2044{
2045 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2046 EndPopup();
2047 g.BeginComboDepth--;
2048}
2049
2050// Call directly after the BeginCombo/EndCombo block. The preview is designed to only host non-interactive elements
2051// (Experimental, see GitHub issues: #1658, #4168)
2052bool ImGui::BeginComboPreview()
2053{
2054 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2055 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
2056 ImGuiComboPreviewData* preview_data = &g.ComboPreviewData;
2057
2058 if (window->SkipItems || !(g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Visible))
2059 return false;
2060 IM_ASSERT(g.LastItemData.Rect.Min.x == preview_data->PreviewRect.Min.x && g.LastItemData.Rect.Min.y == preview_data->PreviewRect.Min.y); // Didn't call after BeginCombo/EndCombo block or forgot to pass ImGuiComboFlags_CustomPreview flag?
2061 if (!window->ClipRect.Overlaps(preview_data->PreviewRect)) // Narrower test (optional)
2062 return false;
2063
2064 // FIXME: This could be contained in a PushWorkRect() api
2065 preview_data->BackupCursorPos = window->DC.CursorPos;
2066 preview_data->BackupCursorMaxPos = window->DC.CursorMaxPos;
2067 preview_data->BackupCursorPosPrevLine = window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine;
2068 preview_data->BackupPrevLineTextBaseOffset = window->DC.PrevLineTextBaseOffset;
2069 preview_data->BackupLayout = window->DC.LayoutType;
2070 window->DC.CursorPos = preview_data->PreviewRect.Min + g.Style.FramePadding;
2071 window->DC.CursorMaxPos = window->DC.CursorPos;
2072 window->DC.LayoutType = ImGuiLayoutType_Horizontal;
2073 window->DC.IsSameLine = false;
2074 PushClipRect(preview_data->PreviewRect.Min, preview_data->PreviewRect.Max, true);
2075
2076 return true;
2077}
2078
2079void ImGui::EndComboPreview()
2080{
2081 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2082 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
2083 ImGuiComboPreviewData* preview_data = &g.ComboPreviewData;
2084
2085 // FIXME: Using CursorMaxPos approximation instead of correct AABB which we will store in ImDrawCmd in the future
2086 ImDrawList* draw_list = window->DrawList;
2087 if (window->DC.CursorMaxPos.x < preview_data->PreviewRect.Max.x && window->DC.CursorMaxPos.y < preview_data->PreviewRect.Max.y)
2088 if (draw_list->CmdBuffer.Size > 1) // Unlikely case that the PushClipRect() didn't create a command
2089 {
2090 draw_list->_CmdHeader.ClipRect = draw_list->CmdBuffer[draw_list->CmdBuffer.Size - 1].ClipRect = draw_list->CmdBuffer[draw_list->CmdBuffer.Size - 2].ClipRect;
2091 draw_list->_TryMergeDrawCmds();
2092 }
2093 PopClipRect();
2094 window->DC.CursorPos = preview_data->BackupCursorPos;
2095 window->DC.CursorMaxPos = ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos, preview_data->BackupCursorMaxPos);
2096 window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine = preview_data->BackupCursorPosPrevLine;
2097 window->DC.PrevLineTextBaseOffset = preview_data->BackupPrevLineTextBaseOffset;
2098 window->DC.LayoutType = preview_data->BackupLayout;
2099 window->DC.IsSameLine = false;
2100 preview_data->PreviewRect = ImRect();
2101}
2102
2103// Getter for the old Combo() API: const char*[]
2104static const char* Items_ArrayGetter(void* data, int idx)
2105{
2106 const char* const* items = (const char* const*)data;
2107 return items[idx];
2108}
2109
2110// Getter for the old Combo() API: "item1\0item2\0item3\0"
2111static const char* Items_SingleStringGetter(void* data, int idx)
2112{
2113 const char* items_separated_by_zeros = (const char*)data;
2114 int items_count = 0;
2115 const char* p = items_separated_by_zeros;
2116 while (*p)
2117 {
2118 if (idx == items_count)
2119 break;
2120 p += ImStrlen(p) + 1;
2121 items_count++;
2122 }
2123 return *p ? p : NULL;
2124}
2125
2126// Old API, prefer using BeginCombo() nowadays if you can.
2127bool ImGui::Combo(const char* label, int* current_item, const char* (*getter)(void* user_data, int idx), void* user_data, int items_count, int popup_max_height_in_items)
2128{
2129 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2130
2131 // Call the getter to obtain the preview string which is a parameter to BeginCombo()
2132 const char* preview_value = NULL;
2133 if (*current_item >= 0 && *current_item < items_count)
2134 preview_value = getter(user_data, *current_item);
2135
2136 // The old Combo() API exposed "popup_max_height_in_items". The new more general BeginCombo() API doesn't have/need it, but we emulate it here.
2137 if (popup_max_height_in_items != -1 && !(g.NextWindowData.HasFlags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasSizeConstraint))
2138 SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(0, 0), ImVec2(FLT_MAX, CalcMaxPopupHeightFromItemCount(popup_max_height_in_items)));
2139
2140 if (!BeginCombo(label, preview_value, ImGuiComboFlags_None))
2141 return false;
2142
2143 // Display items
2144 bool value_changed = false;
2145 ImGuiListClipper clipper;
2146 clipper.Begin(items_count);
2147 clipper.IncludeItemByIndex(*current_item);
2148 while (clipper.Step())
2149 for (int i = clipper.DisplayStart; i < clipper.DisplayEnd; i++)
2150 {
2151 const char* item_text = getter(user_data, i);
2152 if (item_text == NULL)
2153 item_text = "*Unknown item*";
2154
2155 PushID(i);
2156 const bool item_selected = (i == *current_item);
2157 if (Selectable(item_text, item_selected) && *current_item != i)
2158 {
2159 value_changed = true;
2160 *current_item = i;
2161 }
2162 if (item_selected)
2163 SetItemDefaultFocus();
2164 PopID();
2165 }
2166
2167 EndCombo();
2168 if (value_changed)
2169 MarkItemEdited(g.LastItemData.ID);
2170
2171 return value_changed;
2172}
2173
2174// Combo box helper allowing to pass an array of strings.
2175bool ImGui::Combo(const char* label, int* current_item, const char* const items[], int items_count, int height_in_items)
2176{
2177 const bool value_changed = Combo(label, current_item, Items_ArrayGetter, (void*)items, items_count, height_in_items);
2178 return value_changed;
2179}
2180
2181// Combo box helper allowing to pass all items in a single string literal holding multiple zero-terminated items "item1\0item2\0"
2182bool ImGui::Combo(const char* label, int* current_item, const char* items_separated_by_zeros, int height_in_items)
2183{
2184 int items_count = 0;
2185 const char* p = items_separated_by_zeros; // FIXME-OPT: Avoid computing this, or at least only when combo is open
2186 while (*p)
2187 {
2188 p += ImStrlen(p) + 1;
2189 items_count++;
2190 }
2191 bool value_changed = Combo(label, current_item, Items_SingleStringGetter, (void*)items_separated_by_zeros, items_count, height_in_items);
2192 return value_changed;
2193}
2194
2195#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
2196
2197struct ImGuiGetNameFromIndexOldToNewCallbackData { void* UserData; bool (*OldCallback)(void*, int, const char**); };
2198static const char* ImGuiGetNameFromIndexOldToNewCallback(void* user_data, int idx)
2199{
2200 ImGuiGetNameFromIndexOldToNewCallbackData* data = (ImGuiGetNameFromIndexOldToNewCallbackData*)user_data;
2201 const char* s = NULL;
2202 data->OldCallback(data->UserData, idx, &s);
2203 return s;
2204}
2205
2206bool ImGui::ListBox(const char* label, int* current_item, bool (*old_getter)(void*, int, const char**), void* user_data, int items_count, int height_in_items)
2207{
2208 ImGuiGetNameFromIndexOldToNewCallbackData old_to_new_data = { user_data, old_getter };
2209 return ListBox(label, current_item, ImGuiGetNameFromIndexOldToNewCallback, &old_to_new_data, items_count, height_in_items);
2210}
2211bool ImGui::Combo(const char* label, int* current_item, bool (*old_getter)(void*, int, const char**), void* user_data, int items_count, int popup_max_height_in_items)
2212{
2213 ImGuiGetNameFromIndexOldToNewCallbackData old_to_new_data = { user_data, old_getter };
2214 return Combo(label, current_item, ImGuiGetNameFromIndexOldToNewCallback, &old_to_new_data, items_count, popup_max_height_in_items);
2215}
2216
2217#endif
2218
2219//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
2220// [SECTION] Data Type and Data Formatting Helpers [Internal]
2221//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
2222// - DataTypeGetInfo()
2223// - DataTypeFormatString()
2224// - DataTypeApplyOp()
2225// - DataTypeApplyFromText()
2226// - DataTypeCompare()
2227// - DataTypeClamp()
2228// - GetMinimumStepAtDecimalPrecision
2229// - RoundScalarWithFormat<>()
2230//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
2231
2232static const ImGuiDataTypeInfo GDataTypeInfo[] =
2233{
2234 { sizeof(char), "S8", "%d", "%d" }, // ImGuiDataType_S8
2235 { sizeof(unsigned char), "U8", "%u", "%u" },
2236 { sizeof(short), "S16", "%d", "%d" }, // ImGuiDataType_S16
2237 { sizeof(unsigned short), "U16", "%u", "%u" },
2238 { sizeof(int), "S32", "%d", "%d" }, // ImGuiDataType_S32
2239 { sizeof(unsigned int), "U32", "%u", "%u" },
2240#ifdef _MSC_VER
2241 { sizeof(ImS64), "S64", "%I64d","%I64d" }, // ImGuiDataType_S64
2242 { sizeof(ImU64), "U64", "%I64u","%I64u" },
2243#else
2244 { sizeof(ImS64), "S64", "%lld", "%lld" }, // ImGuiDataType_S64
2245 { sizeof(ImU64), "U64", "%llu", "%llu" },
2246#endif
2247 { sizeof(float), "float", "%.3f","%f" }, // ImGuiDataType_Float (float are promoted to double in va_arg)
2248 { sizeof(double), "double","%f", "%lf" }, // ImGuiDataType_Double
2249 { sizeof(bool), "bool", "%d", "%d" }, // ImGuiDataType_Bool
2250 { 0, "char*","%s", "%s" }, // ImGuiDataType_String
2251};
2252IM_STATIC_ASSERT(IM_ARRAYSIZE(GDataTypeInfo) == ImGuiDataType_COUNT);
2253
2254const ImGuiDataTypeInfo* ImGui::DataTypeGetInfo(ImGuiDataType data_type)
2255{
2256 IM_ASSERT(data_type >= 0 && data_type < ImGuiDataType_COUNT);
2257 return &GDataTypeInfo[data_type];
2258}
2259
2260int ImGui::DataTypeFormatString(char* buf, int buf_size, ImGuiDataType data_type, const void* p_data, const char* format)
2261{
2262 // Signedness doesn't matter when pushing integer arguments
2263 if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_S32 || data_type == ImGuiDataType_U32)
2264 return ImFormatString(buf, buf_size, format, *(const ImU32*)p_data);
2265 if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_S64 || data_type == ImGuiDataType_U64)
2266 return ImFormatString(buf, buf_size, format, *(const ImU64*)p_data);
2267 if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_Float)
2268 return ImFormatString(buf, buf_size, format, *(const float*)p_data);
2269 if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_Double)
2270 return ImFormatString(buf, buf_size, format, *(const double*)p_data);
2271 if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_S8)
2272 return ImFormatString(buf, buf_size, format, *(const ImS8*)p_data);
2273 if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_U8)
2274 return ImFormatString(buf, buf_size, format, *(const ImU8*)p_data);
2275 if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_S16)
2276 return ImFormatString(buf, buf_size, format, *(const ImS16*)p_data);
2277 if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_U16)
2278 return ImFormatString(buf, buf_size, format, *(const ImU16*)p_data);
2279 IM_ASSERT(0);
2280 return 0;
2281}
2282
2283void ImGui::DataTypeApplyOp(ImGuiDataType data_type, int op, void* output, const void* arg1, const void* arg2)
2284{
2285 IM_ASSERT(op == '+' || op == '-');
2286 switch (data_type)
2287 {
2288 case ImGuiDataType_S8:
2289 if (op == '+') { *(ImS8*)output = ImAddClampOverflow(*(const ImS8*)arg1, *(const ImS8*)arg2, IM_S8_MIN, IM_S8_MAX); }
2290 if (op == '-') { *(ImS8*)output = ImSubClampOverflow(*(const ImS8*)arg1, *(const ImS8*)arg2, IM_S8_MIN, IM_S8_MAX); }
2291 return;
2292 case ImGuiDataType_U8:
2293 if (op == '+') { *(ImU8*)output = ImAddClampOverflow(*(const ImU8*)arg1, *(const ImU8*)arg2, IM_U8_MIN, IM_U8_MAX); }
2294 if (op == '-') { *(ImU8*)output = ImSubClampOverflow(*(const ImU8*)arg1, *(const ImU8*)arg2, IM_U8_MIN, IM_U8_MAX); }
2295 return;
2296 case ImGuiDataType_S16:
2297 if (op == '+') { *(ImS16*)output = ImAddClampOverflow(*(const ImS16*)arg1, *(const ImS16*)arg2, IM_S16_MIN, IM_S16_MAX); }
2298 if (op == '-') { *(ImS16*)output = ImSubClampOverflow(*(const ImS16*)arg1, *(const ImS16*)arg2, IM_S16_MIN, IM_S16_MAX); }
2299 return;
2300 case ImGuiDataType_U16:
2301 if (op == '+') { *(ImU16*)output = ImAddClampOverflow(*(const ImU16*)arg1, *(const ImU16*)arg2, IM_U16_MIN, IM_U16_MAX); }
2302 if (op == '-') { *(ImU16*)output = ImSubClampOverflow(*(const ImU16*)arg1, *(const ImU16*)arg2, IM_U16_MIN, IM_U16_MAX); }
2303 return;
2304 case ImGuiDataType_S32:
2305 if (op == '+') { *(ImS32*)output = ImAddClampOverflow(*(const ImS32*)arg1, *(const ImS32*)arg2, IM_S32_MIN, IM_S32_MAX); }
2306 if (op == '-') { *(ImS32*)output = ImSubClampOverflow(*(const ImS32*)arg1, *(const ImS32*)arg2, IM_S32_MIN, IM_S32_MAX); }
2307 return;
2308 case ImGuiDataType_U32:
2309 if (op == '+') { *(ImU32*)output = ImAddClampOverflow(*(const ImU32*)arg1, *(const ImU32*)arg2, IM_U32_MIN, IM_U32_MAX); }
2310 if (op == '-') { *(ImU32*)output = ImSubClampOverflow(*(const ImU32*)arg1, *(const ImU32*)arg2, IM_U32_MIN, IM_U32_MAX); }
2311 return;
2312 case ImGuiDataType_S64:
2313 if (op == '+') { *(ImS64*)output = ImAddClampOverflow(*(const ImS64*)arg1, *(const ImS64*)arg2, IM_S64_MIN, IM_S64_MAX); }
2314 if (op == '-') { *(ImS64*)output = ImSubClampOverflow(*(const ImS64*)arg1, *(const ImS64*)arg2, IM_S64_MIN, IM_S64_MAX); }
2315 return;
2316 case ImGuiDataType_U64:
2317 if (op == '+') { *(ImU64*)output = ImAddClampOverflow(*(const ImU64*)arg1, *(const ImU64*)arg2, IM_U64_MIN, IM_U64_MAX); }
2318 if (op == '-') { *(ImU64*)output = ImSubClampOverflow(*(const ImU64*)arg1, *(const ImU64*)arg2, IM_U64_MIN, IM_U64_MAX); }
2319 return;
2320 case ImGuiDataType_Float:
2321 if (op == '+') { *(float*)output = *(const float*)arg1 + *(const float*)arg2; }
2322 if (op == '-') { *(float*)output = *(const float*)arg1 - *(const float*)arg2; }
2323 return;
2324 case ImGuiDataType_Double:
2325 if (op == '+') { *(double*)output = *(const double*)arg1 + *(const double*)arg2; }
2326 if (op == '-') { *(double*)output = *(const double*)arg1 - *(const double*)arg2; }
2327 return;
2328 case ImGuiDataType_COUNT: break;
2329 }
2330 IM_ASSERT(0);
2331}
2332
2333// User can input math operators (e.g. +100) to edit a numerical values.
2334// NB: This is _not_ a full expression evaluator. We should probably add one and replace this dumb mess..
2335bool ImGui::DataTypeApplyFromText(const char* buf, ImGuiDataType data_type, void* p_data, const char* format, void* p_data_when_empty)
2336{
2337 // Copy the value in an opaque buffer so we can compare at the end of the function if it changed at all.
2338 const ImGuiDataTypeInfo* type_info = DataTypeGetInfo(data_type);
2339 ImGuiDataTypeStorage data_backup;
2340 memcpy(&data_backup, p_data, type_info->Size);
2341
2342 while (ImCharIsBlankA(*buf))
2343 buf++;
2344 if (!buf[0])
2345 {
2346 if (p_data_when_empty != NULL)
2347 {
2348 memcpy(p_data, p_data_when_empty, type_info->Size);
2349 return memcmp(&data_backup, p_data, type_info->Size) != 0;
2350 }
2351 return false;
2352 }
2353
2354 // Sanitize format
2355 // - For float/double we have to ignore format with precision (e.g. "%.2f") because sscanf doesn't take them in, so force them into %f and %lf
2356 // - In theory could treat empty format as using default, but this would only cover rare/bizarre case of using InputScalar() + integer + format string without %.
2357 char format_sanitized[32];
2358 if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_Float || data_type == ImGuiDataType_Double)
2359 format = type_info->ScanFmt;
2360 else
2361 format = ImParseFormatSanitizeForScanning(format, format_sanitized, IM_ARRAYSIZE(format_sanitized));
2362
2363 // Small types need a 32-bit buffer to receive the result from scanf()
2364 int v32 = 0;
2365 if (sscanf(buf, format, type_info->Size >= 4 ? p_data : &v32) < 1)
2366 return false;
2367 if (type_info->Size < 4)
2368 {
2369 if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_S8)
2370 *(ImS8*)p_data = (ImS8)ImClamp(v32, (int)IM_S8_MIN, (int)IM_S8_MAX);
2371 else if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_U8)
2372 *(ImU8*)p_data = (ImU8)ImClamp(v32, (int)IM_U8_MIN, (int)IM_U8_MAX);
2373 else if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_S16)
2374 *(ImS16*)p_data = (ImS16)ImClamp(v32, (int)IM_S16_MIN, (int)IM_S16_MAX);
2375 else if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_U16)
2376 *(ImU16*)p_data = (ImU16)ImClamp(v32, (int)IM_U16_MIN, (int)IM_U16_MAX);
2377 else
2378 IM_ASSERT(0);
2379 }
2380
2381 return memcmp(&data_backup, p_data, type_info->Size) != 0;
2382}
2383
2384template<typename T>
2385static int DataTypeCompareT(const T* lhs, const T* rhs)
2386{
2387 if (*lhs < *rhs) return -1;
2388 if (*lhs > *rhs) return +1;
2389 return 0;
2390}
2391
2392int ImGui::DataTypeCompare(ImGuiDataType data_type, const void* arg_1, const void* arg_2)
2393{
2394 switch (data_type)
2395 {
2396 case ImGuiDataType_S8: return DataTypeCompareT<ImS8 >((const ImS8* )arg_1, (const ImS8* )arg_2);
2397 case ImGuiDataType_U8: return DataTypeCompareT<ImU8 >((const ImU8* )arg_1, (const ImU8* )arg_2);
2398 case ImGuiDataType_S16: return DataTypeCompareT<ImS16 >((const ImS16* )arg_1, (const ImS16* )arg_2);
2399 case ImGuiDataType_U16: return DataTypeCompareT<ImU16 >((const ImU16* )arg_1, (const ImU16* )arg_2);
2400 case ImGuiDataType_S32: return DataTypeCompareT<ImS32 >((const ImS32* )arg_1, (const ImS32* )arg_2);
2401 case ImGuiDataType_U32: return DataTypeCompareT<ImU32 >((const ImU32* )arg_1, (const ImU32* )arg_2);
2402 case ImGuiDataType_S64: return DataTypeCompareT<ImS64 >((const ImS64* )arg_1, (const ImS64* )arg_2);
2403 case ImGuiDataType_U64: return DataTypeCompareT<ImU64 >((const ImU64* )arg_1, (const ImU64* )arg_2);
2404 case ImGuiDataType_Float: return DataTypeCompareT<float >((const float* )arg_1, (const float* )arg_2);
2405 case ImGuiDataType_Double: return DataTypeCompareT<double>((const double*)arg_1, (const double*)arg_2);
2406 case ImGuiDataType_COUNT: break;
2407 }
2408 IM_ASSERT(0);
2409 return 0;
2410}
2411
2412template<typename T>
2413static bool DataTypeClampT(T* v, const T* v_min, const T* v_max)
2414{
2415 // Clamp, both sides are optional, return true if modified
2416 if (v_min && *v < *v_min) { *v = *v_min; return true; }
2417 if (v_max && *v > *v_max) { *v = *v_max; return true; }
2418 return false;
2419}
2420
2421bool ImGui::DataTypeClamp(ImGuiDataType data_type, void* p_data, const void* p_min, const void* p_max)
2422{
2423 switch (data_type)
2424 {
2425 case ImGuiDataType_S8: return DataTypeClampT<ImS8 >((ImS8* )p_data, (const ImS8* )p_min, (const ImS8* )p_max);
2426 case ImGuiDataType_U8: return DataTypeClampT<ImU8 >((ImU8* )p_data, (const ImU8* )p_min, (const ImU8* )p_max);
2427 case ImGuiDataType_S16: return DataTypeClampT<ImS16 >((ImS16* )p_data, (const ImS16* )p_min, (const ImS16* )p_max);
2428 case ImGuiDataType_U16: return DataTypeClampT<ImU16 >((ImU16* )p_data, (const ImU16* )p_min, (const ImU16* )p_max);
2429 case ImGuiDataType_S32: return DataTypeClampT<ImS32 >((ImS32* )p_data, (const ImS32* )p_min, (const ImS32* )p_max);
2430 case ImGuiDataType_U32: return DataTypeClampT<ImU32 >((ImU32* )p_data, (const ImU32* )p_min, (const ImU32* )p_max);
2431 case ImGuiDataType_S64: return DataTypeClampT<ImS64 >((ImS64* )p_data, (const ImS64* )p_min, (const ImS64* )p_max);
2432 case ImGuiDataType_U64: return DataTypeClampT<ImU64 >((ImU64* )p_data, (const ImU64* )p_min, (const ImU64* )p_max);
2433 case ImGuiDataType_Float: return DataTypeClampT<float >((float* )p_data, (const float* )p_min, (const float* )p_max);
2434 case ImGuiDataType_Double: return DataTypeClampT<double>((double*)p_data, (const double*)p_min, (const double*)p_max);
2435 case ImGuiDataType_COUNT: break;
2436 }
2437 IM_ASSERT(0);
2438 return false;
2439}
2440
2441bool ImGui::DataTypeIsZero(ImGuiDataType data_type, const void* p_data)
2442{
2443 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2444 return DataTypeCompare(data_type, p_data, &g.DataTypeZeroValue) == 0;
2445}
2446
2447static float GetMinimumStepAtDecimalPrecision(int decimal_precision)
2448{
2449 static const float min_steps[10] = { 1.0f, 0.1f, 0.01f, 0.001f, 0.0001f, 0.00001f, 0.000001f, 0.0000001f, 0.00000001f, 0.000000001f };
2450 if (decimal_precision < 0)
2451 return FLT_MIN;
2452 return (decimal_precision < IM_ARRAYSIZE(min_steps)) ? min_steps[decimal_precision] : ImPow(10.0f, (float)-decimal_precision);
2453}
2454
2455template<typename TYPE>
2456TYPE ImGui::RoundScalarWithFormatT(const char* format, ImGuiDataType data_type, TYPE v)
2457{
2458 IM_UNUSED(data_type);
2459 IM_ASSERT(data_type == ImGuiDataType_Float || data_type == ImGuiDataType_Double);
2460 const char* fmt_start = ImParseFormatFindStart(format);
2461 if (fmt_start[0] != '%' || fmt_start[1] == '%') // Don't apply if the value is not visible in the format string
2462 return v;
2463
2464 // Sanitize format
2465 char fmt_sanitized[32];
2466 ImParseFormatSanitizeForPrinting(fmt_start, fmt_sanitized, IM_ARRAYSIZE(fmt_sanitized));
2467 fmt_start = fmt_sanitized;
2468
2469 // Format value with our rounding, and read back
2470 char v_str[64];
2471 ImFormatString(v_str, IM_ARRAYSIZE(v_str), fmt_start, v);
2472 const char* p = v_str;
2473 while (*p == ' ')
2474 p++;
2475 v = (TYPE)ImAtof(p);
2476
2477 return v;
2478}
2479
2480//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
2481// [SECTION] Widgets: DragScalar, DragFloat, DragInt, etc.
2482//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
2483// - DragBehaviorT<>() [Internal]
2484// - DragBehavior() [Internal]
2485// - DragScalar()
2486// - DragScalarN()
2487// - DragFloat()
2488// - DragFloat2()
2489// - DragFloat3()
2490// - DragFloat4()
2491// - DragFloatRange2()
2492// - DragInt()
2493// - DragInt2()
2494// - DragInt3()
2495// - DragInt4()
2496// - DragIntRange2()
2497//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
2498
2499// This is called by DragBehavior() when the widget is active (held by mouse or being manipulated with Nav controls)
2500template<typename TYPE, typename SIGNEDTYPE, typename FLOATTYPE>
2501bool ImGui::DragBehaviorT(ImGuiDataType data_type, TYPE* v, float v_speed, const TYPE v_min, const TYPE v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2502{
2503 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2504 const ImGuiAxis axis = (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_Vertical) ? ImGuiAxis_Y : ImGuiAxis_X;
2505 const bool is_bounded = (v_min < v_max) || ((v_min == v_max) && (v_min != 0.0f || (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_ClampZeroRange)));
2506 const bool is_wrapped = is_bounded && (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_WrapAround);
2507 const bool is_logarithmic = (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic) != 0;
2508 const bool is_floating_point = (data_type == ImGuiDataType_Float) || (data_type == ImGuiDataType_Double);
2509
2510 // Default tweak speed
2511 if (v_speed == 0.0f && is_bounded && (v_max - v_min < FLT_MAX))
2512 v_speed = (float)((v_max - v_min) * g.DragSpeedDefaultRatio);
2513
2514 // Inputs accumulates into g.DragCurrentAccum, which is flushed into the current value as soon as it makes a difference with our precision settings
2515 float adjust_delta = 0.0f;
2516 if (g.ActiveIdSource == ImGuiInputSource_Mouse && IsMousePosValid() && IsMouseDragPastThreshold(0, g.IO.MouseDragThreshold * DRAG_MOUSE_THRESHOLD_FACTOR))
2517 {
2518 adjust_delta = g.IO.MouseDelta[axis];
2519 if (g.IO.KeyAlt && !(flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_NoSpeedTweaks))
2520 adjust_delta *= 1.0f / 100.0f;
2521 if (g.IO.KeyShift && !(flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_NoSpeedTweaks))
2522 adjust_delta *= 10.0f;
2523 }
2524 else if (g.ActiveIdSource == ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard || g.ActiveIdSource == ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad)
2525 {
2526 const int decimal_precision = is_floating_point ? ImParseFormatPrecision(format, 3) : 0;
2527 const bool tweak_slow = IsKeyDown((g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad) ? ImGuiKey_NavGamepadTweakSlow : ImGuiKey_NavKeyboardTweakSlow);
2528 const bool tweak_fast = IsKeyDown((g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad) ? ImGuiKey_NavGamepadTweakFast : ImGuiKey_NavKeyboardTweakFast);
2529 const float tweak_factor = (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_NoSpeedTweaks) ? 1.0f : tweak_slow ? 1.0f / 10.0f : tweak_fast ? 10.0f : 1.0f;
2530 adjust_delta = GetNavTweakPressedAmount(axis) * tweak_factor;
2531 v_speed = ImMax(v_speed, GetMinimumStepAtDecimalPrecision(decimal_precision));
2532 }
2533 adjust_delta *= v_speed;
2534
2535 // For vertical drag we currently assume that Up=higher value (like we do with vertical sliders). This may become a parameter.
2536 if (axis == ImGuiAxis_Y)
2537 adjust_delta = -adjust_delta;
2538
2539 // For logarithmic use our range is effectively 0..1 so scale the delta into that range
2540 if (is_logarithmic && (v_max - v_min < FLT_MAX) && ((v_max - v_min) > 0.000001f)) // Epsilon to avoid /0
2541 adjust_delta /= (float)(v_max - v_min);
2542
2543 // Clear current value on activation
2544 // Avoid altering values and clamping when we are _already_ past the limits and heading in the same direction, so e.g. if range is 0..255, current value is 300 and we are pushing to the right side, keep the 300.
2545 const bool is_just_activated = g.ActiveIdIsJustActivated;
2546 const bool is_already_past_limits_and_pushing_outward = is_bounded && !is_wrapped && ((*v >= v_max && adjust_delta > 0.0f) || (*v <= v_min && adjust_delta < 0.0f));
2547 if (is_just_activated || is_already_past_limits_and_pushing_outward)
2548 {
2549 g.DragCurrentAccum = 0.0f;
2550 g.DragCurrentAccumDirty = false;
2551 }
2552 else if (adjust_delta != 0.0f)
2553 {
2554 g.DragCurrentAccum += adjust_delta;
2555 g.DragCurrentAccumDirty = true;
2556 }
2557
2558 if (!g.DragCurrentAccumDirty)
2559 return false;
2560
2561 TYPE v_cur = *v;
2562 FLOATTYPE v_old_ref_for_accum_remainder = (FLOATTYPE)0.0f;
2563
2564 float logarithmic_zero_epsilon = 0.0f; // Only valid when is_logarithmic is true
2565 const float zero_deadzone_halfsize = 0.0f; // Drag widgets have no deadzone (as it doesn't make sense)
2566 if (is_logarithmic)
2567 {
2568 // When using logarithmic sliders, we need to clamp to avoid hitting zero, but our choice of clamp value greatly affects slider precision. We attempt to use the specified precision to estimate a good lower bound.
2569 const int decimal_precision = is_floating_point ? ImParseFormatPrecision(format, 3) : 1;
2570 logarithmic_zero_epsilon = ImPow(0.1f, (float)decimal_precision);
2571
2572 // Convert to parametric space, apply delta, convert back
2573 float v_old_parametric = ScaleRatioFromValueT<TYPE, SIGNEDTYPE, FLOATTYPE>(data_type, v_cur, v_min, v_max, is_logarithmic, logarithmic_zero_epsilon, zero_deadzone_halfsize);
2574 float v_new_parametric = v_old_parametric + g.DragCurrentAccum;
2575 v_cur = ScaleValueFromRatioT<TYPE, SIGNEDTYPE, FLOATTYPE>(data_type, v_new_parametric, v_min, v_max, is_logarithmic, logarithmic_zero_epsilon, zero_deadzone_halfsize);
2576 v_old_ref_for_accum_remainder = v_old_parametric;
2577 }
2578 else
2579 {
2580 v_cur += (SIGNEDTYPE)g.DragCurrentAccum;
2581 }
2582
2583 // Round to user desired precision based on format string
2584 if (is_floating_point && !(flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_NoRoundToFormat))
2585 v_cur = RoundScalarWithFormatT<TYPE>(format, data_type, v_cur);
2586
2587 // Preserve remainder after rounding has been applied. This also allow slow tweaking of values.
2588 g.DragCurrentAccumDirty = false;
2589 if (is_logarithmic)
2590 {
2591 // Convert to parametric space, apply delta, convert back
2592 float v_new_parametric = ScaleRatioFromValueT<TYPE, SIGNEDTYPE, FLOATTYPE>(data_type, v_cur, v_min, v_max, is_logarithmic, logarithmic_zero_epsilon, zero_deadzone_halfsize);
2593 g.DragCurrentAccum -= (float)(v_new_parametric - v_old_ref_for_accum_remainder);
2594 }
2595 else
2596 {
2597 g.DragCurrentAccum -= (float)((SIGNEDTYPE)v_cur - (SIGNEDTYPE)*v);
2598 }
2599
2600 // Lose zero sign for float/double
2601 if (v_cur == (TYPE)-0)
2602 v_cur = (TYPE)0;
2603
2604 if (*v != v_cur && is_bounded)
2605 {
2606 if (is_wrapped)
2607 {
2608 // Wrap values
2609 if (v_cur < v_min)
2610 v_cur += v_max - v_min + (is_floating_point ? 0 : 1);
2611 if (v_cur > v_max)
2612 v_cur -= v_max - v_min + (is_floating_point ? 0 : 1);
2613 }
2614 else
2615 {
2616 // Clamp values + handle overflow/wrap-around for integer types.
2617 if (v_cur < v_min || (v_cur > *v && adjust_delta < 0.0f && !is_floating_point))
2618 v_cur = v_min;
2619 if (v_cur > v_max || (v_cur < *v && adjust_delta > 0.0f && !is_floating_point))
2620 v_cur = v_max;
2621 }
2622 }
2623
2624 // Apply result
2625 if (*v == v_cur)
2626 return false;
2627 *v = v_cur;
2628 return true;
2629}
2630
2631bool ImGui::DragBehavior(ImGuiID id, ImGuiDataType data_type, void* p_v, float v_speed, const void* p_min, const void* p_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2632{
2633 // Read imgui.cpp "API BREAKING CHANGES" section for 1.78 if you hit this assert.
2634 IM_ASSERT((flags == 1 || (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_InvalidMask_) == 0) && "Invalid ImGuiSliderFlags flags! Has the legacy 'float power' argument been mistakenly cast to flags? Call function with ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic flags instead.");
2635
2636 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2637 if (g.ActiveId == id)
2638 {
2639 // Those are the things we can do easily outside the DragBehaviorT<> template, saves code generation.
2640 if (g.ActiveIdSource == ImGuiInputSource_Mouse && !g.IO.MouseDown[0])
2641 ClearActiveID();
2642 else if ((g.ActiveIdSource == ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard || g.ActiveIdSource == ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad) && g.NavActivatePressedId == id && !g.ActiveIdIsJustActivated)
2643 ClearActiveID();
2644 }
2645 if (g.ActiveId != id)
2646 return false;
2647 if ((g.LastItemData.ItemFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_ReadOnly) || (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_ReadOnly))
2648 return false;
2649
2650 switch (data_type)
2651 {
2652 case ImGuiDataType_S8: { ImS32 v32 = (ImS32)*(ImS8*)p_v; bool r = DragBehaviorT<ImS32, ImS32, float>(ImGuiDataType_S32, &v32, v_speed, p_min ? *(const ImS8*) p_min : IM_S8_MIN, p_max ? *(const ImS8*)p_max : IM_S8_MAX, format, flags); if (r) *(ImS8*)p_v = (ImS8)v32; return r; }
2653 case ImGuiDataType_U8: { ImU32 v32 = (ImU32)*(ImU8*)p_v; bool r = DragBehaviorT<ImU32, ImS32, float>(ImGuiDataType_U32, &v32, v_speed, p_min ? *(const ImU8*) p_min : IM_U8_MIN, p_max ? *(const ImU8*)p_max : IM_U8_MAX, format, flags); if (r) *(ImU8*)p_v = (ImU8)v32; return r; }
2654 case ImGuiDataType_S16: { ImS32 v32 = (ImS32)*(ImS16*)p_v; bool r = DragBehaviorT<ImS32, ImS32, float>(ImGuiDataType_S32, &v32, v_speed, p_min ? *(const ImS16*)p_min : IM_S16_MIN, p_max ? *(const ImS16*)p_max : IM_S16_MAX, format, flags); if (r) *(ImS16*)p_v = (ImS16)v32; return r; }
2655 case ImGuiDataType_U16: { ImU32 v32 = (ImU32)*(ImU16*)p_v; bool r = DragBehaviorT<ImU32, ImS32, float>(ImGuiDataType_U32, &v32, v_speed, p_min ? *(const ImU16*)p_min : IM_U16_MIN, p_max ? *(const ImU16*)p_max : IM_U16_MAX, format, flags); if (r) *(ImU16*)p_v = (ImU16)v32; return r; }
2656 case ImGuiDataType_S32: return DragBehaviorT<ImS32, ImS32, float >(data_type, (ImS32*)p_v, v_speed, p_min ? *(const ImS32* )p_min : IM_S32_MIN, p_max ? *(const ImS32* )p_max : IM_S32_MAX, format, flags);
2657 case ImGuiDataType_U32: return DragBehaviorT<ImU32, ImS32, float >(data_type, (ImU32*)p_v, v_speed, p_min ? *(const ImU32* )p_min : IM_U32_MIN, p_max ? *(const ImU32* )p_max : IM_U32_MAX, format, flags);
2658 case ImGuiDataType_S64: return DragBehaviorT<ImS64, ImS64, double>(data_type, (ImS64*)p_v, v_speed, p_min ? *(const ImS64* )p_min : IM_S64_MIN, p_max ? *(const ImS64* )p_max : IM_S64_MAX, format, flags);
2659 case ImGuiDataType_U64: return DragBehaviorT<ImU64, ImS64, double>(data_type, (ImU64*)p_v, v_speed, p_min ? *(const ImU64* )p_min : IM_U64_MIN, p_max ? *(const ImU64* )p_max : IM_U64_MAX, format, flags);
2660 case ImGuiDataType_Float: return DragBehaviorT<float, float, float >(data_type, (float*)p_v, v_speed, p_min ? *(const float* )p_min : -FLT_MAX, p_max ? *(const float* )p_max : FLT_MAX, format, flags);
2661 case ImGuiDataType_Double: return DragBehaviorT<double,double,double>(data_type, (double*)p_v, v_speed, p_min ? *(const double*)p_min : -DBL_MAX, p_max ? *(const double*)p_max : DBL_MAX, format, flags);
2662 case ImGuiDataType_COUNT: break;
2663 }
2664 IM_ASSERT(0);
2665 return false;
2666}
2667
2668// Note: p_data, p_min and p_max are _pointers_ to a memory address holding the data. For a Drag widget, p_min and p_max are optional.
2669// Read code of e.g. DragFloat(), DragInt() etc. or examples in 'Demo->Widgets->Data Types' to understand how to use this function directly.
2670bool ImGui::DragScalar(const char* label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void* p_data, float v_speed, const void* p_min, const void* p_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2671{
2672 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
2673 if (window->SkipItems)
2674 return false;
2675
2676 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2677 const ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
2678 const ImGuiID id = window->GetID(label);
2679 const float w = CalcItemWidth();
2680
2681 const ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
2682 const ImRect frame_bb(window->DC.CursorPos, window->DC.CursorPos + ImVec2(w, label_size.y + style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f));
2683 const ImRect total_bb(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max + ImVec2(label_size.x > 0.0f ? style.ItemInnerSpacing.x + label_size.x : 0.0f, 0.0f));
2684
2685 const bool temp_input_allowed = (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_NoInput) == 0;
2686 ItemSize(total_bb, style.FramePadding.y);
2687 if (!ItemAdd(total_bb, id, &frame_bb, temp_input_allowed ? ImGuiItemFlags_Inputable : 0))
2688 return false;
2689
2690 // Default format string when passing NULL
2691 if (format == NULL)
2692 format = DataTypeGetInfo(data_type)->PrintFmt;
2693
2694 const bool hovered = ItemHoverable(frame_bb, id, g.LastItemData.ItemFlags);
2695 bool temp_input_is_active = temp_input_allowed && TempInputIsActive(id);
2696 if (!temp_input_is_active)
2697 {
2698 // Tabbing or CTRL+click on Drag turns it into an InputText
2699 const bool clicked = hovered && IsMouseClicked(0, ImGuiInputFlags_None, id);
2700 const bool double_clicked = (hovered && g.IO.MouseClickedCount[0] == 2 && TestKeyOwner(ImGuiKey_MouseLeft, id));
2701 const bool make_active = (clicked || double_clicked || g.NavActivateId == id);
2702 if (make_active && (clicked || double_clicked))
2703 SetKeyOwner(ImGuiKey_MouseLeft, id);
2704 if (make_active && temp_input_allowed)
2705 if ((clicked && g.IO.KeyCtrl) || double_clicked || (g.NavActivateId == id && (g.NavActivateFlags & ImGuiActivateFlags_PreferInput)))
2706 temp_input_is_active = true;
2707
2708 // (Optional) simple click (without moving) turns Drag into an InputText
2709 if (g.IO.ConfigDragClickToInputText && temp_input_allowed && !temp_input_is_active)
2710 if (g.ActiveId == id && hovered && g.IO.MouseReleased[0] && !IsMouseDragPastThreshold(0, g.IO.MouseDragThreshold * DRAG_MOUSE_THRESHOLD_FACTOR))
2711 {
2712 g.NavActivateId = id;
2713 g.NavActivateFlags = ImGuiActivateFlags_PreferInput;
2714 temp_input_is_active = true;
2715 }
2716
2717 // Store initial value (not used by main lib but available as a convenience but some mods e.g. to revert)
2718 if (make_active)
2719 memcpy(&g.ActiveIdValueOnActivation, p_data, DataTypeGetInfo(data_type)->Size);
2720
2721 if (make_active && !temp_input_is_active)
2722 {
2723 SetActiveID(id, window);
2724 SetFocusID(id, window);
2725 FocusWindow(window);
2726 g.ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask = (1 << ImGuiDir_Left) | (1 << ImGuiDir_Right);
2727 }
2728 }
2729
2730 if (temp_input_is_active)
2731 {
2732 // Only clamp CTRL+Click input when ImGuiSliderFlags_ClampOnInput is set (generally via ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp)
2733 bool clamp_enabled = false;
2734 if ((flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_ClampOnInput) && (p_min != NULL || p_max != NULL))
2735 {
2736 const int clamp_range_dir = (p_min != NULL && p_max != NULL) ? DataTypeCompare(data_type, p_min, p_max) : 0; // -1 when *p_min < *p_max, == 0 when *p_min == *p_max
2737 if (p_min == NULL || p_max == NULL || clamp_range_dir < 0)
2738 clamp_enabled = true;
2739 else if (clamp_range_dir == 0)
2740 clamp_enabled = DataTypeIsZero(data_type, p_min) ? ((flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_ClampZeroRange) != 0) : true;
2741 }
2742 return TempInputScalar(frame_bb, id, label, data_type, p_data, format, clamp_enabled ? p_min : NULL, clamp_enabled ? p_max : NULL);
2743 }
2744
2745 // Draw frame
2746 const ImU32 frame_col = GetColorU32(g.ActiveId == id ? ImGuiCol_FrameBgActive : hovered ? ImGuiCol_FrameBgHovered : ImGuiCol_FrameBg);
2747 RenderNavCursor(frame_bb, id);
2748 RenderFrame(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max, frame_col, true, style.FrameRounding);
2749
2750 // Drag behavior
2751 const bool value_changed = DragBehavior(id, data_type, p_data, v_speed, p_min, p_max, format, flags);
2752 if (value_changed)
2753 MarkItemEdited(id);
2754
2755 // Display value using user-provided display format so user can add prefix/suffix/decorations to the value.
2756 char value_buf[64];
2757 const char* value_buf_end = value_buf + DataTypeFormatString(value_buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(value_buf), data_type, p_data, format);
2758 if (g.LogEnabled)
2759 LogSetNextTextDecoration("{", "}");
2760 RenderTextClipped(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max, value_buf, value_buf_end, NULL, ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f));
2761
2762 if (label_size.x > 0.0f)
2763 RenderText(ImVec2(frame_bb.Max.x + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x, frame_bb.Min.y + style.FramePadding.y), label);
2764
2765 IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_INFO(id, label, g.LastItemData.StatusFlags | (temp_input_allowed ? ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Inputable : 0));
2766 return value_changed;
2767}
2768
2769bool ImGui::DragScalarN(const char* label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void* p_data, int components, float v_speed, const void* p_min, const void* p_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2770{
2771 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
2772 if (window->SkipItems)
2773 return false;
2774
2775 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2776 bool value_changed = false;
2777 BeginGroup();
2778 PushID(label);
2779 PushMultiItemsWidths(components, CalcItemWidth());
2780 size_t type_size = GDataTypeInfo[data_type].Size;
2781 for (int i = 0; i < components; i++)
2782 {
2783 PushID(i);
2784 if (i > 0)
2785 SameLine(0, g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
2786 value_changed |= DragScalar("", data_type, p_data, v_speed, p_min, p_max, format, flags);
2787 PopID();
2788 PopItemWidth();
2789 p_data = (void*)((char*)p_data + type_size);
2790 }
2791 PopID();
2792
2793 const char* label_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(label);
2794 if (label != label_end)
2795 {
2796 SameLine(0, g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
2797 TextEx(label, label_end);
2798 }
2799
2800 EndGroup();
2801 return value_changed;
2802}
2803
2804bool ImGui::DragFloat(const char* label, float* v, float v_speed, float v_min, float v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2805{
2806 return DragScalar(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, v_speed, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
2807}
2808
2809bool ImGui::DragFloat2(const char* label, float v[2], float v_speed, float v_min, float v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2810{
2811 return DragScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, 2, v_speed, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
2812}
2813
2814bool ImGui::DragFloat3(const char* label, float v[3], float v_speed, float v_min, float v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2815{
2816 return DragScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, 3, v_speed, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
2817}
2818
2819bool ImGui::DragFloat4(const char* label, float v[4], float v_speed, float v_min, float v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2820{
2821 return DragScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, 4, v_speed, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
2822}
2823
2824// NB: You likely want to specify the ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp when using this.
2825bool ImGui::DragFloatRange2(const char* label, float* v_current_min, float* v_current_max, float v_speed, float v_min, float v_max, const char* format, const char* format_max, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2826{
2827 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
2828 if (window->SkipItems)
2829 return false;
2830
2831 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2832 PushID(label);
2833 BeginGroup();
2834 PushMultiItemsWidths(2, CalcItemWidth());
2835
2836 float min_min = (v_min >= v_max) ? -FLT_MAX : v_min;
2837 float min_max = (v_min >= v_max) ? *v_current_max : ImMin(v_max, *v_current_max);
2838 ImGuiSliderFlags min_flags = flags | ((min_min == min_max) ? ImGuiSliderFlags_ReadOnly : 0);
2839 bool value_changed = DragScalar("##min", ImGuiDataType_Float, v_current_min, v_speed, &min_min, &min_max, format, min_flags);
2840 PopItemWidth();
2841 SameLine(0, g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
2842
2843 float max_min = (v_min >= v_max) ? *v_current_min : ImMax(v_min, *v_current_min);
2844 float max_max = (v_min >= v_max) ? FLT_MAX : v_max;
2845 ImGuiSliderFlags max_flags = flags | ((max_min == max_max) ? ImGuiSliderFlags_ReadOnly : 0);
2846 value_changed |= DragScalar("##max", ImGuiDataType_Float, v_current_max, v_speed, &max_min, &max_max, format_max ? format_max : format, max_flags);
2847 PopItemWidth();
2848 SameLine(0, g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
2849
2850 TextEx(label, FindRenderedTextEnd(label));
2851 EndGroup();
2852 PopID();
2853
2854 return value_changed;
2855}
2856
2857// NB: v_speed is float to allow adjusting the drag speed with more precision
2858bool ImGui::DragInt(const char* label, int* v, float v_speed, int v_min, int v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2859{
2860 return DragScalar(label, ImGuiDataType_S32, v, v_speed, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
2861}
2862
2863bool ImGui::DragInt2(const char* label, int v[2], float v_speed, int v_min, int v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2864{
2865 return DragScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_S32, v, 2, v_speed, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
2866}
2867
2868bool ImGui::DragInt3(const char* label, int v[3], float v_speed, int v_min, int v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2869{
2870 return DragScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_S32, v, 3, v_speed, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
2871}
2872
2873bool ImGui::DragInt4(const char* label, int v[4], float v_speed, int v_min, int v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2874{
2875 return DragScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_S32, v, 4, v_speed, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
2876}
2877
2878// NB: You likely want to specify the ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp when using this.
2879bool ImGui::DragIntRange2(const char* label, int* v_current_min, int* v_current_max, float v_speed, int v_min, int v_max, const char* format, const char* format_max, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2880{
2881 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
2882 if (window->SkipItems)
2883 return false;
2884
2885 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2886 PushID(label);
2887 BeginGroup();
2888 PushMultiItemsWidths(2, CalcItemWidth());
2889
2890 int min_min = (v_min >= v_max) ? INT_MIN : v_min;
2891 int min_max = (v_min >= v_max) ? *v_current_max : ImMin(v_max, *v_current_max);
2892 ImGuiSliderFlags min_flags = flags | ((min_min == min_max) ? ImGuiSliderFlags_ReadOnly : 0);
2893 bool value_changed = DragInt("##min", v_current_min, v_speed, min_min, min_max, format, min_flags);
2894 PopItemWidth();
2895 SameLine(0, g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
2896
2897 int max_min = (v_min >= v_max) ? *v_current_min : ImMax(v_min, *v_current_min);
2898 int max_max = (v_min >= v_max) ? INT_MAX : v_max;
2899 ImGuiSliderFlags max_flags = flags | ((max_min == max_max) ? ImGuiSliderFlags_ReadOnly : 0);
2900 value_changed |= DragInt("##max", v_current_max, v_speed, max_min, max_max, format_max ? format_max : format, max_flags);
2901 PopItemWidth();
2902 SameLine(0, g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
2903
2904 TextEx(label, FindRenderedTextEnd(label));
2905 EndGroup();
2906 PopID();
2907
2908 return value_changed;
2909}
2910
2911//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
2912// [SECTION] Widgets: SliderScalar, SliderFloat, SliderInt, etc.
2913//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
2914// - ScaleRatioFromValueT<> [Internal]
2915// - ScaleValueFromRatioT<> [Internal]
2916// - SliderBehaviorT<>() [Internal]
2917// - SliderBehavior() [Internal]
2918// - SliderScalar()
2919// - SliderScalarN()
2920// - SliderFloat()
2921// - SliderFloat2()
2922// - SliderFloat3()
2923// - SliderFloat4()
2924// - SliderAngle()
2925// - SliderInt()
2926// - SliderInt2()
2927// - SliderInt3()
2928// - SliderInt4()
2929// - VSliderScalar()
2930// - VSliderFloat()
2931// - VSliderInt()
2932//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
2933
2934// Convert a value v in the output space of a slider into a parametric position on the slider itself (the logical opposite of ScaleValueFromRatioT)
2935template<typename TYPE, typename SIGNEDTYPE, typename FLOATTYPE>
2936float ImGui::ScaleRatioFromValueT(ImGuiDataType data_type, TYPE v, TYPE v_min, TYPE v_max, bool is_logarithmic, float logarithmic_zero_epsilon, float zero_deadzone_halfsize)
2937{
2938 if (v_min == v_max)
2939 return 0.0f;
2940 IM_UNUSED(data_type);
2941
2942 const TYPE v_clamped = (v_min < v_max) ? ImClamp(v, v_min, v_max) : ImClamp(v, v_max, v_min);
2943 if (is_logarithmic)
2944 {
2945 bool flipped = v_max < v_min;
2946
2947 if (flipped) // Handle the case where the range is backwards
2948 ImSwap(v_min, v_max);
2949
2950 // Fudge min/max to avoid getting close to log(0)
2951 FLOATTYPE v_min_fudged = (ImAbs((FLOATTYPE)v_min) < logarithmic_zero_epsilon) ? ((v_min < 0.0f) ? -logarithmic_zero_epsilon : logarithmic_zero_epsilon) : (FLOATTYPE)v_min;
2952 FLOATTYPE v_max_fudged = (ImAbs((FLOATTYPE)v_max) < logarithmic_zero_epsilon) ? ((v_max < 0.0f) ? -logarithmic_zero_epsilon : logarithmic_zero_epsilon) : (FLOATTYPE)v_max;
2953
2954 // Awkward special cases - we need ranges of the form (-100 .. 0) to convert to (-100 .. -epsilon), not (-100 .. epsilon)
2955 if ((v_min == 0.0f) && (v_max < 0.0f))
2956 v_min_fudged = -logarithmic_zero_epsilon;
2957 else if ((v_max == 0.0f) && (v_min < 0.0f))
2958 v_max_fudged = -logarithmic_zero_epsilon;
2959
2960 float result;
2961 if (v_clamped <= v_min_fudged)
2962 result = 0.0f; // Workaround for values that are in-range but below our fudge
2963 else if (v_clamped >= v_max_fudged)
2964 result = 1.0f; // Workaround for values that are in-range but above our fudge
2965 else if ((v_min * v_max) < 0.0f) // Range crosses zero, so split into two portions
2966 {
2967 float zero_point_center = (-(float)v_min) / ((float)v_max - (float)v_min); // The zero point in parametric space. There's an argument we should take the logarithmic nature into account when calculating this, but for now this should do (and the most common case of a symmetrical range works fine)
2968 float zero_point_snap_L = zero_point_center - zero_deadzone_halfsize;
2969 float zero_point_snap_R = zero_point_center + zero_deadzone_halfsize;
2970 if (v == 0.0f)
2971 result = zero_point_center; // Special case for exactly zero
2972 else if (v < 0.0f)
2973 result = (1.0f - (float)(ImLog(-(FLOATTYPE)v_clamped / logarithmic_zero_epsilon) / ImLog(-v_min_fudged / logarithmic_zero_epsilon))) * zero_point_snap_L;
2974 else
2975 result = zero_point_snap_R + ((float)(ImLog((FLOATTYPE)v_clamped / logarithmic_zero_epsilon) / ImLog(v_max_fudged / logarithmic_zero_epsilon)) * (1.0f - zero_point_snap_R));
2976 }
2977 else if ((v_min < 0.0f) || (v_max < 0.0f)) // Entirely negative slider
2978 result = 1.0f - (float)(ImLog(-(FLOATTYPE)v_clamped / -v_max_fudged) / ImLog(-v_min_fudged / -v_max_fudged));
2979 else
2980 result = (float)(ImLog((FLOATTYPE)v_clamped / v_min_fudged) / ImLog(v_max_fudged / v_min_fudged));
2981
2982 return flipped ? (1.0f - result) : result;
2983 }
2984 else
2985 {
2986 // Linear slider
2987 return (float)((FLOATTYPE)(SIGNEDTYPE)(v_clamped - v_min) / (FLOATTYPE)(SIGNEDTYPE)(v_max - v_min));
2988 }
2989}
2990
2991// Convert a parametric position on a slider into a value v in the output space (the logical opposite of ScaleRatioFromValueT)
2992template<typename TYPE, typename SIGNEDTYPE, typename FLOATTYPE>
2993TYPE ImGui::ScaleValueFromRatioT(ImGuiDataType data_type, float t, TYPE v_min, TYPE v_max, bool is_logarithmic, float logarithmic_zero_epsilon, float zero_deadzone_halfsize)
2994{
2995 // We special-case the extents because otherwise our logarithmic fudging can lead to "mathematically correct"
2996 // but non-intuitive behaviors like a fully-left slider not actually reaching the minimum value. Also generally simpler.
2997 if (t <= 0.0f || v_min == v_max)
2998 return v_min;
2999 if (t >= 1.0f)
3000 return v_max;
3001
3002 TYPE result = (TYPE)0;
3003 if (is_logarithmic)
3004 {
3005 // Fudge min/max to avoid getting silly results close to zero
3006 FLOATTYPE v_min_fudged = (ImAbs((FLOATTYPE)v_min) < logarithmic_zero_epsilon) ? ((v_min < 0.0f) ? -logarithmic_zero_epsilon : logarithmic_zero_epsilon) : (FLOATTYPE)v_min;
3007 FLOATTYPE v_max_fudged = (ImAbs((FLOATTYPE)v_max) < logarithmic_zero_epsilon) ? ((v_max < 0.0f) ? -logarithmic_zero_epsilon : logarithmic_zero_epsilon) : (FLOATTYPE)v_max;
3008
3009 const bool flipped = v_max < v_min; // Check if range is "backwards"
3010 if (flipped)
3011 ImSwap(v_min_fudged, v_max_fudged);
3012
3013 // Awkward special case - we need ranges of the form (-100 .. 0) to convert to (-100 .. -epsilon), not (-100 .. epsilon)
3014 if ((v_max == 0.0f) && (v_min < 0.0f))
3015 v_max_fudged = -logarithmic_zero_epsilon;
3016
3017 float t_with_flip = flipped ? (1.0f - t) : t; // t, but flipped if necessary to account for us flipping the range
3018
3019 if ((v_min * v_max) < 0.0f) // Range crosses zero, so we have to do this in two parts
3020 {
3021 float zero_point_center = (-(float)ImMin(v_min, v_max)) / ImAbs((float)v_max - (float)v_min); // The zero point in parametric space
3022 float zero_point_snap_L = zero_point_center - zero_deadzone_halfsize;
3023 float zero_point_snap_R = zero_point_center + zero_deadzone_halfsize;
3024 if (t_with_flip >= zero_point_snap_L && t_with_flip <= zero_point_snap_R)
3025 result = (TYPE)0.0f; // Special case to make getting exactly zero possible (the epsilon prevents it otherwise)
3026 else if (t_with_flip < zero_point_center)
3027 result = (TYPE)-(logarithmic_zero_epsilon * ImPow(-v_min_fudged / logarithmic_zero_epsilon, (FLOATTYPE)(1.0f - (t_with_flip / zero_point_snap_L))));
3028 else
3029 result = (TYPE)(logarithmic_zero_epsilon * ImPow(v_max_fudged / logarithmic_zero_epsilon, (FLOATTYPE)((t_with_flip - zero_point_snap_R) / (1.0f - zero_point_snap_R))));
3030 }
3031 else if ((v_min < 0.0f) || (v_max < 0.0f)) // Entirely negative slider
3032 result = (TYPE)-(-v_max_fudged * ImPow(-v_min_fudged / -v_max_fudged, (FLOATTYPE)(1.0f - t_with_flip)));
3033 else
3034 result = (TYPE)(v_min_fudged * ImPow(v_max_fudged / v_min_fudged, (FLOATTYPE)t_with_flip));
3035 }
3036 else
3037 {
3038 // Linear slider
3039 const bool is_floating_point = (data_type == ImGuiDataType_Float) || (data_type == ImGuiDataType_Double);
3040 if (is_floating_point)
3041 {
3042 result = ImLerp(v_min, v_max, t);
3043 }
3044 else if (t < 1.0)
3045 {
3046 // - For integer values we want the clicking position to match the grab box so we round above
3047 // This code is carefully tuned to work with large values (e.g. high ranges of U64) while preserving this property..
3048 // - Not doing a *1.0 multiply at the end of a range as it tends to be lossy. While absolute aiming at a large s64/u64
3049 // range is going to be imprecise anyway, with this check we at least make the edge values matches expected limits.
3050 FLOATTYPE v_new_off_f = (SIGNEDTYPE)(v_max - v_min) * t;
3051 result = (TYPE)((SIGNEDTYPE)v_min + (SIGNEDTYPE)(v_new_off_f + (FLOATTYPE)(v_min > v_max ? -0.5 : 0.5)));
3052 }
3053 }
3054
3055 return result;
3056}
3057
3058// FIXME: Try to move more of the code into shared SliderBehavior()
3059template<typename TYPE, typename SIGNEDTYPE, typename FLOATTYPE>
3060bool ImGui::SliderBehaviorT(const ImRect& bb, ImGuiID id, ImGuiDataType data_type, TYPE* v, const TYPE v_min, const TYPE v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags, ImRect* out_grab_bb)
3061{
3062 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3063 const ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
3064
3065 const ImGuiAxis axis = (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_Vertical) ? ImGuiAxis_Y : ImGuiAxis_X;
3066 const bool is_logarithmic = (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic) != 0;
3067 const bool is_floating_point = (data_type == ImGuiDataType_Float) || (data_type == ImGuiDataType_Double);
3068 const float v_range_f = (float)(v_min < v_max ? v_max - v_min : v_min - v_max); // We don't need high precision for what we do with it.
3069
3070 // Calculate bounds
3071 const float grab_padding = 2.0f; // FIXME: Should be part of style.
3072 const float slider_sz = (bb.Max[axis] - bb.Min[axis]) - grab_padding * 2.0f;
3073 float grab_sz = style.GrabMinSize;
3074 if (!is_floating_point && v_range_f >= 0.0f) // v_range_f < 0 may happen on integer overflows
3075 grab_sz = ImMax(slider_sz / (v_range_f + 1), style.GrabMinSize); // For integer sliders: if possible have the grab size represent 1 unit
3076 grab_sz = ImMin(grab_sz, slider_sz);
3077 const float slider_usable_sz = slider_sz - grab_sz;
3078 const float slider_usable_pos_min = bb.Min[axis] + grab_padding + grab_sz * 0.5f;
3079 const float slider_usable_pos_max = bb.Max[axis] - grab_padding - grab_sz * 0.5f;
3080
3081 float logarithmic_zero_epsilon = 0.0f; // Only valid when is_logarithmic is true
3082 float zero_deadzone_halfsize = 0.0f; // Only valid when is_logarithmic is true
3083 if (is_logarithmic)
3084 {
3085 // When using logarithmic sliders, we need to clamp to avoid hitting zero, but our choice of clamp value greatly affects slider precision. We attempt to use the specified precision to estimate a good lower bound.
3086 const int decimal_precision = is_floating_point ? ImParseFormatPrecision(format, 3) : 1;
3087 logarithmic_zero_epsilon = ImPow(0.1f, (float)decimal_precision);
3088 zero_deadzone_halfsize = (style.LogSliderDeadzone * 0.5f) / ImMax(slider_usable_sz, 1.0f);
3089 }
3090
3091 // Process interacting with the slider
3092 bool value_changed = false;
3093 if (g.ActiveId == id)
3094 {
3095 bool set_new_value = false;
3096 float clicked_t = 0.0f;
3097 if (g.ActiveIdSource == ImGuiInputSource_Mouse)
3098 {
3099 if (!g.IO.MouseDown[0])
3100 {
3101 ClearActiveID();
3102 }
3103 else
3104 {
3105 const float mouse_abs_pos = g.IO.MousePos[axis];
3106 if (g.ActiveIdIsJustActivated)
3107 {
3108 float grab_t = ScaleRatioFromValueT<TYPE, SIGNEDTYPE, FLOATTYPE>(data_type, *v, v_min, v_max, is_logarithmic, logarithmic_zero_epsilon, zero_deadzone_halfsize);
3109 if (axis == ImGuiAxis_Y)
3110 grab_t = 1.0f - grab_t;
3111 const float grab_pos = ImLerp(slider_usable_pos_min, slider_usable_pos_max, grab_t);
3112 const bool clicked_around_grab = (mouse_abs_pos >= grab_pos - grab_sz * 0.5f - 1.0f) && (mouse_abs_pos <= grab_pos + grab_sz * 0.5f + 1.0f); // No harm being extra generous here.
3113 g.SliderGrabClickOffset = (clicked_around_grab && is_floating_point) ? mouse_abs_pos - grab_pos : 0.0f;
3114 }
3115 if (slider_usable_sz > 0.0f)
3116 clicked_t = ImSaturate((mouse_abs_pos - g.SliderGrabClickOffset - slider_usable_pos_min) / slider_usable_sz);
3117 if (axis == ImGuiAxis_Y)
3118 clicked_t = 1.0f - clicked_t;
3119 set_new_value = true;
3120 }
3121 }
3122 else if (g.ActiveIdSource == ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard || g.ActiveIdSource == ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad)
3123 {
3124 if (g.ActiveIdIsJustActivated)
3125 {
3126 g.SliderCurrentAccum = 0.0f; // Reset any stored nav delta upon activation
3127 g.SliderCurrentAccumDirty = false;
3128 }
3129
3130 float input_delta = (axis == ImGuiAxis_X) ? GetNavTweakPressedAmount(axis) : -GetNavTweakPressedAmount(axis);
3131 if (input_delta != 0.0f)
3132 {
3133 const bool tweak_slow = IsKeyDown((g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad) ? ImGuiKey_NavGamepadTweakSlow : ImGuiKey_NavKeyboardTweakSlow);
3134 const bool tweak_fast = IsKeyDown((g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad) ? ImGuiKey_NavGamepadTweakFast : ImGuiKey_NavKeyboardTweakFast);
3135 const int decimal_precision = is_floating_point ? ImParseFormatPrecision(format, 3) : 0;
3136 if (decimal_precision > 0)
3137 {
3138 input_delta /= 100.0f; // Keyboard/Gamepad tweak speeds in % of slider bounds
3139 if (tweak_slow)
3140 input_delta /= 10.0f;
3141 }
3142 else
3143 {
3144 if ((v_range_f >= -100.0f && v_range_f <= 100.0f && v_range_f != 0.0f) || tweak_slow)
3145 input_delta = ((input_delta < 0.0f) ? -1.0f : +1.0f) / v_range_f; // Keyboard/Gamepad tweak speeds in integer steps
3146 else
3147 input_delta /= 100.0f;
3148 }
3149 if (tweak_fast)
3150 input_delta *= 10.0f;
3151
3152 g.SliderCurrentAccum += input_delta;
3153 g.SliderCurrentAccumDirty = true;
3154 }
3155
3156 float delta = g.SliderCurrentAccum;
3157 if (g.NavActivatePressedId == id && !g.ActiveIdIsJustActivated)
3158 {
3159 ClearActiveID();
3160 }
3161 else if (g.SliderCurrentAccumDirty)
3162 {
3163 clicked_t = ScaleRatioFromValueT<TYPE, SIGNEDTYPE, FLOATTYPE>(data_type, *v, v_min, v_max, is_logarithmic, logarithmic_zero_epsilon, zero_deadzone_halfsize);
3164
3165 if ((clicked_t >= 1.0f && delta > 0.0f) || (clicked_t <= 0.0f && delta < 0.0f)) // This is to avoid applying the saturation when already past the limits
3166 {
3167 set_new_value = false;
3168 g.SliderCurrentAccum = 0.0f; // If pushing up against the limits, don't continue to accumulate
3169 }
3170 else
3171 {
3172 set_new_value = true;
3173 float old_clicked_t = clicked_t;
3174 clicked_t = ImSaturate(clicked_t + delta);
3175
3176 // Calculate what our "new" clicked_t will be, and thus how far we actually moved the slider, and subtract this from the accumulator
3177 TYPE v_new = ScaleValueFromRatioT<TYPE, SIGNEDTYPE, FLOATTYPE>(data_type, clicked_t, v_min, v_max, is_logarithmic, logarithmic_zero_epsilon, zero_deadzone_halfsize);
3178 if (is_floating_point && !(flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_NoRoundToFormat))
3179 v_new = RoundScalarWithFormatT<TYPE>(format, data_type, v_new);
3180 float new_clicked_t = ScaleRatioFromValueT<TYPE, SIGNEDTYPE, FLOATTYPE>(data_type, v_new, v_min, v_max, is_logarithmic, logarithmic_zero_epsilon, zero_deadzone_halfsize);
3181
3182 if (delta > 0)
3183 g.SliderCurrentAccum -= ImMin(new_clicked_t - old_clicked_t, delta);
3184 else
3185 g.SliderCurrentAccum -= ImMax(new_clicked_t - old_clicked_t, delta);
3186 }
3187
3188 g.SliderCurrentAccumDirty = false;
3189 }
3190 }
3191
3192 if (set_new_value)
3193 if ((g.LastItemData.ItemFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_ReadOnly) || (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_ReadOnly))
3194 set_new_value = false;
3195
3196 if (set_new_value)
3197 {
3198 TYPE v_new = ScaleValueFromRatioT<TYPE, SIGNEDTYPE, FLOATTYPE>(data_type, clicked_t, v_min, v_max, is_logarithmic, logarithmic_zero_epsilon, zero_deadzone_halfsize);
3199
3200 // Round to user desired precision based on format string
3201 if (is_floating_point && !(flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_NoRoundToFormat))
3202 v_new = RoundScalarWithFormatT<TYPE>(format, data_type, v_new);
3203
3204 // Apply result
3205 if (*v != v_new)
3206 {
3207 *v = v_new;
3208 value_changed = true;
3209 }
3210 }
3211 }
3212
3213 if (slider_sz < 1.0f)
3214 {
3215 *out_grab_bb = ImRect(bb.Min, bb.Min);
3216 }
3217 else
3218 {
3219 // Output grab position so it can be displayed by the caller
3220 float grab_t = ScaleRatioFromValueT<TYPE, SIGNEDTYPE, FLOATTYPE>(data_type, *v, v_min, v_max, is_logarithmic, logarithmic_zero_epsilon, zero_deadzone_halfsize);
3221 if (axis == ImGuiAxis_Y)
3222 grab_t = 1.0f - grab_t;
3223 const float grab_pos = ImLerp(slider_usable_pos_min, slider_usable_pos_max, grab_t);
3224 if (axis == ImGuiAxis_X)
3225 *out_grab_bb = ImRect(grab_pos - grab_sz * 0.5f, bb.Min.y + grab_padding, grab_pos + grab_sz * 0.5f, bb.Max.y - grab_padding);
3226 else
3227 *out_grab_bb = ImRect(bb.Min.x + grab_padding, grab_pos - grab_sz * 0.5f, bb.Max.x - grab_padding, grab_pos + grab_sz * 0.5f);
3228 }
3229
3230 return value_changed;
3231}
3232
3233// For 32-bit and larger types, slider bounds are limited to half the natural type range.
3234// So e.g. an integer Slider between INT_MAX-10 and INT_MAX will fail, but an integer Slider between INT_MAX/2-10 and INT_MAX/2 will be ok.
3235// It would be possible to lift that limitation with some work but it doesn't seem to be worth it for sliders.
3236bool ImGui::SliderBehavior(const ImRect& bb, ImGuiID id, ImGuiDataType data_type, void* p_v, const void* p_min, const void* p_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags, ImRect* out_grab_bb)
3237{
3238 // Read imgui.cpp "API BREAKING CHANGES" section for 1.78 if you hit this assert.
3239 IM_ASSERT((flags == 1 || (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_InvalidMask_) == 0) && "Invalid ImGuiSliderFlags flags! Has the legacy 'float power' argument been mistakenly cast to flags? Call function with ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic flags instead.");
3240 IM_ASSERT((flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_WrapAround) == 0); // Not supported by SliderXXX(), only by DragXXX()
3241
3242 switch (data_type)
3243 {
3244 case ImGuiDataType_S8: { ImS32 v32 = (ImS32)*(ImS8*)p_v; bool r = SliderBehaviorT<ImS32, ImS32, float>(bb, id, ImGuiDataType_S32, &v32, *(const ImS8*)p_min, *(const ImS8*)p_max, format, flags, out_grab_bb); if (r) *(ImS8*)p_v = (ImS8)v32; return r; }
3245 case ImGuiDataType_U8: { ImU32 v32 = (ImU32)*(ImU8*)p_v; bool r = SliderBehaviorT<ImU32, ImS32, float>(bb, id, ImGuiDataType_U32, &v32, *(const ImU8*)p_min, *(const ImU8*)p_max, format, flags, out_grab_bb); if (r) *(ImU8*)p_v = (ImU8)v32; return r; }
3246 case ImGuiDataType_S16: { ImS32 v32 = (ImS32)*(ImS16*)p_v; bool r = SliderBehaviorT<ImS32, ImS32, float>(bb, id, ImGuiDataType_S32, &v32, *(const ImS16*)p_min, *(const ImS16*)p_max, format, flags, out_grab_bb); if (r) *(ImS16*)p_v = (ImS16)v32; return r; }
3247 case ImGuiDataType_U16: { ImU32 v32 = (ImU32)*(ImU16*)p_v; bool r = SliderBehaviorT<ImU32, ImS32, float>(bb, id, ImGuiDataType_U32, &v32, *(const ImU16*)p_min, *(const ImU16*)p_max, format, flags, out_grab_bb); if (r) *(ImU16*)p_v = (ImU16)v32; return r; }
3248 case ImGuiDataType_S32:
3249 IM_ASSERT(*(const ImS32*)p_min >= IM_S32_MIN / 2 && *(const ImS32*)p_max <= IM_S32_MAX / 2);
3250 return SliderBehaviorT<ImS32, ImS32, float >(bb, id, data_type, (ImS32*)p_v, *(const ImS32*)p_min, *(const ImS32*)p_max, format, flags, out_grab_bb);
3251 case ImGuiDataType_U32:
3252 IM_ASSERT(*(const ImU32*)p_max <= IM_U32_MAX / 2);
3253 return SliderBehaviorT<ImU32, ImS32, float >(bb, id, data_type, (ImU32*)p_v, *(const ImU32*)p_min, *(const ImU32*)p_max, format, flags, out_grab_bb);
3254 case ImGuiDataType_S64:
3255 IM_ASSERT(*(const ImS64*)p_min >= IM_S64_MIN / 2 && *(const ImS64*)p_max <= IM_S64_MAX / 2);
3256 return SliderBehaviorT<ImS64, ImS64, double>(bb, id, data_type, (ImS64*)p_v, *(const ImS64*)p_min, *(const ImS64*)p_max, format, flags, out_grab_bb);
3257 case ImGuiDataType_U64:
3258 IM_ASSERT(*(const ImU64*)p_max <= IM_U64_MAX / 2);
3259 return SliderBehaviorT<ImU64, ImS64, double>(bb, id, data_type, (ImU64*)p_v, *(const ImU64*)p_min, *(const ImU64*)p_max, format, flags, out_grab_bb);
3260 case ImGuiDataType_Float:
3261 IM_ASSERT(*(const float*)p_min >= -FLT_MAX / 2.0f && *(const float*)p_max <= FLT_MAX / 2.0f);
3262 return SliderBehaviorT<float, float, float >(bb, id, data_type, (float*)p_v, *(const float*)p_min, *(const float*)p_max, format, flags, out_grab_bb);
3263 case ImGuiDataType_Double:
3264 IM_ASSERT(*(const double*)p_min >= -DBL_MAX / 2.0f && *(const double*)p_max <= DBL_MAX / 2.0f);
3265 return SliderBehaviorT<double, double, double>(bb, id, data_type, (double*)p_v, *(const double*)p_min, *(const double*)p_max, format, flags, out_grab_bb);
3266 case ImGuiDataType_COUNT: break;
3267 }
3268 IM_ASSERT(0);
3269 return false;
3270}
3271
3272// Note: p_data, p_min and p_max are _pointers_ to a memory address holding the data. For a slider, they are all required.
3273// Read code of e.g. SliderFloat(), SliderInt() etc. or examples in 'Demo->Widgets->Data Types' to understand how to use this function directly.
3274bool ImGui::SliderScalar(const char* label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void* p_data, const void* p_min, const void* p_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
3275{
3276 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
3277 if (window->SkipItems)
3278 return false;
3279
3280 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3281 const ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
3282 const ImGuiID id = window->GetID(label);
3283 const float w = CalcItemWidth();
3284
3285 const ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
3286 const ImRect frame_bb(window->DC.CursorPos, window->DC.CursorPos + ImVec2(w, label_size.y + style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f));
3287 const ImRect total_bb(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max + ImVec2(label_size.x > 0.0f ? style.ItemInnerSpacing.x + label_size.x : 0.0f, 0.0f));
3288
3289 const bool temp_input_allowed = (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_NoInput) == 0;
3290 ItemSize(total_bb, style.FramePadding.y);
3291 if (!ItemAdd(total_bb, id, &frame_bb, temp_input_allowed ? ImGuiItemFlags_Inputable : 0))
3292 return false;
3293
3294 // Default format string when passing NULL
3295 if (format == NULL)
3296 format = DataTypeGetInfo(data_type)->PrintFmt;
3297
3298 const bool hovered = ItemHoverable(frame_bb, id, g.LastItemData.ItemFlags);
3299 bool temp_input_is_active = temp_input_allowed && TempInputIsActive(id);
3300 if (!temp_input_is_active)
3301 {
