3302 // Tabbing or CTRL+click on Slider turns it into an input box
3303 const bool clicked = hovered && IsMouseClicked(0, ImGuiInputFlags_None, id);
3304 const bool make_active = (clicked || g.NavActivateId == id);
3305 if (make_active && clicked)
3306 SetKeyOwner(ImGuiKey_MouseLeft, id);
3307 if (make_active && temp_input_allowed)
3308 if ((clicked && g.IO.KeyCtrl) || (g.NavActivateId == id && (g.NavActivateFlags & ImGuiActivateFlags_PreferInput)))
3309 temp_input_is_active = true;
3310
3311 // Store initial value (not used by main lib but available as a convenience but some mods e.g. to revert)
3312 if (make_active)
3313 memcpy(&g.ActiveIdValueOnActivation, p_data, DataTypeGetInfo(data_type)->Size);
3314
3315 if (make_active && !temp_input_is_active)
3316 {
3317 SetActiveID(id, window);
3318 SetFocusID(id, window);
3319 FocusWindow(window);
3320 g.ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask |= (1 << ImGuiDir_Left) | (1 << ImGuiDir_Right);
3321 }
3322 }
3323
3324 if (temp_input_is_active)
3325 {
3326 // Only clamp CTRL+Click input when ImGuiSliderFlags_ClampOnInput is set (generally via ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp)
3327 const bool clamp_enabled = (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_ClampOnInput) != 0;
3328 return TempInputScalar(frame_bb, id, label, data_type, p_data, format, clamp_enabled ? p_min : NULL, clamp_enabled ? p_max : NULL);
3329 }
3330
3331 // Draw frame
3332 const ImU32 frame_col = GetColorU32(g.ActiveId == id ? ImGuiCol_FrameBgActive : hovered ? ImGuiCol_FrameBgHovered : ImGuiCol_FrameBg);
3333 RenderNavCursor(frame_bb, id);
3334 RenderFrame(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max, frame_col, true, g.Style.FrameRounding);
3335
3336 // Slider behavior
3337 ImRect grab_bb;
3338 const bool value_changed = SliderBehavior(frame_bb, id, data_type, p_data, p_min, p_max, format, flags, &grab_bb);
3339 if (value_changed)
3340 MarkItemEdited(id);
3341
3342 // Render grab
3343 if (grab_bb.Max.x > grab_bb.Min.x)
3344 window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(grab_bb.Min, grab_bb.Max, GetColorU32(g.ActiveId == id ? ImGuiCol_SliderGrabActive : ImGuiCol_SliderGrab), style.GrabRounding);
3345
3346 // Display value using user-provided display format so user can add prefix/suffix/decorations to the value.
3347 char value_buf[64];
3348 const char* value_buf_end = value_buf + DataTypeFormatString(value_buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(value_buf), data_type, p_data, format);
3349 if (g.LogEnabled)
3350 LogSetNextTextDecoration("{", "}");
3351 RenderTextClipped(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max, value_buf, value_buf_end, NULL, ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f));
3352
3353 if (label_size.x > 0.0f)
3354 RenderText(ImVec2(frame_bb.Max.x + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x, frame_bb.Min.y + style.FramePadding.y), label);
3355
3356 IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_INFO(id, label, g.LastItemData.StatusFlags | (temp_input_allowed ? ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Inputable : 0));
3357 return value_changed;
3358}
3359
3360// Add multiple sliders on 1 line for compact edition of multiple components
3361bool ImGui::SliderScalarN(const char* label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void* v, int components, const void* v_min, const void* v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
3362{
3363 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
3364 if (window->SkipItems)
3365 return false;
3366
3367 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3368 bool value_changed = false;
3369 BeginGroup();
3370 PushID(label);
3371 PushMultiItemsWidths(components, CalcItemWidth());
3372 size_t type_size = GDataTypeInfo[data_type].Size;
3373 for (int i = 0; i < components; i++)
3374 {
3375 PushID(i);
3376 if (i > 0)
3377 SameLine(0, g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
3378 value_changed |= SliderScalar("", data_type, v, v_min, v_max, format, flags);
3379 PopID();
3380 PopItemWidth();
3381 v = (void*)((char*)v + type_size);
3382 }
3383 PopID();
3384
3385 const char* label_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(label);
3386 if (label != label_end)
3387 {
3388 SameLine(0, g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
3389 TextEx(label, label_end);
3390 }
3391
3392 EndGroup();
3393 return value_changed;
3394}
3395
3396bool ImGui::SliderFloat(const char* label, float* v, float v_min, float v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
3397{
3398 return SliderScalar(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
3399}
3400
3401bool ImGui::SliderFloat2(const char* label, float v[2], float v_min, float v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
3402{
3403 return SliderScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, 2, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
3404}
3405
3406bool ImGui::SliderFloat3(const char* label, float v[3], float v_min, float v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
3407{
3408 return SliderScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, 3, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
3409}
3410
3411bool ImGui::SliderFloat4(const char* label, float v[4], float v_min, float v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
3412{
3413 return SliderScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, 4, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
3414}
3415
3416bool ImGui::SliderAngle(const char* label, float* v_rad, float v_degrees_min, float v_degrees_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
3417{
3418 if (format == NULL)
3419 format = "%.0f deg";
3420 float v_deg = (*v_rad) * 360.0f / (2 * IM_PI);
3421 bool value_changed = SliderFloat(label, &v_deg, v_degrees_min, v_degrees_max, format, flags);
3422 if (value_changed)
3423 *v_rad = v_deg * (2 * IM_PI) / 360.0f;
3424 return value_changed;
3425}
3426
3427bool ImGui::SliderInt(const char* label, int* v, int v_min, int v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
3428{
3429 return SliderScalar(label, ImGuiDataType_S32, v, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
3430}
3431
3432bool ImGui::SliderInt2(const char* label, int v[2], int v_min, int v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
3433{
3434 return SliderScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_S32, v, 2, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
3435}
3436
3437bool ImGui::SliderInt3(const char* label, int v[3], int v_min, int v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
3438{
3439 return SliderScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_S32, v, 3, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
3440}
3441
3442bool ImGui::SliderInt4(const char* label, int v[4], int v_min, int v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
3443{
3444 return SliderScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_S32, v, 4, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
3445}
3446
3447bool ImGui::VSliderScalar(const char* label, const ImVec2& size, ImGuiDataType data_type, void* p_data, const void* p_min, const void* p_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
3448{
3449 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
3450 if (window->SkipItems)
3451 return false;
3452
3453 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3454 const ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
3455 const ImGuiID id = window->GetID(label);
3456
3457 const ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
3458 const ImRect frame_bb(window->DC.CursorPos, window->DC.CursorPos + size);
3459 const ImRect bb(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max + ImVec2(label_size.x > 0.0f ? style.ItemInnerSpacing.x + label_size.x : 0.0f, 0.0f));
3460
3461 ItemSize(bb, style.FramePadding.y);
3462 if (!ItemAdd(frame_bb, id))
3463 return false;
3464
3465 // Default format string when passing NULL
3466 if (format == NULL)
3467 format = DataTypeGetInfo(data_type)->PrintFmt;
3468
3469 const bool hovered = ItemHoverable(frame_bb, id, g.LastItemData.ItemFlags);
3470 const bool clicked = hovered && IsMouseClicked(0, ImGuiInputFlags_None, id);
3471 if (clicked || g.NavActivateId == id)
3472 {
3473 if (clicked)
3474 SetKeyOwner(ImGuiKey_MouseLeft, id);
3475 SetActiveID(id, window);
3476 SetFocusID(id, window);
3477 FocusWindow(window);
3478 g.ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask |= (1 << ImGuiDir_Up) | (1 << ImGuiDir_Down);
3479 }
3480
3481 // Draw frame
3482 const ImU32 frame_col = GetColorU32(g.ActiveId == id ? ImGuiCol_FrameBgActive : hovered ? ImGuiCol_FrameBgHovered : ImGuiCol_FrameBg);
3483 RenderNavCursor(frame_bb, id);
3484 RenderFrame(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max, frame_col, true, g.Style.FrameRounding);
3485
3486 // Slider behavior
3487 ImRect grab_bb;
3488 const bool value_changed = SliderBehavior(frame_bb, id, data_type, p_data, p_min, p_max, format, flags | ImGuiSliderFlags_Vertical, &grab_bb);
3489 if (value_changed)
3490 MarkItemEdited(id);
3491
3492 // Render grab
3493 if (grab_bb.Max.y > grab_bb.Min.y)
3494 window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(grab_bb.Min, grab_bb.Max, GetColorU32(g.ActiveId == id ? ImGuiCol_SliderGrabActive : ImGuiCol_SliderGrab), style.GrabRounding);
3495
3496 // Display value using user-provided display format so user can add prefix/suffix/decorations to the value.
3497 // For the vertical slider we allow centered text to overlap the frame padding
3498 char value_buf[64];
3499 const char* value_buf_end = value_buf + DataTypeFormatString(value_buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(value_buf), data_type, p_data, format);
3500 RenderTextClipped(ImVec2(frame_bb.Min.x, frame_bb.Min.y + style.FramePadding.y), frame_bb.Max, value_buf, value_buf_end, NULL, ImVec2(0.5f, 0.0f));
3501 if (label_size.x > 0.0f)
3502 RenderText(ImVec2(frame_bb.Max.x + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x, frame_bb.Min.y + style.FramePadding.y), label);
3503
3504 return value_changed;
3505}
3506
3507bool ImGui::VSliderFloat(const char* label, const ImVec2& size, float* v, float v_min, float v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
3508{
3509 return VSliderScalar(label, size, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
3510}
3511
3512bool ImGui::VSliderInt(const char* label, const ImVec2& size, int* v, int v_min, int v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
3513{
3514 return VSliderScalar(label, size, ImGuiDataType_S32, v, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
3515}
3516
3517//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
3518// [SECTION] Widgets: InputScalar, InputFloat, InputInt, etc.
3519//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
3520// - ImParseFormatFindStart() [Internal]
3521// - ImParseFormatFindEnd() [Internal]
3522// - ImParseFormatTrimDecorations() [Internal]
3523// - ImParseFormatSanitizeForPrinting() [Internal]
3524// - ImParseFormatSanitizeForScanning() [Internal]
3525// - ImParseFormatPrecision() [Internal]
3526// - TempInputTextScalar() [Internal]
3527// - InputScalar()
3528// - InputScalarN()
3529// - InputFloat()
3530// - InputFloat2()
3531// - InputFloat3()
3532// - InputFloat4()
3533// - InputInt()
3534// - InputInt2()
3535// - InputInt3()
3536// - InputInt4()
3537// - InputDouble()
3538//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
3539
3540// We don't use strchr() because our strings are usually very short and often start with '%'
3541const char* ImParseFormatFindStart(const char* fmt)
3542{
3543 while (char c = fmt[0])
3544 {
3545 if (c == '%' && fmt[1] != '%')
3546 return fmt;
3547 else if (c == '%')
3548 fmt++;
3549 fmt++;
3550 }
3551 return fmt;
3552}
3553
3554const char* ImParseFormatFindEnd(const char* fmt)
3555{
3556 // Printf/scanf types modifiers: I/L/h/j/l/t/w/z. Other uppercase letters qualify as types aka end of the format.
3557 if (fmt[0] != '%')
3558 return fmt;
3559 const unsigned int ignored_uppercase_mask = (1 << ('I'-'A')) | (1 << ('L'-'A'));
3560 const unsigned int ignored_lowercase_mask = (1 << ('h'-'a')) | (1 << ('j'-'a')) | (1 << ('l'-'a')) | (1 << ('t'-'a')) | (1 << ('w'-'a')) | (1 << ('z'-'a'));
3561 for (char c; (c = *fmt) != 0; fmt++)
3562 {
3563 if (c >= 'A' && c <= 'Z' && ((1 << (c - 'A')) & ignored_uppercase_mask) == 0)
3564 return fmt + 1;
3565 if (c >= 'a' && c <= 'z' && ((1 << (c - 'a')) & ignored_lowercase_mask) == 0)
3566 return fmt + 1;
3567 }
3568 return fmt;
3569}
3570
3571// Extract the format out of a format string with leading or trailing decorations
3572// fmt = "blah blah" -> return ""
3573// fmt = "%.3f" -> return fmt
3574// fmt = "hello %.3f" -> return fmt + 6
3575// fmt = "%.3f hello" -> return buf written with "%.3f"
3576const char* ImParseFormatTrimDecorations(const char* fmt, char* buf, size_t buf_size)
3577{
3578 const char* fmt_start = ImParseFormatFindStart(fmt);
3579 if (fmt_start[0] != '%')
3580 return "";
3581 const char* fmt_end = ImParseFormatFindEnd(fmt_start);
3582 if (fmt_end[0] == 0) // If we only have leading decoration, we don't need to copy the data.
3583 return fmt_start;
3584 ImStrncpy(buf, fmt_start, ImMin((size_t)(fmt_end - fmt_start) + 1, buf_size));
3585 return buf;
3586}
3587
3588// Sanitize format
3589// - Zero terminate so extra characters after format (e.g. "%f123") don't confuse atof/atoi
3590// - stb_sprintf.h supports several new modifiers which format numbers in a way that also makes them incompatible atof/atoi.
3591void ImParseFormatSanitizeForPrinting(const char* fmt_in, char* fmt_out, size_t fmt_out_size)
3592{
3593 const char* fmt_end = ImParseFormatFindEnd(fmt_in);
3594 IM_UNUSED(fmt_out_size);
3595 IM_ASSERT((size_t)(fmt_end - fmt_in + 1) < fmt_out_size); // Format is too long, let us know if this happens to you!
3596 while (fmt_in < fmt_end)
3597 {
3598 char c = *fmt_in++;
3599 if (c != '\'' && c != '$' && c != '_') // Custom flags provided by stb_sprintf.h. POSIX 2008 also supports '.
3600 *(fmt_out++) = c;
3601 }
3602 *fmt_out = 0; // Zero-terminate
3603}
3604
3605// - For scanning we need to remove all width and precision fields and flags "%+3.7f" -> "%f". BUT don't strip types like "%I64d" which includes digits. ! "%07I64d" -> "%I64d"
3606const char* ImParseFormatSanitizeForScanning(const char* fmt_in, char* fmt_out, size_t fmt_out_size)
3607{
3608 const char* fmt_end = ImParseFormatFindEnd(fmt_in);
3609 const char* fmt_out_begin = fmt_out;
3610 IM_UNUSED(fmt_out_size);
3611 IM_ASSERT((size_t)(fmt_end - fmt_in + 1) < fmt_out_size); // Format is too long, let us know if this happens to you!
3612 bool has_type = false;
3613 while (fmt_in < fmt_end)
3614 {
3615 char c = *fmt_in++;
3616 if (!has_type && ((c >= '0' && c <= '9') || c == '.' || c == '+' || c == '#'))
3617 continue;
3618 has_type |= ((c >= 'a' && c <= 'z') || (c >= 'A' && c <= 'Z')); // Stop skipping digits
3619 if (c != '\'' && c != '$' && c != '_') // Custom flags provided by stb_sprintf.h. POSIX 2008 also supports '.
3620 *(fmt_out++) = c;
3621 }
3622 *fmt_out = 0; // Zero-terminate
3623 return fmt_out_begin;
3624}
3625
3626template<typename TYPE>
3627static const char* ImAtoi(const char* src, TYPE* output)
3628{
3629 int negative = 0;
3630 if (*src == '-') { negative = 1; src++; }
3631 if (*src == '+') { src++; }
3632 TYPE v = 0;
3633 while (*src >= '0' && *src <= '9')
3634 v = (v * 10) + (*src++ - '0');
3635 *output = negative ? -v : v;
3636 return src;
3637}
3638
3639// Parse display precision back from the display format string
3640// FIXME: This is still used by some navigation code path to infer a minimum tweak step, but we should aim to rework widgets so it isn't needed.
3641int ImParseFormatPrecision(const char* fmt, int default_precision)
3642{
3643 fmt = ImParseFormatFindStart(fmt);
3644 if (fmt[0] != '%')
3645 return default_precision;
3646 fmt++;
3647 while (*fmt >= '0' && *fmt <= '9')
3648 fmt++;
3649 int precision = INT_MAX;
3650 if (*fmt == '.')
3651 {
3652 fmt = ImAtoi<int>(fmt + 1, &precision);
3653 if (precision < 0 || precision > 99)
3654 precision = default_precision;
3655 }
3656 if (*fmt == 'e' || *fmt == 'E') // Maximum precision with scientific notation
3657 precision = -1;
3658 if ((*fmt == 'g' || *fmt == 'G') && precision == INT_MAX)
3659 precision = -1;
3660 return (precision == INT_MAX) ? default_precision : precision;
3661}
3662
3663// Create text input in place of another active widget (e.g. used when doing a CTRL+Click on drag/slider widgets)
3664// FIXME: Facilitate using this in variety of other situations.
3665// FIXME: Among other things, setting ImGuiItemFlags_AllowDuplicateId in LastItemData is currently correct but
3666// the expected relationship between TempInputXXX functions and LastItemData is a little fishy.
3667bool ImGui::TempInputText(const ImRect& bb, ImGuiID id, const char* label, char* buf, int buf_size, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags)
3668{
3669 // On the first frame, g.TempInputTextId == 0, then on subsequent frames it becomes == id.
3670 // We clear ActiveID on the first frame to allow the InputText() taking it back.
3671 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3672 const bool init = (g.TempInputId != id);
3673 if (init)
3674 ClearActiveID();
3675
3676 g.CurrentWindow->DC.CursorPos = bb.Min;
3677 g.LastItemData.ItemFlags |= ImGuiItemFlags_AllowDuplicateId;
3678 bool value_changed = InputTextEx(label, NULL, buf, buf_size, bb.GetSize(), flags | ImGuiInputTextFlags_MergedItem);
3679 if (init)
3680 {
3681 // First frame we started displaying the InputText widget, we expect it to take the active id.
3682 IM_ASSERT(g.ActiveId == id);
3683 g.TempInputId = g.ActiveId;
3684 }
3685 return value_changed;
3686}
3687
3688// Note that Drag/Slider functions are only forwarding the min/max values clamping values if the ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp flag is set!
3689// This is intended: this way we allow CTRL+Click manual input to set a value out of bounds, for maximum flexibility.
3690// However this may not be ideal for all uses, as some user code may break on out of bound values.
3691bool ImGui::TempInputScalar(const ImRect& bb, ImGuiID id, const char* label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void* p_data, const char* format, const void* p_clamp_min, const void* p_clamp_max)
3692{
3693 // FIXME: May need to clarify display behavior if format doesn't contain %.
3694 // "%d" -> "%d" / "There are %d items" -> "%d" / "items" -> "%d" (fallback). Also see #6405
3695 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3696 const ImGuiDataTypeInfo* type_info = DataTypeGetInfo(data_type);
3697 char fmt_buf[32];
3698 char data_buf[32];
3699 format = ImParseFormatTrimDecorations(format, fmt_buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(fmt_buf));
3700 if (format[0] == 0)
3701 format = type_info->PrintFmt;
3702 DataTypeFormatString(data_buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(data_buf), data_type, p_data, format);
3703 ImStrTrimBlanks(data_buf);
3704
3705 ImGuiInputTextFlags flags = ImGuiInputTextFlags_AutoSelectAll | (ImGuiInputTextFlags)ImGuiInputTextFlags_LocalizeDecimalPoint;
3706 g.LastItemData.ItemFlags |= ImGuiItemFlags_NoMarkEdited; // Because TempInputText() uses ImGuiInputTextFlags_MergedItem it doesn't submit a new item, so we poke LastItemData.
3707 bool value_changed = false;
3708 if (TempInputText(bb, id, label, data_buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(data_buf), flags))
3709 {
3710 // Backup old value
3711 size_t data_type_size = type_info->Size;
3712 ImGuiDataTypeStorage data_backup;
3713 memcpy(&data_backup, p_data, data_type_size);
3714
3715 // Apply new value (or operations) then clamp
3716 DataTypeApplyFromText(data_buf, data_type, p_data, format, NULL);
3717 if (p_clamp_min || p_clamp_max)
3718 {
3719 if (p_clamp_min && p_clamp_max && DataTypeCompare(data_type, p_clamp_min, p_clamp_max) > 0)
3720 ImSwap(p_clamp_min, p_clamp_max);
3721 DataTypeClamp(data_type, p_data, p_clamp_min, p_clamp_max);
3722 }
3723
3724 // Only mark as edited if new value is different
3725 g.LastItemData.ItemFlags &= ~ImGuiItemFlags_NoMarkEdited;
3726 value_changed = memcmp(&data_backup, p_data, data_type_size) != 0;
3727 if (value_changed)
3728 MarkItemEdited(id);
3729 }
3730 return value_changed;
3731}
3732
3733void ImGui::SetNextItemRefVal(ImGuiDataType data_type, void* p_data)
3734{
3735 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3736 g.NextItemData.HasFlags |= ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_HasRefVal;
3737 memcpy(&g.NextItemData.RefVal, p_data, DataTypeGetInfo(data_type)->Size);
3738}
3739
3740// Note: p_data, p_step, p_step_fast are _pointers_ to a memory address holding the data. For an Input widget, p_step and p_step_fast are optional.
3741// Read code of e.g. InputFloat(), InputInt() etc. or examples in 'Demo->Widgets->Data Types' to understand how to use this function directly.
3742bool ImGui::InputScalar(const char* label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void* p_data, const void* p_step, const void* p_step_fast, const char* format, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags)
3743{
3744 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
3745 if (window->SkipItems)
3746 return false;
3747
3748 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3749 ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
3750 IM_ASSERT((flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_EnterReturnsTrue) == 0); // Not supported by InputScalar(). Please open an issue if you this would be useful to you. Otherwise use IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit()!
3751
3752 if (format == NULL)
3753 format = DataTypeGetInfo(data_type)->PrintFmt;
3754
3755 void* p_data_default = (g.NextItemData.HasFlags & ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_HasRefVal) ? &g.NextItemData.RefVal : &g.DataTypeZeroValue;
3756
3757 char buf[64];
3758 if ((flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_DisplayEmptyRefVal) && DataTypeCompare(data_type, p_data, p_data_default) == 0)
3759 buf[0] = 0;
3760 else
3761 DataTypeFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), data_type, p_data, format);
3762
3763 // Disable the MarkItemEdited() call in InputText but keep ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Edited.
3764 // We call MarkItemEdited() ourselves by comparing the actual data rather than the string.
3765 g.NextItemData.ItemFlags |= ImGuiItemFlags_NoMarkEdited;
3766 flags |= ImGuiInputTextFlags_AutoSelectAll | (ImGuiInputTextFlags)ImGuiInputTextFlags_LocalizeDecimalPoint;
3767
3768 bool value_changed = false;
3769 if (p_step == NULL)
3770 {
3771 if (InputText(label, buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), flags))
3772 value_changed = DataTypeApplyFromText(buf, data_type, p_data, format, (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_ParseEmptyRefVal) ? p_data_default : NULL);
3773 }
3774 else
3775 {
3776 const float button_size = GetFrameHeight();
3777
3778 BeginGroup(); // The only purpose of the group here is to allow the caller to query item data e.g. IsItemActive()
3779 PushID(label);
3780 SetNextItemWidth(ImMax(1.0f, CalcItemWidth() - (button_size + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x) * 2));
3781 if (InputText("", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), flags)) // PushId(label) + "" gives us the expected ID from outside point of view
3782 value_changed = DataTypeApplyFromText(buf, data_type, p_data, format, (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_ParseEmptyRefVal) ? p_data_default : NULL);
3783 IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_INFO(g.LastItemData.ID, label, g.LastItemData.StatusFlags | ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Inputable);
3784
3785 // Step buttons
3786 const ImVec2 backup_frame_padding = style.FramePadding;
3787 style.FramePadding.x = style.FramePadding.y;
3788 if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_ReadOnly)
3789 BeginDisabled();
3790 PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags_ButtonRepeat, true);
3791 SameLine(0, style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
3792 if (ButtonEx("-", ImVec2(button_size, button_size)))
3793 {
3794 DataTypeApplyOp(data_type, '-', p_data, p_data, g.IO.KeyCtrl && p_step_fast ? p_step_fast : p_step);
3795 value_changed = true;
3796 }
3797 SameLine(0, style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
3798 if (ButtonEx("+", ImVec2(button_size, button_size)))
3799 {
3800 DataTypeApplyOp(data_type, '+', p_data, p_data, g.IO.KeyCtrl && p_step_fast ? p_step_fast : p_step);
3801 value_changed = true;
3802 }
3803 PopItemFlag();
3804 if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_ReadOnly)
3805 EndDisabled();
3806
3807 const char* label_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(label);
3808 if (label != label_end)
3809 {
3810 SameLine(0, style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
3811 TextEx(label, label_end);
3812 }
3813 style.FramePadding = backup_frame_padding;
3814
3815 PopID();
3816 EndGroup();
3817 }
3818
3819 g.LastItemData.ItemFlags &= ~ImGuiItemFlags_NoMarkEdited;
3820 if (value_changed)
3821 MarkItemEdited(g.LastItemData.ID);
3822
3823 return value_changed;
3824}
3825
3826bool ImGui::InputScalarN(const char* label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void* p_data, int components, const void* p_step, const void* p_step_fast, const char* format, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags)
3827{
3828 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
3829 if (window->SkipItems)
3830 return false;
3831
3832 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3833 bool value_changed = false;
3834 BeginGroup();
3835 PushID(label);
3836 PushMultiItemsWidths(components, CalcItemWidth());
3837 size_t type_size = GDataTypeInfo[data_type].Size;
3838 for (int i = 0; i < components; i++)
3839 {
3840 PushID(i);
3841 if (i > 0)
3842 SameLine(0, g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
3843 value_changed |= InputScalar("", data_type, p_data, p_step, p_step_fast, format, flags);
3844 PopID();
3845 PopItemWidth();
3846 p_data = (void*)((char*)p_data + type_size);
3847 }
3848 PopID();
3849
3850 const char* label_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(label);
3851 if (label != label_end)
3852 {
3853 SameLine(0.0f, g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
3854 TextEx(label, label_end);
3855 }
3856
3857 EndGroup();
3858 return value_changed;
3859}
3860
3861bool ImGui::InputFloat(const char* label, float* v, float step, float step_fast, const char* format, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags)
3862{
3863 return InputScalar(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, (void*)v, (void*)(step > 0.0f ? &step : NULL), (void*)(step_fast > 0.0f ? &step_fast : NULL), format, flags);
3864}
3865
3866bool ImGui::InputFloat2(const char* label, float v[2], const char* format, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags)
3867{
3868 return InputScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, 2, NULL, NULL, format, flags);
3869}
3870
3871bool ImGui::InputFloat3(const char* label, float v[3], const char* format, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags)
3872{
3873 return InputScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, 3, NULL, NULL, format, flags);
3874}
3875
3876bool ImGui::InputFloat4(const char* label, float v[4], const char* format, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags)
3877{
3878 return InputScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, 4, NULL, NULL, format, flags);
3879}
3880
3881bool ImGui::InputInt(const char* label, int* v, int step, int step_fast, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags)
3882{
3883 // Hexadecimal input provided as a convenience but the flag name is awkward. Typically you'd use InputText() to parse your own data, if you want to handle prefixes.
3884 const char* format = (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsHexadecimal) ? "%08X" : "%d";
3885 return InputScalar(label, ImGuiDataType_S32, (void*)v, (void*)(step > 0 ? &step : NULL), (void*)(step_fast > 0 ? &step_fast : NULL), format, flags);
3886}
3887
3888bool ImGui::InputInt2(const char* label, int v[2], ImGuiInputTextFlags flags)
3889{
3890 return InputScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_S32, v, 2, NULL, NULL, "%d", flags);
3891}
3892
3893bool ImGui::InputInt3(const char* label, int v[3], ImGuiInputTextFlags flags)
3894{
3895 return InputScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_S32, v, 3, NULL, NULL, "%d", flags);
3896}
3897
3898bool ImGui::InputInt4(const char* label, int v[4], ImGuiInputTextFlags flags)
3899{
3900 return InputScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_S32, v, 4, NULL, NULL, "%d", flags);
3901}
3902
3903bool ImGui::InputDouble(const char* label, double* v, double step, double step_fast, const char* format, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags)
3904{
3905 return InputScalar(label, ImGuiDataType_Double, (void*)v, (void*)(step > 0.0 ? &step : NULL), (void*)(step_fast > 0.0 ? &step_fast : NULL), format, flags);
3906}
3907
3908//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
3909// [SECTION] Widgets: InputText, InputTextMultiline, InputTextWithHint
3910//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
3911// - imstb_textedit.h include
3912// - InputText()
3913// - InputTextWithHint()
3914// - InputTextMultiline()
3915// - InputTextGetCharInfo() [Internal]
3916// - InputTextReindexLines() [Internal]
3917// - InputTextReindexLinesRange() [Internal]
3918// - InputTextEx() [Internal]
3919// - DebugNodeInputTextState() [Internal]
3920//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
3921
3922namespace ImStb
3923{
3924#include "imstb_textedit.h"
3925}
3926
3927bool ImGui::InputText(const char* label, char* buf, size_t buf_size, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags, ImGuiInputTextCallback callback, void* user_data)
3928{
3929 IM_ASSERT(!(flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_Multiline)); // call InputTextMultiline()
3930 return InputTextEx(label, NULL, buf, (int)buf_size, ImVec2(0, 0), flags, callback, user_data);
3931}
3932
3933bool ImGui::InputTextMultiline(const char* label, char* buf, size_t buf_size, const ImVec2& size, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags, ImGuiInputTextCallback callback, void* user_data)
3934{
3935 return InputTextEx(label, NULL, buf, (int)buf_size, size, flags | ImGuiInputTextFlags_Multiline, callback, user_data);
3936}
3937
3938bool ImGui::InputTextWithHint(const char* label, const char* hint, char* buf, size_t buf_size, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags, ImGuiInputTextCallback callback, void* user_data)
3939{
3940 IM_ASSERT(!(flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_Multiline)); // call InputTextMultiline() or InputTextEx() manually if you need multi-line + hint.
3941 return InputTextEx(label, hint, buf, (int)buf_size, ImVec2(0, 0), flags, callback, user_data);
3942}
3943
3944// This is only used in the path where the multiline widget is inactive.
3945static int InputTextCalcTextLenAndLineCount(const char* text_begin, const char** out_text_end)
3946{
3947 int line_count = 0;
3948 const char* s = text_begin;
3949 while (true)
3950 {
3951 const char* s_eol = strchr(s, '\n');
3952 line_count++;
3953 if (s_eol == NULL)
3954 {
3955 s = s + ImStrlen(s);
3956 break;
3957 }
3958 s = s_eol + 1;
3959 }
3960 *out_text_end = s;
3961 return line_count;
3962}
3963
3964// FIXME: Ideally we'd share code with ImFont::CalcTextSizeA()
3965static ImVec2 InputTextCalcTextSize(ImGuiContext* ctx, const char* text_begin, const char* text_end, const char** remaining, ImVec2* out_offset, bool stop_on_new_line)
3966{
3967 ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
3968 //ImFont* font = g.Font;
3969 ImFontBaked* baked = g.FontBaked;
3970 const float line_height = g.FontSize;
3971 const float scale = line_height / baked->Size;
3972
3973 ImVec2 text_size = ImVec2(0, 0);
3974 float line_width = 0.0f;
3975
3976 const char* s = text_begin;
3977 while (s < text_end)
3978 {
3979 unsigned int c = (unsigned int)*s;
3980 if (c < 0x80)
3981 s += 1;
3982 else
3983 s += ImTextCharFromUtf8(&c, s, text_end);
3984
3985 if (c == '\n')
3986 {
3987 text_size.x = ImMax(text_size.x, line_width);
3988 text_size.y += line_height;
3989 line_width = 0.0f;
3990 if (stop_on_new_line)
3991 break;
3992 continue;
3993 }
3994 if (c == '\r')
3995 continue;
3996
3997 line_width += baked->GetCharAdvance((ImWchar)c) * scale;
3998 }
3999
4000 if (text_size.x < line_width)
4001 text_size.x = line_width;
4002
4003 if (out_offset)
4004 *out_offset = ImVec2(line_width, text_size.y + line_height); // offset allow for the possibility of sitting after a trailing \n
4005
4006 if (line_width > 0 || text_size.y == 0.0f) // whereas size.y will ignore the trailing \n
4007 text_size.y += line_height;
4008
4009 if (remaining)
4010 *remaining = s;
4011
4012 return text_size;
4013}
4014
4015// Wrapper for stb_textedit.h to edit text (our wrapper is for: statically sized buffer, single-line, wchar characters. InputText converts between UTF-8 and wchar)
4016// With our UTF-8 use of stb_textedit:
4017// - STB_TEXTEDIT_GETCHAR is nothing more than a a "GETBYTE". It's only used to compare to ascii or to copy blocks of text so we are fine.
4018// - One exception is the STB_TEXTEDIT_IS_SPACE feature which would expect a full char in order to handle full-width space such as 0x3000 (see ImCharIsBlankW).
4019// - ...but we don't use that feature.
4020namespace ImStb
4021{
4022static int STB_TEXTEDIT_STRINGLEN(const ImGuiInputTextState* obj) { return obj->TextLen; }
4023static char STB_TEXTEDIT_GETCHAR(const ImGuiInputTextState* obj, int idx) { IM_ASSERT(idx <= obj->TextLen); return obj->TextSrc[idx]; }
4024static float STB_TEXTEDIT_GETWIDTH(ImGuiInputTextState* obj, int line_start_idx, int char_idx) { unsigned int c; ImTextCharFromUtf8(&c, obj->TextSrc + line_start_idx + char_idx, obj->TextSrc + obj->TextLen); if ((ImWchar)c == '\n') return IMSTB_TEXTEDIT_GETWIDTH_NEWLINE; ImGuiContext& g = *obj->Ctx; return g.FontBaked->GetCharAdvance((ImWchar)c) * g.FontBakedScale; }
4025static char STB_TEXTEDIT_NEWLINE = '\n';
4026static void STB_TEXTEDIT_LAYOUTROW(StbTexteditRow* r, ImGuiInputTextState* obj, int line_start_idx)
4027{
4028 const char* text = obj->TextSrc;
4029 const char* text_remaining = NULL;
4030 const ImVec2 size = InputTextCalcTextSize(obj->Ctx, text + line_start_idx, text + obj->TextLen, &text_remaining, NULL, true);
4031 r->x0 = 0.0f;
4032 r->x1 = size.x;
4033 r->baseline_y_delta = size.y;
4034 r->ymin = 0.0f;
4035 r->ymax = size.y;
4036 r->num_chars = (int)(text_remaining - (text + line_start_idx));
4037}
4038
4039#define IMSTB_TEXTEDIT_GETNEXTCHARINDEX IMSTB_TEXTEDIT_GETNEXTCHARINDEX_IMPL
4040#define IMSTB_TEXTEDIT_GETPREVCHARINDEX IMSTB_TEXTEDIT_GETPREVCHARINDEX_IMPL
4041
4042static int IMSTB_TEXTEDIT_GETNEXTCHARINDEX_IMPL(ImGuiInputTextState* obj, int idx)
4043{
4044 if (idx >= obj->TextLen)
4045 return obj->TextLen + 1;
4046 unsigned int c;
4047 return idx + ImTextCharFromUtf8(&c, obj->TextSrc + idx, obj->TextSrc + obj->TextLen);
4048}
4049
4050static int IMSTB_TEXTEDIT_GETPREVCHARINDEX_IMPL(ImGuiInputTextState* obj, int idx)
4051{
4052 if (idx <= 0)
4053 return -1;
4054 const char* p = ImTextFindPreviousUtf8Codepoint(obj->TextSrc, obj->TextSrc + idx);
4055 return (int)(p - obj->TextSrc);
4056}
4057
4058static bool ImCharIsSeparatorW(unsigned int c)
4059{
4060 static const unsigned int separator_list[] =
4061 {
4062 ',', 0x3001, '.', 0x3002, ';', 0xFF1B, '(', 0xFF08, ')', 0xFF09, '{', 0xFF5B, '}', 0xFF5D,
4063 '[', 0x300C, ']', 0x300D, '|', 0xFF5C, '!', 0xFF01, '\\', 0xFFE5, '/', 0x30FB, 0xFF0F,
4064 '\n', '\r',
4065 };
4066 for (unsigned int separator : separator_list)
4067 if (c == separator)
4068 return true;
4069 return false;
4070}
4071
4072static int is_word_boundary_from_right(ImGuiInputTextState* obj, int idx)
4073{
4074 // When ImGuiInputTextFlags_Password is set, we don't want actions such as CTRL+Arrow to leak the fact that underlying data are blanks or separators.
4075 if ((obj->Flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_Password) || idx <= 0)
4076 return 0;
4077
4078 const char* curr_p = obj->TextSrc + idx;
4079 const char* prev_p = ImTextFindPreviousUtf8Codepoint(obj->TextSrc, curr_p);
4080 unsigned int curr_c; ImTextCharFromUtf8(&curr_c, curr_p, obj->TextSrc + obj->TextLen);
4081 unsigned int prev_c; ImTextCharFromUtf8(&prev_c, prev_p, obj->TextSrc + obj->TextLen);
4082
4083 bool prev_white = ImCharIsBlankW(prev_c);
4084 bool prev_separ = ImCharIsSeparatorW(prev_c);
4085 bool curr_white = ImCharIsBlankW(curr_c);
4086 bool curr_separ = ImCharIsSeparatorW(curr_c);
4087 return ((prev_white || prev_separ) && !(curr_separ || curr_white)) || (curr_separ && !prev_separ);
4088}
4089static int is_word_boundary_from_left(ImGuiInputTextState* obj, int idx)
4090{
4091 if ((obj->Flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_Password) || idx <= 0)
4092 return 0;
4093
4094 const char* curr_p = obj->TextSrc + idx;
4095 const char* prev_p = ImTextFindPreviousUtf8Codepoint(obj->TextSrc, curr_p);
4096 unsigned int prev_c; ImTextCharFromUtf8(&prev_c, curr_p, obj->TextSrc + obj->TextLen);
4097 unsigned int curr_c; ImTextCharFromUtf8(&curr_c, prev_p, obj->TextSrc + obj->TextLen);
4098
4099 bool prev_white = ImCharIsBlankW(prev_c);
4100 bool prev_separ = ImCharIsSeparatorW(prev_c);
4101 bool curr_white = ImCharIsBlankW(curr_c);
4102 bool curr_separ = ImCharIsSeparatorW(curr_c);
4103 return ((prev_white) && !(curr_separ || curr_white)) || (curr_separ && !prev_separ);
4104}
4105static int STB_TEXTEDIT_MOVEWORDLEFT_IMPL(ImGuiInputTextState* obj, int idx)
4106{
4107 idx = IMSTB_TEXTEDIT_GETPREVCHARINDEX(obj, idx);
4108 while (idx >= 0 && !is_word_boundary_from_right(obj, idx))
4109 idx = IMSTB_TEXTEDIT_GETPREVCHARINDEX(obj, idx);
4110 return idx < 0 ? 0 : idx;
4111}
4112static int STB_TEXTEDIT_MOVEWORDRIGHT_MAC(ImGuiInputTextState* obj, int idx)
4113{
4114 int len = obj->TextLen;
4115 idx = IMSTB_TEXTEDIT_GETNEXTCHARINDEX(obj, idx);
4116 while (idx < len && !is_word_boundary_from_left(obj, idx))
4117 idx = IMSTB_TEXTEDIT_GETNEXTCHARINDEX(obj, idx);
4118 return idx > len ? len : idx;
4119}
4120static int STB_TEXTEDIT_MOVEWORDRIGHT_WIN(ImGuiInputTextState* obj, int idx)
4121{
4122 idx = IMSTB_TEXTEDIT_GETNEXTCHARINDEX(obj, idx);
4123 int len = obj->TextLen;
4124 while (idx < len && !is_word_boundary_from_right(obj, idx))
4125 idx = IMSTB_TEXTEDIT_GETNEXTCHARINDEX(obj, idx);
4126 return idx > len ? len : idx;
4127}
4128static int STB_TEXTEDIT_MOVEWORDRIGHT_IMPL(ImGuiInputTextState* obj, int idx) { ImGuiContext& g = *obj->Ctx; if (g.IO.ConfigMacOSXBehaviors) return STB_TEXTEDIT_MOVEWORDRIGHT_MAC(obj, idx); else return STB_TEXTEDIT_MOVEWORDRIGHT_WIN(obj, idx); }
4129#define STB_TEXTEDIT_MOVEWORDLEFT STB_TEXTEDIT_MOVEWORDLEFT_IMPL // They need to be #define for stb_textedit.h
4130#define STB_TEXTEDIT_MOVEWORDRIGHT STB_TEXTEDIT_MOVEWORDRIGHT_IMPL
4131
4132static void STB_TEXTEDIT_DELETECHARS(ImGuiInputTextState* obj, int pos, int n)
4133{
4134 // Offset remaining text (+ copy zero terminator)
4135 IM_ASSERT(obj->TextSrc == obj->TextA.Data);
4136 char* dst = obj->TextA.Data + pos;
4137 char* src = obj->TextA.Data + pos + n;
4138 memmove(dst, src, obj->TextLen - n - pos + 1);
4139 obj->Edited = true;
4140 obj->TextLen -= n;
4141}
4142
4143static bool STB_TEXTEDIT_INSERTCHARS(ImGuiInputTextState* obj, int pos, const char* new_text, int new_text_len)
4144{
4145 const bool is_resizable = (obj->Flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize) != 0;
4146 const int text_len = obj->TextLen;
4147 IM_ASSERT(pos <= text_len);
4148
4149 if (!is_resizable && (new_text_len + obj->TextLen + 1 > obj->BufCapacity))
4150 return false;
4151
4152 // Grow internal buffer if needed
4153 IM_ASSERT(obj->TextSrc == obj->TextA.Data);
4154 if (new_text_len + text_len + 1 > obj->TextA.Size)
4155 {
4156 if (!is_resizable)
4157 return false;
4158 obj->TextA.resize(text_len + ImClamp(new_text_len, 32, ImMax(256, new_text_len)) + 1);
4159 obj->TextSrc = obj->TextA.Data;
4160 }
4161
4162 char* text = obj->TextA.Data;
4163 if (pos != text_len)
4164 memmove(text + pos + new_text_len, text + pos, (size_t)(text_len - pos));
4165 memcpy(text + pos, new_text, (size_t)new_text_len);
4166
4167 obj->Edited = true;
4168 obj->TextLen += new_text_len;
4169 obj->TextA[obj->TextLen] = '\0';
4170
4171 return true;
4172}
4173
4174// We don't use an enum so we can build even with conflicting symbols (if another user of stb_textedit.h leak their STB_TEXTEDIT_K_* symbols)
4175#define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_LEFT 0x200000 // keyboard input to move cursor left
4176#define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_RIGHT 0x200001 // keyboard input to move cursor right
4177#define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_UP 0x200002 // keyboard input to move cursor up
4178#define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_DOWN 0x200003 // keyboard input to move cursor down
4179#define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_LINESTART 0x200004 // keyboard input to move cursor to start of line
4180#define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_LINEEND 0x200005 // keyboard input to move cursor to end of line
4181#define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_TEXTSTART 0x200006 // keyboard input to move cursor to start of text
4182#define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_TEXTEND 0x200007 // keyboard input to move cursor to end of text
4183#define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_DELETE 0x200008 // keyboard input to delete selection or character under cursor
4184#define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_BACKSPACE 0x200009 // keyboard input to delete selection or character left of cursor
4185#define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_UNDO 0x20000A // keyboard input to perform undo
4186#define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_REDO 0x20000B // keyboard input to perform redo
4187#define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_WORDLEFT 0x20000C // keyboard input to move cursor left one word
4188#define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_WORDRIGHT 0x20000D // keyboard input to move cursor right one word
4189#define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_PGUP 0x20000E // keyboard input to move cursor up a page
4190#define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_PGDOWN 0x20000F // keyboard input to move cursor down a page
4191#define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_SHIFT 0x400000
4192
4193#define IMSTB_TEXTEDIT_IMPLEMENTATION
4194#define IMSTB_TEXTEDIT_memmove memmove
4195#include "imstb_textedit.h"
4196
4197// stb_textedit internally allows for a single undo record to do addition and deletion, but somehow, calling
4198// the stb_textedit_paste() function creates two separate records, so we perform it manually. (FIXME: Report to nothings/stb?)
4199static void stb_textedit_replace(ImGuiInputTextState* str, STB_TexteditState* state, const IMSTB_TEXTEDIT_CHARTYPE* text, int text_len)
4200{
4201 stb_text_makeundo_replace(str, state, 0, str->TextLen, text_len);
4202 ImStb::STB_TEXTEDIT_DELETECHARS(str, 0, str->TextLen);
4203 state->cursor = state->select_start = state->select_end = 0;
4204 if (text_len <= 0)
4205 return;
4206 if (ImStb::STB_TEXTEDIT_INSERTCHARS(str, 0, text, text_len))
4207 {
4208 state->cursor = state->select_start = state->select_end = text_len;
4209 state->has_preferred_x = 0;
4210 return;
4211 }
4212 IM_ASSERT(0); // Failed to insert character, normally shouldn't happen because of how we currently use stb_textedit_replace()
4213}
4214
4215} // namespace ImStb
4216
4217// We added an extra indirection where 'Stb' is heap-allocated, in order facilitate the work of bindings generators.
4218ImGuiInputTextState::ImGuiInputTextState()
4219{
4220 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
4221 Stb = IM_NEW(ImStbTexteditState);
4222 memset(Stb, 0, sizeof(*Stb));
4223}
4224
4225ImGuiInputTextState::~ImGuiInputTextState()
4226{
4227 IM_DELETE(Stb);
4228}
4229
4230void ImGuiInputTextState::OnKeyPressed(int key)
4231{
4232 stb_textedit_key(this, Stb, key);
4233 CursorFollow = true;
4234 CursorAnimReset();
4235}
4236
4237void ImGuiInputTextState::OnCharPressed(unsigned int c)
4238{
4239 // Convert the key to a UTF8 byte sequence.
4240 // The changes we had to make to stb_textedit_key made it very much UTF-8 specific which is not too great.
4241 char utf8[5];
4242 ImTextCharToUtf8(utf8, c);
4243 stb_textedit_text(this, Stb, utf8, (int)ImStrlen(utf8));
4244 CursorFollow = true;
4245 CursorAnimReset();
4246}
4247
4248// Those functions are not inlined in imgui_internal.h, allowing us to hide ImStbTexteditState from that header.
4249void ImGuiInputTextState::CursorAnimReset() { CursorAnim = -0.30f; } // After a user-input the cursor stays on for a while without blinking
4250void ImGuiInputTextState::CursorClamp() { Stb->cursor = ImMin(Stb->cursor, TextLen); Stb->select_start = ImMin(Stb->select_start, TextLen); Stb->select_end = ImMin(Stb->select_end, TextLen); }
4251bool ImGuiInputTextState::HasSelection() const { return Stb->select_start != Stb->select_end; }
4252void ImGuiInputTextState::ClearSelection() { Stb->select_start = Stb->select_end = Stb->cursor; }
4253int ImGuiInputTextState::GetCursorPos() const { return Stb->cursor; }
4254int ImGuiInputTextState::GetSelectionStart() const { return Stb->select_start; }
4255int ImGuiInputTextState::GetSelectionEnd() const { return Stb->select_end; }
4256void ImGuiInputTextState::SelectAll() { Stb->select_start = 0; Stb->cursor = Stb->select_end = TextLen; Stb->has_preferred_x = 0; }
4257void ImGuiInputTextState::ReloadUserBufAndSelectAll() { WantReloadUserBuf = true; ReloadSelectionStart = 0; ReloadSelectionEnd = INT_MAX; }
4258void ImGuiInputTextState::ReloadUserBufAndKeepSelection() { WantReloadUserBuf = true; ReloadSelectionStart = Stb->select_start; ReloadSelectionEnd = Stb->select_end; }
4259void ImGuiInputTextState::ReloadUserBufAndMoveToEnd() { WantReloadUserBuf = true; ReloadSelectionStart = ReloadSelectionEnd = INT_MAX; }
4260
4261ImGuiInputTextCallbackData::ImGuiInputTextCallbackData()
4262{
4263 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
4264}
4265
4266// Public API to manipulate UTF-8 text from within a callback.
4267// FIXME: The existence of this rarely exercised code path is a bit of a nuisance.
4268// Historically they existed because STB_TEXTEDIT_INSERTCHARS() etc. worked on our ImWchar
4269// buffer, but nowadays they both work on UTF-8 data. Should aim to merge both.
4270void ImGuiInputTextCallbackData::DeleteChars(int pos, int bytes_count)
4271{
4272 IM_ASSERT(pos + bytes_count <= BufTextLen);
4273 char* dst = Buf + pos;
4274 const char* src = Buf + pos + bytes_count;
4275 memmove(dst, src, BufTextLen - bytes_count - pos + 1);
4276
4277 if (CursorPos >= pos + bytes_count)
4278 CursorPos -= bytes_count;
4279 else if (CursorPos >= pos)
4280 CursorPos = pos;
4281 SelectionStart = SelectionEnd = CursorPos;
4282 BufDirty = true;
4283 BufTextLen -= bytes_count;
4284}
4285
4286void ImGuiInputTextCallbackData::InsertChars(int pos, const char* new_text, const char* new_text_end)
4287{
4288 // Accept null ranges
4289 if (new_text == new_text_end)
4290 return;
4291
4292 ImGuiContext& g = *Ctx;
4293 ImGuiInputTextState* obj = &g.InputTextState;
4294 IM_ASSERT(obj->ID != 0 && g.ActiveId == obj->ID);
4295
4296 // Grow internal buffer if needed
4297 const bool is_resizable = (Flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize) != 0;
4298 const int new_text_len = new_text_end ? (int)(new_text_end - new_text) : (int)ImStrlen(new_text);
4299 if (new_text_len + BufTextLen + 1 > obj->TextA.Size && (Flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_ReadOnly) == 0)
4300 {
4301 if (!is_resizable)
4302 return;
4303
4304 IM_ASSERT(Buf == obj->TextA.Data);
4305 int new_buf_size = BufTextLen + ImClamp(new_text_len * 4, 32, ImMax(256, new_text_len)) + 1;
4306 obj->TextA.resize(new_buf_size + 1);
4307 obj->TextSrc = obj->TextA.Data;
4308 Buf = obj->TextA.Data;
4309 BufSize = obj->BufCapacity = new_buf_size;
4310 }
4311
4312 if (BufTextLen != pos)
4313 memmove(Buf + pos + new_text_len, Buf + pos, (size_t)(BufTextLen - pos));
4314 memcpy(Buf + pos, new_text, (size_t)new_text_len * sizeof(char));
4315 Buf[BufTextLen + new_text_len] = '\0';
4316
4317 if (CursorPos >= pos)
4318 CursorPos += new_text_len;
4319 SelectionStart = SelectionEnd = CursorPos;
4320 BufDirty = true;
4321 BufTextLen += new_text_len;
4322}
4323
4324void ImGui::PushPasswordFont()
4325{
4326 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4327 ImFontBaked* backup = &g.InputTextPasswordFontBackupBaked;
4328 IM_ASSERT(backup->IndexAdvanceX.Size == 0 && backup->IndexLookup.Size == 0);
4329 ImFontGlyph* glyph = g.FontBaked->FindGlyph('*');
4330 g.InputTextPasswordFontBackupFlags = g.Font->Flags;
4331 backup->FallbackGlyphIndex = g.FontBaked->FallbackGlyphIndex;
4332 backup->FallbackAdvanceX = g.FontBaked->FallbackAdvanceX;
4333 backup->IndexLookup.swap(g.FontBaked->IndexLookup);
4334 backup->IndexAdvanceX.swap(g.FontBaked->IndexAdvanceX);
4335 g.Font->Flags |= ImFontFlags_NoLoadGlyphs;
4336 g.FontBaked->FallbackGlyphIndex = g.FontBaked->Glyphs.index_from_ptr(glyph);
4337 g.FontBaked->FallbackAdvanceX = glyph->AdvanceX;
4338}
4339
4340void ImGui::PopPasswordFont()
4341{
4342 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4343 ImFontBaked* backup = &g.InputTextPasswordFontBackupBaked;
4344 g.Font->Flags = g.InputTextPasswordFontBackupFlags;
4345 g.FontBaked->FallbackGlyphIndex = backup->FallbackGlyphIndex;
4346 g.FontBaked->FallbackAdvanceX = backup->FallbackAdvanceX;
4347 g.FontBaked->IndexLookup.swap(backup->IndexLookup);
4348 g.FontBaked->IndexAdvanceX.swap(backup->IndexAdvanceX);
4349 IM_ASSERT(backup->IndexAdvanceX.Size == 0 && backup->IndexLookup.Size == 0);
4350}
4351
4352// Return false to discard a character.
4353static bool InputTextFilterCharacter(ImGuiContext* ctx, unsigned int* p_char, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags, ImGuiInputTextCallback callback, void* user_data, bool input_source_is_clipboard)
4354{
4355 unsigned int c = *p_char;
4356
4357 // Filter non-printable (NB: isprint is unreliable! see #2467)
4358 bool apply_named_filters = true;
4359 if (c < 0x20)
4360 {
4361 bool pass = false;
4362 pass |= (c == '\n') && (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_Multiline) != 0; // Note that an Enter KEY will emit \r and be ignored (we poll for KEY in InputText() code)
4363 if (c == '\n' && input_source_is_clipboard && (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_Multiline) == 0) // In single line mode, replace \n with a space
4364 {
4365 c = *p_char = ' ';
4366 pass = true;
4367 }
4368 pass |= (c == '\n') && (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_Multiline) != 0;
4369 pass |= (c == '\t') && (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_AllowTabInput) != 0;
4370 if (!pass)
4371 return false;
4372 apply_named_filters = false; // Override named filters below so newline and tabs can still be inserted.
4373 }
4374
4375 if (input_source_is_clipboard == false)
4376 {
4377 // We ignore Ascii representation of delete (emitted from Backspace on OSX, see #2578, #2817)
4378 if (c == 127)
4379 return false;
4380
4381 // Filter private Unicode range. GLFW on OSX seems to send private characters for special keys like arrow keys (FIXME)
4382 if (c >= 0xE000 && c <= 0xF8FF)
4383 return false;
4384 }
4385
4386 // Filter Unicode ranges we are not handling in this build
4387 if (c > IM_UNICODE_CODEPOINT_MAX)
4388 return false;
4389
4390 // Generic named filters
4391 if (apply_named_filters && (flags & (ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsDecimal | ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsHexadecimal | ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsUppercase | ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsNoBlank | ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsScientific | (ImGuiInputTextFlags)ImGuiInputTextFlags_LocalizeDecimalPoint)))
4392 {
4393 // The libc allows overriding locale, with e.g. 'setlocale(LC_NUMERIC, "de_DE.UTF-8");' which affect the output/input of printf/scanf to use e.g. ',' instead of '.'.
4394 // The standard mandate that programs starts in the "C" locale where the decimal point is '.'.
4395 // We don't really intend to provide widespread support for it, but out of empathy for people stuck with using odd API, we support the bare minimum aka overriding the decimal point.
4396 // Change the default decimal_point with:
4397 // ImGui::GetPlatformIO()->Platform_LocaleDecimalPoint = *localeconv()->decimal_point;
4398 // Users of non-default decimal point (in particular ',') may be affected by word-selection logic (is_word_boundary_from_right/is_word_boundary_from_left) functions.
4399 ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
4400 const unsigned c_decimal_point = (unsigned int)g.PlatformIO.Platform_LocaleDecimalPoint;
4401 if (flags & (ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsDecimal | ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsScientific | (ImGuiInputTextFlags)ImGuiInputTextFlags_LocalizeDecimalPoint))
4402 if (c == '.' || c == ',')
4403 c = c_decimal_point;
4404
4405 // Full-width -> half-width conversion for numeric fields (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Halfwidth_and_Fullwidth_Forms_(Unicode_block)
4406 // While this is mostly convenient, this has the side-effect for uninformed users accidentally inputting full-width characters that they may
4407 // scratch their head as to why it works in numerical fields vs in generic text fields it would require support in the font.
4408 if (flags & (ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsDecimal | ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsScientific | ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsHexadecimal))
4409 if (c >= 0xFF01 && c <= 0xFF5E)
4410 c = c - 0xFF01 + 0x21;
4411
4412 // Allow 0-9 . - + * /
4413 if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsDecimal)
4414 if (!(c >= '0' && c <= '9') && (c != c_decimal_point) && (c != '-') && (c != '+') && (c != '*') && (c != '/'))
4415 return false;
4416
4417 // Allow 0-9 . - + * / e E
4418 if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsScientific)
4419 if (!(c >= '0' && c <= '9') && (c != c_decimal_point) && (c != '-') && (c != '+') && (c != '*') && (c != '/') && (c != 'e') && (c != 'E'))
4420 return false;
4421
4422 // Allow 0-9 a-F A-F
4423 if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsHexadecimal)
4424 if (!(c >= '0' && c <= '9') && !(c >= 'a' && c <= 'f') && !(c >= 'A' && c <= 'F'))
4425 return false;
4426
4427 // Turn a-z into A-Z
4428 if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsUppercase)
4429 if (c >= 'a' && c <= 'z')
4430 c += (unsigned int)('A' - 'a');
4431
4432 if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsNoBlank)
4433 if (ImCharIsBlankW(c))
4434 return false;
4435
4436 *p_char = c;
4437 }
4438
4439 // Custom callback filter
4440 if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCharFilter)
4441 {
4442 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4443 ImGuiInputTextCallbackData callback_data;
4444 callback_data.Ctx = &g;
4445 callback_data.EventFlag = ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCharFilter;
4446 callback_data.EventChar = (ImWchar)c;
4447 callback_data.Flags = flags;
4448 callback_data.UserData = user_data;
4449 if (callback(&callback_data) != 0)
4450 return false;
4451 *p_char = callback_data.EventChar;
4452 if (!callback_data.EventChar)
4453 return false;
4454 }
4455
4456 return true;
4457}
4458
4459// Find the shortest single replacement we can make to get from old_buf to new_buf
4460// Note that this doesn't directly alter state->TextA, state->TextLen. They are expected to be made valid separately.
4461// FIXME: Ideally we should transition toward (1) making InsertChars()/DeleteChars() update undo-stack (2) discourage (and keep reconcile) or obsolete (and remove reconcile) accessing buffer directly.
4462static void InputTextReconcileUndoState(ImGuiInputTextState* state, const char* old_buf, int old_length, const char* new_buf, int new_length)
4463{
4464 const int shorter_length = ImMin(old_length, new_length);
4465 int first_diff;
4466 for (first_diff = 0; first_diff < shorter_length; first_diff++)
4467 if (old_buf[first_diff] != new_buf[first_diff])
4468 break;
4469 if (first_diff == old_length && first_diff == new_length)
4470 return;
4471
4472 int old_last_diff = old_length - 1;
4473 int new_last_diff = new_length - 1;
4474 for (; old_last_diff >= first_diff && new_last_diff >= first_diff; old_last_diff--, new_last_diff--)
4475 if (old_buf[old_last_diff] != new_buf[new_last_diff])
4476 break;
4477
4478 const int insert_len = new_last_diff - first_diff + 1;
4479 const int delete_len = old_last_diff - first_diff + 1;
4480 if (insert_len > 0 || delete_len > 0)
4481 if (IMSTB_TEXTEDIT_CHARTYPE* p = stb_text_createundo(&state->Stb->undostate, first_diff, delete_len, insert_len))
4482 for (int i = 0; i < delete_len; i++)
4483 p[i] = old_buf[first_diff + i];
4484}
4485
4486// As InputText() retain textual data and we currently provide a path for user to not retain it (via local variables)
4487// we need some form of hook to reapply data back to user buffer on deactivation frame. (#4714)
4488// It would be more desirable that we discourage users from taking advantage of the "user not retaining data" trick,
4489// but that more likely be attractive when we do have _NoLiveEdit flag available.
4490void ImGui::InputTextDeactivateHook(ImGuiID id)
4491{
4492 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4493 ImGuiInputTextState* state = &g.InputTextState;
4494 if (id == 0 || state->ID != id)
4495 return;
4496 g.InputTextDeactivatedState.ID = state->ID;
4497 if (state->Flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_ReadOnly)
4498 {
4499 g.InputTextDeactivatedState.TextA.resize(0); // In theory this data won't be used, but clear to be neat.
4500 }
4501 else
4502 {
4503 IM_ASSERT(state->TextA.Data != 0);
4504 IM_ASSERT(state->TextA[state->TextLen] == 0);
4505 g.InputTextDeactivatedState.TextA.resize(state->TextLen + 1);
4506 memcpy(g.InputTextDeactivatedState.TextA.Data, state->TextA.Data, state->TextLen + 1);
4507 }
4508}
4509
4510// Edit a string of text
4511// - buf_size account for the zero-terminator, so a buf_size of 6 can hold "Hello" but not "Hello!".
4512// This is so we can easily call InputText() on static arrays using ARRAYSIZE() and to match
4513// Note that in std::string world, capacity() would omit 1 byte used by the zero-terminator.
4514// - When active, hold on a privately held copy of the text (and apply back to 'buf'). So changing 'buf' while the InputText is active has no effect.
4515// - If you want to use ImGui::InputText() with std::string, see misc/cpp/imgui_stdlib.h
4516// (FIXME: Rather confusing and messy function, among the worse part of our codebase, expecting to rewrite a V2 at some point.. Partly because we are
4517// doing UTF8 > U16 > UTF8 conversions on the go to easily interface with stb_textedit. Ideally should stay in UTF-8 all the time. See https://github.com/nothings/stb/issues/188)
4518bool ImGui::InputTextEx(const char* label, const char* hint, char* buf, int buf_size, const ImVec2& size_arg, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags, ImGuiInputTextCallback callback, void* callback_user_data)
4519{
4520 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
4521 if (window->SkipItems)
4522 return false;
4523
4524 IM_ASSERT(buf != NULL && buf_size >= 0);
4525 IM_ASSERT(!((flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory) && (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_Multiline))); // Can't use both together (they both use up/down keys)
4526 IM_ASSERT(!((flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCompletion) && (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_AllowTabInput))); // Can't use both together (they both use tab key)
4527 IM_ASSERT(!((flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_ElideLeft) && (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_Multiline))); // Multiline will not work with left-trimming
4528
4529 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4530 ImGuiIO& io = g.IO;
4531 const ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
4532
4533 const bool RENDER_SELECTION_WHEN_INACTIVE = false;
4534 const bool is_multiline = (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_Multiline) != 0;
4535
4536 if (is_multiline) // Open group before calling GetID() because groups tracks id created within their scope (including the scrollbar)
4537 BeginGroup();
4538 const ImGuiID id = window->GetID(label);
4539 const ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
4540 const ImVec2 frame_size = CalcItemSize(size_arg, CalcItemWidth(), (is_multiline ? g.FontSize * 8.0f : label_size.y) + style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f); // Arbitrary default of 8 lines high for multi-line
4541 const ImVec2 total_size = ImVec2(frame_size.x + (label_size.x > 0.0f ? style.ItemInnerSpacing.x + label_size.x : 0.0f), frame_size.y);
4542
4543 const ImRect frame_bb(window->DC.CursorPos, window->DC.CursorPos + frame_size);
4544 const ImRect total_bb(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Min + total_size);
4545
4546 ImGuiWindow* draw_window = window;
4547 ImVec2 inner_size = frame_size;
4548 ImGuiLastItemData item_data_backup;
4549 if (is_multiline)
4550 {
4551 ImVec2 backup_pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
4552 ItemSize(total_bb, style.FramePadding.y);
4553 if (!ItemAdd(total_bb, id, &frame_bb, ImGuiItemFlags_Inputable))
4554 {
4555 EndGroup();
4556 return false;
4557 }
4558 item_data_backup = g.LastItemData;
4559 window->DC.CursorPos = backup_pos;
4560
4561 // Prevent NavActivation from Tabbing when our widget accepts Tab inputs: this allows cycling through widgets without stopping.
4562 if (g.NavActivateId == id && (g.NavActivateFlags & ImGuiActivateFlags_FromTabbing) && (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_AllowTabInput))
4563 g.NavActivateId = 0;
4564
4565 // Prevent NavActivate reactivating in BeginChild() when we are already active.
4566 const ImGuiID backup_activate_id = g.NavActivateId;
4567 if (g.ActiveId == id) // Prevent reactivation
4568 g.NavActivateId = 0;
4569
4570 // We reproduce the contents of BeginChildFrame() in order to provide 'label' so our window internal data are easier to read/debug.
4571 PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_ChildBg, style.Colors[ImGuiCol_FrameBg]);
4572 PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ChildRounding, style.FrameRounding);
4573 PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ChildBorderSize, style.FrameBorderSize);
4574 PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_WindowPadding, ImVec2(0, 0)); // Ensure no clip rect so mouse hover can reach FramePadding edges
4575 bool child_visible = BeginChildEx(label, id, frame_bb.GetSize(), ImGuiChildFlags_Borders, ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove);
4576 g.NavActivateId = backup_activate_id;
4577 PopStyleVar(3);
4578 PopStyleColor();
4579 if (!child_visible)
4580 {
4581 EndChild();
4582 EndGroup();
4583 return false;
4584 }
4585 draw_window = g.CurrentWindow; // Child window
4586 draw_window->DC.NavLayersActiveMaskNext |= (1 << draw_window->DC.NavLayerCurrent); // This is to ensure that EndChild() will display a navigation highlight so we can "enter" into it.
4587 draw_window->DC.CursorPos += style.FramePadding;
4588 inner_size.x -= draw_window->ScrollbarSizes.x;
4589 }
4590 else
4591 {
4592 // Support for internal ImGuiInputTextFlags_MergedItem flag, which could be redesigned as an ItemFlags if needed (with test performed in ItemAdd)
4593 ItemSize(total_bb, style.FramePadding.y);
4594 if (!(flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_MergedItem))
4595 if (!ItemAdd(total_bb, id, &frame_bb, ImGuiItemFlags_Inputable))
4596 return false;
4597 }
4598
4599 // Ensure mouse cursor is set even after switching to keyboard/gamepad mode. May generalize further? (#6417)
4600 bool hovered = ItemHoverable(frame_bb, id, g.LastItemData.ItemFlags | ImGuiItemFlags_NoNavDisableMouseHover);
4601 if (hovered)
4602 SetMouseCursor(ImGuiMouseCursor_TextInput);
4603 if (hovered && g.NavHighlightItemUnderNav)
4604 hovered = false;
4605
4606 // We are only allowed to access the state if we are already the active widget.
4607 ImGuiInputTextState* state = GetInputTextState(id);
4608
4609 if (g.LastItemData.ItemFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_ReadOnly)
4610 flags |= ImGuiInputTextFlags_ReadOnly;
4611 const bool is_readonly = (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_ReadOnly) != 0;
4612 const bool is_password = (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_Password) != 0;
4613 const bool is_undoable = (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_NoUndoRedo) == 0;
4614 const bool is_resizable = (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize) != 0;
4615 if (is_resizable)
4616 IM_ASSERT(callback != NULL); // Must provide a callback if you set the ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize flag!
4617
4618 const bool input_requested_by_nav = (g.ActiveId != id) && ((g.NavActivateId == id) && ((g.NavActivateFlags & ImGuiActivateFlags_PreferInput) || (g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard)));
4619
4620 const bool user_clicked = hovered && io.MouseClicked[0];
4621 const bool user_scroll_finish = is_multiline && state != NULL && g.ActiveId == 0 && g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame == GetWindowScrollbarID(draw_window, ImGuiAxis_Y);
4622 const bool user_scroll_active = is_multiline && state != NULL && g.ActiveId == GetWindowScrollbarID(draw_window, ImGuiAxis_Y);
4623 bool clear_active_id = false;
4624 bool select_all = false;
4625
4626 float scroll_y = is_multiline ? draw_window->Scroll.y : FLT_MAX;
4627
4628 const bool init_reload_from_user_buf = (state != NULL && state->WantReloadUserBuf);
4629 const bool init_changed_specs = (state != NULL && state->Stb->single_line != !is_multiline); // state != NULL means its our state.
4630 const bool init_make_active = (user_clicked || user_scroll_finish || input_requested_by_nav);
4631 const bool init_state = (init_make_active || user_scroll_active);
4632 if (init_reload_from_user_buf)
4633 {
4634 int new_len = (int)ImStrlen(buf);
4635 IM_ASSERT(new_len + 1 <= buf_size && "Is your input buffer properly zero-terminated?");
4636 state->WantReloadUserBuf = false;
4637 InputTextReconcileUndoState(state, state->TextA.Data, state->TextLen, buf, new_len);
4638 state->TextA.resize(buf_size + 1); // we use +1 to make sure that .Data is always pointing to at least an empty string.
4639 state->TextLen = new_len;
4640 memcpy(state->TextA.Data, buf, state->TextLen + 1);
4641 state->Stb->select_start = state->ReloadSelectionStart;
4642 state->Stb->cursor = state->Stb->select_end = state->ReloadSelectionEnd;
4643 state->CursorClamp();
4644 }
4645 else if ((init_state && g.ActiveId != id) || init_changed_specs)
4646 {
4647 // Access state even if we don't own it yet.
4648 state = &g.InputTextState;
4649 state->CursorAnimReset();
4650
4651 // Backup state of deactivating item so they'll have a chance to do a write to output buffer on the same frame they report IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit (#4714)
4652 InputTextDeactivateHook(state->ID);
4653
4654 // Take a copy of the initial buffer value.
4655 // From the moment we focused we are normally ignoring the content of 'buf' (unless we are in read-only mode)
4656 const int buf_len = (int)ImStrlen(buf);
4657 IM_ASSERT(buf_len + 1 <= buf_size && "Is your input buffer properly zero-terminated?");
4658 state->TextToRevertTo.resize(buf_len + 1); // UTF-8. we use +1 to make sure that .Data is always pointing to at least an empty string.
4659 memcpy(state->TextToRevertTo.Data, buf, buf_len + 1);
4660
4661 // Preserve cursor position and undo/redo stack if we come back to same widget
4662 // FIXME: Since we reworked this on 2022/06, may want to differentiate recycle_cursor vs recycle_undostate?
4663 bool recycle_state = (state->ID == id && !init_changed_specs);
4664 if (recycle_state && (state->TextLen != buf_len || (state->TextA.Data == NULL || strncmp(state->TextA.Data, buf, buf_len) != 0)))
4665 recycle_state = false;
4666
4667 // Start edition
4668 state->ID = id;
4669 state->TextLen = buf_len;
4670 if (!is_readonly)
4671 {
4672 state->TextA.resize(buf_size + 1); // we use +1 to make sure that .Data is always pointing to at least an empty string.
4673 memcpy(state->TextA.Data, buf, state->TextLen + 1);
4674 }
4675
4676 // Find initial scroll position for right alignment
4677 state->Scroll = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
4678 if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_ElideLeft)
4679 state->Scroll.x += ImMax(0.0f, CalcTextSize(buf).x - frame_size.x + style.FramePadding.x * 2.0f);
4680
4681 // Recycle existing cursor/selection/undo stack but clamp position
4682 // Note a single mouse click will override the cursor/position immediately by calling stb_textedit_click handler.
4683 if (recycle_state)
4684 state->CursorClamp();
4685 else
4686 stb_textedit_initialize_state(state->Stb, !is_multiline);
4687
4688 if (!is_multiline)
4689 {
4690 if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_AutoSelectAll)
4691 select_all = true;
4692 if (input_requested_by_nav && (!recycle_state || !(g.NavActivateFlags & ImGuiActivateFlags_TryToPreserveState)))
4693 select_all = true;
4694 if (user_clicked && io.KeyCtrl)
4695 select_all = true;
4696 }
4697
4698 if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_AlwaysOverwrite)
4699 state->Stb->insert_mode = 1; // stb field name is indeed incorrect (see #2863)
4700 }
4701
4702 const bool is_osx = io.ConfigMacOSXBehaviors;
4703 if (g.ActiveId != id && init_make_active)
4704 {
4705 IM_ASSERT(state && state->ID == id);
4706 SetActiveID(id, window);
4707 SetFocusID(id, window);
4708 FocusWindow(window);
4709 }
4710 if (g.ActiveId == id)
4711 {
4712 // Declare some inputs, the other are registered and polled via Shortcut() routing system.
4713 // FIXME: The reason we don't use Shortcut() is we would need a routing flag to specify multiple mods, or to all mods combination into individual shortcuts.
4714 const ImGuiKey always_owned_keys[] = { ImGuiKey_LeftArrow, ImGuiKey_RightArrow, ImGuiKey_Enter, ImGuiKey_KeypadEnter, ImGuiKey_Delete, ImGuiKey_Backspace, ImGuiKey_Home, ImGuiKey_End };
4715 for (ImGuiKey key : always_owned_keys)
4716 SetKeyOwner(key, id);
4717 if (user_clicked)
4718 SetKeyOwner(ImGuiKey_MouseLeft, id);
4719 g.ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask |= (1 << ImGuiDir_Left) | (1 << ImGuiDir_Right);
4720 if (is_multiline || (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory))
4721 {
4722 g.ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask |= (1 << ImGuiDir_Up) | (1 << ImGuiDir_Down);
4723 SetKeyOwner(ImGuiKey_UpArrow, id);
4724 SetKeyOwner(ImGuiKey_DownArrow, id);
4725 }
4726 if (is_multiline)
4727 {
4728 SetKeyOwner(ImGuiKey_PageUp, id);
4729 SetKeyOwner(ImGuiKey_PageDown, id);
4730 }
4731 // FIXME: May be a problem to always steal Alt on OSX, would ideally still allow an uninterrupted Alt down-up to toggle menu
4732 if (is_osx)
4733 SetKeyOwner(ImGuiMod_Alt, id);
4734
4735 // Expose scroll in a manner that is agnostic to us using a child window
4736 if (is_multiline && state != NULL)
4737 state->Scroll.y = draw_window->Scroll.y;
4738
4739 // Read-only mode always ever read from source buffer. Refresh TextLen when active.
4740 if (is_readonly && state != NULL)
4741 state->TextLen = (int)ImStrlen(buf);
4742 //if (is_readonly && state != NULL)
4743 // state->TextA.clear(); // Uncomment to facilitate debugging, but we otherwise prefer to keep/amortize th allocation.
4744 }
4745 if (state != NULL)
4746 state->TextSrc = is_readonly ? buf : state->TextA.Data;
4747
4748 // We have an edge case if ActiveId was set through another widget (e.g. widget being swapped), clear id immediately (don't wait until the end of the function)
4749 if (g.ActiveId == id && state == NULL)
4750 ClearActiveID();
4751
4752 // Release focus when we click outside
4753 if (g.ActiveId == id && io.MouseClicked[0] && !init_state && !init_make_active) //-V560
4754 clear_active_id = true;
4755
4756 // Lock the decision of whether we are going to take the path displaying the cursor or selection
4757 bool render_cursor = (g.ActiveId == id) || (state && user_scroll_active);
4758 bool render_selection = state && (state->HasSelection() || select_all) && (RENDER_SELECTION_WHEN_INACTIVE || render_cursor);
4759 bool value_changed = false;
4760 bool validated = false;
4761
4762 // Select the buffer to render.
4763 const bool buf_display_from_state = (render_cursor || render_selection || g.ActiveId == id) && !is_readonly && state;
4764 bool is_displaying_hint = (hint != NULL && (buf_display_from_state ? state->TextA.Data : buf)[0] == 0);
4765
4766 // Password pushes a temporary font with only a fallback glyph
4767 if (is_password && !is_displaying_hint)
4768 PushPasswordFont();
4769
4770 // Process mouse inputs and character inputs
4771 if (g.ActiveId == id)
4772 {
4773 IM_ASSERT(state != NULL);
4774 state->Edited = false;
4775 state->BufCapacity = buf_size;
4776 state->Flags = flags;
4777
4778 // Although we are active we don't prevent mouse from hovering other elements unless we are interacting right now with the widget.
4779 // Down the line we should have a cleaner library-wide concept of Selected vs Active.
4780 g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap = !io.MouseDown[0];
4781
4782 // Edit in progress
4783 const float mouse_x = (io.MousePos.x - frame_bb.Min.x - style.FramePadding.x) + state->Scroll.x;
4784 const float mouse_y = (is_multiline ? (io.MousePos.y - draw_window->DC.CursorPos.y) : (g.FontSize * 0.5f));
4785
4786 if (select_all)
4787 {
4788 state->SelectAll();
4789 state->SelectedAllMouseLock = true;
4790 }
4791 else if (hovered && io.MouseClickedCount[0] >= 2 && !io.KeyShift)
4792 {
4793 stb_textedit_click(state, state->Stb, mouse_x, mouse_y);
4794 const int multiclick_count = (io.MouseClickedCount[0] - 2);
4795 if ((multiclick_count % 2) == 0)
4796 {
4797 // Double-click: Select word
4798 // We always use the "Mac" word advance for double-click select vs CTRL+Right which use the platform dependent variant:
4799 // FIXME: There are likely many ways to improve this behavior, but there's no "right" behavior (depends on use-case, software, OS)
4800 const bool is_bol = (state->Stb->cursor == 0) || ImStb::STB_TEXTEDIT_GETCHAR(state, state->Stb->cursor - 1) == '\n';
4801 if (STB_TEXT_HAS_SELECTION(state->Stb) || !is_bol)
4802 state->OnKeyPressed(STB_TEXTEDIT_K_WORDLEFT);
4803 //state->OnKeyPressed(STB_TEXTEDIT_K_WORDRIGHT | STB_TEXTEDIT_K_SHIFT);
4804 if (!STB_TEXT_HAS_SELECTION(state->Stb))
4805 ImStb::stb_textedit_prep_selection_at_cursor(state->Stb);
4806 state->Stb->cursor = ImStb::STB_TEXTEDIT_MOVEWORDRIGHT_MAC(state, state->Stb->cursor);
4807 state->Stb->select_end = state->Stb->cursor;
4808 ImStb::stb_textedit_clamp(state, state->Stb);
4809 }
4810 else
4811 {
4812 // Triple-click: Select line
4813 const bool is_eol = ImStb::STB_TEXTEDIT_GETCHAR(state, state->Stb->cursor) == '\n';
4814 state->OnKeyPressed(STB_TEXTEDIT_K_LINESTART);
4815 state->OnKeyPressed(STB_TEXTEDIT_K_LINEEND | STB_TEXTEDIT_K_SHIFT);
4816 state->OnKeyPressed(STB_TEXTEDIT_K_RIGHT | STB_TEXTEDIT_K_SHIFT);
4817 if (!is_eol && is_multiline)
4818 {
4819 ImSwap(state->Stb->select_start, state->Stb->select_end);
4820 state->Stb->cursor = state->Stb->select_end;
4821 }
4822 state->CursorFollow = false;
4823 }
4824 state->CursorAnimReset();
4825 }
4826 else if (io.MouseClicked[0] && !state->SelectedAllMouseLock)
4827 {
4828 if (hovered)
4829 {
4830 if (io.KeyShift)
4831 stb_textedit_drag(state, state->Stb, mouse_x, mouse_y);
4832 else
4833 stb_textedit_click(state, state->Stb, mouse_x, mouse_y);
4834 state->CursorAnimReset();
4835 }
4836 }
4837 else if (io.MouseDown[0] && !state->SelectedAllMouseLock && (io.MouseDelta.x != 0.0f || io.MouseDelta.y != 0.0f))
4838 {
4839 stb_textedit_drag(state, state->Stb, mouse_x, mouse_y);
4840 state->CursorAnimReset();
4841 state->CursorFollow = true;
4842 }
4843 if (state->SelectedAllMouseLock && !io.MouseDown[0])
4844 state->SelectedAllMouseLock = false;
4845
4846 // We expect backends to emit a Tab key but some also emit a Tab character which we ignore (#2467, #1336)
4847 // (For Tab and Enter: Win32/SFML/Allegro are sending both keys and chars, GLFW and SDL are only sending keys. For Space they all send all threes)
4848 if ((flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_AllowTabInput) && !is_readonly)
4849 {
4850 if (Shortcut(ImGuiKey_Tab, ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat, id))
4851 {
4852 unsigned int c = '\t'; // Insert TAB
4853 if (InputTextFilterCharacter(&g, &c, flags, callback, callback_user_data))
4854 state->OnCharPressed(c);
4855 }
4856 // FIXME: Implement Shift+Tab
4857 /*
4858 if (Shortcut(ImGuiKey_Tab | ImGuiMod_Shift, ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat, id))
4859 {
4860 }
4861 */
4862 }
4863
4864 // Process regular text input (before we check for Return because using some IME will effectively send a Return?)
4865 // We ignore CTRL inputs, but need to allow ALT+CTRL as some keyboards (e.g. German) use AltGR (which _is_ Alt+Ctrl) to input certain characters.
4866 const bool ignore_char_inputs = (io.KeyCtrl && !io.KeyAlt) || (is_osx && io.KeyCtrl);
4867 if (io.InputQueueCharacters.Size > 0)
4868 {
4869 if (!ignore_char_inputs && !is_readonly && !input_requested_by_nav)
4870 for (int n = 0; n < io.InputQueueCharacters.Size; n++)
4871 {
4872 // Insert character if they pass filtering
4873 unsigned int c = (unsigned int)io.InputQueueCharacters[n];
4874 if (c == '\t') // Skip Tab, see above.
4875 continue;
4876 if (InputTextFilterCharacter(&g, &c, flags, callback, callback_user_data))
4877 state->OnCharPressed(c);
4878 }
4879
4880 // Consume characters
4881 io.InputQueueCharacters.resize(0);
4882 }
4883 }
4884
4885 // Process other shortcuts/key-presses
4886 bool revert_edit = false;
4887 if (g.ActiveId == id && !g.ActiveIdIsJustActivated && !clear_active_id)
4888 {
4889 IM_ASSERT(state != NULL);
4890
4891 const int row_count_per_page = ImMax((int)((inner_size.y - style.FramePadding.y) / g.FontSize), 1);
4892 state->Stb->row_count_per_page = row_count_per_page;
4893
4894 const int k_mask = (io.KeyShift ? STB_TEXTEDIT_K_SHIFT : 0);
4895 const bool is_wordmove_key_down = is_osx ? io.KeyAlt : io.KeyCtrl; // OS X style: Text editing cursor movement using Alt instead of Ctrl
4896 const bool is_startend_key_down = is_osx && io.KeyCtrl && !io.KeySuper && !io.KeyAlt; // OS X style: Line/Text Start and End using Cmd+Arrows instead of Home/End
4897
4898 // Using Shortcut() with ImGuiInputFlags_RouteFocused (default policy) to allow routing operations for other code (e.g. calling window trying to use CTRL+A and CTRL+B: former would be handled by InputText)
4899 // Otherwise we could simply assume that we own the keys as we are active.
4900 const ImGuiInputFlags f_repeat = ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat;
4901 const bool is_cut = (Shortcut(ImGuiMod_Ctrl | ImGuiKey_X, f_repeat, id) || Shortcut(ImGuiMod_Shift | ImGuiKey_Delete, f_repeat, id)) && !is_readonly && !is_password && (!is_multiline || state->HasSelection());
4902 const bool is_copy = (Shortcut(ImGuiMod_Ctrl | ImGuiKey_C, 0, id) || Shortcut(ImGuiMod_Ctrl | ImGuiKey_Insert, 0, id)) && !is_password && (!is_multiline || state->HasSelection());
4903 const bool is_paste = (Shortcut(ImGuiMod_Ctrl | ImGuiKey_V, f_repeat, id) || Shortcut(ImGuiMod_Shift | ImGuiKey_Insert, f_repeat, id)) && !is_readonly;
4904 const bool is_undo = (Shortcut(ImGuiMod_Ctrl | ImGuiKey_Z, f_repeat, id)) && !is_readonly && is_undoable;
4905 const bool is_redo = (Shortcut(ImGuiMod_Ctrl | ImGuiKey_Y, f_repeat, id) || Shortcut(ImGuiMod_Ctrl | ImGuiMod_Shift | ImGuiKey_Z, f_repeat, id)) && !is_readonly && is_undoable;
4906 const bool is_select_all = Shortcut(ImGuiMod_Ctrl | ImGuiKey_A, 0, id);
4907
4908 // We allow validate/cancel with Nav source (gamepad) to makes it easier to undo an accidental NavInput press with no keyboard wired, but otherwise it isn't very useful.
4909 const bool nav_gamepad_active = (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableGamepad) != 0 && (io.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad) != 0;
4910 const bool is_enter_pressed = IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Enter, true) || IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_KeypadEnter, true);
4911 const bool is_gamepad_validate = nav_gamepad_active && (IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_NavGamepadActivate, false) || IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_NavGamepadInput, false));
4912 const bool is_cancel = Shortcut(ImGuiKey_Escape, f_repeat, id) || (nav_gamepad_active && Shortcut(ImGuiKey_NavGamepadCancel, f_repeat, id));
4913
4914 // FIXME: Should use more Shortcut() and reduce IsKeyPressed()+SetKeyOwner(), but requires modifiers combination to be taken account of.
4915 // FIXME-OSX: Missing support for Alt(option)+Right/Left = go to end of line, or next line if already in end of line.
4916 if (IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_LeftArrow)) { state->OnKeyPressed((is_startend_key_down ? STB_TEXTEDIT_K_LINESTART : is_wordmove_key_down ? STB_TEXTEDIT_K_WORDLEFT : STB_TEXTEDIT_K_LEFT) | k_mask); }
4917 else if (IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_RightArrow)) { state->OnKeyPressed((is_startend_key_down ? STB_TEXTEDIT_K_LINEEND : is_wordmove_key_down ? STB_TEXTEDIT_K_WORDRIGHT : STB_TEXTEDIT_K_RIGHT) | k_mask); }
4918 else if (IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_UpArrow) && is_multiline) { if (io.KeyCtrl) SetScrollY(draw_window, ImMax(draw_window->Scroll.y - g.FontSize, 0.0f)); else state->OnKeyPressed((is_startend_key_down ? STB_TEXTEDIT_K_TEXTSTART : STB_TEXTEDIT_K_UP) | k_mask); }
4919 else if (IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_DownArrow) && is_multiline) { if (io.KeyCtrl) SetScrollY(draw_window, ImMin(draw_window->Scroll.y + g.FontSize, GetScrollMaxY())); else state->OnKeyPressed((is_startend_key_down ? STB_TEXTEDIT_K_TEXTEND : STB_TEXTEDIT_K_DOWN) | k_mask); }
4920 else if (IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_PageUp) && is_multiline) { state->OnKeyPressed(STB_TEXTEDIT_K_PGUP | k_mask); scroll_y -= row_count_per_page * g.FontSize; }
4921 else if (IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_PageDown) && is_multiline) { state->OnKeyPressed(STB_TEXTEDIT_K_PGDOWN | k_mask); scroll_y += row_count_per_page * g.FontSize; }
4922 else if (IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Home)) { state->OnKeyPressed(io.KeyCtrl ? STB_TEXTEDIT_K_TEXTSTART | k_mask : STB_TEXTEDIT_K_LINESTART | k_mask); }
4923 else if (IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_End)) { state->OnKeyPressed(io.KeyCtrl ? STB_TEXTEDIT_K_TEXTEND | k_mask : STB_TEXTEDIT_K_LINEEND | k_mask); }
4924 else if (IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Delete) && !is_readonly && !is_cut)
4925 {
4926 if (!state->HasSelection())
4927 {
4928 // OSX doesn't seem to have Super+Delete to delete until end-of-line, so we don't emulate that (as opposed to Super+Backspace)
4929 if (is_wordmove_key_down)
4930 state->OnKeyPressed(STB_TEXTEDIT_K_WORDRIGHT | STB_TEXTEDIT_K_SHIFT);
4931 }
4932 state->OnKeyPressed(STB_TEXTEDIT_K_DELETE | k_mask);
4933 }
4934 else if (IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Backspace) && !is_readonly)
4935 {
4936 if (!state->HasSelection())
4937 {
4938 if (is_wordmove_key_down)
4939 state->OnKeyPressed(STB_TEXTEDIT_K_WORDLEFT | STB_TEXTEDIT_K_SHIFT);
4940 else if (is_osx && io.KeyCtrl && !io.KeyAlt && !io.KeySuper)
4941 state->OnKeyPressed(STB_TEXTEDIT_K_LINESTART | STB_TEXTEDIT_K_SHIFT);
4942 }
4943 state->OnKeyPressed(STB_TEXTEDIT_K_BACKSPACE | k_mask);
4944 }
4945 else if (is_enter_pressed || is_gamepad_validate)
4946 {
4947 // Determine if we turn Enter into a \n character
4948 bool ctrl_enter_for_new_line = (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CtrlEnterForNewLine) != 0;
4949 if (!is_multiline || is_gamepad_validate || (ctrl_enter_for_new_line && !io.KeyCtrl) || (!ctrl_enter_for_new_line && io.KeyCtrl))
4950 {
4951 validated = true;
4952 if (io.ConfigInputTextEnterKeepActive && !is_multiline)
4953 state->SelectAll(); // No need to scroll
4954 else
4955 clear_active_id = true;
4956 }
4957 else if (!is_readonly)
4958 {
4959 unsigned int c = '\n'; // Insert new line
4960 if (InputTextFilterCharacter(&g, &c, flags, callback, callback_user_data))
