4961 state->OnCharPressed(c);
4962 }
4963 }
4964 else if (is_cancel)
4965 {
4966 if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_EscapeClearsAll)
4967 {
4968 if (buf[0] != 0)
4969 {
4970 revert_edit = true;
4971 }
4972 else
4973 {
4974 render_cursor = render_selection = false;
4975 clear_active_id = true;
4976 }
4977 }
4978 else
4979 {
4980 clear_active_id = revert_edit = true;
4981 render_cursor = render_selection = false;
4982 }
4983 }
4984 else if (is_undo || is_redo)
4985 {
4986 state->OnKeyPressed(is_undo ? STB_TEXTEDIT_K_UNDO : STB_TEXTEDIT_K_REDO);
4987 state->ClearSelection();
4988 }
4989 else if (is_select_all)
4990 {
4991 state->SelectAll();
4992 state->CursorFollow = true;
4993 }
4994 else if (is_cut || is_copy)
4995 {
4996 // Cut, Copy
4997 if (g.PlatformIO.Platform_SetClipboardTextFn != NULL)
4998 {
4999 // SetClipboardText() only takes null terminated strings + state->TextSrc may point to read-only user buffer, so we need to make a copy.
5000 const int ib = state->HasSelection() ? ImMin(state->Stb->select_start, state->Stb->select_end) : 0;
5001 const int ie = state->HasSelection() ? ImMax(state->Stb->select_start, state->Stb->select_end) : state->TextLen;
5002 g.TempBuffer.reserve(ie - ib + 1);
5003 memcpy(g.TempBuffer.Data, state->TextSrc + ib, ie - ib);
5004 g.TempBuffer.Data[ie - ib] = 0;
5005 SetClipboardText(g.TempBuffer.Data);
5006 }
5007 if (is_cut)
5008 {
5009 if (!state->HasSelection())
5010 state->SelectAll();
5011 state->CursorFollow = true;
5012 stb_textedit_cut(state, state->Stb);
5013 }
5014 }
5015 else if (is_paste)
5016 {
5017 if (const char* clipboard = GetClipboardText())
5018 {
5019 // Filter pasted buffer
5020 const int clipboard_len = (int)ImStrlen(clipboard);
5021 ImVector<char> clipboard_filtered;
5022 clipboard_filtered.reserve(clipboard_len + 1);
5023 for (const char* s = clipboard; *s != 0; )
5024 {
5025 unsigned int c;
5026 int in_len = ImTextCharFromUtf8(&c, s, NULL);
5027 s += in_len;
5028 if (!InputTextFilterCharacter(&g, &c, flags, callback, callback_user_data, true))
5029 continue;
5030 char c_utf8[5];
5031 ImTextCharToUtf8(c_utf8, c);
5032 int out_len = (int)ImStrlen(c_utf8);
5033 clipboard_filtered.resize(clipboard_filtered.Size + out_len);
5034 memcpy(clipboard_filtered.Data + clipboard_filtered.Size - out_len, c_utf8, out_len);
5035 }
5036 if (clipboard_filtered.Size > 0) // If everything was filtered, ignore the pasting operation
5037 {
5038 clipboard_filtered.push_back(0);
5039 stb_textedit_paste(state, state->Stb, clipboard_filtered.Data, clipboard_filtered.Size - 1);
5040 state->CursorFollow = true;
5041 }
5042 }
5043 }
5044
5045 // Update render selection flag after events have been handled, so selection highlight can be displayed during the same frame.
5046 render_selection |= state->HasSelection() && (RENDER_SELECTION_WHEN_INACTIVE || render_cursor);
5047 }
5048
5049 // Process callbacks and apply result back to user's buffer.
5050 const char* apply_new_text = NULL;
5051 int apply_new_text_length = 0;
5052 if (g.ActiveId == id)
5053 {
5054 IM_ASSERT(state != NULL);
5055 if (revert_edit && !is_readonly)
5056 {
5057 if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_EscapeClearsAll)
5058 {
5059 // Clear input
5060 IM_ASSERT(buf[0] != 0);
5061 apply_new_text = "";
5062 apply_new_text_length = 0;
5063 value_changed = true;
5064 IMSTB_TEXTEDIT_CHARTYPE empty_string;
5065 stb_textedit_replace(state, state->Stb, &empty_string, 0);
5066 }
5067 else if (strcmp(buf, state->TextToRevertTo.Data) != 0)
5068 {
5069 apply_new_text = state->TextToRevertTo.Data;
5070 apply_new_text_length = state->TextToRevertTo.Size - 1;
5071
5072 // Restore initial value. Only return true if restoring to the initial value changes the current buffer contents.
5073 // Push records into the undo stack so we can CTRL+Z the revert operation itself
5074 value_changed = true;
5075 stb_textedit_replace(state, state->Stb, state->TextToRevertTo.Data, state->TextToRevertTo.Size - 1);
5076 }
5077 }
5078
5079 // FIXME-OPT: We always reapply the live buffer back to the input buffer before clearing ActiveId,
5080 // even though strictly speaking it wasn't modified on this frame. Should mark dirty state from the stb_textedit callbacks.
5081 // If we do that, need to ensure that as special case, 'validated == true' also writes back.
5082 // This also allows the user to use InputText() without maintaining any user-side storage.
5083 // (please note that if you use this property along ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize you can end up with your temporary string object
5084 // unnecessarily allocating once a frame, either store your string data, either if you don't then don't use ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize).
5085 const bool apply_edit_back_to_user_buffer = true;// !revert_edit || (validated && (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_EnterReturnsTrue) != 0);
5086 if (apply_edit_back_to_user_buffer)
5087 {
5088 // Apply current edited text immediately.
5089 // Note that as soon as the input box is active, the in-widget value gets priority over any underlying modification of the input buffer
5090
5091 // User callback
5092 if ((flags & (ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCompletion | ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory | ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackEdit | ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackAlways)) != 0)
5093 {
5094 IM_ASSERT(callback != NULL);
5095
5096 // The reason we specify the usage semantic (Completion/History) is that Completion needs to disable keyboard TABBING at the moment.
5097 ImGuiInputTextFlags event_flag = 0;
5098 ImGuiKey event_key = ImGuiKey_None;
5099 if ((flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCompletion) != 0 && Shortcut(ImGuiKey_Tab, 0, id))
5100 {
5101 event_flag = ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCompletion;
5102 event_key = ImGuiKey_Tab;
5103 }
5104 else if ((flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory) != 0 && IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_UpArrow))
5105 {
5106 event_flag = ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory;
5107 event_key = ImGuiKey_UpArrow;
5108 }
5109 else if ((flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory) != 0 && IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_DownArrow))
5110 {
5111 event_flag = ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory;
5112 event_key = ImGuiKey_DownArrow;
5113 }
5114 else if ((flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackEdit) && state->Edited)
5115 {
5116 event_flag = ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackEdit;
5117 }
5118 else if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackAlways)
5119 {
5120 event_flag = ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackAlways;
5121 }
5122
5123 if (event_flag)
5124 {
5125 ImGuiInputTextCallbackData callback_data;
5126 callback_data.Ctx = &g;
5127 callback_data.EventFlag = event_flag;
5128 callback_data.Flags = flags;
5129 callback_data.UserData = callback_user_data;
5130
5131 // FIXME-OPT: Undo stack reconcile needs a backup of the data until we rework API, see #7925
5132 char* callback_buf = is_readonly ? buf : state->TextA.Data;
5133 IM_ASSERT(callback_buf == state->TextSrc);
5134 state->CallbackTextBackup.resize(state->TextLen + 1);
5135 memcpy(state->CallbackTextBackup.Data, callback_buf, state->TextLen + 1);
5136
5137 callback_data.EventKey = event_key;
5138 callback_data.Buf = callback_buf;
5139 callback_data.BufTextLen = state->TextLen;
5140 callback_data.BufSize = state->BufCapacity;
5141 callback_data.BufDirty = false;
5142
5143 const int utf8_cursor_pos = callback_data.CursorPos = state->Stb->cursor;
5144 const int utf8_selection_start = callback_data.SelectionStart = state->Stb->select_start;
5145 const int utf8_selection_end = callback_data.SelectionEnd = state->Stb->select_end;
5146
5147 // Call user code
5148 callback(&callback_data);
5149
5150 // Read back what user may have modified
5151 callback_buf = is_readonly ? buf : state->TextA.Data; // Pointer may have been invalidated by a resize callback
5152 IM_ASSERT(callback_data.Buf == callback_buf); // Invalid to modify those fields
5153 IM_ASSERT(callback_data.BufSize == state->BufCapacity);
5154 IM_ASSERT(callback_data.Flags == flags);
5155 const bool buf_dirty = callback_data.BufDirty;
5156 if (callback_data.CursorPos != utf8_cursor_pos || buf_dirty) { state->Stb->cursor = callback_data.CursorPos; state->CursorFollow = true; }
5157 if (callback_data.SelectionStart != utf8_selection_start || buf_dirty) { state->Stb->select_start = (callback_data.SelectionStart == callback_data.CursorPos) ? state->Stb->cursor : callback_data.SelectionStart; }
5158 if (callback_data.SelectionEnd != utf8_selection_end || buf_dirty) { state->Stb->select_end = (callback_data.SelectionEnd == callback_data.SelectionStart) ? state->Stb->select_start : callback_data.SelectionEnd; }
5159 if (buf_dirty)
5160 {
5161 // Callback may update buffer and thus set buf_dirty even in read-only mode.
5162 IM_ASSERT(callback_data.BufTextLen == (int)ImStrlen(callback_data.Buf)); // You need to maintain BufTextLen if you change the text!
5163 InputTextReconcileUndoState(state, state->CallbackTextBackup.Data, state->CallbackTextBackup.Size - 1, callback_data.Buf, callback_data.BufTextLen);
5164 state->TextLen = callback_data.BufTextLen; // Assume correct length and valid UTF-8 from user, saves us an extra strlen()
5165 state->CursorAnimReset();
5166 }
5167 }
5168 }
5169
5170 // Will copy result string if modified
5171 if (!is_readonly && strcmp(state->TextSrc, buf) != 0)
5172 {
5173 apply_new_text = state->TextSrc;
5174 apply_new_text_length = state->TextLen;
5175 value_changed = true;
5176 }
5177 }
5178 }
5179
5180 // Handle reapplying final data on deactivation (see InputTextDeactivateHook() for details)
5181 if (g.InputTextDeactivatedState.ID == id)
5182 {
5183 if (g.ActiveId != id && IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit() && !is_readonly && strcmp(g.InputTextDeactivatedState.TextA.Data, buf) != 0)
5184 {
5185 apply_new_text = g.InputTextDeactivatedState.TextA.Data;
5186 apply_new_text_length = g.InputTextDeactivatedState.TextA.Size - 1;
5187 value_changed = true;
5188 //IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG("InputText(): apply Deactivated data for 0x%08X: \"%.*s\".\n", id, apply_new_text_length, apply_new_text);
5189 }
5190 g.InputTextDeactivatedState.ID = 0;
5191 }
5192
5193 // Copy result to user buffer. This can currently only happen when (g.ActiveId == id)
5194 if (apply_new_text != NULL)
5195 {
5199 IM_ASSERT(apply_new_text_length >= 0);
5200 if (is_resizable)
5201 {
5202 ImGuiInputTextCallbackData callback_data;
5203 callback_data.Ctx = &g;
5204 callback_data.EventFlag = ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize;
5205 callback_data.Flags = flags;
5206 callback_data.Buf = buf;
5207 callback_data.BufTextLen = apply_new_text_length;
5208 callback_data.BufSize = ImMax(buf_size, apply_new_text_length + 1);
5209 callback_data.UserData = callback_user_data;
5210 callback(&callback_data);
5211 buf = callback_data.Buf;
5212 buf_size = callback_data.BufSize;
5213 apply_new_text_length = ImMin(callback_data.BufTextLen, buf_size - 1);
5214 IM_ASSERT(apply_new_text_length <= buf_size);
5215 }
5216 //IMGUI_DEBUG_PRINT("InputText(\"%s\"): apply_new_text length %d\n", label, apply_new_text_length);
5217
5218 // If the underlying buffer resize was denied or not carried to the next frame, apply_new_text_length+1 may be >= buf_size.
5219 ImStrncpy(buf, apply_new_text, ImMin(apply_new_text_length + 1, buf_size));
5220 }
5221
5222 // Release active ID at the end of the function (so e.g. pressing Return still does a final application of the value)
5223 // Otherwise request text input ahead for next frame.
5224 if (g.ActiveId == id && clear_active_id)
5225 ClearActiveID();
5226
5227 // Render frame
5228 if (!is_multiline)
5229 {
5230 RenderNavCursor(frame_bb, id);
5231 RenderFrame(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_FrameBg), true, style.FrameRounding);
5232 }
5233
5234 const ImVec4 clip_rect(frame_bb.Min.x, frame_bb.Min.y, frame_bb.Min.x + inner_size.x, frame_bb.Min.y + inner_size.y); // Not using frame_bb.Max because we have adjusted size
5235 ImVec2 draw_pos = is_multiline ? draw_window->DC.CursorPos : frame_bb.Min + style.FramePadding;
5236 ImVec2 text_size(0.0f, 0.0f);
5237
5238 // Set upper limit of single-line InputTextEx() at 2 million characters strings. The current pathological worst case is a long line
5239 // without any carriage return, which would makes ImFont::RenderText() reserve too many vertices and probably crash. Avoid it altogether.
5240 // Note that we only use this limit on single-line InputText(), so a pathologically large line on a InputTextMultiline() would still crash.
5241 const int buf_display_max_length = 2 * 1024 * 1024;
5242 const char* buf_display = buf_display_from_state ? state->TextA.Data : buf; //-V595
5243 const char* buf_display_end = NULL; // We have specialized paths below for setting the length
5244
5245 // Display hint when contents is empty
5246 // At this point we need to handle the possibility that a callback could have modified the underlying buffer (#8368)
5247 const bool new_is_displaying_hint = (hint != NULL && (buf_display_from_state ? state->TextA.Data : buf)[0] == 0);
5248 if (new_is_displaying_hint != is_displaying_hint)
5249 {
5250 if (is_password && !is_displaying_hint)
5251 PopPasswordFont();
5252 is_displaying_hint = new_is_displaying_hint;
5253 if (is_password && !is_displaying_hint)
5254 PushPasswordFont();
5255 }
5256 if (is_displaying_hint)
5257 {
5258 buf_display = hint;
5259 buf_display_end = hint + ImStrlen(hint);
5260 }
5261
5262 // Render text. We currently only render selection when the widget is active or while scrolling.
5263 // FIXME: We could remove the '&& render_cursor' to keep rendering selection when inactive.
5264 if (render_cursor || render_selection)
5265 {
5266 IM_ASSERT(state != NULL);
5267 if (!is_displaying_hint)
5268 buf_display_end = buf_display + state->TextLen;
5269
5270 // Render text (with cursor and selection)
5271 // This is going to be messy. We need to:
5272 // - Display the text (this alone can be more easily clipped)
5273 // - Handle scrolling, highlight selection, display cursor (those all requires some form of 1d->2d cursor position calculation)
5274 // - Measure text height (for scrollbar)
5275 // We are attempting to do most of that in **one main pass** to minimize the computation cost (non-negligible for large amount of text) + 2nd pass for selection rendering (we could merge them by an extra refactoring effort)
5276 // FIXME: This should occur on buf_display but we'd need to maintain cursor/select_start/select_end for UTF-8.
5277 const char* text_begin = buf_display;
5278 const char* text_end = text_begin + state->TextLen;
5279 ImVec2 cursor_offset, select_start_offset;
5280
5281 {
5282 // Find lines numbers straddling cursor and selection min position
5283 int cursor_line_no = render_cursor ? -1 : -1000;
5284 int selmin_line_no = render_selection ? -1 : -1000;
5285 const char* cursor_ptr = render_cursor ? text_begin + state->Stb->cursor : NULL;
5286 const char* selmin_ptr = render_selection ? text_begin + ImMin(state->Stb->select_start, state->Stb->select_end) : NULL;
5287
5288 // Count lines and find line number for cursor and selection ends
5289 int line_count = 1;
5290 if (is_multiline)
5291 {
5292 for (const char* s = text_begin; (s = (const char*)ImMemchr(s, '\n', (size_t)(text_end - s))) != NULL; s++)
5293 {
5294 if (cursor_line_no == -1 && s >= cursor_ptr) { cursor_line_no = line_count; }
5295 if (selmin_line_no == -1 && s >= selmin_ptr) { selmin_line_no = line_count; }
5296 line_count++;
5297 }
5298 }
5299 if (cursor_line_no == -1)
5300 cursor_line_no = line_count;
5301 if (selmin_line_no == -1)
5302 selmin_line_no = line_count;
5303
5304 // Calculate 2d position by finding the beginning of the line and measuring distance
5305 cursor_offset.x = InputTextCalcTextSize(&g, ImStrbol(cursor_ptr, text_begin), cursor_ptr).x;
5306 cursor_offset.y = cursor_line_no * g.FontSize;
5307 if (selmin_line_no >= 0)
5308 {
5309 select_start_offset.x = InputTextCalcTextSize(&g, ImStrbol(selmin_ptr, text_begin), selmin_ptr).x;
5310 select_start_offset.y = selmin_line_no * g.FontSize;
5311 }
5312
5313 // Store text height (note that we haven't calculated text width at all, see GitHub issues #383, #1224)
5314 if (is_multiline)
5315 text_size = ImVec2(inner_size.x, line_count * g.FontSize);
5316 }
5317
5318 // Scroll
5319 if (render_cursor && state->CursorFollow)
5320 {
5321 // Horizontal scroll in chunks of quarter width
5322 if (!(flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_NoHorizontalScroll))
5323 {
5324 const float scroll_increment_x = inner_size.x * 0.25f;
5325 const float visible_width = inner_size.x - style.FramePadding.x;
5326 if (cursor_offset.x < state->Scroll.x)
5327 state->Scroll.x = IM_TRUNC(ImMax(0.0f, cursor_offset.x - scroll_increment_x));
5328 else if (cursor_offset.x - visible_width >= state->Scroll.x)
5329 state->Scroll.x = IM_TRUNC(cursor_offset.x - visible_width + scroll_increment_x);
5330 }
5331 else
5332 {
5333 state->Scroll.y = 0.0f;
5334 }
5335
5336 // Vertical scroll
5337 if (is_multiline)
5338 {
5339 // Test if cursor is vertically visible
5340 if (cursor_offset.y - g.FontSize < scroll_y)
5341 scroll_y = ImMax(0.0f, cursor_offset.y - g.FontSize);
5342 else if (cursor_offset.y - (inner_size.y - style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f) >= scroll_y)
5343 scroll_y = cursor_offset.y - inner_size.y + style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f;
5344 const float scroll_max_y = ImMax((text_size.y + style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f) - inner_size.y, 0.0f);
5345 scroll_y = ImClamp(scroll_y, 0.0f, scroll_max_y);
5346 draw_pos.y += (draw_window->Scroll.y - scroll_y); // Manipulate cursor pos immediately avoid a frame of lag
5347 draw_window->Scroll.y = scroll_y;
5348 }
5349
5350 state->CursorFollow = false;
5351 }
5352
5353 // Draw selection
5354 const ImVec2 draw_scroll = ImVec2(state->Scroll.x, 0.0f);
5355 if (render_selection)
5356 {
5357 const char* text_selected_begin = text_begin + ImMin(state->Stb->select_start, state->Stb->select_end);
5358 const char* text_selected_end = text_begin + ImMax(state->Stb->select_start, state->Stb->select_end);
5359
5360 ImU32 bg_color = GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_TextSelectedBg, render_cursor ? 1.0f : 0.6f); // FIXME: current code flow mandate that render_cursor is always true here, we are leaving the transparent one for tests.
5361 float bg_offy_up = is_multiline ? 0.0f : -1.0f; // FIXME: those offsets should be part of the style? they don't play so well with multi-line selection.
5362 float bg_offy_dn = is_multiline ? 0.0f : 2.0f;
5363 ImVec2 rect_pos = draw_pos + select_start_offset - draw_scroll;
5364 for (const char* p = text_selected_begin; p < text_selected_end; )
5365 {
5366 if (rect_pos.y > clip_rect.w + g.FontSize)
5367 break;
5368 if (rect_pos.y < clip_rect.y)
5369 {
5370 p = (const char*)ImMemchr((void*)p, '\n', text_selected_end - p);
5371 p = p ? p + 1 : text_selected_end;
5372 }
5373 else
5374 {
5375 ImVec2 rect_size = InputTextCalcTextSize(&g, p, text_selected_end, &p, NULL, true);
5376 if (rect_size.x <= 0.0f) rect_size.x = IM_TRUNC(g.FontBaked->GetCharAdvance((ImWchar)' ') * 0.50f); // So we can see selected empty lines
5377 ImRect rect(rect_pos + ImVec2(0.0f, bg_offy_up - g.FontSize), rect_pos + ImVec2(rect_size.x, bg_offy_dn));
5378 rect.ClipWith(clip_rect);
5379 if (rect.Overlaps(clip_rect))
5380 draw_window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(rect.Min, rect.Max, bg_color);
5381 rect_pos.x = draw_pos.x - draw_scroll.x;
5382 }
5383 rect_pos.y += g.FontSize;
5384 }
5385 }
5386
5387 // We test for 'buf_display_max_length' as a way to avoid some pathological cases (e.g. single-line 1 MB string) which would make ImDrawList crash.
5388 // FIXME-OPT: Multiline could submit a smaller amount of contents to AddText() since we already iterated through it.
5389 if (is_multiline || (buf_display_end - buf_display) < buf_display_max_length)
5390 {
5391 ImU32 col = GetColorU32(is_displaying_hint ? ImGuiCol_TextDisabled : ImGuiCol_Text);
5392 draw_window->DrawList->AddText(g.Font, g.FontSize, draw_pos - draw_scroll, col, buf_display, buf_display_end, 0.0f, is_multiline ? NULL : &clip_rect);
5393 }
5394
5395 // Draw blinking cursor
5396 if (render_cursor)
5397 {
5398 state->CursorAnim += io.DeltaTime;
5399 bool cursor_is_visible = (!g.IO.ConfigInputTextCursorBlink) || (state->CursorAnim <= 0.0f) || ImFmod(state->CursorAnim, 1.20f) <= 0.80f;
5400 ImVec2 cursor_screen_pos = ImTrunc(draw_pos + cursor_offset - draw_scroll);
5401 ImRect cursor_screen_rect(cursor_screen_pos.x, cursor_screen_pos.y - g.FontSize + 0.5f, cursor_screen_pos.x + 1.0f, cursor_screen_pos.y - 1.5f);
5402 if (cursor_is_visible && cursor_screen_rect.Overlaps(clip_rect))
5403 draw_window->DrawList->AddLine(cursor_screen_rect.Min, cursor_screen_rect.GetBL(), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_InputTextCursor), 1.0f); // FIXME-DPI: Cursor thickness (#7031)
5404
5405 // Notify OS of text input position for advanced IME (-1 x offset so that Windows IME can cover our cursor. Bit of an extra nicety.)
5406 // This is required for some backends (SDL3) to start emitting character/text inputs.
5407 // As per #6341, make sure we don't set that on the deactivating frame.
5408 if (!is_readonly && g.ActiveId == id)
5409 {
5410 ImGuiPlatformImeData* ime_data = &g.PlatformImeData; // (this is a public struct, passed to io.Platform_SetImeDataFn() handler)
5411 ime_data->WantVisible = true;
5412 ime_data->WantTextInput = true;
5413 ime_data->InputPos = ImVec2(cursor_screen_pos.x - 1.0f, cursor_screen_pos.y - g.FontSize);
5414 ime_data->InputLineHeight = g.FontSize;
5415 ime_data->ViewportId = window->Viewport->ID;
5416 }
5417 }
5418 }
5419 else
5420 {
5421 // Render text only (no selection, no cursor)
5422 if (is_multiline)
5423 text_size = ImVec2(inner_size.x, InputTextCalcTextLenAndLineCount(buf_display, &buf_display_end) * g.FontSize); // We don't need width
5424 else if (!is_displaying_hint && g.ActiveId == id)
5425 buf_display_end = buf_display + state->TextLen;
5426 else if (!is_displaying_hint)
5427 buf_display_end = buf_display + ImStrlen(buf_display);
5428
5429 if (is_multiline || (buf_display_end - buf_display) < buf_display_max_length)
5430 {
5431 // Find render position for right alignment
5432 if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_ElideLeft)
5433 draw_pos.x = ImMin(draw_pos.x, frame_bb.Max.x - CalcTextSize(buf_display, NULL).x - style.FramePadding.x);
5434
5435 const ImVec2 draw_scroll = /*state ? ImVec2(state->Scroll.x, 0.0f) :*/ ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f); // Preserve scroll when inactive?
5436 ImU32 col = GetColorU32(is_displaying_hint ? ImGuiCol_TextDisabled : ImGuiCol_Text);
5437 draw_window->DrawList->AddText(g.Font, g.FontSize, draw_pos - draw_scroll, col, buf_display, buf_display_end, 0.0f, is_multiline ? NULL : &clip_rect);
5438 }
5439 }
5440
5441 if (is_password && !is_displaying_hint)
5442 PopPasswordFont();
5443
5444 if (is_multiline)
5445 {
5446 // For focus requests to work on our multiline we need to ensure our child ItemAdd() call specifies the ImGuiItemFlags_Inputable (see #4761, #7870)...
5447 Dummy(ImVec2(text_size.x, text_size.y + style.FramePadding.y));
5448 g.NextItemData.ItemFlags |= (ImGuiItemFlags)ImGuiItemFlags_Inputable | ImGuiItemFlags_NoTabStop;
5449 EndChild();
5450 item_data_backup.StatusFlags |= (g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredWindow);
5451
5452 // ...and then we need to undo the group overriding last item data, which gets a bit messy as EndGroup() tries to forward scrollbar being active...
5453 // FIXME: This quite messy/tricky, should attempt to get rid of the child window.
5454 EndGroup();
5455 if (g.LastItemData.ID == 0 || g.LastItemData.ID != GetWindowScrollbarID(draw_window, ImGuiAxis_Y))
5456 {
5457 g.LastItemData.ID = id;
5458 g.LastItemData.ItemFlags = item_data_backup.ItemFlags;
5459 g.LastItemData.StatusFlags = item_data_backup.StatusFlags;
5460 }
5461 }
5462 if (state)
5463 state->TextSrc = NULL;
5464
5465 // Log as text
5466 if (g.LogEnabled && (!is_password || is_displaying_hint))
5467 {
5468 LogSetNextTextDecoration("{", "}");
5469 LogRenderedText(&draw_pos, buf_display, buf_display_end);
5470 }
5471
5472 if (label_size.x > 0)
5473 RenderText(ImVec2(frame_bb.Max.x + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x, frame_bb.Min.y + style.FramePadding.y), label);
5474
5475 if (value_changed)
5476 MarkItemEdited(id);
5477
5478 IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_INFO(id, label, g.LastItemData.StatusFlags | ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Inputable);
5479 if ((flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_EnterReturnsTrue) != 0)
5480 return validated;
5481 else
5482 return value_changed;
5483}
5484
5485void ImGui::DebugNodeInputTextState(ImGuiInputTextState* state)
5486{
5487#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_DEBUG_TOOLS
5488 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5489 ImStb::STB_TexteditState* stb_state = state->Stb;
5490 ImStb::StbUndoState* undo_state = &stb_state->undostate;
5491 Text("ID: 0x%08X, ActiveID: 0x%08X", state->ID, g.ActiveId);
5492 DebugLocateItemOnHover(state->ID);
5493 Text("CurLenA: %d, Cursor: %d, Selection: %d..%d", state->TextLen, stb_state->cursor, stb_state->select_start, stb_state->select_end);
5494 Text("BufCapacity: %d", state->BufCapacity);
5495 Text("(Internal Buffer: TextA Size: %d, Capacity: %d)", state->TextA.Size, state->TextA.Capacity);
5496 Text("has_preferred_x: %d (%.2f)", stb_state->has_preferred_x, stb_state->preferred_x);
5497 Text("undo_point: %d, redo_point: %d, undo_char_point: %d, redo_char_point: %d", undo_state->undo_point, undo_state->redo_point, undo_state->undo_char_point, undo_state->redo_char_point);
5498 if (BeginChild("undopoints", ImVec2(0.0f, GetTextLineHeight() * 10), ImGuiChildFlags_Borders | ImGuiChildFlags_ResizeY)) // Visualize undo state
5499 {
5500 PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, ImVec2(0, 0));
5501 for (int n = 0; n < IMSTB_TEXTEDIT_UNDOSTATECOUNT; n++)
5502 {
5503 ImStb::StbUndoRecord* undo_rec = &undo_state->undo_rec[n];
5504 const char undo_rec_type = (n < undo_state->undo_point) ? 'u' : (n >= undo_state->redo_point) ? 'r' : ' ';
5505 if (undo_rec_type == ' ')
5506 BeginDisabled();
5507 const int buf_preview_len = (undo_rec_type != ' ' && undo_rec->char_storage != -1) ? undo_rec->insert_length : 0;
5508 const char* buf_preview_str = undo_state->undo_char + undo_rec->char_storage;
5509 Text("%c [%02d] where %03d, insert %03d, delete %03d, char_storage %03d \"%.*s\"",
5510 undo_rec_type, n, undo_rec->where, undo_rec->insert_length, undo_rec->delete_length, undo_rec->char_storage, buf_preview_len, buf_preview_str);
5511 if (undo_rec_type == ' ')
5512 EndDisabled();
5513 }
5514 PopStyleVar();
5515 }
5516 EndChild();
5517#else
5518 IM_UNUSED(state);
5519#endif
5520}
5521
5522//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
5523// [SECTION] Widgets: ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton, etc.
5524//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
5525// - ColorEdit3()
5526// - ColorEdit4()
5527// - ColorPicker3()
5528// - RenderColorRectWithAlphaCheckerboard() [Internal]
5529// - ColorPicker4()
5530// - ColorButton()
5531// - SetColorEditOptions()
5532// - ColorTooltip() [Internal]
5533// - ColorEditOptionsPopup() [Internal]
5534// - ColorPickerOptionsPopup() [Internal]
5535//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
5536
5537bool ImGui::ColorEdit3(const char* label, float col[3], ImGuiColorEditFlags flags)
5538{
5539 return ColorEdit4(label, col, flags | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha);
5540}
5541
5542static void ColorEditRestoreH(const float* col, float* H)
5543{
5544 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5545 IM_ASSERT(g.ColorEditCurrentID != 0);
5546 if (g.ColorEditSavedID != g.ColorEditCurrentID || g.ColorEditSavedColor != ImGui::ColorConvertFloat4ToU32(ImVec4(col[0], col[1], col[2], 0)))
5547 return;
5548 *H = g.ColorEditSavedHue;
5549}
5550
5551// ColorEdit supports RGB and HSV inputs. In case of RGB input resulting color may have undefined hue and/or saturation.
5552// Since widget displays both RGB and HSV values we must preserve hue and saturation to prevent these values resetting.
5553static void ColorEditRestoreHS(const float* col, float* H, float* S, float* V)
5554{
5555 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5556 IM_ASSERT(g.ColorEditCurrentID != 0);
5557 if (g.ColorEditSavedID != g.ColorEditCurrentID || g.ColorEditSavedColor != ImGui::ColorConvertFloat4ToU32(ImVec4(col[0], col[1], col[2], 0)))
5558 return;
5559
5560 // When S == 0, H is undefined.
5561 // When H == 1 it wraps around to 0.
5562 if (*S == 0.0f || (*H == 0.0f && g.ColorEditSavedHue == 1))
5563 *H = g.ColorEditSavedHue;
5564
5565 // When V == 0, S is undefined.
5566 if (*V == 0.0f)
5567 *S = g.ColorEditSavedSat;
5568}
5569
5570// Edit colors components (each component in 0.0f..1.0f range).
5571// See enum ImGuiColorEditFlags_ for available options. e.g. Only access 3 floats if ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha flag is set.
5572// With typical options: Left-click on color square to open color picker. Right-click to open option menu. CTRL+Click over input fields to edit them and TAB to go to next item.
5573bool ImGui::ColorEdit4(const char* label, float col[4], ImGuiColorEditFlags flags)
5574{
5575 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
5576 if (window->SkipItems)
5577 return false;
5578
5579 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5580 const ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
5581 const float square_sz = GetFrameHeight();
5582 const char* label_display_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(label);
5583 float w_full = CalcItemWidth();
5584 g.NextItemData.ClearFlags();
5585
5586 BeginGroup();
5587 PushID(label);
5588 const bool set_current_color_edit_id = (g.ColorEditCurrentID == 0);
5589 if (set_current_color_edit_id)
5590 g.ColorEditCurrentID = window->IDStack.back();
5591
5592 // If we're not showing any slider there's no point in doing any HSV conversions
5593 const ImGuiColorEditFlags flags_untouched = flags;
5594 if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs)
5595 flags = (flags & (~ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_)) | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions;
5596
5597 // Context menu: display and modify options (before defaults are applied)
5598 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions))
5599 ColorEditOptionsPopup(col, flags);
5600
5601 // Read stored options
5602 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_))
5603 flags |= (g.ColorEditOptions & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_);
5604 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_))
5605 flags |= (g.ColorEditOptions & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_);
5606 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_))
5607 flags |= (g.ColorEditOptions & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_);
5608 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_))
5609 flags |= (g.ColorEditOptions & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_);
5610 flags |= (g.ColorEditOptions & ~(ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_));
5611 IM_ASSERT(ImIsPowerOfTwo(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_)); // Check that only 1 is selected
5612 IM_ASSERT(ImIsPowerOfTwo(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_)); // Check that only 1 is selected
5613
5614 const bool alpha = (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha) == 0;
5615 const bool hdr = (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_HDR) != 0;
5616 const int components = alpha ? 4 : 3;
5617 const float w_button = (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSmallPreview) ? 0.0f : (square_sz + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
5618 const float w_inputs = ImMax(w_full - w_button, 1.0f);
5619 w_full = w_inputs + w_button;
5620
5621 // Convert to the formats we need
5622 float f[4] = { col[0], col[1], col[2], alpha ? col[3] : 1.0f };
5623 if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV) && (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB))
5624 ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(f[0], f[1], f[2], f[0], f[1], f[2]);
5625 else if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB) && (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV))
5626 {
5627 // Hue is lost when converting from grayscale rgb (saturation=0). Restore it.
5628 ColorConvertRGBtoHSV(f[0], f[1], f[2], f[0], f[1], f[2]);
5629 ColorEditRestoreHS(col, &f[0], &f[1], &f[2]);
5630 }
5631 int i[4] = { IM_F32_TO_INT8_UNBOUND(f[0]), IM_F32_TO_INT8_UNBOUND(f[1]), IM_F32_TO_INT8_UNBOUND(f[2]), IM_F32_TO_INT8_UNBOUND(f[3]) };
5632
5633 bool value_changed = false;
5634 bool value_changed_as_float = false;
5635
5636 const ImVec2 pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
5637 const float inputs_offset_x = (style.ColorButtonPosition == ImGuiDir_Left) ? w_button : 0.0f;
5638 window->DC.CursorPos.x = pos.x + inputs_offset_x;
5639
5640 if ((flags & (ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV)) != 0 && (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs) == 0)
5641 {
5642 // RGB/HSV 0..255 Sliders
5643 const float w_items = w_inputs - style.ItemInnerSpacing.x * (components - 1);
5644
5645 const bool hide_prefix = (IM_TRUNC(w_items / components) <= CalcTextSize((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float) ? "M:0.000" : "M:000").x);
5646 static const char* ids[4] = { "##X", "##Y", "##Z", "##W" };
5647 static const char* fmt_table_int[3][4] =
5648 {
5649 { "%3d", "%3d", "%3d", "%3d" }, // Short display
5650 { "R:%3d", "G:%3d", "B:%3d", "A:%3d" }, // Long display for RGBA
5651 { "H:%3d", "S:%3d", "V:%3d", "A:%3d" } // Long display for HSVA
5652 };
5653 static const char* fmt_table_float[3][4] =
5654 {
5655 { "%0.3f", "%0.3f", "%0.3f", "%0.3f" }, // Short display
5656 { "R:%0.3f", "G:%0.3f", "B:%0.3f", "A:%0.3f" }, // Long display for RGBA
5657 { "H:%0.3f", "S:%0.3f", "V:%0.3f", "A:%0.3f" } // Long display for HSVA
5658 };
5659 const int fmt_idx = hide_prefix ? 0 : (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV) ? 2 : 1;
5660
5661 float prev_split = 0.0f;
5662 for (int n = 0; n < components; n++)
5663 {
5664 if (n > 0)
5665 SameLine(0, style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
5666 float next_split = IM_TRUNC(w_items * (n + 1) / components);
5667 SetNextItemWidth(ImMax(next_split - prev_split, 1.0f));
5668 prev_split = next_split;
5669
5670 // FIXME: When ImGuiColorEditFlags_HDR flag is passed HS values snap in weird ways when SV values go below 0.
5671 if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float)
5672 {
5673 value_changed |= DragFloat(ids[n], &f[n], 1.0f / 255.0f, 0.0f, hdr ? 0.0f : 1.0f, fmt_table_float[fmt_idx][n]);
5674 value_changed_as_float |= value_changed;
5675 }
5676 else
5677 {
5678 value_changed |= DragInt(ids[n], &i[n], 1.0f, 0, hdr ? 0 : 255, fmt_table_int[fmt_idx][n]);
5679 }
5680 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions))
5681 OpenPopupOnItemClick("context", ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonRight);
5682 }
5683 }
5684 else if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex) != 0 && (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs) == 0)
5685 {
5686 // RGB Hexadecimal Input
5687 char buf[64];
5688 if (alpha)
5689 ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "#%02X%02X%02X%02X", ImClamp(i[0], 0, 255), ImClamp(i[1], 0, 255), ImClamp(i[2], 0, 255), ImClamp(i[3], 0, 255));
5690 else
5691 ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "#%02X%02X%02X", ImClamp(i[0], 0, 255), ImClamp(i[1], 0, 255), ImClamp(i[2], 0, 255));
5692 SetNextItemWidth(w_inputs);
5693 if (InputText("##Text", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsUppercase))
5694 {
5695 value_changed = true;
5696 char* p = buf;
5697 while (*p == '#' || ImCharIsBlankA(*p))
5698 p++;
5699 i[0] = i[1] = i[2] = 0;
5700 i[3] = 0xFF; // alpha default to 255 is not parsed by scanf (e.g. inputting #FFFFFF omitting alpha)
5701 int r;
5702 if (alpha)
5703 r = sscanf(p, "%02X%02X%02X%02X", (unsigned int*)&i[0], (unsigned int*)&i[1], (unsigned int*)&i[2], (unsigned int*)&i[3]); // Treat at unsigned (%X is unsigned)
5704 else
5705 r = sscanf(p, "%02X%02X%02X", (unsigned int*)&i[0], (unsigned int*)&i[1], (unsigned int*)&i[2]);
5706 IM_UNUSED(r); // Fixes C6031: Return value ignored: 'sscanf'.
5707 }
5708 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions))
5709 OpenPopupOnItemClick("context", ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonRight);
5710 }
5711
5712 ImGuiWindow* picker_active_window = NULL;
5713 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSmallPreview))
5714 {
5715 const float button_offset_x = ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs) || (style.ColorButtonPosition == ImGuiDir_Left)) ? 0.0f : w_inputs + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x;
5716 window->DC.CursorPos = ImVec2(pos.x + button_offset_x, pos.y);
5717
5718 const ImVec4 col_v4(col[0], col[1], col[2], alpha ? col[3] : 1.0f);
5719 if (ColorButton("##ColorButton", col_v4, flags))
5720 {
5721 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoPicker))
5722 {
5723 // Store current color and open a picker
5724 g.ColorPickerRef = col_v4;
5725 OpenPopup("picker");
5726 SetNextWindowPos(g.LastItemData.Rect.GetBL() + ImVec2(0.0f, style.ItemSpacing.y));
5727 }
5728 }
5729 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions))
5730 OpenPopupOnItemClick("context", ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonRight);
5731
5732 if (BeginPopup("picker"))
5733 {
5734 if (g.CurrentWindow->BeginCount == 1)
5735 {
5736 picker_active_window = g.CurrentWindow;
5737 if (label != label_display_end)
5738 {
5739 TextEx(label, label_display_end);
5740 Spacing();
5741 }
5742 ImGuiColorEditFlags picker_flags_to_forward = ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_HDR | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaBar;
5743 ImGuiColorEditFlags picker_flags = (flags_untouched & picker_flags_to_forward) | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoLabel | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf;
5744 SetNextItemWidth(square_sz * 12.0f); // Use 256 + bar sizes?
5745 value_changed |= ColorPicker4("##picker", col, picker_flags, &g.ColorPickerRef.x);
5746 }
5747 EndPopup();
5748 }
5749 }
5750
5751 if (label != label_display_end && !(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoLabel))
5752 {
5753 // Position not necessarily next to last submitted button (e.g. if style.ColorButtonPosition == ImGuiDir_Left),
5754 // but we need to use SameLine() to setup baseline correctly. Might want to refactor SameLine() to simplify this.
5755 SameLine(0.0f, style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
5756 window->DC.CursorPos.x = pos.x + ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs) ? w_button : w_full + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
5757 TextEx(label, label_display_end);
5758 }
5759
5760 // Convert back
5761 if (value_changed && picker_active_window == NULL)
5762 {
5763 if (!value_changed_as_float)
5764 for (int n = 0; n < 4; n++)
5765 f[n] = i[n] / 255.0f;
5766 if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV) && (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB))
5767 {
5768 g.ColorEditSavedHue = f[0];
5769 g.ColorEditSavedSat = f[1];
5770 ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(f[0], f[1], f[2], f[0], f[1], f[2]);
5771 g.ColorEditSavedID = g.ColorEditCurrentID;
5772 g.ColorEditSavedColor = ColorConvertFloat4ToU32(ImVec4(f[0], f[1], f[2], 0));
5773 }
5774 if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB) && (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV))
5775 ColorConvertRGBtoHSV(f[0], f[1], f[2], f[0], f[1], f[2]);
5776
5777 col[0] = f[0];
5778 col[1] = f[1];
5779 col[2] = f[2];
5780 if (alpha)
5781 col[3] = f[3];
5782 }
5783
5784 if (set_current_color_edit_id)
5785 g.ColorEditCurrentID = 0;
5786 PopID();
5787 EndGroup();
5788
5789 // Drag and Drop Target
5790 // NB: The flag test is merely an optional micro-optimization, BeginDragDropTarget() does the same test.
5791 if ((g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredRect) && !(g.LastItemData.ItemFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_ReadOnly) && !(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoDragDrop) && BeginDragDropTarget())
5792 {
5793 bool accepted_drag_drop = false;
5794 if (const ImGuiPayload* payload = AcceptDragDropPayload(IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_COLOR_3F))
5795 {
5796 memcpy((float*)col, payload->Data, sizeof(float) * 3); // Preserve alpha if any //-V512 //-V1086
5797 value_changed = accepted_drag_drop = true;
5798 }
5799 if (const ImGuiPayload* payload = AcceptDragDropPayload(IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_COLOR_4F))
5800 {
5801 memcpy((float*)col, payload->Data, sizeof(float) * components);
5802 value_changed = accepted_drag_drop = true;
5803 }
5804
5805 // Drag-drop payloads are always RGB
5806 if (accepted_drag_drop && (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV))
5807 ColorConvertRGBtoHSV(col[0], col[1], col[2], col[0], col[1], col[2]);
5808 EndDragDropTarget();
5809 }
5810
5811 // When picker is being actively used, use its active id so IsItemActive() will function on ColorEdit4().
5812 if (picker_active_window && g.ActiveId != 0 && g.ActiveIdWindow == picker_active_window)
5813 g.LastItemData.ID = g.ActiveId;
5814
5815 if (value_changed && g.LastItemData.ID != 0) // In case of ID collision, the second EndGroup() won't catch g.ActiveId
5816 MarkItemEdited(g.LastItemData.ID);
5817
5818 return value_changed;
5819}
5820
5821bool ImGui::ColorPicker3(const char* label, float col[3], ImGuiColorEditFlags flags)
5822{
5823 float col4[4] = { col[0], col[1], col[2], 1.0f };
5824 if (!ColorPicker4(label, col4, flags | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha))
5825 return false;
5826 col[0] = col4[0]; col[1] = col4[1]; col[2] = col4[2];
5827 return true;
5828}
5829
5830// Helper for ColorPicker4()
5831static void RenderArrowsForVerticalBar(ImDrawList* draw_list, ImVec2 pos, ImVec2 half_sz, float bar_w, float alpha)
5832{
5833 ImU32 alpha8 = IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(alpha);
5834 ImGui::RenderArrowPointingAt(draw_list, ImVec2(pos.x + half_sz.x + 1, pos.y), ImVec2(half_sz.x + 2, half_sz.y + 1), ImGuiDir_Right, IM_COL32(0,0,0,alpha8));
5835 ImGui::RenderArrowPointingAt(draw_list, ImVec2(pos.x + half_sz.x, pos.y), half_sz, ImGuiDir_Right, IM_COL32(255,255,255,alpha8));
5836 ImGui::RenderArrowPointingAt(draw_list, ImVec2(pos.x + bar_w - half_sz.x - 1, pos.y), ImVec2(half_sz.x + 2, half_sz.y + 1), ImGuiDir_Left, IM_COL32(0,0,0,alpha8));
5837 ImGui::RenderArrowPointingAt(draw_list, ImVec2(pos.x + bar_w - half_sz.x, pos.y), half_sz, ImGuiDir_Left, IM_COL32(255,255,255,alpha8));
5838}
5839
5840// Note: ColorPicker4() only accesses 3 floats if ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha flag is set.
5841// (In C++ the 'float col[4]' notation for a function argument is equivalent to 'float* col', we only specify a size to facilitate understanding of the code.)
5842// FIXME: we adjust the big color square height based on item width, which may cause a flickering feedback loop (if automatic height makes a vertical scrollbar appears, affecting automatic width..)
5843// FIXME: this is trying to be aware of style.Alpha but not fully correct. Also, the color wheel will have overlapping glitches with (style.Alpha < 1.0)
5844bool ImGui::ColorPicker4(const char* label, float col[4], ImGuiColorEditFlags flags, const float* ref_col)
5845{
5846 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5847 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
5848 if (window->SkipItems)
5849 return false;
5850
5851 ImDrawList* draw_list = window->DrawList;
5852 ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
5853 ImGuiIO& io = g.IO;
5854
5855 const float width = CalcItemWidth();
5856 const bool is_readonly = ((g.NextItemData.ItemFlags | g.CurrentItemFlags) & ImGuiItemFlags_ReadOnly) != 0;
5857 g.NextItemData.ClearFlags();
5858
5859 PushID(label);
5860 const bool set_current_color_edit_id = (g.ColorEditCurrentID == 0);
5861 if (set_current_color_edit_id)
5862 g.ColorEditCurrentID = window->IDStack.back();
5863 BeginGroup();
5864
5865 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSidePreview))
5866 flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSmallPreview;
5867
5868 // Context menu: display and store options.
5869 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions))
5870 ColorPickerOptionsPopup(col, flags);
5871
5872 // Read stored options
5873 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_))
5874 flags |= ((g.ColorEditOptions & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_) ? g.ColorEditOptions : ImGuiColorEditFlags_DefaultOptions_) & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_;
5875 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_))
5876 flags |= ((g.ColorEditOptions & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_) ? g.ColorEditOptions : ImGuiColorEditFlags_DefaultOptions_) & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_;
5877 IM_ASSERT(ImIsPowerOfTwo(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_)); // Check that only 1 is selected
5878 IM_ASSERT(ImIsPowerOfTwo(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_)); // Check that only 1 is selected
5879 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions))
5880 flags |= (g.ColorEditOptions & ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaBar);
5881
5882 // Setup
5883 int components = (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha) ? 3 : 4;
5884 bool alpha_bar = (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaBar) && !(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha);
5885 ImVec2 picker_pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
5886 float square_sz = GetFrameHeight();
5887 float bars_width = square_sz; // Arbitrary smallish width of Hue/Alpha picking bars
5888 float sv_picker_size = ImMax(bars_width * 1, width - (alpha_bar ? 2 : 1) * (bars_width + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x)); // Saturation/Value picking box
5889 float bar0_pos_x = picker_pos.x + sv_picker_size + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x;
5890 float bar1_pos_x = bar0_pos_x + bars_width + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x;
5891 float bars_triangles_half_sz = IM_TRUNC(bars_width * 0.20f);
5892
5893 float backup_initial_col[4];
5894 memcpy(backup_initial_col, col, components * sizeof(float));
5895
5896 float wheel_thickness = sv_picker_size * 0.08f;
5897 float wheel_r_outer = sv_picker_size * 0.50f;
5898 float wheel_r_inner = wheel_r_outer - wheel_thickness;
5899 ImVec2 wheel_center(picker_pos.x + (sv_picker_size + bars_width)*0.5f, picker_pos.y + sv_picker_size * 0.5f);
5900
5901 // Note: the triangle is displayed rotated with triangle_pa pointing to Hue, but most coordinates stays unrotated for logic.
5902 float triangle_r = wheel_r_inner - (int)(sv_picker_size * 0.027f);
5903 ImVec2 triangle_pa = ImVec2(triangle_r, 0.0f); // Hue point.
5904 ImVec2 triangle_pb = ImVec2(triangle_r * -0.5f, triangle_r * -0.866025f); // Black point.
5905 ImVec2 triangle_pc = ImVec2(triangle_r * -0.5f, triangle_r * +0.866025f); // White point.
5906
5907 float H = col[0], S = col[1], V = col[2];
5908 float R = col[0], G = col[1], B = col[2];
5909 if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB)
5910 {
5911 // Hue is lost when converting from grayscale rgb (saturation=0). Restore it.
5912 ColorConvertRGBtoHSV(R, G, B, H, S, V);
5913 ColorEditRestoreHS(col, &H, &S, &V);
5914 }
5915 else if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV)
5916 {
5917 ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(H, S, V, R, G, B);
5918 }
5919
5920 bool value_changed = false, value_changed_h = false, value_changed_sv = false;
5921
5922 PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags_NoNav, true);
5923 if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueWheel)
5924 {
5925 // Hue wheel + SV triangle logic
5926 InvisibleButton("hsv", ImVec2(sv_picker_size + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x + bars_width, sv_picker_size));
5927 if (IsItemActive() && !is_readonly)
5928 {
5929 ImVec2 initial_off = g.IO.MouseClickedPos[0] - wheel_center;
5930 ImVec2 current_off = g.IO.MousePos - wheel_center;
5931 float initial_dist2 = ImLengthSqr(initial_off);
5932 if (initial_dist2 >= (wheel_r_inner - 1) * (wheel_r_inner - 1) && initial_dist2 <= (wheel_r_outer + 1) * (wheel_r_outer + 1))
5933 {
5934 // Interactive with Hue wheel
5935 H = ImAtan2(current_off.y, current_off.x) / IM_PI * 0.5f;
5936 if (H < 0.0f)
5937 H += 1.0f;
5938 value_changed = value_changed_h = true;
5939 }
5940 float cos_hue_angle = ImCos(-H * 2.0f * IM_PI);
5941 float sin_hue_angle = ImSin(-H * 2.0f * IM_PI);
5942 if (ImTriangleContainsPoint(triangle_pa, triangle_pb, triangle_pc, ImRotate(initial_off, cos_hue_angle, sin_hue_angle)))
5943 {
5944 // Interacting with SV triangle
5945 ImVec2 current_off_unrotated = ImRotate(current_off, cos_hue_angle, sin_hue_angle);
5946 if (!ImTriangleContainsPoint(triangle_pa, triangle_pb, triangle_pc, current_off_unrotated))
5947 current_off_unrotated = ImTriangleClosestPoint(triangle_pa, triangle_pb, triangle_pc, current_off_unrotated);
5948 float uu, vv, ww;
5949 ImTriangleBarycentricCoords(triangle_pa, triangle_pb, triangle_pc, current_off_unrotated, uu, vv, ww);
5950 V = ImClamp(1.0f - vv, 0.0001f, 1.0f);
5951 S = ImClamp(uu / V, 0.0001f, 1.0f);
5952 value_changed = value_changed_sv = true;
5953 }
5954 }
5955 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions))
5956 OpenPopupOnItemClick("context", ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonRight);
5957 }
5958 else if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueBar)
5959 {
5960 // SV rectangle logic
5961 InvisibleButton("sv", ImVec2(sv_picker_size, sv_picker_size));
5962 if (IsItemActive() && !is_readonly)
5963 {
5964 S = ImSaturate((io.MousePos.x - picker_pos.x) / (sv_picker_size - 1));
5965 V = 1.0f - ImSaturate((io.MousePos.y - picker_pos.y) / (sv_picker_size - 1));
5966 ColorEditRestoreH(col, &H); // Greatly reduces hue jitter and reset to 0 when hue == 255 and color is rapidly modified using SV square.
5967 value_changed = value_changed_sv = true;
5968 }
5969 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions))
5970 OpenPopupOnItemClick("context", ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonRight);
5971
5972 // Hue bar logic
5973 SetCursorScreenPos(ImVec2(bar0_pos_x, picker_pos.y));
5974 InvisibleButton("hue", ImVec2(bars_width, sv_picker_size));
5975 if (IsItemActive() && !is_readonly)
5976 {
5977 H = ImSaturate((io.MousePos.y - picker_pos.y) / (sv_picker_size - 1));
5978 value_changed = value_changed_h = true;
5979 }
5980 }
5981
5982 // Alpha bar logic
5983 if (alpha_bar)
5984 {
5985 SetCursorScreenPos(ImVec2(bar1_pos_x, picker_pos.y));
5986 InvisibleButton("alpha", ImVec2(bars_width, sv_picker_size));
5987 if (IsItemActive())
5988 {
5989 col[3] = 1.0f - ImSaturate((io.MousePos.y - picker_pos.y) / (sv_picker_size - 1));
5990 value_changed = true;
5991 }
5992 }
5993 PopItemFlag(); // ImGuiItemFlags_NoNav
5994
5995 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSidePreview))
5996 {
5997 SameLine(0, style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
5998 BeginGroup();
5999 }
6000
6001 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoLabel))
6002 {
6003 const char* label_display_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(label);
6004 if (label != label_display_end)
6005 {
6006 if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSidePreview))
6007 SameLine(0, style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
6008 TextEx(label, label_display_end);
6009 }
6010 }
6011
6012 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSidePreview))
6013 {
6014 PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags_NoNavDefaultFocus, true);
6015 ImVec4 col_v4(col[0], col[1], col[2], (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha) ? 1.0f : col[3]);
6016 if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoLabel))
6017 Text("Current");
6018
6019 ImGuiColorEditFlags sub_flags_to_forward = ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_HDR | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoTooltip;
6020 ColorButton("##current", col_v4, (flags & sub_flags_to_forward), ImVec2(square_sz * 3, square_sz * 2));
6021 if (ref_col != NULL)
6022 {
6023 Text("Original");
6024 ImVec4 ref_col_v4(ref_col[0], ref_col[1], ref_col[2], (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha) ? 1.0f : ref_col[3]);
6025 if (ColorButton("##original", ref_col_v4, (flags & sub_flags_to_forward), ImVec2(square_sz * 3, square_sz * 2)))
6026 {
6027 memcpy(col, ref_col, components * sizeof(float));
6028 value_changed = true;
6029 }
6030 }
6031 PopItemFlag();
6032 EndGroup();
6033 }
6034
6035 // Convert back color to RGB
6036 if (value_changed_h || value_changed_sv)
6037 {
6038 if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB)
6039 {
6040 ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(H, S, V, col[0], col[1], col[2]);
6041 g.ColorEditSavedHue = H;
6042 g.ColorEditSavedSat = S;
6043 g.ColorEditSavedID = g.ColorEditCurrentID;
6044 g.ColorEditSavedColor = ColorConvertFloat4ToU32(ImVec4(col[0], col[1], col[2], 0));
6045 }
6046 else if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV)
6047 {
6048 col[0] = H;
6049 col[1] = S;
6050 col[2] = V;
6051 }
6052 }
6053
6054 // R,G,B and H,S,V slider color editor
6055 bool value_changed_fix_hue_wrap = false;
6056 if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs) == 0)
6057 {
6058 PushItemWidth((alpha_bar ? bar1_pos_x : bar0_pos_x) + bars_width - picker_pos.x);
6059 ImGuiColorEditFlags sub_flags_to_forward = ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_HDR | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoTooltip | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSmallPreview;
6060 ImGuiColorEditFlags sub_flags = (flags & sub_flags_to_forward) | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoPicker;
6061 if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB || (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_) == 0)
6062 if (ColorEdit4("##rgb", col, sub_flags | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB))
6063 {
6064 // FIXME: Hackily differentiating using the DragInt (ActiveId != 0 && !ActiveIdAllowOverlap) vs. using the InputText or DropTarget.
6065 // For the later we don't want to run the hue-wrap canceling code. If you are well versed in HSV picker please provide your input! (See #2050)
6066 value_changed_fix_hue_wrap = (g.ActiveId != 0 && !g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap);
6067 value_changed = true;
6068 }
6069 if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV || (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_) == 0)
6070 value_changed |= ColorEdit4("##hsv", col, sub_flags | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV);
6071 if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex || (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_) == 0)
6072 value_changed |= ColorEdit4("##hex", col, sub_flags | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex);
6073 PopItemWidth();
6074 }
6075
6076 // Try to cancel hue wrap (after ColorEdit4 call), if any
6077 if (value_changed_fix_hue_wrap && (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB))
6078 {
6079 float new_H, new_S, new_V;
6080 ColorConvertRGBtoHSV(col[0], col[1], col[2], new_H, new_S, new_V);
6081 if (new_H <= 0 && H > 0)
6082 {
6083 if (new_V <= 0 && V != new_V)
6084 ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(H, S, new_V <= 0 ? V * 0.5f : new_V, col[0], col[1], col[2]);
6085 else if (new_S <= 0)
6086 ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(H, new_S <= 0 ? S * 0.5f : new_S, new_V, col[0], col[1], col[2]);
6087 }
6088 }
6089
6090 if (value_changed)
6091 {
6092 if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB)
6093 {
6094 R = col[0];
6095 G = col[1];
6096 B = col[2];
6097 ColorConvertRGBtoHSV(R, G, B, H, S, V);
6098 ColorEditRestoreHS(col, &H, &S, &V); // Fix local Hue as display below will use it immediately.
6099 }
6100 else if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV)
6101 {
6102 H = col[0];
6103 S = col[1];
6104 V = col[2];
6105 ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(H, S, V, R, G, B);
6106 }
6107 }
6108
6109 const int style_alpha8 = IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(style.Alpha);
6110 const ImU32 col_black = IM_COL32(0,0,0,style_alpha8);
6111 const ImU32 col_white = IM_COL32(255,255,255,style_alpha8);
6112 const ImU32 col_midgrey = IM_COL32(128,128,128,style_alpha8);
6113 const ImU32 col_hues[6 + 1] = { IM_COL32(255,0,0,style_alpha8), IM_COL32(255,255,0,style_alpha8), IM_COL32(0,255,0,style_alpha8), IM_COL32(0,255,255,style_alpha8), IM_COL32(0,0,255,style_alpha8), IM_COL32(255,0,255,style_alpha8), IM_COL32(255,0,0,style_alpha8) };
6114
6115 ImVec4 hue_color_f(1, 1, 1, style.Alpha); ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(H, 1, 1, hue_color_f.x, hue_color_f.y, hue_color_f.z);
6116 ImU32 hue_color32 = ColorConvertFloat4ToU32(hue_color_f);
6117 ImU32 user_col32_striped_of_alpha = ColorConvertFloat4ToU32(ImVec4(R, G, B, style.Alpha)); // Important: this is still including the main rendering/style alpha!!
6118
6119 ImVec2 sv_cursor_pos;
6120
6121 if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueWheel)
6122 {
6123 // Render Hue Wheel
6124 const float aeps = 0.5f / wheel_r_outer; // Half a pixel arc length in radians (2pi cancels out).
6125 const int segment_per_arc = ImMax(4, (int)wheel_r_outer / 12);
6126 for (int n = 0; n < 6; n++)
6127 {
6128 const float a0 = (n) /6.0f * 2.0f * IM_PI - aeps;
6129 const float a1 = (n+1.0f)/6.0f * 2.0f * IM_PI + aeps;
6130 const int vert_start_idx = draw_list->VtxBuffer.Size;
6131 draw_list->PathArcTo(wheel_center, (wheel_r_inner + wheel_r_outer)*0.5f, a0, a1, segment_per_arc);
6132 draw_list->PathStroke(col_white, 0, wheel_thickness);
6133 const int vert_end_idx = draw_list->VtxBuffer.Size;
6134
6135 // Paint colors over existing vertices
6136 ImVec2 gradient_p0(wheel_center.x + ImCos(a0) * wheel_r_inner, wheel_center.y + ImSin(a0) * wheel_r_inner);
6137 ImVec2 gradient_p1(wheel_center.x + ImCos(a1) * wheel_r_inner, wheel_center.y + ImSin(a1) * wheel_r_inner);
6138 ShadeVertsLinearColorGradientKeepAlpha(draw_list, vert_start_idx, vert_end_idx, gradient_p0, gradient_p1, col_hues[n], col_hues[n + 1]);
6139 }
6140
6141 // Render Cursor + preview on Hue Wheel
6142 float cos_hue_angle = ImCos(H * 2.0f * IM_PI);
6143 float sin_hue_angle = ImSin(H * 2.0f * IM_PI);
6144 ImVec2 hue_cursor_pos(wheel_center.x + cos_hue_angle * (wheel_r_inner + wheel_r_outer) * 0.5f, wheel_center.y + sin_hue_angle * (wheel_r_inner + wheel_r_outer) * 0.5f);
6145 float hue_cursor_rad = value_changed_h ? wheel_thickness * 0.65f : wheel_thickness * 0.55f;
6146 int hue_cursor_segments = draw_list->_CalcCircleAutoSegmentCount(hue_cursor_rad); // Lock segment count so the +1 one matches others.
6147 draw_list->AddCircleFilled(hue_cursor_pos, hue_cursor_rad, hue_color32, hue_cursor_segments);
6148 draw_list->AddCircle(hue_cursor_pos, hue_cursor_rad + 1, col_midgrey, hue_cursor_segments);
6149 draw_list->AddCircle(hue_cursor_pos, hue_cursor_rad, col_white, hue_cursor_segments);
6150
6151 // Render SV triangle (rotated according to hue)
6152 ImVec2 tra = wheel_center + ImRotate(triangle_pa, cos_hue_angle, sin_hue_angle);
6153 ImVec2 trb = wheel_center + ImRotate(triangle_pb, cos_hue_angle, sin_hue_angle);
6154 ImVec2 trc = wheel_center + ImRotate(triangle_pc, cos_hue_angle, sin_hue_angle);
6155 ImVec2 uv_white = GetFontTexUvWhitePixel();
6156 draw_list->PrimReserve(3, 3);
6157 draw_list->PrimVtx(tra, uv_white, hue_color32);
6158 draw_list->PrimVtx(trb, uv_white, col_black);
6159 draw_list->PrimVtx(trc, uv_white, col_white);
6160 draw_list->AddTriangle(tra, trb, trc, col_midgrey, 1.5f);
6161 sv_cursor_pos = ImLerp(ImLerp(trc, tra, ImSaturate(S)), trb, ImSaturate(1 - V));
6162 }
6163 else if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueBar)
6164 {
6165 // Render SV Square
6166 draw_list->AddRectFilledMultiColor(picker_pos, picker_pos + ImVec2(sv_picker_size, sv_picker_size), col_white, hue_color32, hue_color32, col_white);
6167 draw_list->AddRectFilledMultiColor(picker_pos, picker_pos + ImVec2(sv_picker_size, sv_picker_size), 0, 0, col_black, col_black);
6168 RenderFrameBorder(picker_pos, picker_pos + ImVec2(sv_picker_size, sv_picker_size), 0.0f);
6169 sv_cursor_pos.x = ImClamp(IM_ROUND(picker_pos.x + ImSaturate(S) * sv_picker_size), picker_pos.x + 2, picker_pos.x + sv_picker_size - 2); // Sneakily prevent the circle to stick out too much
6170 sv_cursor_pos.y = ImClamp(IM_ROUND(picker_pos.y + ImSaturate(1 - V) * sv_picker_size), picker_pos.y + 2, picker_pos.y + sv_picker_size - 2);
6171
6172 // Render Hue Bar
6173 for (int i = 0; i < 6; ++i)
6174 draw_list->AddRectFilledMultiColor(ImVec2(bar0_pos_x, picker_pos.y + i * (sv_picker_size / 6)), ImVec2(bar0_pos_x + bars_width, picker_pos.y + (i + 1) * (sv_picker_size / 6)), col_hues[i], col_hues[i], col_hues[i + 1], col_hues[i + 1]);
6175 float bar0_line_y = IM_ROUND(picker_pos.y + H * sv_picker_size);
6176 RenderFrameBorder(ImVec2(bar0_pos_x, picker_pos.y), ImVec2(bar0_pos_x + bars_width, picker_pos.y + sv_picker_size), 0.0f);
6177 RenderArrowsForVerticalBar(draw_list, ImVec2(bar0_pos_x - 1, bar0_line_y), ImVec2(bars_triangles_half_sz + 1, bars_triangles_half_sz), bars_width + 2.0f, style.Alpha);
6178 }
6179
6180 // Render cursor/preview circle (clamp S/V within 0..1 range because floating points colors may lead HSV values to be out of range)
6181 float sv_cursor_rad = value_changed_sv ? wheel_thickness * 0.55f : wheel_thickness * 0.40f;
6182 int sv_cursor_segments = draw_list->_CalcCircleAutoSegmentCount(sv_cursor_rad); // Lock segment count so the +1 one matches others.
6183 draw_list->AddCircleFilled(sv_cursor_pos, sv_cursor_rad, user_col32_striped_of_alpha, sv_cursor_segments);
6184 draw_list->AddCircle(sv_cursor_pos, sv_cursor_rad + 1, col_midgrey, sv_cursor_segments);
6185 draw_list->AddCircle(sv_cursor_pos, sv_cursor_rad, col_white, sv_cursor_segments);
6186
6187 // Render alpha bar
6188 if (alpha_bar)
6189 {
6190 float alpha = ImSaturate(col[3]);
6191 ImRect bar1_bb(bar1_pos_x, picker_pos.y, bar1_pos_x + bars_width, picker_pos.y + sv_picker_size);
6192 RenderColorRectWithAlphaCheckerboard(draw_list, bar1_bb.Min, bar1_bb.Max, 0, bar1_bb.GetWidth() / 2.0f, ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f));
6193 draw_list->AddRectFilledMultiColor(bar1_bb.Min, bar1_bb.Max, user_col32_striped_of_alpha, user_col32_striped_of_alpha, user_col32_striped_of_alpha & ~IM_COL32_A_MASK, user_col32_striped_of_alpha & ~IM_COL32_A_MASK);
6194 float bar1_line_y = IM_ROUND(picker_pos.y + (1.0f - alpha) * sv_picker_size);
6195 RenderFrameBorder(bar1_bb.Min, bar1_bb.Max, 0.0f);
6196 RenderArrowsForVerticalBar(draw_list, ImVec2(bar1_pos_x - 1, bar1_line_y), ImVec2(bars_triangles_half_sz + 1, bars_triangles_half_sz), bars_width + 2.0f, style.Alpha);
6197 }
6198
6199 EndGroup();
6200
6201 if (value_changed && memcmp(backup_initial_col, col, components * sizeof(float)) == 0)
6202 value_changed = false;
6203 if (value_changed && g.LastItemData.ID != 0) // In case of ID collision, the second EndGroup() won't catch g.ActiveId
6204 MarkItemEdited(g.LastItemData.ID);
6205
6206 if (set_current_color_edit_id)
6207 g.ColorEditCurrentID = 0;
6208 PopID();
6209
6210 return value_changed;
6211}
6212
6213// A little color square. Return true when clicked.
6214// FIXME: May want to display/ignore the alpha component in the color display? Yet show it in the tooltip.
6215// 'desc_id' is not called 'label' because we don't display it next to the button, but only in the tooltip.
6216// Note that 'col' may be encoded in HSV if ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV is set.
6217bool ImGui::ColorButton(const char* desc_id, const ImVec4& col, ImGuiColorEditFlags flags, const ImVec2& size_arg)
6218{
6219 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
6220 if (window->SkipItems)
6221 return false;
6222
6223 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6224 const ImGuiID id = window->GetID(desc_id);
6225 const float default_size = GetFrameHeight();
6226 const ImVec2 size(size_arg.x == 0.0f ? default_size : size_arg.x, size_arg.y == 0.0f ? default_size : size_arg.y);
6227 const ImRect bb(window->DC.CursorPos, window->DC.CursorPos + size);
6228 ItemSize(bb, (size.y >= default_size) ? g.Style.FramePadding.y : 0.0f);
6229 if (!ItemAdd(bb, id))
6230 return false;
6231
6232 bool hovered, held;
6233 bool pressed = ButtonBehavior(bb, id, &hovered, &held);
6234
6235 if (flags & (ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaOpaque))
6236 flags &= ~(ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaNoBg | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf);
6237
6238 ImVec4 col_rgb = col;
6239 if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV)
6240 ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(col_rgb.x, col_rgb.y, col_rgb.z, col_rgb.x, col_rgb.y, col_rgb.z);
6241
6242 ImVec4 col_rgb_without_alpha(col_rgb.x, col_rgb.y, col_rgb.z, 1.0f);
6243 float grid_step = ImMin(size.x, size.y) / 2.99f;
6244 float rounding = ImMin(g.Style.FrameRounding, grid_step * 0.5f);
6245 ImRect bb_inner = bb;
6246 float off = 0.0f;
6247 if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoBorder) == 0)
6248 {
6249 off = -0.75f; // The border (using Col_FrameBg) tends to look off when color is near-opaque and rounding is enabled. This offset seemed like a good middle ground to reduce those artifacts.
6250 bb_inner.Expand(off);
6251 }
6252 if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf) && col_rgb.w < 1.0f)
6253 {
6254 float mid_x = IM_ROUND((bb_inner.Min.x + bb_inner.Max.x) * 0.5f);
6255 if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaNoBg) == 0)
6256 RenderColorRectWithAlphaCheckerboard(window->DrawList, ImVec2(bb_inner.Min.x + grid_step, bb_inner.Min.y), bb_inner.Max, GetColorU32(col_rgb), grid_step, ImVec2(-grid_step + off, off), rounding, ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersRight);
6257 else
6258 window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(bb_inner.Min.x + grid_step, bb_inner.Min.y), bb_inner.Max, GetColorU32(col_rgb), rounding, ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersRight);
6259 window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(bb_inner.Min, ImVec2(mid_x, bb_inner.Max.y), GetColorU32(col_rgb_without_alpha), rounding, ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersLeft);
6260 }
6261 else
6262 {
6263 // Because GetColorU32() multiplies by the global style Alpha and we don't want to display a checkerboard if the source code had no alpha
6264 ImVec4 col_source = (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaOpaque) ? col_rgb_without_alpha : col_rgb;
6265 if (col_source.w < 1.0f && (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaNoBg) == 0)
6266 RenderColorRectWithAlphaCheckerboard(window->DrawList, bb_inner.Min, bb_inner.Max, GetColorU32(col_source), grid_step, ImVec2(off, off), rounding);
6267 else
6268 window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(bb_inner.Min, bb_inner.Max, GetColorU32(col_source), rounding);
6269 }
6270 RenderNavCursor(bb, id);
6271 if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoBorder) == 0)
6272 {
6273 if (g.Style.FrameBorderSize > 0.0f)
6274 RenderFrameBorder(bb.Min, bb.Max, rounding);
6275 else
6276 window->DrawList->AddRect(bb.Min, bb.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_FrameBg), rounding); // Color buttons are often in need of some sort of border // FIXME-DPI
6277 }
6278
6279 // Drag and Drop Source
6280 // NB: The ActiveId test is merely an optional micro-optimization, BeginDragDropSource() does the same test.
6281 if (g.ActiveId == id && !(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoDragDrop) && BeginDragDropSource())
6282 {
6283 if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha)
6284 SetDragDropPayload(IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_COLOR_3F, &col_rgb, sizeof(float) * 3, ImGuiCond_Once);
6285 else
6286 SetDragDropPayload(IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_COLOR_4F, &col_rgb, sizeof(float) * 4, ImGuiCond_Once);
6287 ColorButton(desc_id, col, flags);
6288 SameLine();
6289 TextEx("Color");
6290 EndDragDropSource();
6291 }
6292
6293 // Tooltip
6294 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoTooltip) && hovered && IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_ForTooltip))
6295 ColorTooltip(desc_id, &col.x, flags & (ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaMask_));
6296
6297 return pressed;
6298}
6299
6300// Initialize/override default color options
6301void ImGui::SetColorEditOptions(ImGuiColorEditFlags flags)
6302{
6303 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6304 if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_) == 0)
6305 flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_DefaultOptions_ & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_;
6306 if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_) == 0)
6307 flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_DefaultOptions_ & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_;
6308 if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_) == 0)
6309 flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_DefaultOptions_ & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_;
6310 if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_) == 0)
6311 flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_DefaultOptions_ & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_;
6312 IM_ASSERT(ImIsPowerOfTwo(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_)); // Check only 1 option is selected
6313 IM_ASSERT(ImIsPowerOfTwo(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_)); // Check only 1 option is selected
6314 IM_ASSERT(ImIsPowerOfTwo(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_)); // Check only 1 option is selected
6315 IM_ASSERT(ImIsPowerOfTwo(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_)); // Check only 1 option is selected
6316 g.ColorEditOptions = flags;
6317}
6318
6319// Note: only access 3 floats if ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha flag is set.
6320void ImGui::ColorTooltip(const char* text, const float* col, ImGuiColorEditFlags flags)
6321{
6322 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6323
6324 if (!BeginTooltipEx(ImGuiTooltipFlags_OverridePrevious, ImGuiWindowFlags_None))
6325 return;
6326 const char* text_end = text ? FindRenderedTextEnd(text, NULL) : text;
6327 if (text_end > text)
6328 {
6329 TextEx(text, text_end);
6330 Separator();
6331 }
6332
6333 ImVec2 sz(g.FontSize * 3 + g.Style.FramePadding.y * 2, g.FontSize * 3 + g.Style.FramePadding.y * 2);
6334 ImVec4 cf(col[0], col[1], col[2], (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha) ? 1.0f : col[3]);
6335 int cr = IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(col[0]), cg = IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(col[1]), cb = IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(col[2]), ca = (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha) ? 255 : IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(col[3]);
6336 ImGuiColorEditFlags flags_to_forward = ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaMask_;
6337 ColorButton("##preview", cf, (flags & flags_to_forward) | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoTooltip, sz);
6338 SameLine();
6339 if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB) || !(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_))
6340 {
6341 if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha)
6342 Text("#%02X%02X%02X\nR: %d, G: %d, B: %d\n(%.3f, %.3f, %.3f)", cr, cg, cb, cr, cg, cb, col[0], col[1], col[2]);
6343 else
6344 Text("#%02X%02X%02X%02X\nR:%d, G:%d, B:%d, A:%d\n(%.3f, %.3f, %.3f, %.3f)", cr, cg, cb, ca, cr, cg, cb, ca, col[0], col[1], col[2], col[3]);
6345 }
6346 else if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV)
6347 {
6348 if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha)
6349 Text("H: %.3f, S: %.3f, V: %.3f", col[0], col[1], col[2]);
6350 else
6351 Text("H: %.3f, S: %.3f, V: %.3f, A: %.3f", col[0], col[1], col[2], col[3]);
6352 }
6353 EndTooltip();
6354}
6355
6356void ImGui::ColorEditOptionsPopup(const float* col, ImGuiColorEditFlags flags)
6357{
6358 bool allow_opt_inputs = !(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_);
6359 bool allow_opt_datatype = !(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_);
6360 if ((!allow_opt_inputs && !allow_opt_datatype) || !BeginPopup("context"))
6361 return;
6362
6363 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6364 PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags_NoMarkEdited, true);
6365 ImGuiColorEditFlags opts = g.ColorEditOptions;
6366 if (allow_opt_inputs)
6367 {
6368 if (RadioButton("RGB", (opts & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB) != 0)) opts = (opts & ~ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_) | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB;
6369 if (RadioButton("HSV", (opts & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV) != 0)) opts = (opts & ~ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_) | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV;
6370 if (RadioButton("Hex", (opts & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex) != 0)) opts = (opts & ~ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_) | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex;
6371 }
6372 if (allow_opt_datatype)
6373 {
6374 if (allow_opt_inputs) Separator();
6375 if (RadioButton("0..255", (opts & ImGuiColorEditFlags_Uint8) != 0)) opts = (opts & ~ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_) | ImGuiColorEditFlags_Uint8;
6376 if (RadioButton("0.00..1.00", (opts & ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float) != 0)) opts = (opts & ~ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_) | ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float;
6377 }
6378
6379 if (allow_opt_inputs || allow_opt_datatype)
6380 Separator();
6381 if (Button("Copy as..", ImVec2(-1, 0)))
6382 OpenPopup("Copy");
6383 if (BeginPopup("Copy"))
6384 {
6385 int cr = IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(col[0]), cg = IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(col[1]), cb = IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(col[2]), ca = (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha) ? 255 : IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(col[3]);
6386 char buf[64];
6387 ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "(%.3ff, %.3ff, %.3ff, %.3ff)", col[0], col[1], col[2], (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha) ? 1.0f : col[3]);
6388 if (Selectable(buf))
6389 SetClipboardText(buf);
6390 ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "(%d,%d,%d,%d)", cr, cg, cb, ca);
6391 if (Selectable(buf))
6392 SetClipboardText(buf);
6393 ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "#%02X%02X%02X", cr, cg, cb);
6394 if (Selectable(buf))
6395 SetClipboardText(buf);
6396 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha))
6397 {
6398 ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "#%02X%02X%02X%02X", cr, cg, cb, ca);
6399 if (Selectable(buf))
6400 SetClipboardText(buf);
6401 }
6402 EndPopup();
6403 }
6404
6405 g.ColorEditOptions = opts;
6406 PopItemFlag();
6407 EndPopup();
6408}
6409
6410void ImGui::ColorPickerOptionsPopup(const float* ref_col, ImGuiColorEditFlags flags)
6411{
6412 bool allow_opt_picker = !(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_);
6413 bool allow_opt_alpha_bar = !(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha) && !(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaBar);
6414 if ((!allow_opt_picker && !allow_opt_alpha_bar) || !BeginPopup("context"))
6415 return;
6416
6417 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6418 PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags_NoMarkEdited, true);
6419 if (allow_opt_picker)
6420 {
6421 ImVec2 picker_size(g.FontSize * 8, ImMax(g.FontSize * 8 - (GetFrameHeight() + g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x), 1.0f)); // FIXME: Picker size copied from main picker function
6422 PushItemWidth(picker_size.x);
6423 for (int picker_type = 0; picker_type < 2; picker_type++)
6424 {
6425 // Draw small/thumbnail version of each picker type (over an invisible button for selection)
6426 if (picker_type > 0) Separator();
6427 PushID(picker_type);
6428 ImGuiColorEditFlags picker_flags = ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoLabel | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSidePreview | (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha);
6429 if (picker_type == 0) picker_flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueBar;
6430 if (picker_type == 1) picker_flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueWheel;
6431 ImVec2 backup_pos = GetCursorScreenPos();
6432 if (Selectable("##selectable", false, 0, picker_size)) // By default, Selectable() is closing popup
6433 g.ColorEditOptions = (g.ColorEditOptions & ~ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_) | (picker_flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_);
6434 SetCursorScreenPos(backup_pos);
6435 ImVec4 previewing_ref_col;
6436 memcpy(&previewing_ref_col, ref_col, sizeof(float) * ((picker_flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha) ? 3 : 4));
6437 ColorPicker4("##previewing_picker", &previewing_ref_col.x, picker_flags);
6438 PopID();
6439 }
6440 PopItemWidth();
6441 }
6442 if (allow_opt_alpha_bar)
6443 {
6444 if (allow_opt_picker) Separator();
6445 CheckboxFlags("Alpha Bar", &g.ColorEditOptions, ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaBar);
6446 }
6447 PopItemFlag();
6448 EndPopup();
6449}
6450
6451//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
6452// [SECTION] Widgets: TreeNode, CollapsingHeader, etc.
6453//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
6454// - TreeNode()
6455// - TreeNodeV()
6456// - TreeNodeEx()
6457// - TreeNodeExV()
6458// - TreeNodeStoreStackData() [Internal]
6459// - TreeNodeBehavior() [Internal]
6460// - TreePush()
6461// - TreePop()
6462// - GetTreeNodeToLabelSpacing()
6463// - SetNextItemOpen()
6464// - CollapsingHeader()
6465//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
6466
6467bool ImGui::TreeNode(const char* str_id, const char* fmt, ...)
6468{
6469 va_list args;
6470 va_start(args, fmt);
6471 bool is_open = TreeNodeExV(str_id, 0, fmt, args);
6472 va_end(args);
6473 return is_open;
6474}
6475
6476bool ImGui::TreeNode(const void* ptr_id, const char* fmt, ...)
6477{
6478 va_list args;
6479 va_start(args, fmt);
6480 bool is_open = TreeNodeExV(ptr_id, 0, fmt, args);
6481 va_end(args);
6482 return is_open;
6483}
6484
6485bool ImGui::TreeNode(const char* label)
6486{
6487 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
6488 if (window->SkipItems)
6489 return false;
6490 ImGuiID id = window->GetID(label);
6491 return TreeNodeBehavior(id, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_None, label, NULL);
6492}
6493
6494bool ImGui::TreeNodeV(const char* str_id, const char* fmt, va_list args)
6495{
6496 return TreeNodeExV(str_id, 0, fmt, args);
6497}
6498
6499bool ImGui::TreeNodeV(const void* ptr_id, const char* fmt, va_list args)
6500{
6501 return TreeNodeExV(ptr_id, 0, fmt, args);
6502}
6503
6504bool ImGui::TreeNodeEx(const char* label, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags)
6505{
6506 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
6507 if (window->SkipItems)
6508 return false;
6509 ImGuiID id = window->GetID(label);
6510 return TreeNodeBehavior(id, flags, label, NULL);
6511}
6512
6513bool ImGui::TreeNodeEx(const char* str_id, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags, const char* fmt, ...)
6514{
6515 va_list args;
6516 va_start(args, fmt);
6517 bool is_open = TreeNodeExV(str_id, flags, fmt, args);
6518 va_end(args);
6519 return is_open;
6520}
6521
6522bool ImGui::TreeNodeEx(const void* ptr_id, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags, const char* fmt, ...)
6523{
6524 va_list args;
6525 va_start(args, fmt);
6526 bool is_open = TreeNodeExV(ptr_id, flags, fmt, args);
6527 va_end(args);
6528 return is_open;
6529}
6530
6531bool ImGui::TreeNodeExV(const char* str_id, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags, const char* fmt, va_list args)
6532{
6533 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
6534 if (window->SkipItems)
6535 return false;
6536
6537 ImGuiID id = window->GetID(str_id);
6538 const char* label, *label_end;
6539 ImFormatStringToTempBufferV(&label, &label_end, fmt, args);
6540 return TreeNodeBehavior(id, flags, label, label_end);
6541}
6542
6543bool ImGui::TreeNodeExV(const void* ptr_id, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags, const char* fmt, va_list args)
6544{
6545 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
6546 if (window->SkipItems)
6547 return false;
6548
6549 ImGuiID id = window->GetID(ptr_id);
6550 const char* label, *label_end;
6551 ImFormatStringToTempBufferV(&label, &label_end, fmt, args);
6552 return TreeNodeBehavior(id, flags, label, label_end);
6553}
6554
6555bool ImGui::TreeNodeGetOpen(ImGuiID storage_id)
6556{
6557 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6558 ImGuiStorage* storage = g.CurrentWindow->DC.StateStorage;
6559 return storage->GetInt(storage_id, 0) != 0;
6560}
6561
6562void ImGui::TreeNodeSetOpen(ImGuiID storage_id, bool open)
6563{
6564 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6565 ImGuiStorage* storage = g.CurrentWindow->DC.StateStorage;
6566 storage->SetInt(storage_id, open ? 1 : 0);
6567}
6568
6569bool ImGui::TreeNodeUpdateNextOpen(ImGuiID storage_id, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags)
6570{
6571 if (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Leaf)
6572 return true;
6573
6574 // We only write to the tree storage if the user clicks, or explicitly use the SetNextItemOpen function
6575 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6576 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
6577 ImGuiStorage* storage = window->DC.StateStorage;
6578
6579 bool is_open;
6580 if (g.NextItemData.HasFlags & ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_HasOpen)
6581 {
6582 if (g.NextItemData.OpenCond & ImGuiCond_Always)
6583 {
6584 is_open = g.NextItemData.OpenVal;
6585 TreeNodeSetOpen(storage_id, is_open);
6586 }
6587 else
6588 {
6589 // We treat ImGuiCond_Once and ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver the same because tree node state are not saved persistently.
6590 const int stored_value = storage->GetInt(storage_id, -1);
6591 if (stored_value == -1)
6592 {
6593 is_open = g.NextItemData.OpenVal;
6594 TreeNodeSetOpen(storage_id, is_open);
6595 }
6596 else
6597 {
6598 is_open = stored_value != 0;
6599 }
6600 }
6601 }
6602 else
6603 {
6604 is_open = storage->GetInt(storage_id, (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen) ? 1 : 0) != 0;
6605 }
6606
6607 // When logging is enabled, we automatically expand tree nodes (but *NOT* collapsing headers.. seems like sensible behavior).
6608 // NB- If we are above max depth we still allow manually opened nodes to be logged.
6609 if (g.LogEnabled && !(flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoAutoOpenOnLog) && (window->DC.TreeDepth - g.LogDepthRef) < g.LogDepthToExpand)
6610 is_open = true;
6611
6612 return is_open;
6613}
6614
6615// Store ImGuiTreeNodeStackData for just submitted node.
6616// Currently only supports 32 level deep and we are fine with (1 << Depth) overflowing into a zero, easy to increase.
6617static void TreeNodeStoreStackData(ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags, float x1)
6618{
6619 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6620 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
6621
6622 g.TreeNodeStack.resize(g.TreeNodeStack.Size + 1);
6623 ImGuiTreeNodeStackData* tree_node_data = &g.TreeNodeStack.Data[g.TreeNodeStack.Size - 1];
6624 tree_node_data->ID = g.LastItemData.ID;
6625 tree_node_data->TreeFlags = flags;
6626 tree_node_data->ItemFlags = g.LastItemData.ItemFlags;
6627 tree_node_data->NavRect = g.LastItemData.NavRect;
6628
6629 // Initially I tried to latch value for GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_TreeLines) but it's not a good trade-off for very large trees.
6630 const bool draw_lines = (flags & (ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesFull | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesToNodes)) != 0;
6631 tree_node_data->DrawLinesX1 = draw_lines ? (x1 + g.FontSize * 0.5f + g.Style.FramePadding.x) : +FLT_MAX;
6632 tree_node_data->DrawLinesTableColumn = (draw_lines && g.CurrentTable) ? (ImGuiTableColumnIdx)g.CurrentTable->CurrentColumn : -1;
6633 tree_node_data->DrawLinesToNodesY2 = -FLT_MAX;
6634 window->DC.TreeHasStackDataDepthMask |= (1 << window->DC.TreeDepth);
6635 if (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesToNodes)
