6636 window->DC.TreeRecordsClippedNodesY2Mask |= (1 << window->DC.TreeDepth);
6637}
6638
6639// When using public API, currently 'id == storage_id' is always true, but we separate the values to facilitate advanced user code doing storage queries outside of UI loop.
6640bool ImGui::TreeNodeBehavior(ImGuiID id, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags, const char* label, const char* label_end)
6641{
6642 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
6643 if (window->SkipItems)
6644 return false;
6645
6646 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6647 const ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
6648 const bool display_frame = (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Framed) != 0;
6649 const ImVec2 padding = (display_frame || (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_FramePadding)) ? style.FramePadding : ImVec2(style.FramePadding.x, ImMin(window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset, style.FramePadding.y));
6650
6651 if (!label_end)
6652 label_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(label);
6653 const ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, label_end, false);
6654
6655 const float text_offset_x = g.FontSize + (display_frame ? padding.x * 3 : padding.x * 2); // Collapsing arrow width + Spacing
6656 const float text_offset_y = ImMax(padding.y, window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset); // Latch before ItemSize changes it
6657 const float text_width = g.FontSize + label_size.x + padding.x * 2; // Include collapsing arrow
6658
6659 // We vertically grow up to current line height up the typical widget height.
6660 const float frame_height = ImMax(ImMin(window->DC.CurrLineSize.y, g.FontSize + style.FramePadding.y * 2), label_size.y + padding.y * 2);
6661 const bool span_all_columns = (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanAllColumns) != 0 && (g.CurrentTable != NULL);
6662 const bool span_all_columns_label = (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_LabelSpanAllColumns) != 0 && (g.CurrentTable != NULL);
6663 ImRect frame_bb;
6664 frame_bb.Min.x = span_all_columns ? window->ParentWorkRect.Min.x : (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanFullWidth) ? window->WorkRect.Min.x : window->DC.CursorPos.x;
6665 frame_bb.Min.y = window->DC.CursorPos.y;
6666 frame_bb.Max.x = span_all_columns ? window->ParentWorkRect.Max.x : (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanLabelWidth) ? window->DC.CursorPos.x + text_width + padding.x : window->WorkRect.Max.x;
6667 frame_bb.Max.y = window->DC.CursorPos.y + frame_height;
6668 if (display_frame)
6669 {
6670 const float outer_extend = IM_TRUNC(window->WindowPadding.x * 0.5f); // Framed header expand a little outside of current limits
6671 frame_bb.Min.x -= outer_extend;
6672 frame_bb.Max.x += outer_extend;
6673 }
6674
6675 ImVec2 text_pos(window->DC.CursorPos.x + text_offset_x, window->DC.CursorPos.y + text_offset_y);
6676 ItemSize(ImVec2(text_width, frame_height), padding.y);
6677
6678 // For regular tree nodes, we arbitrary allow to click past 2 worth of ItemSpacing
6679 ImRect interact_bb = frame_bb;
6680 if ((flags & (ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Framed | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanAvailWidth | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanFullWidth | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanLabelWidth | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanAllColumns)) == 0)
6681 interact_bb.Max.x = frame_bb.Min.x + text_width + (label_size.x > 0.0f ? style.ItemSpacing.x * 2.0f : 0.0f);
6682
6683 // Compute open and multi-select states before ItemAdd() as it clear NextItem data.
6684 ImGuiID storage_id = (g.NextItemData.HasFlags & ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_HasStorageID) ? g.NextItemData.StorageId : id;
6685 bool is_open = TreeNodeUpdateNextOpen(storage_id, flags);
6686
6687 bool is_visible;
6688 if (span_all_columns || span_all_columns_label)
6689 {
6690 // Modify ClipRect for the ItemAdd(), faster than doing a PushColumnsBackground/PushTableBackgroundChannel for every Selectable..
6691 const float backup_clip_rect_min_x = window->ClipRect.Min.x;
6692 const float backup_clip_rect_max_x = window->ClipRect.Max.x;
6693 window->ClipRect.Min.x = window->ParentWorkRect.Min.x;
6694 window->ClipRect.Max.x = window->ParentWorkRect.Max.x;
6695 is_visible = ItemAdd(interact_bb, id);
6696 window->ClipRect.Min.x = backup_clip_rect_min_x;
6697 window->ClipRect.Max.x = backup_clip_rect_max_x;
6698 }
6699 else
6700 {
6701 is_visible = ItemAdd(interact_bb, id);
6702 }
6703 g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HasDisplayRect;
6704 g.LastItemData.DisplayRect = frame_bb;
6705
6706 // If a NavLeft request is happening and ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NavLeftJumpsToParent enabled:
6707 // Store data for the current depth to allow returning to this node from any child item.
6708 // For this purpose we essentially compare if g.NavIdIsAlive went from 0 to 1 between TreeNode() and TreePop().
6709 // It will become tempting to enable ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NavLeftJumpsToParent by default or move it to ImGuiStyle.
6710 bool store_tree_node_stack_data = false;
6711 if ((flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesMask_) == 0)
6712 flags |= g.Style.TreeLinesFlags;
6713 const bool draw_tree_lines = (flags & (ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesFull | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesToNodes)) && (frame_bb.Min.y < window->ClipRect.Max.y) && (g.Style.TreeLinesSize > 0.0f);
6714 if (!(flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen))
6715 {
6716 store_tree_node_stack_data = draw_tree_lines;
6717 if ((flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NavLeftJumpsToParent) && !g.NavIdIsAlive)
6718 if (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Left && g.NavWindow == window && NavMoveRequestButNoResultYet())
6719 store_tree_node_stack_data = true;
6720 }
6721
6722 const bool is_leaf = (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Leaf) != 0;
6723 if (!is_visible)
6724 {
6725 if ((flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesToNodes) && (window->DC.TreeRecordsClippedNodesY2Mask & (1 << (window->DC.TreeDepth - 1))))
6726 {
6727 ImGuiTreeNodeStackData* parent_data = &g.TreeNodeStack.Data[g.TreeNodeStack.Size - 1];
6728 parent_data->DrawLinesToNodesY2 = ImMax(parent_data->DrawLinesToNodesY2, window->DC.CursorPos.y); // Don't need to aim to mid Y position as we are clipped anyway.
6729 if (frame_bb.Min.y >= window->ClipRect.Max.y)
6730 window->DC.TreeRecordsClippedNodesY2Mask &= ~(1 << (window->DC.TreeDepth - 1)); // Done
6731 }
6732 if (is_open && store_tree_node_stack_data)
6733 TreeNodeStoreStackData(flags, text_pos.x - text_offset_x); // Call before TreePushOverrideID()
6734 if (is_open && !(flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen))
6735 TreePushOverrideID(id);
6736 IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_INFO(g.LastItemData.ID, label, g.LastItemData.StatusFlags | (is_leaf ? 0 : ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Openable) | (is_open ? ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Opened : 0));
6737 return is_open;
6738 }
6739
6740 if (span_all_columns || span_all_columns_label)
6741 {
6742 TablePushBackgroundChannel();
6743 g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HasClipRect;
6744 g.LastItemData.ClipRect = window->ClipRect;
6745 }
6746
6747 ImGuiButtonFlags button_flags = ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_None;
6748 if ((flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_AllowOverlap) || (g.LastItemData.ItemFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_AllowOverlap))
6749 button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_AllowOverlap;
6750 if (!is_leaf)
6751 button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnDragDropHold;
6752
6753 // We allow clicking on the arrow section with keyboard modifiers held, in order to easily
6754 // allow browsing a tree while preserving selection with code implementing multi-selection patterns.
6755 // When clicking on the rest of the tree node we always disallow keyboard modifiers.
6756 const float arrow_hit_x1 = (text_pos.x - text_offset_x) - style.TouchExtraPadding.x;
6757 const float arrow_hit_x2 = (text_pos.x - text_offset_x) + (g.FontSize + padding.x * 2.0f) + style.TouchExtraPadding.x;
6758 const bool is_mouse_x_over_arrow = (g.IO.MousePos.x >= arrow_hit_x1 && g.IO.MousePos.x < arrow_hit_x2);
6759
6760 const bool is_multi_select = (g.LastItemData.ItemFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_IsMultiSelect) != 0;
6761 if (is_multi_select) // We absolutely need to distinguish open vs select so _OpenOnArrow comes by default
6762 flags |= (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnMask_) == 0 ? ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnArrow | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnDoubleClick : ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnArrow;
6763
6764 // Open behaviors can be altered with the _OpenOnArrow and _OnOnDoubleClick flags.
6765 // Some alteration have subtle effects (e.g. toggle on MouseUp vs MouseDown events) due to requirements for multi-selection and drag and drop support.
6766 // - Single-click on label = Toggle on MouseUp (default, when _OpenOnArrow=0)
6767 // - Single-click on arrow = Toggle on MouseDown (when _OpenOnArrow=0)
6768 // - Single-click on arrow = Toggle on MouseDown (when _OpenOnArrow=1)
6769 // - Double-click on label = Toggle on MouseDoubleClick (when _OpenOnDoubleClick=1)
6770 // - Double-click on arrow = Toggle on MouseDoubleClick (when _OpenOnDoubleClick=1 and _OpenOnArrow=0)
6771 // It is rather standard that arrow click react on Down rather than Up.
6772 // We set ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClickRelease on OpenOnDoubleClick because we want the item to be active on the initial MouseDown in order for drag and drop to work.
6773 if (is_mouse_x_over_arrow)
6774 button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClick;
6775 else if (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnDoubleClick)
6776 button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClickRelease | ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnDoubleClick;
6777 else
6778 button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClickRelease;
6779 if (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoNavFocus)
6780 button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_NoNavFocus;
6781
6782 bool selected = (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Selected) != 0;
6783 const bool was_selected = selected;
6784
6785 // Multi-selection support (header)
6786 if (is_multi_select)
6787 {
6788 // Handle multi-select + alter button flags for it
6789 MultiSelectItemHeader(id, &selected, &button_flags);
6790 if (is_mouse_x_over_arrow)
6791 button_flags = (button_flags | ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClick) & ~ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClickRelease;
6792 }
6793 else
6794 {
6795 if (window != g.HoveredWindow || !is_mouse_x_over_arrow)
6796 button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_NoKeyModsAllowed;
6797 }
6798
6799 bool hovered, held;
6800 bool pressed = ButtonBehavior(interact_bb, id, &hovered, &held, button_flags);
6801 bool toggled = false;
6802 if (!is_leaf)
6803 {
6804 if (pressed && g.DragDropHoldJustPressedId != id)
6805 {
6806 if ((flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnMask_) == 0 || (g.NavActivateId == id && !is_multi_select))
6807 toggled = true; // Single click
6808 if (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnArrow)
6809 toggled |= is_mouse_x_over_arrow && !g.NavHighlightItemUnderNav; // Lightweight equivalent of IsMouseHoveringRect() since ButtonBehavior() already did the job
6810 if ((flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnDoubleClick) && g.IO.MouseClickedCount[0] == 2)
6811 toggled = true; // Double click
6812 }
6813 else if (pressed && g.DragDropHoldJustPressedId == id)
6814 {
6815 IM_ASSERT(button_flags & ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnDragDropHold);
6816 if (!is_open) // When using Drag and Drop "hold to open" we keep the node highlighted after opening, but never close it again.
6817 toggled = true;
6818 else
6819 pressed = false; // Cancel press so it doesn't trigger selection.
6820 }
6821
6822 if (g.NavId == id && g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Left && is_open)
6823 {
6824 toggled = true;
6825 NavClearPreferredPosForAxis(ImGuiAxis_X);
6826 NavMoveRequestCancel();
6827 }
6828 if (g.NavId == id && g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Right && !is_open) // If there's something upcoming on the line we may want to give it the priority?
6829 {
6830 toggled = true;
6831 NavClearPreferredPosForAxis(ImGuiAxis_X);
6832 NavMoveRequestCancel();
6833 }
6834
6835 if (toggled)
6836 {
6837 is_open = !is_open;
6838 window->DC.StateStorage->SetInt(storage_id, is_open);
6839 g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_ToggledOpen;
6840 }
6841 }
6842
6843 // Multi-selection support (footer)
6844 if (is_multi_select)
6845 {
6846 bool pressed_copy = pressed && !toggled;
6847 MultiSelectItemFooter(id, &selected, &pressed_copy);
6848 if (pressed)
6849 SetNavID(id, window->DC.NavLayerCurrent, g.CurrentFocusScopeId, interact_bb);
6850 }
6851
6852 if (selected != was_selected)
6853 g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_ToggledSelection;
6854
6855 // Render
6856 {
6857 const ImU32 text_col = GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text);
6858 ImGuiNavRenderCursorFlags nav_render_cursor_flags = ImGuiNavRenderCursorFlags_Compact;
6859 if (is_multi_select)
6860 nav_render_cursor_flags |= ImGuiNavRenderCursorFlags_AlwaysDraw; // Always show the nav rectangle
6861 if (display_frame)
6862 {
6863 // Framed type
6864 const ImU32 bg_col = GetColorU32((held && hovered) ? ImGuiCol_HeaderActive : hovered ? ImGuiCol_HeaderHovered : ImGuiCol_Header);
6865 RenderFrame(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max, bg_col, true, style.FrameRounding);
6866 RenderNavCursor(frame_bb, id, nav_render_cursor_flags);
6867 if (span_all_columns && !span_all_columns_label)
6868 TablePopBackgroundChannel();
6869 if (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Bullet)
6870 RenderBullet(window->DrawList, ImVec2(text_pos.x - text_offset_x * 0.60f, text_pos.y + g.FontSize * 0.5f), text_col);
6871 else if (!is_leaf)
6872 RenderArrow(window->DrawList, ImVec2(text_pos.x - text_offset_x + padding.x, text_pos.y), text_col, is_open ? ((flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_UpsideDownArrow) ? ImGuiDir_Up : ImGuiDir_Down) : ImGuiDir_Right, 1.0f);
6873 else // Leaf without bullet, left-adjusted text
6874 text_pos.x -= text_offset_x - padding.x;
6875 if (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_ClipLabelForTrailingButton)
6876 frame_bb.Max.x -= g.FontSize + style.FramePadding.x;
6877 if (g.LogEnabled)
6878 LogSetNextTextDecoration("###", "###");
6879 }
6880 else
6881 {
6882 // Unframed typed for tree nodes
6883 if (hovered || selected)
6884 {
6885 const ImU32 bg_col = GetColorU32((held && hovered) ? ImGuiCol_HeaderActive : hovered ? ImGuiCol_HeaderHovered : ImGuiCol_Header);
6886 RenderFrame(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max, bg_col, false);
6887 }
6888 RenderNavCursor(frame_bb, id, nav_render_cursor_flags);
6889 if (span_all_columns && !span_all_columns_label)
6890 TablePopBackgroundChannel();
6891 if (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Bullet)
6892 RenderBullet(window->DrawList, ImVec2(text_pos.x - text_offset_x * 0.5f, text_pos.y + g.FontSize * 0.5f), text_col);
6893 else if (!is_leaf)
6894 RenderArrow(window->DrawList, ImVec2(text_pos.x - text_offset_x + padding.x, text_pos.y + g.FontSize * 0.15f), text_col, is_open ? ((flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_UpsideDownArrow) ? ImGuiDir_Up : ImGuiDir_Down) : ImGuiDir_Right, 0.70f);
6895 if (g.LogEnabled)
6896 LogSetNextTextDecoration(">", NULL);
6897 }
6898
6899 if (draw_tree_lines)
6900 TreeNodeDrawLineToChildNode(ImVec2(text_pos.x - text_offset_x + padding.x, text_pos.y + g.FontSize * 0.5f));
6901
6902 // Label
6903 if (display_frame)
6904 RenderTextClipped(text_pos, frame_bb.Max, label, label_end, &label_size);
6905 else
6906 RenderText(text_pos, label, label_end, false);
6907
6908 if (span_all_columns_label)
6909 TablePopBackgroundChannel();
6910 }
6911
6912 if (is_open && store_tree_node_stack_data)
6913 TreeNodeStoreStackData(flags, text_pos.x - text_offset_x); // Call before TreePushOverrideID()
6914 if (is_open && !(flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen))
6915 TreePushOverrideID(id); // Could use TreePush(label) but this avoid computing twice
6916
6917 IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_INFO(id, label, g.LastItemData.StatusFlags | (is_leaf ? 0 : ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Openable) | (is_open ? ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Opened : 0));
6918 return is_open;
6919}
6920
6921// Draw horizontal line from our parent node
6922// This is only called for visible child nodes so we are not too fussy anymore about performances
6923void ImGui::TreeNodeDrawLineToChildNode(const ImVec2& target_pos)
6924{
6925 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6926 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
6927 if (window->DC.TreeDepth == 0 || (window->DC.TreeHasStackDataDepthMask & (1 << (window->DC.TreeDepth - 1))) == 0)
6928 return;
6929
6930 ImGuiTreeNodeStackData* parent_data = &g.TreeNodeStack.Data[g.TreeNodeStack.Size - 1];
6931 float x1 = ImTrunc(parent_data->DrawLinesX1);
6932 float x2 = ImTrunc(target_pos.x - g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
6933 float y = ImTrunc(target_pos.y);
6934 float rounding = (g.Style.TreeLinesRounding > 0.0f) ? ImMin(x2 - x1, g.Style.TreeLinesRounding) : 0.0f;
6935 parent_data->DrawLinesToNodesY2 = ImMax(parent_data->DrawLinesToNodesY2, y - rounding);
6936 if (x1 >= x2)
6937 return;
6938 if (rounding > 0.0f)
6939 {
6940 x1 += 0.5f + rounding;
6941 window->DrawList->PathArcToFast(ImVec2(x1, y - rounding), rounding, 6, 3);
6942 if (x1 < x2)
6943 window->DrawList->PathLineTo(ImVec2(x2, y));
6944 window->DrawList->PathStroke(GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_TreeLines), ImDrawFlags_None, g.Style.TreeLinesSize);
6945 }
6946 else
6947 {
6948 window->DrawList->AddLine(ImVec2(x1, y), ImVec2(x2, y), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_TreeLines), g.Style.TreeLinesSize);
6949 }
6950}
6951
6952// Draw vertical line of the hierarchy
6953void ImGui::TreeNodeDrawLineToTreePop(const ImGuiTreeNodeStackData* data)
6954{
6955 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6956 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
6957 float y1 = ImMax(data->NavRect.Max.y, window->ClipRect.Min.y);
6958 float y2 = data->DrawLinesToNodesY2;
6959 if (data->TreeFlags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesFull)
6960 {
6961 float y2_full = window->DC.CursorPos.y;
6962 if (g.CurrentTable)
6963 y2_full = ImMax(g.CurrentTable->RowPosY2, y2_full);
6964 y2_full = ImTrunc(y2_full - g.Style.ItemSpacing.y - g.FontSize * 0.5f);
6965 if (y2 + (g.Style.ItemSpacing.y + g.Style.TreeLinesRounding) < y2_full) // FIXME: threshold to use ToNodes Y2 instead of Full Y2 when close by ItemSpacing.y
6966 y2 = y2_full;
6967 }
6968 y2 = ImMin(y2, window->ClipRect.Max.y);
6969 if (y2 <= y1)
6970 return;
6971 float x = ImTrunc(data->DrawLinesX1);
6972 if (data->DrawLinesTableColumn != -1)
6973 TablePushColumnChannel(data->DrawLinesTableColumn);
6974 window->DrawList->AddLine(ImVec2(x, y1), ImVec2(x, y2), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_TreeLines), g.Style.TreeLinesSize);
6975 if (data->DrawLinesTableColumn != -1)
6976 TablePopColumnChannel();
6977}
6978
6979void ImGui::TreePush(const char* str_id)
6980{
6981 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
6982 Indent();
6983 window->DC.TreeDepth++;
6984 PushID(str_id);
6985}
6986
6987void ImGui::TreePush(const void* ptr_id)
6988{
6989 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
6990 Indent();
6991 window->DC.TreeDepth++;
6992 PushID(ptr_id);
6993}
6994
6995void ImGui::TreePushOverrideID(ImGuiID id)
6996{
6997 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6998 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
6999 Indent();
7000 window->DC.TreeDepth++;
7001 PushOverrideID(id);
7002}
7003
7004void ImGui::TreePop()
7005{
7006 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7007 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7008 Unindent();
7009
7010 window->DC.TreeDepth--;
7011 ImU32 tree_depth_mask = (1 << window->DC.TreeDepth);
7012
7013 if (window->DC.TreeHasStackDataDepthMask & tree_depth_mask)
7014 {
7015 const ImGuiTreeNodeStackData* data = &g.TreeNodeStack.Data[g.TreeNodeStack.Size - 1];
7016 IM_ASSERT(data->ID == window->IDStack.back());
7017
7018 // Handle Left arrow to move to parent tree node (when ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NavLeftJumpsToParent is enabled)
7019 if (data->TreeFlags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NavLeftJumpsToParent)
7020 if (g.NavIdIsAlive && g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Left && g.NavWindow == window && NavMoveRequestButNoResultYet())
7021 NavMoveRequestResolveWithPastTreeNode(&g.NavMoveResultLocal, data);
7022
7023 // Draw hierarchy lines
7024 if (data->DrawLinesX1 != +FLT_MAX && window->DC.CursorPos.y >= window->ClipRect.Min.y)
7025 TreeNodeDrawLineToTreePop(data);
7026
7027 g.TreeNodeStack.pop_back();
7028 window->DC.TreeHasStackDataDepthMask &= ~tree_depth_mask;
7029 window->DC.TreeRecordsClippedNodesY2Mask &= ~tree_depth_mask;
7030 }
7031
7032 IM_ASSERT(window->IDStack.Size > 1); // There should always be 1 element in the IDStack (pushed during window creation). If this triggers you called TreePop/PopID too much.
7033 PopID();
7034}
7035
7036// Horizontal distance preceding label when using TreeNode() or Bullet()
7037float ImGui::GetTreeNodeToLabelSpacing()
7038{
7039 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7040 return g.FontSize + (g.Style.FramePadding.x * 2.0f);
7041}
7042
7043// Set next TreeNode/CollapsingHeader open state.
7044void ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(bool is_open, ImGuiCond cond)
7045{
7046 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7047 if (g.CurrentWindow->SkipItems)
7048 return;
7049 g.NextItemData.HasFlags |= ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_HasOpen;
7050 g.NextItemData.OpenVal = is_open;
7051 g.NextItemData.OpenCond = (ImU8)(cond ? cond : ImGuiCond_Always);
7052}
7053
7054// Set next TreeNode/CollapsingHeader storage id.
7055void ImGui::SetNextItemStorageID(ImGuiID storage_id)
7056{
7057 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7058 if (g.CurrentWindow->SkipItems)
7059 return;
7060 g.NextItemData.HasFlags |= ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_HasStorageID;
7061 g.NextItemData.StorageId = storage_id;
7062}
7063
7064// CollapsingHeader returns true when opened but do not indent nor push into the ID stack (because of the ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen flag).
7065// This is basically the same as calling TreeNodeEx(label, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_CollapsingHeader). You can remove the _NoTreePushOnOpen flag if you want behavior closer to normal TreeNode().
7066bool ImGui::CollapsingHeader(const char* label, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags)
7067{
7068 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
7069 if (window->SkipItems)
7070 return false;
7071 ImGuiID id = window->GetID(label);
7072 return TreeNodeBehavior(id, flags | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_CollapsingHeader, label);
7073}
7074
7075// p_visible == NULL : regular collapsing header
7076// p_visible != NULL && *p_visible == true : show a small close button on the corner of the header, clicking the button will set *p_visible = false
7077// p_visible != NULL && *p_visible == false : do not show the header at all
7078// Do not mistake this with the Open state of the header itself, which you can adjust with SetNextItemOpen() or ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen.
7079bool ImGui::CollapsingHeader(const char* label, bool* p_visible, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags)
7080{
7081 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
7082 if (window->SkipItems)
7083 return false;
7084
7085 if (p_visible && !*p_visible)
7086 return false;
7087
7088 ImGuiID id = window->GetID(label);
7089 flags |= ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_CollapsingHeader;
7090 if (p_visible)
7091 flags |= ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_AllowOverlap | (ImGuiTreeNodeFlags)ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_ClipLabelForTrailingButton;
7092 bool is_open = TreeNodeBehavior(id, flags, label);
7093 if (p_visible != NULL)
7094 {
7095 // Create a small overlapping close button
7096 // FIXME: We can evolve this into user accessible helpers to add extra buttons on title bars, headers, etc.
7097 // FIXME: CloseButton can overlap into text, need find a way to clip the text somehow.
7098 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7099 ImGuiLastItemData last_item_backup = g.LastItemData;
7100 float button_size = g.FontSize;
7101 float button_x = ImMax(g.LastItemData.Rect.Min.x, g.LastItemData.Rect.Max.x - g.Style.FramePadding.x - button_size);
7102 float button_y = g.LastItemData.Rect.Min.y + g.Style.FramePadding.y;
7103 ImGuiID close_button_id = GetIDWithSeed("#CLOSE", NULL, id);
7104 if (CloseButton(close_button_id, ImVec2(button_x, button_y)))
7105 *p_visible = false;
7106 g.LastItemData = last_item_backup;
7107 }
7108
7109 return is_open;
7110}
7111
7112//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
7113// [SECTION] Widgets: Selectable
7114//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
7115// - Selectable()
7116//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
7117
7118// Tip: pass a non-visible label (e.g. "##hello") then you can use the space to draw other text or image.
7119// But you need to make sure the ID is unique, e.g. enclose calls in PushID/PopID or use ##unique_id.
7120// With this scheme, ImGuiSelectableFlags_SpanAllColumns and ImGuiSelectableFlags_AllowOverlap are also frequently used flags.
7121// FIXME: Selectable() with (size.x == 0.0f) and (SelectableTextAlign.x > 0.0f) followed by SameLine() is currently not supported.
7122bool ImGui::Selectable(const char* label, bool selected, ImGuiSelectableFlags flags, const ImVec2& size_arg)
7123{
7124 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
7125 if (window->SkipItems)
7126 return false;
7127
7128 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7129 const ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
7130
7131 // Submit label or explicit size to ItemSize(), whereas ItemAdd() will submit a larger/spanning rectangle.
7132 ImGuiID id = window->GetID(label);
7133 ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
7134 ImVec2 size(size_arg.x != 0.0f ? size_arg.x : label_size.x, size_arg.y != 0.0f ? size_arg.y : label_size.y);
7135 ImVec2 pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
7136 pos.y += window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset;
7137 ItemSize(size, 0.0f);
7138
7139 // Fill horizontal space
7140 // We don't support (size < 0.0f) in Selectable() because the ItemSpacing extension would make explicitly right-aligned sizes not visibly match other widgets.
7141 const bool span_all_columns = (flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_SpanAllColumns) != 0;
7142 const float min_x = span_all_columns ? window->ParentWorkRect.Min.x : pos.x;
7143 const float max_x = span_all_columns ? window->ParentWorkRect.Max.x : window->WorkRect.Max.x;
7144 if (size_arg.x == 0.0f || (flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_SpanAvailWidth))
7145 size.x = ImMax(label_size.x, max_x - min_x);
7146
7147 // Selectables are meant to be tightly packed together with no click-gap, so we extend their box to cover spacing between selectable.
7148 // FIXME: Not part of layout so not included in clipper calculation, but ItemSize currently doesn't allow offsetting CursorPos.
7149 ImRect bb(min_x, pos.y, min_x + size.x, pos.y + size.y);
7150 if ((flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_NoPadWithHalfSpacing) == 0)
7151 {
7152 const float spacing_x = span_all_columns ? 0.0f : style.ItemSpacing.x;
7153 const float spacing_y = style.ItemSpacing.y;
7154 const float spacing_L = IM_TRUNC(spacing_x * 0.50f);
7155 const float spacing_U = IM_TRUNC(spacing_y * 0.50f);
7156 bb.Min.x -= spacing_L;
7157 bb.Min.y -= spacing_U;
7158 bb.Max.x += (spacing_x - spacing_L);
7159 bb.Max.y += (spacing_y - spacing_U);
7160 }
7161 //if (g.IO.KeyCtrl) { GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(bb.Min, bb.Max, IM_COL32(0, 255, 0, 255)); }
7162
7163 const bool disabled_item = (flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_Disabled) != 0;
7164 const ImGuiItemFlags extra_item_flags = disabled_item ? (ImGuiItemFlags)ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled : ImGuiItemFlags_None;
7165 bool is_visible;
7166 if (span_all_columns)
7167 {
7168 // Modify ClipRect for the ItemAdd(), faster than doing a PushColumnsBackground/PushTableBackgroundChannel for every Selectable..
7169 const float backup_clip_rect_min_x = window->ClipRect.Min.x;
7170 const float backup_clip_rect_max_x = window->ClipRect.Max.x;
7171 window->ClipRect.Min.x = window->ParentWorkRect.Min.x;
7172 window->ClipRect.Max.x = window->ParentWorkRect.Max.x;
7173 is_visible = ItemAdd(bb, id, NULL, extra_item_flags);
7174 window->ClipRect.Min.x = backup_clip_rect_min_x;
7175 window->ClipRect.Max.x = backup_clip_rect_max_x;
7176 }
7177 else
7178 {
7179 is_visible = ItemAdd(bb, id, NULL, extra_item_flags);
7180 }
7181
7182 const bool is_multi_select = (g.LastItemData.ItemFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_IsMultiSelect) != 0;
7183 if (!is_visible)
7184 if (!is_multi_select || !g.BoxSelectState.UnclipMode || !g.BoxSelectState.UnclipRect.Overlaps(bb)) // Extra layer of "no logic clip" for box-select support (would be more overhead to add to ItemAdd)
7185 return false;
7186
7187 const bool disabled_global = (g.CurrentItemFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled) != 0;
7188 if (disabled_item && !disabled_global) // Only testing this as an optimization
7189 BeginDisabled();
7190
7191 // FIXME: We can standardize the behavior of those two, we could also keep the fast path of override ClipRect + full push on render only,
7192 // which would be advantageous since most selectable are not selected.
7193 if (span_all_columns)
7194 {
7195 if (g.CurrentTable)
7196 TablePushBackgroundChannel();
7197 else if (window->DC.CurrentColumns)
7198 PushColumnsBackground();
7199 g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HasClipRect;
7200 g.LastItemData.ClipRect = window->ClipRect;
7201 }
7202
7203 // We use NoHoldingActiveID on menus so user can click and _hold_ on a menu then drag to browse child entries
7204 ImGuiButtonFlags button_flags = 0;
7205 if (flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_NoHoldingActiveID) { button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_NoHoldingActiveId; }
7206 if (flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_NoSetKeyOwner) { button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_NoSetKeyOwner; }
7207 if (flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_SelectOnClick) { button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClick; }
7208 if (flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_SelectOnRelease) { button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnRelease; }
7209 if (flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_AllowDoubleClick) { button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClickRelease | ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnDoubleClick; }
7210 if ((flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_AllowOverlap) || (g.LastItemData.ItemFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_AllowOverlap)) { button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_AllowOverlap; }
7211
7212 // Multi-selection support (header)
7213 const bool was_selected = selected;
7214 if (is_multi_select)
7215 {
7216 // Handle multi-select + alter button flags for it
7217 MultiSelectItemHeader(id, &selected, &button_flags);
7218 }
7219
7220 bool hovered, held;
7221 bool pressed = ButtonBehavior(bb, id, &hovered, &held, button_flags);
7222
7223 // Multi-selection support (footer)
7224 if (is_multi_select)
7225 {
7226 MultiSelectItemFooter(id, &selected, &pressed);
7227 }
7228 else
7229 {
7230 // Auto-select when moved into
7231 // - This will be more fully fleshed in the range-select branch
7232 // - This is not exposed as it won't nicely work with some user side handling of shift/control
7233 // - We cannot do 'if (g.NavJustMovedToId != id) { selected = false; pressed = was_selected; }' for two reasons
7234 // - (1) it would require focus scope to be set, need exposing PushFocusScope() or equivalent (e.g. BeginSelection() calling PushFocusScope())
7235 // - (2) usage will fail with clipped items
7236 // The multi-select API aim to fix those issues, e.g. may be replaced with a BeginSelection() API.
7237 if ((flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_SelectOnNav) && g.NavJustMovedToId != 0 && g.NavJustMovedToFocusScopeId == g.CurrentFocusScopeId)
7238 if (g.NavJustMovedToId == id)
7239 selected = pressed = true;
7240 }
7241
7242 // Update NavId when clicking or when Hovering (this doesn't happen on most widgets), so navigation can be resumed with keyboard/gamepad
7243 if (pressed || (hovered && (flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_SetNavIdOnHover)))
7244 {
7245 if (!g.NavHighlightItemUnderNav && g.NavWindow == window && g.NavLayer == window->DC.NavLayerCurrent)
7246 {
7247 SetNavID(id, window->DC.NavLayerCurrent, g.CurrentFocusScopeId, WindowRectAbsToRel(window, bb)); // (bb == NavRect)
7248 if (g.IO.ConfigNavCursorVisibleAuto)
7249 g.NavCursorVisible = false;
7250 }
7251 }
7252 if (pressed)
7253 MarkItemEdited(id);
7254
7255 if (selected != was_selected)
7256 g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_ToggledSelection;
7257
7258 // Render
7259 if (is_visible)
7260 {
7261 const bool highlighted = hovered || (flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_Highlight);
7262 if (highlighted || selected)
7263 {
7264 // Between 1.91.0 and 1.91.4 we made selected Selectable use an arbitrary lerp between _Header and _HeaderHovered. Removed that now. (#8106)
7265 ImU32 col = GetColorU32((held && highlighted) ? ImGuiCol_HeaderActive : highlighted ? ImGuiCol_HeaderHovered : ImGuiCol_Header);
7266 RenderFrame(bb.Min, bb.Max, col, false, 0.0f);
7267 }
7268 if (g.NavId == id)
7269 {
7270 ImGuiNavRenderCursorFlags nav_render_cursor_flags = ImGuiNavRenderCursorFlags_Compact | ImGuiNavRenderCursorFlags_NoRounding;
7271 if (is_multi_select)
7272 nav_render_cursor_flags |= ImGuiNavRenderCursorFlags_AlwaysDraw; // Always show the nav rectangle
7273 RenderNavCursor(bb, id, nav_render_cursor_flags);
7274 }
7275 }
7276
7277 if (span_all_columns)
7278 {
7279 if (g.CurrentTable)
7280 TablePopBackgroundChannel();
7281 else if (window->DC.CurrentColumns)
7282 PopColumnsBackground();
7283 }
7284
7285 // Text stays at the submission position. Alignment/clipping extents ignore SpanAllColumns.
7286 if (is_visible)
7287 RenderTextClipped(pos, ImVec2(ImMin(pos.x + size.x, window->WorkRect.Max.x), pos.y + size.y), label, NULL, &label_size, style.SelectableTextAlign, &bb);
7288
7289 // Automatically close popups
7290 if (pressed && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) && !(flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_NoAutoClosePopups) && (g.LastItemData.ItemFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_AutoClosePopups))
7291 CloseCurrentPopup();
7292
7293 if (disabled_item && !disabled_global)
7294 EndDisabled();
7295
7296 // Selectable() always returns a pressed state!
7297 // Users of BeginMultiSelect()/EndMultiSelect() scope: you may call ImGui::IsItemToggledSelection() to retrieve
7298 // selection toggle, only useful if you need that state updated (e.g. for rendering purpose) before reaching EndMultiSelect().
7299 IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_INFO(id, label, g.LastItemData.StatusFlags);
7300 return pressed; //-V1020
7301}
7302
7303bool ImGui::Selectable(const char* label, bool* p_selected, ImGuiSelectableFlags flags, const ImVec2& size_arg)
7304{
7305 if (Selectable(label, *p_selected, flags, size_arg))
7306 {
7307 *p_selected = !*p_selected;
7308 return true;
7309 }
7310 return false;
7311}
7312
7313
7314//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
7315// [SECTION] Widgets: Typing-Select support
7316//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
7317
7318// [Experimental] Currently not exposed in public API.
7319// Consume character inputs and return search request, if any.
7320// This would typically only be called on the focused window or location you want to grab inputs for, e.g.
7321// if (ImGui::IsWindowFocused(...))
7322// if (ImGuiTypingSelectRequest* req = ImGui::GetTypingSelectRequest())
7323// focus_idx = ImGui::TypingSelectFindMatch(req, my_items.size(), [](void*, int n) { return my_items[n]->Name; }, &my_items, -1);
7324// However the code is written in a way where calling it from multiple locations is safe (e.g. to obtain buffer).
7325ImGuiTypingSelectRequest* ImGui::GetTypingSelectRequest(ImGuiTypingSelectFlags flags)
7326{
7327 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7328 ImGuiTypingSelectState* data = &g.TypingSelectState;
7329 ImGuiTypingSelectRequest* out_request = &data->Request;
7330
7331 // Clear buffer
7332 const float TYPING_SELECT_RESET_TIMER = 1.80f; // FIXME: Potentially move to IO config.
7333 const int TYPING_SELECT_SINGLE_CHAR_COUNT_FOR_LOCK = 4; // Lock single char matching when repeating same char 4 times
7334 if (data->SearchBuffer[0] != 0)
7335 {
7336 bool clear_buffer = false;
7337 clear_buffer |= (g.NavFocusScopeId != data->FocusScope);
7338 clear_buffer |= (data->LastRequestTime + TYPING_SELECT_RESET_TIMER < g.Time);
7339 clear_buffer |= g.NavAnyRequest;
7340 clear_buffer |= g.ActiveId != 0 && g.NavActivateId == 0; // Allow temporary SPACE activation to not interfere
7341 clear_buffer |= IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Escape) || IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Enter);
7342 clear_buffer |= IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Backspace) && (flags & ImGuiTypingSelectFlags_AllowBackspace) == 0;
7343 //if (clear_buffer) { IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG("GetTypingSelectRequest(): Clear SearchBuffer.\n"); }
7344 if (clear_buffer)
7345 data->Clear();
7346 }
7347
7348 // Append to buffer
7349 const int buffer_max_len = IM_ARRAYSIZE(data->SearchBuffer) - 1;
7350 int buffer_len = (int)ImStrlen(data->SearchBuffer);
7351 bool select_request = false;
7352 for (ImWchar w : g.IO.InputQueueCharacters)
7353 {
7354 const int w_len = ImTextCountUtf8BytesFromStr(&w, &w + 1);
7355 if (w < 32 || (buffer_len == 0 && ImCharIsBlankW(w)) || (buffer_len + w_len > buffer_max_len)) // Ignore leading blanks
7356 continue;
7357 char w_buf[5];
7358 ImTextCharToUtf8(w_buf, (unsigned int)w);
7359 if (data->SingleCharModeLock && w_len == out_request->SingleCharSize && memcmp(w_buf, data->SearchBuffer, w_len) == 0)
7360 {
7361 select_request = true; // Same character: don't need to append to buffer.
7362 continue;
7363 }
7364 if (data->SingleCharModeLock)
7365 {
7366 data->Clear(); // Different character: clear
7367 buffer_len = 0;
7368 }
7369 memcpy(data->SearchBuffer + buffer_len, w_buf, w_len + 1); // Append
7370 buffer_len += w_len;
7371 select_request = true;
7372 }
7373 g.IO.InputQueueCharacters.resize(0);
7374
7375 // Handle backspace
7376 if ((flags & ImGuiTypingSelectFlags_AllowBackspace) && IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Backspace, ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat))
7377 {
7378 char* p = (char*)(void*)ImTextFindPreviousUtf8Codepoint(data->SearchBuffer, data->SearchBuffer + buffer_len);
7379 *p = 0;
7380 buffer_len = (int)(p - data->SearchBuffer);
7381 }
7382
7383 // Return request if any
7384 if (buffer_len == 0)
7385 return NULL;
7386 if (select_request)
7387 {
7388 data->FocusScope = g.NavFocusScopeId;
7389 data->LastRequestFrame = g.FrameCount;
7390 data->LastRequestTime = (float)g.Time;
7391 }
7392 out_request->Flags = flags;
7393 out_request->SearchBufferLen = buffer_len;
7394 out_request->SearchBuffer = data->SearchBuffer;
7395 out_request->SelectRequest = (data->LastRequestFrame == g.FrameCount);
7396 out_request->SingleCharMode = false;
7397 out_request->SingleCharSize = 0;
7398
7399 // Calculate if buffer contains the same character repeated.
7400 // - This can be used to implement a special search mode on first character.
7401 // - Performed on UTF-8 codepoint for correctness.
7402 // - SingleCharMode is always set for first input character, because it usually leads to a "next".
7403 if (flags & ImGuiTypingSelectFlags_AllowSingleCharMode)
7404 {
7405 const char* buf_begin = out_request->SearchBuffer;
7406 const char* buf_end = out_request->SearchBuffer + out_request->SearchBufferLen;
7407 const int c0_len = ImTextCountUtf8BytesFromChar(buf_begin, buf_end);
7408 const char* p = buf_begin + c0_len;
7409 for (; p < buf_end; p += c0_len)
7410 if (memcmp(buf_begin, p, (size_t)c0_len) != 0)
7411 break;
7412 const int single_char_count = (p == buf_end) ? (out_request->SearchBufferLen / c0_len) : 0;
7413 out_request->SingleCharMode = (single_char_count > 0 || data->SingleCharModeLock);
7414 out_request->SingleCharSize = (ImS8)c0_len;
7415 data->SingleCharModeLock |= (single_char_count >= TYPING_SELECT_SINGLE_CHAR_COUNT_FOR_LOCK); // From now on we stop search matching to lock to single char mode.
7416 }
7417
7418 return out_request;
7419}
7420
7421static int ImStrimatchlen(const char* s1, const char* s1_end, const char* s2)
7422{
7423 int match_len = 0;
7424 while (s1 < s1_end && ImToUpper(*s1++) == ImToUpper(*s2++))
7425 match_len++;
7426 return match_len;
7427}
7428
7429// Default handler for finding a result for typing-select. You may implement your own.
7430// You might want to display a tooltip to visualize the current request SearchBuffer
7431// When SingleCharMode is set:
7432// - it is better to NOT display a tooltip of other on-screen display indicator.
7433// - the index of the currently focused item is required.
7434// if your SetNextItemSelectionUserData() values are indices, you can obtain it from ImGuiMultiSelectIO::NavIdItem, otherwise from g.NavLastValidSelectionUserData.
7435int ImGui::TypingSelectFindMatch(ImGuiTypingSelectRequest* req, int items_count, const char* (*get_item_name_func)(void*, int), void* user_data, int nav_item_idx)
7436{
7437 if (req == NULL || req->SelectRequest == false) // Support NULL parameter so both calls can be done from same spot.
7438 return -1;
7439 int idx = -1;
7440 if (req->SingleCharMode && (req->Flags & ImGuiTypingSelectFlags_AllowSingleCharMode))
7441 idx = TypingSelectFindNextSingleCharMatch(req, items_count, get_item_name_func, user_data, nav_item_idx);
7442 else
7443 idx = TypingSelectFindBestLeadingMatch(req, items_count, get_item_name_func, user_data);
7444 if (idx != -1)
7445 SetNavCursorVisibleAfterMove();
7446 return idx;
7447}
7448
7449// Special handling when a single character is repeated: perform search on a single letter and goes to next.
7450int ImGui::TypingSelectFindNextSingleCharMatch(ImGuiTypingSelectRequest* req, int items_count, const char* (*get_item_name_func)(void*, int), void* user_data, int nav_item_idx)
7451{
7452 // FIXME: Assume selection user data is index. Would be extremely practical.
7453 //if (nav_item_idx == -1)
7454 // nav_item_idx = (int)g.NavLastValidSelectionUserData;
7455
7456 int first_match_idx = -1;
7457 bool return_next_match = false;
7458 for (int idx = 0; idx < items_count; idx++)
7459 {
7460 const char* item_name = get_item_name_func(user_data, idx);
7461 if (ImStrimatchlen(req->SearchBuffer, req->SearchBuffer + req->SingleCharSize, item_name) < req->SingleCharSize)
7462 continue;
7463 if (return_next_match) // Return next matching item after current item.
7464 return idx;
7465 if (first_match_idx == -1 && nav_item_idx == -1) // Return first match immediately if we don't have a nav_item_idx value.
7466 return idx;
7467 if (first_match_idx == -1) // Record first match for wrapping.
7468 first_match_idx = idx;
7469 if (nav_item_idx == idx) // Record that we encountering nav_item so we can return next match.
7470 return_next_match = true;
7471 }
7472 return first_match_idx; // First result
7473}
7474
7475int ImGui::TypingSelectFindBestLeadingMatch(ImGuiTypingSelectRequest* req, int items_count, const char* (*get_item_name_func)(void*, int), void* user_data)
7476{
7477 int longest_match_idx = -1;
7478 int longest_match_len = 0;
7479 for (int idx = 0; idx < items_count; idx++)
7480 {
7481 const char* item_name = get_item_name_func(user_data, idx);
7482 const int match_len = ImStrimatchlen(req->SearchBuffer, req->SearchBuffer + req->SearchBufferLen, item_name);
7483 if (match_len <= longest_match_len)
7484 continue;
7485 longest_match_idx = idx;
7486 longest_match_len = match_len;
7487 if (match_len == req->SearchBufferLen)
7488 break;
7489 }
7490 return longest_match_idx;
7491}
7492
7493void ImGui::DebugNodeTypingSelectState(ImGuiTypingSelectState* data)
7494{
7495#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_DEBUG_TOOLS
7496 Text("SearchBuffer = \"%s\"", data->SearchBuffer);
7497 Text("SingleCharMode = %d, Size = %d, Lock = %d", data->Request.SingleCharMode, data->Request.SingleCharSize, data->SingleCharModeLock);
7498 Text("LastRequest = time: %.2f, frame: %d", data->LastRequestTime, data->LastRequestFrame);
7499#else
7500 IM_UNUSED(data);
7501#endif
7502}
7503
7504//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
7505// [SECTION] Widgets: Box-Select support
7506// This has been extracted away from Multi-Select logic in the hope that it could eventually be used elsewhere, but hasn't been yet.
7507//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
7508// Extra logic in MultiSelectItemFooter() and ImGuiListClipper::Step()
7509//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
7510// - BoxSelectPreStartDrag() [Internal]
7511// - BoxSelectActivateDrag() [Internal]
7512// - BoxSelectDeactivateDrag() [Internal]
7513// - BoxSelectScrollWithMouseDrag() [Internal]
7514// - BeginBoxSelect() [Internal]
7515// - EndBoxSelect() [Internal]
7516//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
7517
7518// Call on the initial click.
7519static void BoxSelectPreStartDrag(ImGuiID id, ImGuiSelectionUserData clicked_item)
7520{
7521 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7522 ImGuiBoxSelectState* bs = &g.BoxSelectState;
7523 bs->ID = id;
7524 bs->IsStarting = true; // Consider starting box-select.
7525 bs->IsStartedFromVoid = (clicked_item == ImGuiSelectionUserData_Invalid);
7526 bs->IsStartedSetNavIdOnce = bs->IsStartedFromVoid;
7527 bs->KeyMods = g.IO.KeyMods;
7528 bs->StartPosRel = bs->EndPosRel = ImGui::WindowPosAbsToRel(g.CurrentWindow, g.IO.MousePos);
7529 bs->ScrollAccum = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
7530}
7531
7532static void BoxSelectActivateDrag(ImGuiBoxSelectState* bs, ImGuiWindow* window)
7533{
7534 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7535 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_SELECTION("[selection] BeginBoxSelect() 0X%08X: Activate\n", bs->ID);
7536 bs->IsActive = true;
7537 bs->Window = window;
7538 bs->IsStarting = false;
7539 ImGui::SetActiveID(bs->ID, window);
7540 ImGui::SetActiveIdUsingAllKeyboardKeys();
7541 if (bs->IsStartedFromVoid && (bs->KeyMods & (ImGuiMod_Ctrl | ImGuiMod_Shift)) == 0)
7542 bs->RequestClear = true;
7543}
7544
7545static void BoxSelectDeactivateDrag(ImGuiBoxSelectState* bs)
7546{
7547 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7548 bs->IsActive = bs->IsStarting = false;
7549 if (g.ActiveId == bs->ID)
7550 {
7551 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_SELECTION("[selection] BeginBoxSelect() 0X%08X: Deactivate\n", bs->ID);
7552 ImGui::ClearActiveID();
7553 }
7554 bs->ID = 0;
7555}
7556
7557static void BoxSelectScrollWithMouseDrag(ImGuiBoxSelectState* bs, ImGuiWindow* window, const ImRect& inner_r)
7558{
7559 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7560 IM_ASSERT(bs->Window == window);
7561 for (int n = 0; n < 2; n++) // each axis
7562 {
7563 const float mouse_pos = g.IO.MousePos[n];
7564 const float dist = (mouse_pos > inner_r.Max[n]) ? mouse_pos - inner_r.Max[n] : (mouse_pos < inner_r.Min[n]) ? mouse_pos - inner_r.Min[n] : 0.0f;
7565 const float scroll_curr = window->Scroll[n];
7566 if (dist == 0.0f || (dist < 0.0f && scroll_curr < 0.0f) || (dist > 0.0f && scroll_curr >= window->ScrollMax[n]))
7567 continue;
7568
7569 const float speed_multiplier = ImLinearRemapClamp(g.FontSize, g.FontSize * 5.0f, 1.0f, 4.0f, ImAbs(dist)); // x1 to x4 depending on distance
7570 const float scroll_step = g.FontSize * 35.0f * speed_multiplier * ImSign(dist) * g.IO.DeltaTime;
7571 bs->ScrollAccum[n] += scroll_step;
7572
7573 // Accumulate into a stored value so we can handle high-framerate
7574 const float scroll_step_i = ImFloor(bs->ScrollAccum[n]);
7575 if (scroll_step_i == 0.0f)
7576 continue;
7577 if (n == 0)
7578 ImGui::SetScrollX(window, scroll_curr + scroll_step_i);
7579 else
7580 ImGui::SetScrollY(window, scroll_curr + scroll_step_i);
7581 bs->ScrollAccum[n] -= scroll_step_i;
7582 }
7583}
7584
7585bool ImGui::BeginBoxSelect(const ImRect& scope_rect, ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiID box_select_id, ImGuiMultiSelectFlags ms_flags)
7586{
7587 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7588 ImGuiBoxSelectState* bs = &g.BoxSelectState;
7589 KeepAliveID(box_select_id);
7590 if (bs->ID != box_select_id)
7591 return false;
7592
7593 // IsStarting is set by MultiSelectItemFooter() when considering a possible box-select. We validate it here and lock geometry.
7594 bs->UnclipMode = false;
7595 bs->RequestClear = false;
7596 if (bs->IsStarting && IsMouseDragPastThreshold(0))
7597 BoxSelectActivateDrag(bs, window);
7598 else if ((bs->IsStarting || bs->IsActive) && g.IO.MouseDown[0] == false)
7599 BoxSelectDeactivateDrag(bs);
7600 if (!bs->IsActive)
7601 return false;
7602
7603 // Current frame absolute prev/current rectangles are used to toggle selection.
7604 // They are derived from positions relative to scrolling space.
7605 ImVec2 start_pos_abs = WindowPosRelToAbs(window, bs->StartPosRel);
7606 ImVec2 prev_end_pos_abs = WindowPosRelToAbs(window, bs->EndPosRel); // Clamped already
7607 ImVec2 curr_end_pos_abs = g.IO.MousePos;
7608 if (ms_flags & ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ScopeWindow) // Box-select scrolling only happens with ScopeWindow
7609 curr_end_pos_abs = ImClamp(curr_end_pos_abs, scope_rect.Min, scope_rect.Max);
7610 bs->BoxSelectRectPrev.Min = ImMin(start_pos_abs, prev_end_pos_abs);
7611 bs->BoxSelectRectPrev.Max = ImMax(start_pos_abs, prev_end_pos_abs);
7612 bs->BoxSelectRectCurr.Min = ImMin(start_pos_abs, curr_end_pos_abs);
7613 bs->BoxSelectRectCurr.Max = ImMax(start_pos_abs, curr_end_pos_abs);
7614
7615 // Box-select 2D mode detects horizontal changes (vertical ones are already picked by Clipper)
7616 // Storing an extra rect used by widgets supporting box-select.
7617 if (ms_flags & ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_BoxSelect2d)
7618 if (bs->BoxSelectRectPrev.Min.x != bs->BoxSelectRectCurr.Min.x || bs->BoxSelectRectPrev.Max.x != bs->BoxSelectRectCurr.Max.x)
7619 {
7620 bs->UnclipMode = true;
7621 bs->UnclipRect = bs->BoxSelectRectPrev; // FIXME-OPT: UnclipRect x coordinates could be intersection of Prev and Curr rect on X axis.
7622 bs->UnclipRect.Add(bs->BoxSelectRectCurr);
7623 }
7624
7625 //GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(bs->UnclipRect.Min, bs->UnclipRect.Max, IM_COL32(255,0,0,200), 0.0f, 0, 3.0f);
7626 //GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(bs->BoxSelectRectPrev.Min, bs->BoxSelectRectPrev.Max, IM_COL32(255,0,0,200), 0.0f, 0, 3.0f);
7627 //GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(bs->BoxSelectRectCurr.Min, bs->BoxSelectRectCurr.Max, IM_COL32(0,255,0,200), 0.0f, 0, 1.0f);
7628 return true;
7629}
7630
7631void ImGui::EndBoxSelect(const ImRect& scope_rect, ImGuiMultiSelectFlags ms_flags)
7632{
7633 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7634 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7635 ImGuiBoxSelectState* bs = &g.BoxSelectState;
7636 IM_ASSERT(bs->IsActive);
7637 bs->UnclipMode = false;
7638
7639 // Render selection rectangle
7640 bs->EndPosRel = WindowPosAbsToRel(window, ImClamp(g.IO.MousePos, scope_rect.Min, scope_rect.Max)); // Clamp stored position according to current scrolling view
7641 ImRect box_select_r = bs->BoxSelectRectCurr;
7642 box_select_r.ClipWith(scope_rect);
7643 window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(box_select_r.Min, box_select_r.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_SeparatorHovered, 0.30f)); // FIXME-MULTISELECT: Styling
7644 window->DrawList->AddRect(box_select_r.Min, box_select_r.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_NavCursor)); // FIXME-MULTISELECT FIXME-DPI: Styling
7645
7646 // Scroll
7647 const bool enable_scroll = (ms_flags & ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ScopeWindow) && (ms_flags & ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_BoxSelectNoScroll) == 0;
7648 if (enable_scroll)
7649 {
7650 ImRect scroll_r = scope_rect;
7651 scroll_r.Expand(-g.FontSize);
7652 //GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(scroll_r.Min, scroll_r.Max, IM_COL32(0, 255, 0, 255));
7653 if (!scroll_r.Contains(g.IO.MousePos))
7654 BoxSelectScrollWithMouseDrag(bs, window, scroll_r);
7655 }
7656}
7657
7658//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
7659// [SECTION] Widgets: Multi-Select support
7660//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
7661// - DebugLogMultiSelectRequests() [Internal]
7662// - CalcScopeRect() [Internal]
7663// - BeginMultiSelect()
7664// - EndMultiSelect()
7665// - SetNextItemSelectionUserData()
7666// - MultiSelectItemHeader() [Internal]
7667// - MultiSelectItemFooter() [Internal]
7668// - DebugNodeMultiSelectState() [Internal]
7669//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
7670
7671static void DebugLogMultiSelectRequests(const char* function, const ImGuiMultiSelectIO* io)
7672{
7673 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7674 IM_UNUSED(function);
7675 for (const ImGuiSelectionRequest& req : io->Requests)
7676 {
7677 if (req.Type == ImGuiSelectionRequestType_SetAll) IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_SELECTION("[selection] %s: Request: SetAll %d (= %s)\n", function, req.Selected, req.Selected ? "SelectAll" : "Clear");
7678 if (req.Type == ImGuiSelectionRequestType_SetRange) IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_SELECTION("[selection] %s: Request: SetRange %" IM_PRId64 "..%" IM_PRId64 " (0x%" IM_PRIX64 "..0x%" IM_PRIX64 ") = %d (dir %d)\n", function, req.RangeFirstItem, req.RangeLastItem, req.RangeFirstItem, req.RangeLastItem, req.Selected, req.RangeDirection);
7679 }
7680}
7681
7682static ImRect CalcScopeRect(ImGuiMultiSelectTempData* ms, ImGuiWindow* window)
7683{
7684 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7685 if (ms->Flags & ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ScopeRect)
7686 {
7687 // Warning: this depends on CursorMaxPos so it means to be called by EndMultiSelect() only
7688 return ImRect(ms->ScopeRectMin, ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos, ms->ScopeRectMin));
7689 }
7690 else
7691 {
7692 // When a table, pull HostClipRect, which allows us to predict ClipRect before first row/layout is performed. (#7970)
7693 ImRect scope_rect = window->InnerClipRect;
7694 if (g.CurrentTable != NULL)
7695 scope_rect = g.CurrentTable->HostClipRect;
7696
7697 // Add inner table decoration (#7821) // FIXME: Why not baking in InnerClipRect?
7698 scope_rect.Min = ImMin(scope_rect.Min + ImVec2(window->DecoInnerSizeX1, window->DecoInnerSizeY1), scope_rect.Max);
7699 return scope_rect;
7700 }
7701}
7702
7703// Return ImGuiMultiSelectIO structure.
7704// Lifetime: don't hold on ImGuiMultiSelectIO* pointers over multiple frames or past any subsequent call to BeginMultiSelect() or EndMultiSelect().
7705// Passing 'selection_size' and 'items_count' parameters is currently optional.
7706// - 'selection_size' is useful to disable some shortcut routing: e.g. ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ClearOnEscape won't claim Escape key when selection_size 0,
7707// allowing a first press to clear selection THEN the second press to leave child window and return to parent.
7708// - 'items_count' is stored in ImGuiMultiSelectIO which makes it a convenient way to pass the information to your ApplyRequest() handler (but you may pass it differently).
7709// - If they are costly for you to compute (e.g. external intrusive selection without maintaining size), you may avoid them and pass -1.
7710// - If you can easily tell if your selection is empty or not, you may pass 0/1, or you may enable ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ClearOnEscape flag dynamically.
7711ImGuiMultiSelectIO* ImGui::BeginMultiSelect(ImGuiMultiSelectFlags flags, int selection_size, int items_count)
7712{
7713 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7714 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7715
7716 if (++g.MultiSelectTempDataStacked > g.MultiSelectTempData.Size)
7717 g.MultiSelectTempData.resize(g.MultiSelectTempDataStacked, ImGuiMultiSelectTempData());
7718 ImGuiMultiSelectTempData* ms = &g.MultiSelectTempData[g.MultiSelectTempDataStacked - 1];
7719 IM_STATIC_ASSERT(offsetof(ImGuiMultiSelectTempData, IO) == 0); // Clear() relies on that.
7720 g.CurrentMultiSelect = ms;
7721 if ((flags & (ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ScopeWindow | ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ScopeRect)) == 0)
7722 flags |= ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ScopeWindow;
7723 if (flags & ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_SingleSelect)
7724 flags &= ~(ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_BoxSelect2d | ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_BoxSelect1d);
7725 if (flags & ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_BoxSelect2d)
7726 flags &= ~ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_BoxSelect1d;
7727
7728 // FIXME: Workaround to the fact we override CursorMaxPos, meaning size measurement are lost. (#8250)
7729 // They should perhaps be stacked properly?
7730 if (ImGuiTable* table = g.CurrentTable)
7731 if (table->CurrentColumn != -1)
7732 TableEndCell(table); // This is currently safe to call multiple time. If that properly is lost we can extract the "save measurement" part of it.
7733
7734 // FIXME: BeginFocusScope()
7735 const ImGuiID id = window->IDStack.back();
7736 ms->Clear();
7737 ms->FocusScopeId = id;
7738 ms->Flags = flags;
7739 ms->IsFocused = (ms->FocusScopeId == g.NavFocusScopeId);
7740 ms->BackupCursorMaxPos = window->DC.CursorMaxPos;
7741 ms->ScopeRectMin = window->DC.CursorMaxPos = window->DC.CursorPos;
7742 PushFocusScope(ms->FocusScopeId);
7743 if (flags & ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ScopeWindow) // Mark parent child window as navigable into, with highlight. Assume user will always submit interactive items.
7744 window->DC.NavLayersActiveMask |= 1 << ImGuiNavLayer_Main;
7745
7746 // Use copy of keyboard mods at the time of the request, otherwise we would requires mods to be held for an extra frame.
7747 ms->KeyMods = g.NavJustMovedToId ? (g.NavJustMovedToIsTabbing ? 0 : g.NavJustMovedToKeyMods) : g.IO.KeyMods;
7748 if (flags & ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoRangeSelect)
7749 ms->KeyMods &= ~ImGuiMod_Shift;
7750
7751 // Bind storage
7752 ImGuiMultiSelectState* storage = g.MultiSelectStorage.GetOrAddByKey(id);
7753 storage->ID = id;
7754 storage->LastFrameActive = g.FrameCount;
7755 storage->LastSelectionSize = selection_size;
7756 storage->Window = window;
7757 ms->Storage = storage;
7758
7759 // Output to user
7760 ms->IO.Requests.resize(0);
7761 ms->IO.RangeSrcItem = storage->RangeSrcItem;
7762 ms->IO.NavIdItem = storage->NavIdItem;
7763 ms->IO.NavIdSelected = (storage->NavIdSelected == 1) ? true : false;
7764 ms->IO.ItemsCount = items_count;
7765
7766 // Clear when using Navigation to move within the scope
7767 // (we compare FocusScopeId so it possible to use multiple selections inside a same window)
7768 bool request_clear = false;
7769 bool request_select_all = false;
7770 if (g.NavJustMovedToId != 0 && g.NavJustMovedToFocusScopeId == ms->FocusScopeId && g.NavJustMovedToHasSelectionData)
7771 {
7772 if (ms->KeyMods & ImGuiMod_Shift)
7773 ms->IsKeyboardSetRange = true;
7774 if (ms->IsKeyboardSetRange)
7775 IM_ASSERT(storage->RangeSrcItem != ImGuiSelectionUserData_Invalid); // Not ready -> could clear?
7776 if ((ms->KeyMods & (ImGuiMod_Ctrl | ImGuiMod_Shift)) == 0 && (flags & (ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoAutoClear | ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoAutoSelect)) == 0)
7777 request_clear = true;
7778 }
7779 else if (g.NavJustMovedFromFocusScopeId == ms->FocusScopeId)
7780 {
7781 // Also clear on leaving scope (may be optional?)
7782 if ((ms->KeyMods & (ImGuiMod_Ctrl | ImGuiMod_Shift)) == 0 && (flags & (ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoAutoClear | ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoAutoSelect)) == 0)
7783 request_clear = true;
7784 }
7785
7786 // Box-select handling: update active state.
7787 ImGuiBoxSelectState* bs = &g.BoxSelectState;
7788 if (flags & (ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_BoxSelect1d | ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_BoxSelect2d))
7789 {
7790 ms->BoxSelectId = GetID("##BoxSelect");
7791 if (BeginBoxSelect(CalcScopeRect(ms, window), window, ms->BoxSelectId, flags))
7792 request_clear |= bs->RequestClear;
7793 }
7794
7795 if (ms->IsFocused)
7796 {
7797 // Shortcut: Clear selection (Escape)
7798 // - Only claim shortcut if selection is not empty, allowing further presses on Escape to e.g. leave current child window.
7799 // - Box select also handle Escape and needs to pass an id to bypass ActiveIdUsingAllKeyboardKeys lock.
7800 if (flags & ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ClearOnEscape)
7801 {
7802 if (selection_size != 0 || bs->IsActive)
7803 if (Shortcut(ImGuiKey_Escape, ImGuiInputFlags_None, bs->IsActive ? bs->ID : 0))
7804 {
7805 request_clear = true;
7806 if (bs->IsActive)
7807 BoxSelectDeactivateDrag(bs);
7808 }
7809 }
7810
7811 // Shortcut: Select all (CTRL+A)
7812 if (!(flags & ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_SingleSelect) && !(flags & ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoSelectAll))
7813 if (Shortcut(ImGuiMod_Ctrl | ImGuiKey_A))
7814 request_select_all = true;
7815 }
7816
7817 if (request_clear || request_select_all)
7818 {
7819 MultiSelectAddSetAll(ms, request_select_all);
7820 if (!request_select_all)
7821 storage->LastSelectionSize = 0;
7822 }
7823 ms->LoopRequestSetAll = request_select_all ? 1 : request_clear ? 0 : -1;
7824 ms->LastSubmittedItem = ImGuiSelectionUserData_Invalid;
7825
7826 if (g.DebugLogFlags & ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventSelection)
7827 DebugLogMultiSelectRequests("BeginMultiSelect", &ms->IO);
7828
7829 return &ms->IO;
7830}
7831
7832// Return updated ImGuiMultiSelectIO structure.
7833// Lifetime: don't hold on ImGuiMultiSelectIO* pointers over multiple frames or past any subsequent call to BeginMultiSelect() or EndMultiSelect().
7834ImGuiMultiSelectIO* ImGui::EndMultiSelect()
7835{
7836 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7837 ImGuiMultiSelectTempData* ms = g.CurrentMultiSelect;
7838 ImGuiMultiSelectState* storage = ms->Storage;
7839 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7840 IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(ms->FocusScopeId == g.CurrentFocusScopeId, "EndMultiSelect() FocusScope mismatch!");
7841 IM_ASSERT(g.CurrentMultiSelect != NULL && storage->Window == g.CurrentWindow);
7842 IM_ASSERT(g.MultiSelectTempDataStacked > 0 && &g.MultiSelectTempData[g.MultiSelectTempDataStacked - 1] == g.CurrentMultiSelect);
7843
7844 ImRect scope_rect = CalcScopeRect(ms, window);
7845 if (ms->IsFocused)
7846 {
7847 // We currently don't allow user code to modify RangeSrcItem by writing to BeginIO's version, but that would be an easy change here.
7848 if (ms->IO.RangeSrcReset || (ms->RangeSrcPassedBy == false && ms->IO.RangeSrcItem != ImGuiSelectionUserData_Invalid)) // Can't read storage->RangeSrcItem here -> we want the state at beginning of the scope (see tests for easy failure)
7849 {
7850 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_SELECTION("[selection] EndMultiSelect: Reset RangeSrcItem.\n"); // Will set be to NavId.
7851 storage->RangeSrcItem = ImGuiSelectionUserData_Invalid;
7852 }
7853 if (ms->NavIdPassedBy == false && storage->NavIdItem != ImGuiSelectionUserData_Invalid)
7854 {
7855 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_SELECTION("[selection] EndMultiSelect: Reset NavIdItem.\n");
7856 storage->NavIdItem = ImGuiSelectionUserData_Invalid;
7857 storage->NavIdSelected = -1;
7858 }
7859
7860 if ((ms->Flags & (ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_BoxSelect1d | ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_BoxSelect2d)) && GetBoxSelectState(ms->BoxSelectId))
7861 EndBoxSelect(scope_rect, ms->Flags);
7862 }
7863
7864 if (ms->IsEndIO == false)
7865 ms->IO.Requests.resize(0);
7866
7867 // Clear selection when clicking void?
7868 // We specifically test for IsMouseDragPastThreshold(0) == false to allow box-selection!
7869 // The InnerRect test is necessary for non-child/decorated windows.
7870 bool scope_hovered = IsWindowHovered() && window->InnerRect.Contains(g.IO.MousePos);
7871 if (scope_hovered && (ms->Flags & ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ScopeRect))
7872 scope_hovered &= scope_rect.Contains(g.IO.MousePos);
7873 if (scope_hovered && g.HoveredId == 0 && g.ActiveId == 0)
7874 {
7875 if (ms->Flags & (ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_BoxSelect1d | ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_BoxSelect2d))
7876 {
7877 if (!g.BoxSelectState.IsActive && !g.BoxSelectState.IsStarting && g.IO.MouseClickedCount[0] == 1)
7878 {
7879 BoxSelectPreStartDrag(ms->BoxSelectId, ImGuiSelectionUserData_Invalid);
7880 FocusWindow(window, ImGuiFocusRequestFlags_UnlessBelowModal);
7881 SetHoveredID(ms->BoxSelectId);
7882 if (ms->Flags & ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ScopeRect)
7883 SetNavID(0, ImGuiNavLayer_Main, ms->FocusScopeId, ImRect(g.IO.MousePos, g.IO.MousePos)); // Automatically switch FocusScope for initial click from void to box-select.
7884 }
7885 }
7886
7887 if (ms->Flags & ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ClearOnClickVoid)
7888 if (IsMouseReleased(0) && IsMouseDragPastThreshold(0) == false && g.IO.KeyMods == ImGuiMod_None)
7889 MultiSelectAddSetAll(ms, false);
7890 }
7891
7892 // Courtesy nav wrapping helper flag
7893 if (ms->Flags & ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NavWrapX)
7894 {
7895 IM_ASSERT(ms->Flags & ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ScopeWindow); // Only supported at window scope
7896 ImGui::NavMoveRequestTryWrapping(ImGui::GetCurrentWindow(), ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapX);
7897 }
7898
7899 // Unwind
7900 window->DC.CursorMaxPos = ImMax(ms->BackupCursorMaxPos, window->DC.CursorMaxPos);
7901 PopFocusScope();
7902
7903 if (g.DebugLogFlags & ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventSelection)
7904 DebugLogMultiSelectRequests("EndMultiSelect", &ms->IO);
7905
7906 ms->FocusScopeId = 0;
7907 ms->Flags = ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_None;
7908 g.CurrentMultiSelect = (--g.MultiSelectTempDataStacked > 0) ? &g.MultiSelectTempData[g.MultiSelectTempDataStacked - 1] : NULL;
7909
7910 return &ms->IO;
7911}
7912
7913void ImGui::SetNextItemSelectionUserData(ImGuiSelectionUserData selection_user_data)
7914{
7915 // Note that flags will be cleared by ItemAdd(), so it's only useful for Navigation code!
7916 // This designed so widgets can also cheaply set this before calling ItemAdd(), so we are not tied to MultiSelect api.
7917 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7918 g.NextItemData.SelectionUserData = selection_user_data;
7919 g.NextItemData.FocusScopeId = g.CurrentFocusScopeId;
7920
7921 if (ImGuiMultiSelectTempData* ms = g.CurrentMultiSelect)
7922 {
7923 // Auto updating RangeSrcPassedBy for cases were clipper is not used (done before ItemAdd() clipping)
7924 g.NextItemData.ItemFlags |= ImGuiItemFlags_HasSelectionUserData | ImGuiItemFlags_IsMultiSelect;
7925 if (ms->IO.RangeSrcItem == selection_user_data)
7926 ms->RangeSrcPassedBy = true;
7927 }
7928 else
7929 {
7930 g.NextItemData.ItemFlags |= ImGuiItemFlags_HasSelectionUserData;
7931 }
7932}
7933
7934// In charge of:
7935// - Applying SetAll for submitted items.
7936// - Applying SetRange for submitted items and record end points.
7937// - Altering button behavior flags to facilitate use with drag and drop.
7938void ImGui::MultiSelectItemHeader(ImGuiID id, bool* p_selected, ImGuiButtonFlags* p_button_flags)
7939{
7940 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7941 ImGuiMultiSelectTempData* ms = g.CurrentMultiSelect;
7942
7943 bool selected = *p_selected;
7944 if (ms->IsFocused)
7945 {
7946 ImGuiMultiSelectState* storage = ms->Storage;
7947 ImGuiSelectionUserData item_data = g.NextItemData.SelectionUserData;
7948 IM_ASSERT(g.NextItemData.FocusScopeId == g.CurrentFocusScopeId && "Forgot to call SetNextItemSelectionUserData() prior to item, required in BeginMultiSelect()/EndMultiSelect() scope");
7949
7950 // Apply SetAll (Clear/SelectAll) requests requested by BeginMultiSelect().
7951 // This is only useful if the user hasn't processed them already, and this only works if the user isn't using the clipper.
7952 // If you are using a clipper you need to process the SetAll request after calling BeginMultiSelect()
7953 if (ms->LoopRequestSetAll != -1)
7954 selected = (ms->LoopRequestSetAll == 1);
7955
7956 // When using SHIFT+Nav: because it can incur scrolling we cannot afford a frame of lag with the selection highlight (otherwise scrolling would happen before selection)
7957 // For this to work, we need someone to set 'RangeSrcPassedBy = true' at some point (either clipper either SetNextItemSelectionUserData() function)
7958 if (ms->IsKeyboardSetRange)
7959 {
7960 IM_ASSERT(id != 0 && (ms->KeyMods & ImGuiMod_Shift) != 0);
7961 const bool is_range_dst = (ms->RangeDstPassedBy == false) && g.NavJustMovedToId == id; // Assume that g.NavJustMovedToId is not clipped.
7962 if (is_range_dst)
7963 ms->RangeDstPassedBy = true;
7964 if (is_range_dst && storage->RangeSrcItem == ImGuiSelectionUserData_Invalid) // If we don't have RangeSrc, assign RangeSrc = RangeDst
7965 {
7966 storage->RangeSrcItem = item_data;
7967 storage->RangeSelected = selected ? 1 : 0;
7968 }
7969 const bool is_range_src = storage->RangeSrcItem == item_data;
7970 if (is_range_src || is_range_dst || ms->RangeSrcPassedBy != ms->RangeDstPassedBy)
7971 {
7972 // Apply range-select value to visible items
7973 IM_ASSERT(storage->RangeSrcItem != ImGuiSelectionUserData_Invalid && storage->RangeSelected != -1);
7974 selected = (storage->RangeSelected != 0);
7975 }
7976 else if ((ms->KeyMods & ImGuiMod_Ctrl) == 0 && (ms->Flags & ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoAutoClear) == 0)
7977 {
7978 // Clear other items
7979 selected = false;
7980 }
7981 }
7982 *p_selected = selected;
7983 }
7984
7985 // Alter button behavior flags
7986 // To handle drag and drop of multiple items we need to avoid clearing selection on click.
7987 // Enabling this test makes actions using CTRL+SHIFT delay their effect on MouseUp which is annoying, but it allows drag and drop of multiple items.
7988 if (p_button_flags != NULL)
7989 {
7990 ImGuiButtonFlags button_flags = *p_button_flags;
7991 button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_NoHoveredOnFocus;
7992 if ((!selected || (g.ActiveId == id && g.ActiveIdHasBeenPressedBefore)) && !(ms->Flags & ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_SelectOnClickRelease))
7993 button_flags = (button_flags | ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClick) & ~ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClickRelease;
7994 else
7995 button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClickRelease;
7996 *p_button_flags = button_flags;
7997 }
7998}
7999
8000// In charge of:
8001// - Auto-select on navigation.
8002// - Box-select toggle handling.
8003// - Right-click handling.
8004// - Altering selection based on Ctrl/Shift modifiers, both for keyboard and mouse.
8005// - Record current selection state for RangeSrc
8006// This is all rather complex, best to run and refer to "widgets_multiselect_xxx" tests in imgui_test_suite.
8007void ImGui::MultiSelectItemFooter(ImGuiID id, bool* p_selected, bool* p_pressed)
8008{
8009 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8010 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
8011
8012 bool selected = *p_selected;
8013 bool pressed = *p_pressed;
8014 ImGuiMultiSelectTempData* ms = g.CurrentMultiSelect;
8015 ImGuiMultiSelectState* storage = ms->Storage;
8016 if (pressed)
8017 ms->IsFocused = true;
8018
8019 bool hovered = false;
8020 if (g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredRect)
8021 hovered = IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup);
8022 if (!ms->IsFocused && !hovered)
8023 return;
8024
8025 ImGuiSelectionUserData item_data = g.NextItemData.SelectionUserData;
8026
8027 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags flags = ms->Flags;
8028 const bool is_singleselect = (flags & ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_SingleSelect) != 0;
8029 bool is_ctrl = (ms->KeyMods & ImGuiMod_Ctrl) != 0;
8030 bool is_shift = (ms->KeyMods & ImGuiMod_Shift) != 0;
8031
8032 bool apply_to_range_src = false;
8033
8034 if (g.NavId == id && storage->RangeSrcItem == ImGuiSelectionUserData_Invalid)
8035 apply_to_range_src = true;
8036 if (ms->IsEndIO == false)
8037 {
8038 ms->IO.Requests.resize(0);
8039 ms->IsEndIO = true;
8040 }
8041
8042 // Auto-select as you navigate a list
8043 if (g.NavJustMovedToId == id)
8044 {
8045 if ((flags & ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoAutoSelect) == 0)
8046 {
8047 if (is_ctrl && is_shift)
8048 pressed = true;
8049 else if (!is_ctrl)
8050 selected = pressed = true;
8051 }
8052 else
8053 {
8054 // With NoAutoSelect, using Shift+keyboard performs a write/copy
8055 if (is_shift)
8056 pressed = true;
8057 else if (!is_ctrl)
8058 apply_to_range_src = true; // Since if (pressed) {} main block is not running we update this
8059 }
8060 }
8061
8062 if (apply_to_range_src)
8063 {
8064 storage->RangeSrcItem = item_data;
8065 storage->RangeSelected = selected; // Will be updated at the end of this function anyway.
8066 }
8067
8068 // Box-select toggle handling
8069 if (ms->BoxSelectId != 0)
8070 if (ImGuiBoxSelectState* bs = GetBoxSelectState(ms->BoxSelectId))
8071 {
8072 const bool rect_overlap_curr = bs->BoxSelectRectCurr.Overlaps(g.LastItemData.Rect);
8073 const bool rect_overlap_prev = bs->BoxSelectRectPrev.Overlaps(g.LastItemData.Rect);
8074 if ((rect_overlap_curr && !rect_overlap_prev && !selected) || (rect_overlap_prev && !rect_overlap_curr))
8075 {
8076 if (storage->LastSelectionSize <= 0 && bs->IsStartedSetNavIdOnce)
8077 {
8078 pressed = true; // First item act as a pressed: code below will emit selection request and set NavId (whatever we emit here will be overridden anyway)
8079 bs->IsStartedSetNavIdOnce = false;
8080 }
8081 else
8082 {
8083 selected = !selected;
8084 MultiSelectAddSetRange(ms, selected, +1, item_data, item_data);
8085 }
8086 storage->LastSelectionSize = ImMax(storage->LastSelectionSize + 1, 1);
8087 }
8088 }
8089
8090 // Right-click handling.
8091 // FIXME-MULTISELECT: Currently filtered out by ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoAutoSelect but maybe should be moved to Selectable(). See https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/pull/5816
8092 if (hovered && IsMouseClicked(1) && (flags & ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoAutoSelect) == 0)
8093 {
8094 if (g.ActiveId != 0 && g.ActiveId != id)
8095 ClearActiveID();
8096 SetFocusID(id, window);
8097 if (!pressed && !selected)
8098 {
8099 pressed = true;
8100 is_ctrl = is_shift = false;
8101 }
8102 }
8103
8104 // Unlike Space, Enter doesn't alter selection (but can still return a press) unless current item is not selected.
8105 // The later, "unless current item is not select", may become optional? It seems like a better default if Enter doesn't necessarily open something
8106 // (unlike e.g. Windows explorer). For use case where Enter always open something, we might decide to make this optional?
8107 const bool enter_pressed = pressed && (g.NavActivateId == id) && (g.NavActivateFlags & ImGuiActivateFlags_PreferInput);
8108
8109 // Alter selection
8110 if (pressed && (!enter_pressed || !selected))
8111 {
8112 // Box-select
8113 ImGuiInputSource input_source = (g.NavJustMovedToId == id || g.NavActivateId == id) ? g.NavInputSource : ImGuiInputSource_Mouse;
8114 if (flags & (ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_BoxSelect1d | ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_BoxSelect2d))
8115 if (selected == false && !g.BoxSelectState.IsActive && !g.BoxSelectState.IsStarting && input_source == ImGuiInputSource_Mouse && g.IO.MouseClickedCount[0] == 1)
8116 BoxSelectPreStartDrag(ms->BoxSelectId, item_data);
8117
8118 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
8119 // ACTION | Begin | Pressed/Activated | End
8120 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
8121 // Keys Navigated: | Clear | Src=item, Sel=1 SetRange 1
8122 // Keys Navigated: Ctrl | n/a | n/a
8123 // Keys Navigated: Shift | n/a | Dst=item, Sel=1, => Clear + SetRange 1
8124 // Keys Navigated: Ctrl+Shift | n/a | Dst=item, Sel=Src => Clear + SetRange Src-Dst
8125 // Keys Activated: | n/a | Src=item, Sel=1 => Clear + SetRange 1
8126 // Keys Activated: Ctrl | n/a | Src=item, Sel=!Sel => SetSange 1
8127 // Keys Activated: Shift | n/a | Dst=item, Sel=1 => Clear + SetSange 1
8128 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
8129 // Mouse Pressed: | n/a | Src=item, Sel=1, => Clear + SetRange 1
8130 // Mouse Pressed: Ctrl | n/a | Src=item, Sel=!Sel => SetRange 1
8131 // Mouse Pressed: Shift | n/a | Dst=item, Sel=1, => Clear + SetRange 1
8132 // Mouse Pressed: Ctrl+Shift | n/a | Dst=item, Sel=!Sel => SetRange Src-Dst
8133 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
8134
8135 if ((flags & ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoAutoClear) == 0)
8136 {
8137 bool request_clear = false;
8138 if (is_singleselect)
8139 request_clear = true;
8140 else if ((input_source == ImGuiInputSource_Mouse || g.NavActivateId == id) && !is_ctrl)
8141 request_clear = (flags & ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoAutoClearOnReselect) ? !selected : true;
8142 else if ((input_source == ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard || input_source == ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad) && is_shift && !is_ctrl)
8143 request_clear = true; // With is_shift==false the RequestClear was done in BeginIO, not necessary to do again.
8144 if (request_clear)
8145 MultiSelectAddSetAll(ms, false);
8146 }
8147
8148 int range_direction;
8149 bool range_selected;
8150 if (is_shift && !is_singleselect)
8151 {
8152 //IM_ASSERT(storage->HasRangeSrc && storage->HasRangeValue);
8153 if (storage->RangeSrcItem == ImGuiSelectionUserData_Invalid)
8154 storage->RangeSrcItem = item_data;
8155 if ((flags & ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoAutoSelect) == 0)
8156 {
8157 // Shift+Arrow always select
8158 // Ctrl+Shift+Arrow copy source selection state (already stored by BeginMultiSelect() in storage->RangeSelected)
8159 range_selected = (is_ctrl && storage->RangeSelected != -1) ? (storage->RangeSelected != 0) : true;
8160 }
8161 else
8162 {
8163 // Shift+Arrow copy source selection state
8164 // Shift+Click always copy from target selection state
8165 if (ms->IsKeyboardSetRange)
8166 range_selected = (storage->RangeSelected != -1) ? (storage->RangeSelected != 0) : true;
8167 else
8168 range_selected = !selected;
8169 }
8170 range_direction = ms->RangeSrcPassedBy ? +1 : -1;
8171 }
8172 else
8173 {
8174 // Ctrl inverts selection, otherwise always select
8175 if ((flags & ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoAutoSelect) == 0)
8176 selected = is_ctrl ? !selected : true;
8177 else
8178 selected = !selected;
8179 storage->RangeSrcItem = item_data;
8180 range_selected = selected;
8181 range_direction = +1;
8182 }
8183 MultiSelectAddSetRange(ms, range_selected, range_direction, storage->RangeSrcItem, item_data);
8184 }
8185
8186 // Update/store the selection state of the Source item (used by CTRL+SHIFT, when Source is unselected we perform a range unselect)
8187 if (storage->RangeSrcItem == item_data)
8188 storage->RangeSelected = selected ? 1 : 0;
8189
8190 // Update/store the selection state of focused item
8191 if (g.NavId == id)
8192 {
8193 storage->NavIdItem = item_data;
8194 storage->NavIdSelected = selected ? 1 : 0;
8195 }
8196 if (storage->NavIdItem == item_data)
8197 ms->NavIdPassedBy = true;
8198 ms->LastSubmittedItem = item_data;
8199
8200 *p_selected = selected;
8201 *p_pressed = pressed;
8202}
8203
8204void ImGui::MultiSelectAddSetAll(ImGuiMultiSelectTempData* ms, bool selected)
8205{
8206 ImGuiSelectionRequest req = { ImGuiSelectionRequestType_SetAll, selected, 0, ImGuiSelectionUserData_Invalid, ImGuiSelectionUserData_Invalid };
8207 ms->IO.Requests.resize(0); // Can always clear previous requests
8208 ms->IO.Requests.push_back(req); // Add new request
8209}
8210
8211void ImGui::MultiSelectAddSetRange(ImGuiMultiSelectTempData* ms, bool selected, int range_dir, ImGuiSelectionUserData first_item, ImGuiSelectionUserData last_item)
8212{
8213 // Merge contiguous spans into same request (unless NoRangeSelect is set which guarantees single-item ranges)
8214 if (ms->IO.Requests.Size > 0 && first_item == last_item && (ms->Flags & ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoRangeSelect) == 0)
8215 {
8216 ImGuiSelectionRequest* prev = &ms->IO.Requests.Data[ms->IO.Requests.Size - 1];
8217 if (prev->Type == ImGuiSelectionRequestType_SetRange && prev->RangeLastItem == ms->LastSubmittedItem && prev->Selected == selected)
8218 {
8219 prev->RangeLastItem = last_item;
8220 return;
8221 }
8222 }
8223
8224 ImGuiSelectionRequest req = { ImGuiSelectionRequestType_SetRange, selected, (ImS8)range_dir, (range_dir > 0) ? first_item : last_item, (range_dir > 0) ? last_item : first_item };
8225 ms->IO.Requests.push_back(req); // Add new request
8226}
8227
8228void ImGui::DebugNodeMultiSelectState(ImGuiMultiSelectState* storage)
8229{
8230#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_DEBUG_TOOLS
8231 const bool is_active = (storage->LastFrameActive >= GetFrameCount() - 2); // Note that fully clipped early out scrolling tables will appear as inactive here.
8232 if (!is_active) { PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Text, GetStyleColorVec4(ImGuiCol_TextDisabled)); }
8233 bool open = TreeNode((void*)(intptr_t)storage->ID, "MultiSelect 0x%08X in '%s'%s", storage->ID, storage->Window ? storage->Window->Name : "N/A", is_active ? "" : " *Inactive*");
8234 if (!is_active) { PopStyleColor(); }
8235 if (!open)
8236 return;
8237 Text("RangeSrcItem = %" IM_PRId64 " (0x%" IM_PRIX64 "), RangeSelected = %d", storage->RangeSrcItem, storage->RangeSrcItem, storage->RangeSelected);
8238 Text("NavIdItem = %" IM_PRId64 " (0x%" IM_PRIX64 "), NavIdSelected = %d", storage->NavIdItem, storage->NavIdItem, storage->NavIdSelected);
8239 Text("LastSelectionSize = %d", storage->LastSelectionSize); // Provided by user
8240 TreePop();
8241#else
8242 IM_UNUSED(storage);
8243#endif
8244}
8245
8246//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
8247// [SECTION] Widgets: Multi-Select helpers
8248//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
8249// - ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage
8250// - ImGuiSelectionExternalStorage
8251//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
8252
8253ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage::ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage()
8254{
8255 Size = 0;
8256 PreserveOrder = false;
8257 UserData = NULL;
8258 AdapterIndexToStorageId = [](ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage*, int idx) { return (ImGuiID)idx; };
8259 _SelectionOrder = 1; // Always >0
8260}
8261
8262void ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage::Clear()
8263{
8264 Size = 0;
8265 _SelectionOrder = 1; // Always >0
8266 _Storage.Data.resize(0);
8267}
8268
8269void ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage::Swap(ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage& r)
8270{
8271 ImSwap(Size, r.Size);
8272 ImSwap(_SelectionOrder, r._SelectionOrder);
8273 _Storage.Data.swap(r._Storage.Data);
8274}
8275
8276bool ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage::Contains(ImGuiID id) const
8277{
