8278 return _Storage.GetInt(id, 0) != 0;
8279}
8280
8281static int IMGUI_CDECL PairComparerByValueInt(const void* lhs, const void* rhs)
8282{
8283 int lhs_v = ((const ImGuiStoragePair*)lhs)->val_i;
8284 int rhs_v = ((const ImGuiStoragePair*)rhs)->val_i;
8285 return (lhs_v > rhs_v ? +1 : lhs_v < rhs_v ? -1 : 0);
8286}
8287
8288// GetNextSelectedItem() is an abstraction allowing us to change our underlying actual storage system without impacting user.
8289// (e.g. store unselected vs compact down, compact down on demand, use raw ImVector<ImGuiID> instead of ImGuiStorage...)
8290bool ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage::GetNextSelectedItem(void** opaque_it, ImGuiID* out_id)
8291{
8292 ImGuiStoragePair* it = (ImGuiStoragePair*)*opaque_it;
8293 ImGuiStoragePair* it_end = _Storage.Data.Data + _Storage.Data.Size;
8294 if (PreserveOrder && it == NULL && it_end != NULL)
8295 ImQsort(_Storage.Data.Data, (size_t)_Storage.Data.Size, sizeof(ImGuiStoragePair), PairComparerByValueInt); // ~ImGuiStorage::BuildSortByValueInt()
8296 if (it == NULL)
8297 it = _Storage.Data.Data;
8298 IM_ASSERT(it >= _Storage.Data.Data && it <= it_end);
8299 if (it != it_end)
8300 while (it->val_i == 0 && it < it_end)
8301 it++;
8302 const bool has_more = (it != it_end);
8303 *opaque_it = has_more ? (void**)(it + 1) : (void**)(it);
8304 *out_id = has_more ? it->key : 0;
8305 if (PreserveOrder && !has_more)
8306 _Storage.BuildSortByKey();
8307 return has_more;
8308}
8309
8310void ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage::SetItemSelected(ImGuiID id, bool selected)
8311{
8312 int* p_int = _Storage.GetIntRef(id, 0);
8313 if (selected && *p_int == 0) { *p_int = _SelectionOrder++; Size++; }
8314 else if (!selected && *p_int != 0) { *p_int = 0; Size--; }
8315}
8316
8317// Optimized for batch edits (with same value of 'selected')
8318static void ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage_BatchSetItemSelected(ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage* selection, ImGuiID id, bool selected, int size_before_amends, int selection_order)
8319{
8320 ImGuiStorage* storage = &selection->_Storage;
8321 ImGuiStoragePair* it = ImLowerBound(storage->Data.Data, storage->Data.Data + size_before_amends, id);
8322 const bool is_contained = (it != storage->Data.Data + size_before_amends) && (it->key == id);
8323 if (selected == (is_contained && it->val_i != 0))
8324 return;
8325 if (selected && !is_contained)
8326 storage->Data.push_back(ImGuiStoragePair(id, selection_order)); // Push unsorted at end of vector, will be sorted in SelectionMultiAmendsFinish()
8327 else if (is_contained)
8328 it->val_i = selected ? selection_order : 0; // Modify in-place.
8329 selection->Size += selected ? +1 : -1;
8330}
8331
8332static void ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage_BatchFinish(ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage* selection, bool selected, int size_before_amends)
8333{
8334 ImGuiStorage* storage = &selection->_Storage;
8335 if (selected && selection->Size != size_before_amends)
8336 storage->BuildSortByKey(); // When done selecting: sort everything
8337}
8338
8339// Apply requests coming from BeginMultiSelect() and EndMultiSelect().
8340// - Enable 'Demo->Tools->Debug Log->Selection' to see selection requests as they happen.
8341// - Honoring SetRange requests requires that you can iterate/interpolate between RangeFirstItem and RangeLastItem.
8342// - In this demo we often submit indices to SetNextItemSelectionUserData() + store the same indices in persistent selection.
8343// - Your code may do differently. If you store pointers or objects ID in ImGuiSelectionUserData you may need to perform
8344// a lookup in order to have some way to iterate/interpolate between two items.
8345// - A full-featured application is likely to allow search/filtering which is likely to lead to using indices
8346// and constructing a view index <> object id/ptr data structure anyway.
8347// WHEN YOUR APPLICATION SETTLES ON A CHOICE, YOU WILL PROBABLY PREFER TO GET RID OF THIS UNNECESSARY 'ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage' INDIRECTION LOGIC.
8348// Notice that with the simplest adapter (using indices everywhere), all functions return their parameters.
8349// The most simple implementation (using indices everywhere) would look like:
8350// for (ImGuiSelectionRequest& req : ms_io->Requests)
8351// {
8352// if (req.Type == ImGuiSelectionRequestType_SetAll) { Clear(); if (req.Selected) { for (int n = 0; n < items_count; n++) { SetItemSelected(n, true); } }
8353// if (req.Type == ImGuiSelectionRequestType_SetRange) { for (int n = (int)ms_io->RangeFirstItem; n <= (int)ms_io->RangeLastItem; n++) { SetItemSelected(n, ms_io->Selected); } }
8354// }
8355void ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage::ApplyRequests(ImGuiMultiSelectIO* ms_io)
8356{
8357 // For convenience we obtain ItemsCount as passed to BeginMultiSelect(), which is optional.
8358 // It makes sense when using ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage to simply pass your items count to BeginMultiSelect().
8359 // Other scheme may handle SetAll differently.
8360 IM_ASSERT(ms_io->ItemsCount != -1 && "Missing value for items_count in BeginMultiSelect() call!");
8361 IM_ASSERT(AdapterIndexToStorageId != NULL);
8362
8363 // This is optimized/specialized to cope with very large selections (e.g. 100k+ items)
8364 // - A simpler version could call SetItemSelected() directly instead of ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage_BatchSetItemSelected() + ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage_BatchFinish().
8365 // - Optimized select can append unsorted, then sort in a second pass. Optimized unselect can clear in-place then compact in a second pass.
8366 // - A more optimal version wouldn't even use ImGuiStorage but directly a ImVector<ImGuiID> to reduce bandwidth, but this is a reasonable trade off to reuse code.
8367 // - There are many ways this could be better optimized. The worse case scenario being: using BoxSelect2d in a grid, box-select scrolling down while wiggling
8368 // left and right: it affects coarse clipping + can emit multiple SetRange with 1 item each.)
8369 // FIXME-OPT: For each block of consecutive SetRange request:
8370 // - add all requests to a sorted list, store ID, selected, offset in ImGuiStorage.
8371 // - rewrite sorted storage a single time.
8372 for (ImGuiSelectionRequest& req : ms_io->Requests)
8373 {
8374 if (req.Type == ImGuiSelectionRequestType_SetAll)
8375 {
8376 Clear();
8377 if (req.Selected)
8378 {
8379 _Storage.Data.reserve(ms_io->ItemsCount);
8380 const int size_before_amends = _Storage.Data.Size;
8381 for (int idx = 0; idx < ms_io->ItemsCount; idx++, _SelectionOrder++)
8382 ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage_BatchSetItemSelected(this, GetStorageIdFromIndex(idx), req.Selected, size_before_amends, _SelectionOrder);
8383 ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage_BatchFinish(this, req.Selected, size_before_amends);
8384 }
8385 }
8386 else if (req.Type == ImGuiSelectionRequestType_SetRange)
8387 {
8388 const int selection_changes = (int)req.RangeLastItem - (int)req.RangeFirstItem + 1;
8389 //ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui; IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_SELECTION("Req %d/%d: set %d to %d\n", ms_io->Requests.index_from_ptr(&req), ms_io->Requests.Size, selection_changes, req.Selected);
8390 if (selection_changes == 1 || (selection_changes < Size / 100))
8391 {
8392 // Multiple sorted insertion + copy likely to be faster.
8393 // Technically we could do a single copy with a little more work (sort sequential SetRange requests)
8394 for (int idx = (int)req.RangeFirstItem; idx <= (int)req.RangeLastItem; idx++)
8395 SetItemSelected(GetStorageIdFromIndex(idx), req.Selected);
8396 }
8397 else
8398 {
8399 // Append insertion + single sort likely be faster.
8400 // Use req.RangeDirection to set order field so that shift+clicking from 1 to 5 is different than shift+clicking from 5 to 1
8401 const int size_before_amends = _Storage.Data.Size;
8402 int selection_order = _SelectionOrder + ((req.RangeDirection < 0) ? selection_changes - 1 : 0);
8403 for (int idx = (int)req.RangeFirstItem; idx <= (int)req.RangeLastItem; idx++, selection_order += req.RangeDirection)
8404 ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage_BatchSetItemSelected(this, GetStorageIdFromIndex(idx), req.Selected, size_before_amends, selection_order);
8405 if (req.Selected)
8406 _SelectionOrder += selection_changes;
8407 ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage_BatchFinish(this, req.Selected, size_before_amends);
8408 }
8409 }
8410 }
8411}
8412
8413//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
8414
8415ImGuiSelectionExternalStorage::ImGuiSelectionExternalStorage()
8416{
8417 UserData = NULL;
8418 AdapterSetItemSelected = NULL;
8419}
8420
8421// Apply requests coming from BeginMultiSelect() and EndMultiSelect().
8422// We also pull 'ms_io->ItemsCount' as passed for BeginMultiSelect() for consistency with ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage
8423// This makes no assumption about underlying storage.
8424void ImGuiSelectionExternalStorage::ApplyRequests(ImGuiMultiSelectIO* ms_io)
8425{
8426 IM_ASSERT(AdapterSetItemSelected);
8427 for (ImGuiSelectionRequest& req : ms_io->Requests)
8428 {
8429 if (req.Type == ImGuiSelectionRequestType_SetAll)
8430 for (int idx = 0; idx < ms_io->ItemsCount; idx++)
8431 AdapterSetItemSelected(this, idx, req.Selected);
8432 if (req.Type == ImGuiSelectionRequestType_SetRange)
8433 for (int idx = (int)req.RangeFirstItem; idx <= (int)req.RangeLastItem; idx++)
8434 AdapterSetItemSelected(this, idx, req.Selected);
8435 }
8436}
8437
8438//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
8439// [SECTION] Widgets: ListBox
8440//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
8441// - BeginListBox()
8442// - EndListBox()
8443// - ListBox()
8444//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
8445
8446// This is essentially a thin wrapper to using BeginChild/EndChild with the ImGuiChildFlags_FrameStyle flag for stylistic changes + displaying a label.
8447// This handle some subtleties with capturing info from the label.
8448// If you don't need a label you can pretty much directly use ImGui::BeginChild() with ImGuiChildFlags_FrameStyle.
8449// Tip: To have a list filling the entire window width, use size.x = -FLT_MIN and pass an non-visible label e.g. "##empty"
8450// Tip: If your vertical size is calculated from an item count (e.g. 10 * item_height) consider adding a fractional part to facilitate seeing scrolling boundaries (e.g. 10.5f * item_height).
8451bool ImGui::BeginListBox(const char* label, const ImVec2& size_arg)
8452{
8453 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8454 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
8455 if (window->SkipItems)
8456 return false;
8457
8458 const ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
8459 const ImGuiID id = GetID(label);
8460 const ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
8461
8462 // Size default to hold ~7.25 items.
8463 // Fractional number of items helps seeing that we can scroll down/up without looking at scrollbar.
8464 ImVec2 size = ImTrunc(CalcItemSize(size_arg, CalcItemWidth(), GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing() * 7.25f + style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f));
8465 ImVec2 frame_size = ImVec2(size.x, ImMax(size.y, label_size.y));
8466 ImRect frame_bb(window->DC.CursorPos, window->DC.CursorPos + frame_size);
8467 ImRect bb(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max + ImVec2(label_size.x > 0.0f ? style.ItemInnerSpacing.x + label_size.x : 0.0f, 0.0f));
8468 g.NextItemData.ClearFlags();
8469
8470 if (!IsRectVisible(bb.Min, bb.Max))
8471 {
8472 ItemSize(bb.GetSize(), style.FramePadding.y);
8473 ItemAdd(bb, 0, &frame_bb);
8474 g.NextWindowData.ClearFlags(); // We behave like Begin() and need to consume those values
8475 return false;
8476 }
8477
8478 // FIXME-OPT: We could omit the BeginGroup() if label_size.x == 0.0f but would need to omit the EndGroup() as well.
8479 BeginGroup();
8480 if (label_size.x > 0.0f)
8481 {
8482 ImVec2 label_pos = ImVec2(frame_bb.Max.x + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x, frame_bb.Min.y + style.FramePadding.y);
8483 RenderText(label_pos, label);
8484 window->DC.CursorMaxPos = ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos, label_pos + label_size);
8485 AlignTextToFramePadding();
8486 }
8487
8488 BeginChild(id, frame_bb.GetSize(), ImGuiChildFlags_FrameStyle);
8489 return true;
8490}
8491
8492void ImGui::EndListBox()
8493{
8494 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8495 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
8496 IM_ASSERT((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && "Mismatched BeginListBox/EndListBox calls. Did you test the return value of BeginListBox?");
8497 IM_UNUSED(window);
8498
8499 EndChild();
8500 EndGroup(); // This is only required to be able to do IsItemXXX query on the whole ListBox including label
8501}
8502
8503bool ImGui::ListBox(const char* label, int* current_item, const char* const items[], int items_count, int height_items)
8504{
8505 const bool value_changed = ListBox(label, current_item, Items_ArrayGetter, (void*)items, items_count, height_items);
8506 return value_changed;
8507}
8508
8509// This is merely a helper around BeginListBox(), EndListBox().
8510// Considering using those directly to submit custom data or store selection differently.
8511bool ImGui::ListBox(const char* label, int* current_item, const char* (*getter)(void* user_data, int idx), void* user_data, int items_count, int height_in_items)
8512{
8513 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8514
8515 // Calculate size from "height_in_items"
8516 if (height_in_items < 0)
8517 height_in_items = ImMin(items_count, 7);
8518 float height_in_items_f = height_in_items + 0.25f;
8519 ImVec2 size(0.0f, ImTrunc(GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing() * height_in_items_f + g.Style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f));
8520
8521 if (!BeginListBox(label, size))
8522 return false;
8523
8524 // Assume all items have even height (= 1 line of text). If you need items of different height,
8525 // you can create a custom version of ListBox() in your code without using the clipper.
8526 bool value_changed = false;
8527 ImGuiListClipper clipper;
8528 clipper.Begin(items_count, GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing()); // We know exactly our line height here so we pass it as a minor optimization, but generally you don't need to.
8529 clipper.IncludeItemByIndex(*current_item);
8530 while (clipper.Step())
8531 for (int i = clipper.DisplayStart; i < clipper.DisplayEnd; i++)
8532 {
8533 const char* item_text = getter(user_data, i);
8534 if (item_text == NULL)
8535 item_text = "*Unknown item*";
8536
8537 PushID(i);
8538 const bool item_selected = (i == *current_item);
8539 if (Selectable(item_text, item_selected))
8540 {
8541 *current_item = i;
8542 value_changed = true;
8543 }
8544 if (item_selected)
8545 SetItemDefaultFocus();
8546 PopID();
8547 }
8548 EndListBox();
8549
8550 if (value_changed)
8551 MarkItemEdited(g.LastItemData.ID);
8552
8553 return value_changed;
8554}
8555
8556//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
8557// [SECTION] Widgets: PlotLines, PlotHistogram
8558//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
8559// - PlotEx() [Internal]
8560// - PlotLines()
8561// - PlotHistogram()
8562//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
8563// Plot/Graph widgets are not very good.
8564// Consider writing your own, or using a third-party one, see:
8565// - ImPlot https://github.com/epezent/implot
8566// - others https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki/Useful-Extensions
8567//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
8568
8569int ImGui::PlotEx(ImGuiPlotType plot_type, const char* label, float (*values_getter)(void* data, int idx), void* data, int values_count, int values_offset, const char* overlay_text, float scale_min, float scale_max, const ImVec2& size_arg)
8570{
8571 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8572 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
8573 if (window->SkipItems)
8574 return -1;
8575
8576 const ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
8577 const ImGuiID id = window->GetID(label);
8578
8579 const ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
8580 const ImVec2 frame_size = CalcItemSize(size_arg, CalcItemWidth(), label_size.y + style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f);
8581
8582 const ImRect frame_bb(window->DC.CursorPos, window->DC.CursorPos + frame_size);
8583 const ImRect inner_bb(frame_bb.Min + style.FramePadding, frame_bb.Max - style.FramePadding);
8584 const ImRect total_bb(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max + ImVec2(label_size.x > 0.0f ? style.ItemInnerSpacing.x + label_size.x : 0.0f, 0));
8585 ItemSize(total_bb, style.FramePadding.y);
8586 if (!ItemAdd(total_bb, id, &frame_bb, ImGuiItemFlags_NoNav))
8587 return -1;
8588 bool hovered;
8589 ButtonBehavior(frame_bb, id, &hovered, NULL);
8590
8591 // Determine scale from values if not specified
8592 if (scale_min == FLT_MAX || scale_max == FLT_MAX)
8593 {
8594 float v_min = FLT_MAX;
8595 float v_max = -FLT_MAX;
8596 for (int i = 0; i < values_count; i++)
8597 {
8598 const float v = values_getter(data, i);
8599 if (v != v) // Ignore NaN values
8600 continue;
8601 v_min = ImMin(v_min, v);
8602 v_max = ImMax(v_max, v);
8603 }
8604 if (scale_min == FLT_MAX)
8605 scale_min = v_min;
8606 if (scale_max == FLT_MAX)
8607 scale_max = v_max;
8608 }
8609
8610 RenderFrame(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_FrameBg), true, style.FrameRounding);
8611
8612 const int values_count_min = (plot_type == ImGuiPlotType_Lines) ? 2 : 1;
8613 int idx_hovered = -1;
8614 if (values_count >= values_count_min)
8615 {
8616 int res_w = ImMin((int)frame_size.x, values_count) + ((plot_type == ImGuiPlotType_Lines) ? -1 : 0);
8617 int item_count = values_count + ((plot_type == ImGuiPlotType_Lines) ? -1 : 0);
8618
8619 // Tooltip on hover
8620 if (hovered && inner_bb.Contains(g.IO.MousePos))
8621 {
8622 const float t = ImClamp((g.IO.MousePos.x - inner_bb.Min.x) / (inner_bb.Max.x - inner_bb.Min.x), 0.0f, 0.9999f);
8623 const int v_idx = (int)(t * item_count);
8624 IM_ASSERT(v_idx >= 0 && v_idx < values_count);
8625
8626 const float v0 = values_getter(data, (v_idx + values_offset) % values_count);
8627 const float v1 = values_getter(data, (v_idx + 1 + values_offset) % values_count);
8628 if (plot_type == ImGuiPlotType_Lines)
8629 SetTooltip("%d: %8.4g\n%d: %8.4g", v_idx, v0, v_idx + 1, v1);
8630 else if (plot_type == ImGuiPlotType_Histogram)
8631 SetTooltip("%d: %8.4g", v_idx, v0);
8632 idx_hovered = v_idx;
8633 }
8634
8635 const float t_step = 1.0f / (float)res_w;
8636 const float inv_scale = (scale_min == scale_max) ? 0.0f : (1.0f / (scale_max - scale_min));
8637
8638 float v0 = values_getter(data, (0 + values_offset) % values_count);
8639 float t0 = 0.0f;
8640 ImVec2 tp0 = ImVec2( t0, 1.0f - ImSaturate((v0 - scale_min) * inv_scale) ); // Point in the normalized space of our target rectangle
8641 float histogram_zero_line_t = (scale_min * scale_max < 0.0f) ? (1 + scale_min * inv_scale) : (scale_min < 0.0f ? 0.0f : 1.0f); // Where does the zero line stands
8642
8643 const ImU32 col_base = GetColorU32((plot_type == ImGuiPlotType_Lines) ? ImGuiCol_PlotLines : ImGuiCol_PlotHistogram);
8644 const ImU32 col_hovered = GetColorU32((plot_type == ImGuiPlotType_Lines) ? ImGuiCol_PlotLinesHovered : ImGuiCol_PlotHistogramHovered);
8645
8646 for (int n = 0; n < res_w; n++)
8647 {
8648 const float t1 = t0 + t_step;
8649 const int v1_idx = (int)(t0 * item_count + 0.5f);
8650 IM_ASSERT(v1_idx >= 0 && v1_idx < values_count);
8651 const float v1 = values_getter(data, (v1_idx + values_offset + 1) % values_count);
8652 const ImVec2 tp1 = ImVec2( t1, 1.0f - ImSaturate((v1 - scale_min) * inv_scale) );
8653
8654 // NB: Draw calls are merged together by the DrawList system. Still, we should render our batch are lower level to save a bit of CPU.
8655 ImVec2 pos0 = ImLerp(inner_bb.Min, inner_bb.Max, tp0);
8656 ImVec2 pos1 = ImLerp(inner_bb.Min, inner_bb.Max, (plot_type == ImGuiPlotType_Lines) ? tp1 : ImVec2(tp1.x, histogram_zero_line_t));
8657 if (plot_type == ImGuiPlotType_Lines)
8658 {
8659 window->DrawList->AddLine(pos0, pos1, idx_hovered == v1_idx ? col_hovered : col_base);
8660 }
8661 else if (plot_type == ImGuiPlotType_Histogram)
8662 {
8663 if (pos1.x >= pos0.x + 2.0f)
8664 pos1.x -= 1.0f;
8665 window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(pos0, pos1, idx_hovered == v1_idx ? col_hovered : col_base);
8666 }
8667
8668 t0 = t1;
8669 tp0 = tp1;
8670 }
8671 }
8672
8673 // Text overlay
8674 if (overlay_text)
8675 RenderTextClipped(ImVec2(frame_bb.Min.x, frame_bb.Min.y + style.FramePadding.y), frame_bb.Max, overlay_text, NULL, NULL, ImVec2(0.5f, 0.0f));
8676
8677 if (label_size.x > 0.0f)
8678 RenderText(ImVec2(frame_bb.Max.x + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x, inner_bb.Min.y), label);
8679
8680 // Return hovered index or -1 if none are hovered.
8681 // This is currently not exposed in the public API because we need a larger redesign of the whole thing, but in the short-term we are making it available in PlotEx().
8682 return idx_hovered;
8683}
8684
8685struct ImGuiPlotArrayGetterData
8686{
8687 const float* Values;
8688 int Stride;
8689
8690 ImGuiPlotArrayGetterData(const float* values, int stride) { Values = values; Stride = stride; }
8691};
8692
8693static float Plot_ArrayGetter(void* data, int idx)
8694{
8695 ImGuiPlotArrayGetterData* plot_data = (ImGuiPlotArrayGetterData*)data;
8696 const float v = *(const float*)(const void*)((const unsigned char*)plot_data->Values + (size_t)idx * plot_data->Stride);
8697 return v;
8698}
8699
8700void ImGui::PlotLines(const char* label, const float* values, int values_count, int values_offset, const char* overlay_text, float scale_min, float scale_max, ImVec2 graph_size, int stride)
8701{
8702 ImGuiPlotArrayGetterData data(values, stride);
8703 PlotEx(ImGuiPlotType_Lines, label, &Plot_ArrayGetter, (void*)&data, values_count, values_offset, overlay_text, scale_min, scale_max, graph_size);
8704}
8705
8706void ImGui::PlotLines(const char* label, float (*values_getter)(void* data, int idx), void* data, int values_count, int values_offset, const char* overlay_text, float scale_min, float scale_max, ImVec2 graph_size)
8707{
8708 PlotEx(ImGuiPlotType_Lines, label, values_getter, data, values_count, values_offset, overlay_text, scale_min, scale_max, graph_size);
8709}
8710
8711void ImGui::PlotHistogram(const char* label, const float* values, int values_count, int values_offset, const char* overlay_text, float scale_min, float scale_max, ImVec2 graph_size, int stride)
8712{
8713 ImGuiPlotArrayGetterData data(values, stride);
8714 PlotEx(ImGuiPlotType_Histogram, label, &Plot_ArrayGetter, (void*)&data, values_count, values_offset, overlay_text, scale_min, scale_max, graph_size);
8715}
8716
8717void ImGui::PlotHistogram(const char* label, float (*values_getter)(void* data, int idx), void* data, int values_count, int values_offset, const char* overlay_text, float scale_min, float scale_max, ImVec2 graph_size)
8718{
8719 PlotEx(ImGuiPlotType_Histogram, label, values_getter, data, values_count, values_offset, overlay_text, scale_min, scale_max, graph_size);
8720}
8721
8722//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
8723// [SECTION] Widgets: Value helpers
8724// Those is not very useful, legacy API.
8725//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
8726// - Value()
8727//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
8728
8729void ImGui::Value(const char* prefix, bool b)
8730{
8731 Text("%s: %s", prefix, (b ? "true" : "false"));
8732}
8733
8734void ImGui::Value(const char* prefix, int v)
8735{
8736 Text("%s: %d", prefix, v);
8737}
8738
8739void ImGui::Value(const char* prefix, unsigned int v)
8740{
8741 Text("%s: %d", prefix, v);
8742}
8743
8744void ImGui::Value(const char* prefix, float v, const char* float_format)
8745{
8746 if (float_format)
8747 {
8748 char fmt[64];
8749 ImFormatString(fmt, IM_ARRAYSIZE(fmt), "%%s: %s", float_format);
8750 Text(fmt, prefix, v);
8751 }
8752 else
8753 {
8754 Text("%s: %.3f", prefix, v);
8755 }
8756}
8757
8758//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
8759// [SECTION] MenuItem, BeginMenu, EndMenu, etc.
8760//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
8761// - ImGuiMenuColumns [Internal]
8762// - BeginMenuBar()
8763// - EndMenuBar()
8764// - BeginMainMenuBar()
8765// - EndMainMenuBar()
8766// - BeginMenu()
8767// - EndMenu()
8768// - MenuItemEx() [Internal]
8769// - MenuItem()
8770//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
8771
8772// Helpers for internal use
8773void ImGuiMenuColumns::Update(float spacing, bool window_reappearing)
8774{
8775 if (window_reappearing)
8776 memset(Widths, 0, sizeof(Widths));
8777 Spacing = (ImU16)spacing;
8778 CalcNextTotalWidth(true);
8779 memset(Widths, 0, sizeof(Widths));
8780 TotalWidth = NextTotalWidth;
8781 NextTotalWidth = 0;
8782}
8783
8784void ImGuiMenuColumns::CalcNextTotalWidth(bool update_offsets)
8785{
8786 ImU16 offset = 0;
8787 bool want_spacing = false;
8788 for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(Widths); i++)
8789 {
8790 ImU16 width = Widths[i];
8791 if (want_spacing && width > 0)
8792 offset += Spacing;
8793 want_spacing |= (width > 0);
8794 if (update_offsets)
8795 {
8796 if (i == 1) { OffsetLabel = offset; }
8797 if (i == 2) { OffsetShortcut = offset; }
8798 if (i == 3) { OffsetMark = offset; }
8799 }
8800 offset += width;
8801 }
8802 NextTotalWidth = offset;
8803}
8804
8805float ImGuiMenuColumns::DeclColumns(float w_icon, float w_label, float w_shortcut, float w_mark)
8806{
8807 Widths[0] = ImMax(Widths[0], (ImU16)w_icon);
8808 Widths[1] = ImMax(Widths[1], (ImU16)w_label);
8809 Widths[2] = ImMax(Widths[2], (ImU16)w_shortcut);
8810 Widths[3] = ImMax(Widths[3], (ImU16)w_mark);
8811 CalcNextTotalWidth(false);
8812 return (float)ImMax(TotalWidth, NextTotalWidth);
8813}
8814
8815// FIXME: Provided a rectangle perhaps e.g. a BeginMenuBarEx() could be used anywhere..
8816// Currently the main responsibility of this function being to setup clip-rect + horizontal layout + menu navigation layer.
8817// Ideally we also want this to be responsible for claiming space out of the main window scrolling rectangle, in which case ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar will become unnecessary.
8818// Then later the same system could be used for multiple menu-bars, scrollbars, side-bars.
8819bool ImGui::BeginMenuBar()
8820{
8821 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
8822 if (window->SkipItems)
8823 return false;
8824 if (!(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar))
8825 return false;
8826
8827 IM_ASSERT(!window->DC.MenuBarAppending);
8828 BeginGroup(); // Backup position on layer 0 // FIXME: Misleading to use a group for that backup/restore
8829 PushID("##MenuBar");
8830
8831 // We don't clip with current window clipping rectangle as it is already set to the area below. However we clip with window full rect.
8832 // We remove 1 worth of rounding to Max.x to that text in long menus and small windows don't tend to display over the lower-right rounded area, which looks particularly glitchy.
8833 const float border_top = ImMax(IM_ROUND(window->WindowBorderSize * 0.5f - window->TitleBarHeight), 0.0f);
8834 const float border_half = IM_ROUND(window->WindowBorderSize * 0.5f);
8835 ImRect bar_rect = window->MenuBarRect();
8836 ImRect clip_rect(ImFloor(bar_rect.Min.x + border_half), ImFloor(bar_rect.Min.y + border_top), ImFloor(ImMax(bar_rect.Min.x, bar_rect.Max.x - ImMax(window->WindowRounding, border_half))), ImFloor(bar_rect.Max.y));
8837 clip_rect.ClipWith(window->OuterRectClipped);
8838 PushClipRect(clip_rect.Min, clip_rect.Max, false);
8839
8840 // We overwrite CursorMaxPos because BeginGroup sets it to CursorPos (essentially the .EmitItem hack in EndMenuBar() would need something analogous here, maybe a BeginGroupEx() with flags).
8841 window->DC.CursorPos = window->DC.CursorMaxPos = ImVec2(bar_rect.Min.x + window->DC.MenuBarOffset.x, bar_rect.Min.y + window->DC.MenuBarOffset.y);
8842 window->DC.LayoutType = ImGuiLayoutType_Horizontal;
8843 window->DC.IsSameLine = false;
8844 window->DC.NavLayerCurrent = ImGuiNavLayer_Menu;
8845 window->DC.MenuBarAppending = true;
8846 AlignTextToFramePadding();
8847 return true;
8848}
8849
8850void ImGui::EndMenuBar()
8851{
8852 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
8853 if (window->SkipItems)
8854 return;
8855 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8856
8857 IM_MSVC_WARNING_SUPPRESS(6011); // Static Analysis false positive "warning C6011: Dereferencing NULL pointer 'window'"
8858 IM_ASSERT(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar);
8859 IM_ASSERT(window->DC.MenuBarAppending);
8860
8861 // Nav: When a move request within one of our child menu failed, capture the request to navigate among our siblings.
8862 if (NavMoveRequestButNoResultYet() && (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Left || g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Right) && (g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu))
8863 {
8864 // Try to find out if the request is for one of our child menu
8865 ImGuiWindow* nav_earliest_child = g.NavWindow;
8866 while (nav_earliest_child->ParentWindow && (nav_earliest_child->ParentWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu))
8867 nav_earliest_child = nav_earliest_child->ParentWindow;
8868 if (nav_earliest_child->ParentWindow == window && nav_earliest_child->DC.ParentLayoutType == ImGuiLayoutType_Horizontal && (g.NavMoveFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_Forwarded) == 0)
8869 {
8870 // To do so we claim focus back, restore NavId and then process the movement request for yet another frame.
8871 // This involve a one-frame delay which isn't very problematic in this situation. We could remove it by scoring in advance for multiple window (probably not worth bothering)
8872 const ImGuiNavLayer layer = ImGuiNavLayer_Menu;
8873 IM_ASSERT(window->DC.NavLayersActiveMaskNext & (1 << layer)); // Sanity check (FIXME: Seems unnecessary)
8874 FocusWindow(window);
8875 SetNavID(window->NavLastIds[layer], layer, 0, window->NavRectRel[layer]);
8876 // FIXME-NAV: How to deal with this when not using g.IO.ConfigNavCursorVisibleAuto?
8877 if (g.NavCursorVisible)
8878 {
8879 g.NavCursorVisible = false; // Hide nav cursor for the current frame so we don't see the intermediary selection. Will be set again
8880 g.NavCursorHideFrames = 2;
8881 }
8882 g.NavHighlightItemUnderNav = g.NavMousePosDirty = true;
8883 NavMoveRequestForward(g.NavMoveDir, g.NavMoveClipDir, g.NavMoveFlags, g.NavMoveScrollFlags); // Repeat
8884 }
8885 }
8886
8887 PopClipRect();
8888 PopID();
8889 window->DC.MenuBarOffset.x = window->DC.CursorPos.x - window->Pos.x; // Save horizontal position so next append can reuse it. This is kinda equivalent to a per-layer CursorPos.
8890
8891 // FIXME: Extremely confusing, cleanup by (a) working on WorkRect stack system (b) not using a Group confusingly here.
8892 ImGuiGroupData& group_data = g.GroupStack.back();
8893 group_data.EmitItem = false;
8894 ImVec2 restore_cursor_max_pos = group_data.BackupCursorMaxPos;
8895 window->DC.IdealMaxPos.x = ImMax(window->DC.IdealMaxPos.x, window->DC.CursorMaxPos.x - window->Scroll.x); // Convert ideal extents for scrolling layer equivalent.
8896 EndGroup(); // Restore position on layer 0 // FIXME: Misleading to use a group for that backup/restore
8897 window->DC.LayoutType = ImGuiLayoutType_Vertical;
8898 window->DC.IsSameLine = false;
8899 window->DC.NavLayerCurrent = ImGuiNavLayer_Main;
8900 window->DC.MenuBarAppending = false;
8901 window->DC.CursorMaxPos = restore_cursor_max_pos;
8902}
8903
8904// Important: calling order matters!
8905// FIXME: Somehow overlapping with docking tech.
8906// FIXME: The "rect-cut" aspect of this could be formalized into a lower-level helper (rect-cut: https://halt.software/dead-simple-layouts)
8907bool ImGui::BeginViewportSideBar(const char* name, ImGuiViewport* viewport_p, ImGuiDir dir, float axis_size, ImGuiWindowFlags window_flags)
8908{
8909 IM_ASSERT(dir != ImGuiDir_None);
8910
8911 ImGuiWindow* bar_window = FindWindowByName(name);
8912 ImGuiViewportP* viewport = (ImGuiViewportP*)(void*)(viewport_p ? viewport_p : GetMainViewport());
8913 if (bar_window == NULL || bar_window->BeginCount == 0)
8914 {
8915 // Calculate and set window size/position
8916 ImRect avail_rect = viewport->GetBuildWorkRect();
8917 ImGuiAxis axis = (dir == ImGuiDir_Up || dir == ImGuiDir_Down) ? ImGuiAxis_Y : ImGuiAxis_X;
8918 ImVec2 pos = avail_rect.Min;
8919 if (dir == ImGuiDir_Right || dir == ImGuiDir_Down)
8920 pos[axis] = avail_rect.Max[axis] - axis_size;
8921 ImVec2 size = avail_rect.GetSize();
8922 size[axis] = axis_size;
8923 SetNextWindowPos(pos);
8924 SetNextWindowSize(size);
8925
8926 // Report our size into work area (for next frame) using actual window size
8927 if (dir == ImGuiDir_Up || dir == ImGuiDir_Left)
8928 viewport->BuildWorkInsetMin[axis] += axis_size;
8929 else if (dir == ImGuiDir_Down || dir == ImGuiDir_Right)
8930 viewport->BuildWorkInsetMax[axis] += axis_size;
8931 }
8932
8933 window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDocking;
8934 SetNextWindowViewport(viewport->ID); // Enforce viewport so we don't create our own viewport when ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsNoMerge is set.
8935 PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_WindowRounding, 0.0f);
8936 PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_WindowMinSize, ImVec2(0, 0)); // Lift normal size constraint
8937 bool is_open = Begin(name, NULL, window_flags);
8938 PopStyleVar(2);
8939
8940 return is_open;
8941}
8942
8943bool ImGui::BeginMainMenuBar()
8944{
8945 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8946 ImGuiViewportP* viewport = (ImGuiViewportP*)(void*)GetMainViewport();
8947
8948 // Notify of viewport change so GetFrameHeight() can be accurate in case of DPI change
8949 SetCurrentViewport(NULL, viewport);
8950
8951 // For the main menu bar, which cannot be moved, we honor g.Style.DisplaySafeAreaPadding to ensure text can be visible on a TV set.
8952 // FIXME: This could be generalized as an opt-in way to clamp window->DC.CursorStartPos to avoid SafeArea?
8953 // FIXME: Consider removing support for safe area down the line... it's messy. Nowadays consoles have support for TV calibration in OS settings.
8954 g.NextWindowData.MenuBarOffsetMinVal = ImVec2(g.Style.DisplaySafeAreaPadding.x, ImMax(g.Style.DisplaySafeAreaPadding.y - g.Style.FramePadding.y, 0.0f));
8955 ImGuiWindowFlags window_flags = ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings | ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar;
8956 float height = GetFrameHeight();
8957 bool is_open = BeginViewportSideBar("##MainMenuBar", viewport, ImGuiDir_Up, height, window_flags);
8958 g.NextWindowData.MenuBarOffsetMinVal = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
8959 if (!is_open)
8960 {
8961 End();
8962 return false;
8963 }
8964
8965 // Temporarily disable _NoSavedSettings, in the off-chance that tables or child windows submitted within the menu-bar may want to use settings. (#8356)
8966 g.CurrentWindow->Flags &= ~ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings;
8967 BeginMenuBar();
8968 return is_open;
8969}
8970
8971void ImGui::EndMainMenuBar()
8972{
8973 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8974 if (!g.CurrentWindow->DC.MenuBarAppending)
8975 {
8976 IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(0, "Calling EndMainMenuBar() not from a menu-bar!"); // Not technically testing that it is the main menu bar
8977 return;
8978 }
8979
8980 EndMenuBar();
8981 g.CurrentWindow->Flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings; // Restore _NoSavedSettings (#8356)
8982
8983 // When the user has left the menu layer (typically: closed menus through activation of an item), we restore focus to the previous window
8984 // FIXME: With this strategy we won't be able to restore a NULL focus.
8985 if (g.CurrentWindow == g.NavWindow && g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main && !g.NavAnyRequest && g.ActiveId == 0)
8986 FocusTopMostWindowUnderOne(g.NavWindow, NULL, NULL, ImGuiFocusRequestFlags_UnlessBelowModal | ImGuiFocusRequestFlags_RestoreFocusedChild);
8987
8988 End();
8989}
8990
8991static bool IsRootOfOpenMenuSet()
8992{
8993 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8994 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
8995 if ((g.OpenPopupStack.Size <= g.BeginPopupStack.Size) || (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu))
8996 return false;
8997
8998 // Initially we used 'upper_popup->OpenParentId == window->IDStack.back()' to differentiate multiple menu sets from each others
8999 // (e.g. inside menu bar vs loose menu items) based on parent ID.
9000 // This would however prevent the use of e.g. PushID() user code submitting menus.
9001 // Previously this worked between popup and a first child menu because the first child menu always had the _ChildWindow flag,
9002 // making hovering on parent popup possible while first child menu was focused - but this was generally a bug with other side effects.
9003 // Instead we don't treat Popup specifically (in order to consistently support menu features in them), maybe the first child menu of a Popup
9004 // doesn't have the _ChildWindow flag, and we rely on this IsRootOfOpenMenuSet() check to allow hovering between root window/popup and first child menu.
9005 // In the end, lack of ID check made it so we could no longer differentiate between separate menu sets. To compensate for that, we at least check parent window nav layer.
9006 // This fixes the most common case of menu opening on hover when moving between window content and menu bar. Multiple different menu sets in same nav layer would still
9007 // open on hover, but that should be a lesser problem, because if such menus are close in proximity in window content then it won't feel weird and if they are far apart
9008 // it likely won't be a problem anyone runs into.
9009 const ImGuiPopupData* upper_popup = &g.OpenPopupStack[g.BeginPopupStack.Size];
9010 if (window->DC.NavLayerCurrent != upper_popup->ParentNavLayer)
9011 return false;
9012 return upper_popup->Window && (upper_popup->Window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu) && ImGui::IsWindowChildOf(upper_popup->Window, window, true, false);
9013}
9014
9015bool ImGui::BeginMenuEx(const char* label, const char* icon, bool enabled)
9016{
9017 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
9018 if (window->SkipItems)
9019 return false;
9020
9021 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9022 const ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
9023 const ImGuiID id = window->GetID(label);
9024 bool menu_is_open = IsPopupOpen(id, ImGuiPopupFlags_None);
9025
9026 // Sub-menus are ChildWindow so that mouse can be hovering across them (otherwise top-most popup menu would steal focus and not allow hovering on parent menu)
9027 // The first menu in a hierarchy isn't so hovering doesn't get across (otherwise e.g. resizing borders with ImGuiButtonFlags_FlattenChildren would react), but top-most BeginMenu() will bypass that limitation.
9028 ImGuiWindowFlags window_flags = ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu | ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavFocus;
9029 if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu)
9030 window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow;
9031
9032 // If a menu with same the ID was already submitted, we will append to it, matching the behavior of Begin().
9033 // We are relying on a O(N) search - so O(N log N) over the frame - which seems like the most efficient for the expected small amount of BeginMenu() calls per frame.
9034 // If somehow this is ever becoming a problem we can switch to use e.g. ImGuiStorage mapping key to last frame used.
9035 if (g.MenusIdSubmittedThisFrame.contains(id))
9036 {
9037 if (menu_is_open)
9038 menu_is_open = BeginPopupMenuEx(id, label, window_flags); // menu_is_open can be 'false' when the popup is completely clipped (e.g. zero size display)
9039 else
9040 g.NextWindowData.ClearFlags(); // we behave like Begin() and need to consume those values
9041 return menu_is_open;
9042 }
9043
9044 // Tag menu as used. Next time BeginMenu() with same ID is called it will append to existing menu
9045 g.MenusIdSubmittedThisFrame.push_back(id);
9046
9047 ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
9048
9049 // Odd hack to allow hovering across menus of a same menu-set (otherwise we wouldn't be able to hover parent without always being a Child window)
9050 // This is only done for items for the menu set and not the full parent window.
9051 const bool menuset_is_open = IsRootOfOpenMenuSet();
9052 if (menuset_is_open)
9053 PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags_NoWindowHoverableCheck, true);
9054
9055 // The reference position stored in popup_pos will be used by Begin() to find a suitable position for the child menu,
9056 // However the final position is going to be different! It is chosen by FindBestWindowPosForPopup().
9057 // e.g. Menus tend to overlap each other horizontally to amplify relative Z-ordering.
9058 ImVec2 popup_pos, pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
9059 PushID(label);
9060 if (!enabled)
9061 BeginDisabled();
9062 const ImGuiMenuColumns* offsets = &window->DC.MenuColumns;
9063 bool pressed;
9064
9065 // We use ImGuiSelectableFlags_NoSetKeyOwner to allow down on one menu item, move, up on another.
9066 const ImGuiSelectableFlags selectable_flags = ImGuiSelectableFlags_NoHoldingActiveID | ImGuiSelectableFlags_NoSetKeyOwner | ImGuiSelectableFlags_SelectOnClick | ImGuiSelectableFlags_NoAutoClosePopups;
9067 if (window->DC.LayoutType == ImGuiLayoutType_Horizontal)
9068 {
9069 // Menu inside a horizontal menu bar
9070 // Selectable extend their highlight by half ItemSpacing in each direction.
9071 // For ChildMenu, the popup position will be overwritten by the call to FindBestWindowPosForPopup() in Begin()
9072 popup_pos = ImVec2(pos.x - 1.0f - IM_TRUNC(style.ItemSpacing.x * 0.5f), pos.y - style.FramePadding.y + window->MenuBarHeight);
9073 window->DC.CursorPos.x += IM_TRUNC(style.ItemSpacing.x * 0.5f);
9074 PushStyleVarX(ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, style.ItemSpacing.x * 2.0f);
9075 float w = label_size.x;
9076 ImVec2 text_pos(window->DC.CursorPos.x + offsets->OffsetLabel, window->DC.CursorPos.y + window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset);
9077 pressed = Selectable("", menu_is_open, selectable_flags, ImVec2(w, label_size.y));
9078 LogSetNextTextDecoration("[", "]");
9079 RenderText(text_pos, label);
9080 PopStyleVar();
9081 window->DC.CursorPos.x += IM_TRUNC(style.ItemSpacing.x * (-1.0f + 0.5f)); // -1 spacing to compensate the spacing added when Selectable() did a SameLine(). It would also work to call SameLine() ourselves after the PopStyleVar().
9082 }
9083 else
9084 {
9085 // Menu inside a regular/vertical menu
9086 // (In a typical menu window where all items are BeginMenu() or MenuItem() calls, extra_w will always be 0.0f.
9087 // Only when they are other items sticking out we're going to add spacing, yet only register minimum width into the layout system.
9088 popup_pos = ImVec2(pos.x, pos.y - style.WindowPadding.y);
9089 float icon_w = (icon && icon[0]) ? CalcTextSize(icon, NULL).x : 0.0f;
9090 float checkmark_w = IM_TRUNC(g.FontSize * 1.20f);
9091 float min_w = window->DC.MenuColumns.DeclColumns(icon_w, label_size.x, 0.0f, checkmark_w); // Feedback to next frame
9092 float extra_w = ImMax(0.0f, GetContentRegionAvail().x - min_w);
9093 ImVec2 text_pos(window->DC.CursorPos.x + offsets->OffsetLabel, window->DC.CursorPos.y + window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset);
9094 pressed = Selectable("", menu_is_open, selectable_flags | ImGuiSelectableFlags_SpanAvailWidth, ImVec2(min_w, label_size.y));
9095 LogSetNextTextDecoration("", ">");
9096 RenderText(text_pos, label);
9097 if (icon_w > 0.0f)
9098 RenderText(pos + ImVec2(offsets->OffsetIcon, 0.0f), icon);
9099 RenderArrow(window->DrawList, pos + ImVec2(offsets->OffsetMark + extra_w + g.FontSize * 0.30f, 0.0f), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text), ImGuiDir_Right);
9100 }
9101 if (!enabled)
9102 EndDisabled();
9103
9104 const bool hovered = (g.HoveredId == id) && enabled && !g.NavHighlightItemUnderNav;
9105 if (menuset_is_open)
9106 PopItemFlag();
9107
9108 bool want_open = false;
9109 bool want_open_nav_init = false;
9110 bool want_close = false;
9111 if (window->DC.LayoutType == ImGuiLayoutType_Vertical) // (window->Flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup|ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu))
9112 {
9113 // Close menu when not hovering it anymore unless we are moving roughly in the direction of the menu
9114 // Implement http://bjk5.com/post/44698559168/breaking-down-amazons-mega-dropdown to avoid using timers, so menus feels more reactive.
9115 bool moving_toward_child_menu = false;
9116 ImGuiPopupData* child_popup = (g.BeginPopupStack.Size < g.OpenPopupStack.Size) ? &g.OpenPopupStack[g.BeginPopupStack.Size] : NULL; // Popup candidate (testing below)
9117 ImGuiWindow* child_menu_window = (child_popup && child_popup->Window && child_popup->Window->ParentWindow == window) ? child_popup->Window : NULL;
9118 if (g.HoveredWindow == window && child_menu_window != NULL)
9119 {
9120 const float ref_unit = g.FontSize; // FIXME-DPI
9121 const float child_dir = (window->Pos.x < child_menu_window->Pos.x) ? 1.0f : -1.0f;
9122 const ImRect next_window_rect = child_menu_window->Rect();
9123 ImVec2 ta = (g.IO.MousePos - g.IO.MouseDelta);
9124 ImVec2 tb = (child_dir > 0.0f) ? next_window_rect.GetTL() : next_window_rect.GetTR();
9125 ImVec2 tc = (child_dir > 0.0f) ? next_window_rect.GetBL() : next_window_rect.GetBR();
9126 const float pad_farmost_h = ImClamp(ImFabs(ta.x - tb.x) * 0.30f, ref_unit * 0.5f, ref_unit * 2.5f); // Add a bit of extra slack.
9127 ta.x += child_dir * -0.5f;
9128 tb.x += child_dir * ref_unit;
9129 tc.x += child_dir * ref_unit;
9130 tb.y = ta.y + ImMax((tb.y - pad_farmost_h) - ta.y, -ref_unit * 8.0f); // Triangle has maximum height to limit the slope and the bias toward large sub-menus
9131 tc.y = ta.y + ImMin((tc.y + pad_farmost_h) - ta.y, +ref_unit * 8.0f);
9132 moving_toward_child_menu = ImTriangleContainsPoint(ta, tb, tc, g.IO.MousePos);
9133 //GetForegroundDrawList()->AddTriangleFilled(ta, tb, tc, moving_toward_child_menu ? IM_COL32(0,128,0,128) : IM_COL32(128,0,0,128)); // [DEBUG]
9134 }
9135
9136 // The 'HovereWindow == window' check creates an inconsistency (e.g. moving away from menu slowly tends to hit same window, whereas moving away fast does not)
9137 // But we also need to not close the top-menu menu when moving over void. Perhaps we should extend the triangle check to a larger polygon.
9138 // (Remember to test this on BeginPopup("A")->BeginMenu("B") sequence which behaves slightly differently as B isn't a Child of A and hovering isn't shared.)
9139 if (menu_is_open && !hovered && g.HoveredWindow == window && !moving_toward_child_menu && !g.NavHighlightItemUnderNav && g.ActiveId == 0)
9140 want_close = true;
9141
9142 // Open
9143 // (note: at this point 'hovered' actually includes the NavDisableMouseHover == false test)
9144 if (!menu_is_open && pressed) // Click/activate to open
9145 want_open = true;
9146 else if (!menu_is_open && hovered && !moving_toward_child_menu) // Hover to open
9147 want_open = true;
9148 else if (!menu_is_open && hovered && g.HoveredIdTimer >= 0.30f && g.MouseStationaryTimer >= 0.30f) // Hover to open (timer fallback)
9149 want_open = true;
9150 if (g.NavId == id && g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Right) // Nav-Right to open
9151 {
9152 want_open = want_open_nav_init = true;
9153 NavMoveRequestCancel();
9154 SetNavCursorVisibleAfterMove();
9155 }
9156 }
9157 else
9158 {
9159 // Menu bar
9160 if (menu_is_open && pressed && menuset_is_open) // Click an open menu again to close it
9161 {
9162 want_close = true;
9163 want_open = menu_is_open = false;
9164 }
9165 else if (pressed || (hovered && menuset_is_open && !menu_is_open)) // First click to open, then hover to open others
9166 {
9167 want_open = true;
9168 }
9169 else if (g.NavId == id && g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Down) // Nav-Down to open
9170 {
9171 want_open = true;
9172 NavMoveRequestCancel();
9173 }
9174 }
9175
9176 if (!enabled) // explicitly close if an open menu becomes disabled, facilitate users code a lot in pattern such as 'if (BeginMenu("options", has_object)) { ..use object.. }'
9177 want_close = true;
9178 if (want_close && IsPopupOpen(id, ImGuiPopupFlags_None))
9179 ClosePopupToLevel(g.BeginPopupStack.Size, true);
9180
9181 IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_INFO(id, label, g.LastItemData.StatusFlags | ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Openable | (menu_is_open ? ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Opened : 0));
9182 PopID();
9183
9184 if (want_open && !menu_is_open && g.OpenPopupStack.Size > g.BeginPopupStack.Size)
9185 {
9186 // Don't reopen/recycle same menu level in the same frame if it is a different menu ID, first close the other menu and yield for a frame.
9187 OpenPopup(label);
9188 }
9189 else if (want_open)
9190 {
9191 menu_is_open = true;
9192 OpenPopup(label, ImGuiPopupFlags_NoReopen);// | (want_open_nav_init ? ImGuiPopupFlags_NoReopenAlwaysNavInit : 0));
9193 }
9194
9195 if (menu_is_open)
9196 {
9197 ImGuiLastItemData last_item_in_parent = g.LastItemData;
9198 SetNextWindowPos(popup_pos, ImGuiCond_Always); // Note: misleading: the value will serve as reference for FindBestWindowPosForPopup(), not actual pos.
9199 PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ChildRounding, style.PopupRounding); // First level will use _PopupRounding, subsequent will use _ChildRounding
9200 menu_is_open = BeginPopupMenuEx(id, label, window_flags); // menu_is_open may be 'false' when the popup is completely clipped (e.g. zero size display)
9201 PopStyleVar();
9202 if (menu_is_open)
9203 {
9204 // Implement what ImGuiPopupFlags_NoReopenAlwaysNavInit would do:
9205 // Perform an init request in the case the popup was already open (via a previous mouse hover)
9206 if (want_open && want_open_nav_init && !g.NavInitRequest)
9207 {
9208 FocusWindow(g.CurrentWindow, ImGuiFocusRequestFlags_UnlessBelowModal);
9209 NavInitWindow(g.CurrentWindow, false);
9210 }
9211
9212 // Restore LastItemData so IsItemXXXX functions can work after BeginMenu()/EndMenu()
9213 // (This fixes using IsItemClicked() and IsItemHovered(), but IsItemHovered() also relies on its support for ImGuiItemFlags_NoWindowHoverableCheck)
9214 g.LastItemData = last_item_in_parent;
9215 if (g.HoveredWindow == window)
9216 g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredWindow;
9217 }
9218 }
9219 else
9220 {
9221 g.NextWindowData.ClearFlags(); // We behave like Begin() and need to consume those values
9222 }
9223
9224 return menu_is_open;
9225}
9226
9227bool ImGui::BeginMenu(const char* label, bool enabled)
9228{
9229 return BeginMenuEx(label, NULL, enabled);
9230}
9231
9232void ImGui::EndMenu()
9233{
9234 // Nav: When a left move request our menu failed, close ourselves.
9235 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9236 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9237 IM_ASSERT(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup); // Mismatched BeginMenu()/EndMenu() calls
9238 ImGuiWindow* parent_window = window->ParentWindow; // Should always be != NULL is we passed assert.
9239 if (window->BeginCount == window->BeginCountPreviousFrame)
9240 if (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Left && NavMoveRequestButNoResultYet())
9241 if (g.NavWindow && (g.NavWindow->RootWindowForNav == window) && parent_window->DC.LayoutType == ImGuiLayoutType_Vertical)
9242 {
9243 ClosePopupToLevel(g.BeginPopupStack.Size - 1, true);
9244 NavMoveRequestCancel();
9245 }
9246
9247 EndPopup();
9248}
9249
9250bool ImGui::MenuItemEx(const char* label, const char* icon, const char* shortcut, bool selected, bool enabled)
9251{
9252 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
9253 if (window->SkipItems)
9254 return false;
9255
9256 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9257 ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
9258 ImVec2 pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
9259 ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
9260
9261 // See BeginMenuEx() for comments about this.
9262 const bool menuset_is_open = IsRootOfOpenMenuSet();
9263 if (menuset_is_open)
9264 PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags_NoWindowHoverableCheck, true);
9265
9266 // We've been using the equivalent of ImGuiSelectableFlags_SetNavIdOnHover on all Selectable() since early Nav system days (commit 43ee5d73),
9267 // but I am unsure whether this should be kept at all. For now moved it to be an opt-in feature used by menus only.
9268 bool pressed;
9269 PushID(label);
9270 if (!enabled)
9271 BeginDisabled();
9272
9273 // We use ImGuiSelectableFlags_NoSetKeyOwner to allow down on one menu item, move, up on another.
9274 const ImGuiSelectableFlags selectable_flags = ImGuiSelectableFlags_SelectOnRelease | ImGuiSelectableFlags_NoSetKeyOwner | ImGuiSelectableFlags_SetNavIdOnHover;
9275 const ImGuiMenuColumns* offsets = &window->DC.MenuColumns;
9276 if (window->DC.LayoutType == ImGuiLayoutType_Horizontal)
9277 {
9278 // Mimic the exact layout spacing of BeginMenu() to allow MenuItem() inside a menu bar, which is a little misleading but may be useful
9279 // Note that in this situation: we don't render the shortcut, we render a highlight instead of the selected tick mark.
9280 float w = label_size.x;
9281 window->DC.CursorPos.x += IM_TRUNC(style.ItemSpacing.x * 0.5f);
9282 ImVec2 text_pos(window->DC.CursorPos.x + offsets->OffsetLabel, window->DC.CursorPos.y + window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset);
9283 PushStyleVarX(ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, style.ItemSpacing.x * 2.0f);
9284 pressed = Selectable("", selected, selectable_flags, ImVec2(w, 0.0f));
9285 PopStyleVar();
9286 if (g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Visible)
9287 RenderText(text_pos, label);
9288 window->DC.CursorPos.x += IM_TRUNC(style.ItemSpacing.x * (-1.0f + 0.5f)); // -1 spacing to compensate the spacing added when Selectable() did a SameLine(). It would also work to call SameLine() ourselves after the PopStyleVar().
9289 }
9290 else
9291 {
9292 // Menu item inside a vertical menu
9293 // (In a typical menu window where all items are BeginMenu() or MenuItem() calls, extra_w will always be 0.0f.
9294 // Only when they are other items sticking out we're going to add spacing, yet only register minimum width into the layout system.
9295 float icon_w = (icon && icon[0]) ? CalcTextSize(icon, NULL).x : 0.0f;
9296 float shortcut_w = (shortcut && shortcut[0]) ? CalcTextSize(shortcut, NULL).x : 0.0f;
9297 float checkmark_w = IM_TRUNC(g.FontSize * 1.20f);
9298 float min_w = window->DC.MenuColumns.DeclColumns(icon_w, label_size.x, shortcut_w, checkmark_w); // Feedback for next frame
9299 float stretch_w = ImMax(0.0f, GetContentRegionAvail().x - min_w);
9300 pressed = Selectable("", false, selectable_flags | ImGuiSelectableFlags_SpanAvailWidth, ImVec2(min_w, label_size.y));
9301 if (g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Visible)
9302 {
9303 RenderText(pos + ImVec2(offsets->OffsetLabel, 0.0f), label);
9304 if (icon_w > 0.0f)
9305 RenderText(pos + ImVec2(offsets->OffsetIcon, 0.0f), icon);
9306 if (shortcut_w > 0.0f)
9307 {
9308 PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Text, style.Colors[ImGuiCol_TextDisabled]);
9309 LogSetNextTextDecoration("(", ")");
9310 RenderText(pos + ImVec2(offsets->OffsetShortcut + stretch_w, 0.0f), shortcut, NULL, false);
9311 PopStyleColor();
9312 }
9313 if (selected)
9314 RenderCheckMark(window->DrawList, pos + ImVec2(offsets->OffsetMark + stretch_w + g.FontSize * 0.40f, g.FontSize * 0.134f * 0.5f), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text), g.FontSize * 0.866f);
9315 }
9316 }
9317 IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_INFO(g.LastItemData.ID, label, g.LastItemData.StatusFlags | ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Checkable | (selected ? ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Checked : 0));
9318 if (!enabled)
9319 EndDisabled();
9320 PopID();
9321 if (menuset_is_open)
9322 PopItemFlag();
9323
9324 return pressed;
9325}
9326
9327bool ImGui::MenuItem(const char* label, const char* shortcut, bool selected, bool enabled)
9328{
9329 return MenuItemEx(label, NULL, shortcut, selected, enabled);
9330}
9331
9332bool ImGui::MenuItem(const char* label, const char* shortcut, bool* p_selected, bool enabled)
9333{
9334 if (MenuItemEx(label, NULL, shortcut, p_selected ? *p_selected : false, enabled))
9335 {
9336 if (p_selected)
9337 *p_selected = !*p_selected;
9338 return true;
9339 }
9340 return false;
9341}
9342
9343//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
9344// [SECTION] Widgets: BeginTabBar, EndTabBar, etc.
9345//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
9346// - BeginTabBar()
9347// - BeginTabBarEx() [Internal]
9348// - EndTabBar()
9349// - TabBarLayout() [Internal]
9350// - TabBarCalcTabID() [Internal]
9351// - TabBarCalcMaxTabWidth() [Internal]
9352// - TabBarFindTabById() [Internal]
9353// - TabBarFindTabByOrder() [Internal]
9354// - TabBarFindMostRecentlySelectedTabForActiveWindow() [Internal]
9355// - TabBarGetCurrentTab() [Internal]
9356// - TabBarGetTabName() [Internal]
9357// - TabBarAddTab() [Internal]
9358// - TabBarRemoveTab() [Internal]
9359// - TabBarCloseTab() [Internal]
9360// - TabBarScrollClamp() [Internal]
9361// - TabBarScrollToTab() [Internal]
9362// - TabBarQueueFocus() [Internal]
9363// - TabBarQueueReorder() [Internal]
9364// - TabBarProcessReorderFromMousePos() [Internal]
9365// - TabBarProcessReorder() [Internal]
9366// - TabBarScrollingButtons() [Internal]
9367// - TabBarTabListPopupButton() [Internal]
9368//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
9369
9370struct ImGuiTabBarSection
9371{
9372 int TabCount; // Number of tabs in this section.
9373 float Width; // Sum of width of tabs in this section (after shrinking down)
9374 float Spacing; // Horizontal spacing at the end of the section.
9375
9376 ImGuiTabBarSection() { memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this)); }
9377};
9378
9379namespace ImGui
9380{
9381 static void TabBarLayout(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar);
9382 static ImU32 TabBarCalcTabID(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, const char* label, ImGuiWindow* docked_window);
9383 static float TabBarCalcMaxTabWidth();
9384 static float TabBarScrollClamp(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, float scrolling);
9385 static void TabBarScrollToTab(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, ImGuiID tab_id, ImGuiTabBarSection* sections);
9386 static ImGuiTabItem* TabBarScrollingButtons(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar);
9387 static ImGuiTabItem* TabBarTabListPopupButton(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar);
9388}
9389
9390ImGuiTabBar::ImGuiTabBar()
9391{
9392 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
9393 CurrFrameVisible = PrevFrameVisible = -1;
9394 LastTabItemIdx = -1;
9395}
9396
9397static inline int TabItemGetSectionIdx(const ImGuiTabItem* tab)
9398{
9399 return (tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_Leading) ? 0 : (tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_Trailing) ? 2 : 1;
9400}
9401
9402static int IMGUI_CDECL TabItemComparerBySection(const void* lhs, const void* rhs)
9403{
9404 const ImGuiTabItem* a = (const ImGuiTabItem*)lhs;
9405 const ImGuiTabItem* b = (const ImGuiTabItem*)rhs;
9406 const int a_section = TabItemGetSectionIdx(a);
9407 const int b_section = TabItemGetSectionIdx(b);
9408 if (a_section != b_section)
9409 return a_section - b_section;
9410 return (int)(a->IndexDuringLayout - b->IndexDuringLayout);
9411}
9412
9413static int IMGUI_CDECL TabItemComparerByBeginOrder(const void* lhs, const void* rhs)
9414{
9415 const ImGuiTabItem* a = (const ImGuiTabItem*)lhs;
9416 const ImGuiTabItem* b = (const ImGuiTabItem*)rhs;
9417 return (int)(a->BeginOrder - b->BeginOrder);
9418}
9419
9420static ImGuiTabBar* GetTabBarFromTabBarRef(const ImGuiPtrOrIndex& ref)
9421{
9422 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9423 return ref.Ptr ? (ImGuiTabBar*)ref.Ptr : g.TabBars.GetByIndex(ref.Index);
9424}
9425
9426static ImGuiPtrOrIndex GetTabBarRefFromTabBar(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar)
9427{
9428 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9429 if (g.TabBars.Contains(tab_bar))
9430 return ImGuiPtrOrIndex(g.TabBars.GetIndex(tab_bar));
9431 return ImGuiPtrOrIndex(tab_bar);
9432}
9433
9434bool ImGui::BeginTabBar(const char* str_id, ImGuiTabBarFlags flags)
9435{
9436 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9437 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9438 if (window->SkipItems)
9439 return false;
9440
9441 ImGuiID id = window->GetID(str_id);
9442 ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar = g.TabBars.GetOrAddByKey(id);
9443 ImRect tab_bar_bb = ImRect(window->DC.CursorPos.x, window->DC.CursorPos.y, window->WorkRect.Max.x, window->DC.CursorPos.y + g.FontSize + g.Style.FramePadding.y * 2);
9444 tab_bar->ID = id;
9445 tab_bar->SeparatorMinX = tab_bar->BarRect.Min.x - IM_TRUNC(window->WindowPadding.x * 0.5f);
9446 tab_bar->SeparatorMaxX = tab_bar->BarRect.Max.x + IM_TRUNC(window->WindowPadding.x * 0.5f);
9447 //if (g.NavWindow && IsWindowChildOf(g.NavWindow, window, false, false))
9448 flags |= ImGuiTabBarFlags_IsFocused;
9449 return BeginTabBarEx(tab_bar, tab_bar_bb, flags);
9450}
9451
9452bool ImGui::BeginTabBarEx(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, const ImRect& tab_bar_bb, ImGuiTabBarFlags flags)
9453{
9454 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9455 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9456 if (window->SkipItems)
9457 return false;
9458
9459 IM_ASSERT(tab_bar->ID != 0);
9460 if ((flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_DockNode) == 0)
9461 PushOverrideID(tab_bar->ID);
9462
9463 // Add to stack
9464 g.CurrentTabBarStack.push_back(GetTabBarRefFromTabBar(tab_bar));
9465 g.CurrentTabBar = tab_bar;
9466 tab_bar->Window = window;
9467
9468 // Append with multiple BeginTabBar()/EndTabBar() pairs.
9469 tab_bar->BackupCursorPos = window->DC.CursorPos;
9470 if (tab_bar->CurrFrameVisible == g.FrameCount)
9471 {
9472 window->DC.CursorPos = ImVec2(tab_bar->BarRect.Min.x, tab_bar->BarRect.Max.y + tab_bar->ItemSpacingY);
9473 tab_bar->BeginCount++;
9474 return true;
9475 }
9476
9477 // Ensure correct ordering when toggling ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable flag, or when a new tab was added while being not reorderable
9478 if ((flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable) != (tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable) || (tab_bar->TabsAddedNew && !(flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable)))
9479 if ((flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_DockNode) == 0) // FIXME: TabBar with DockNode can now be hybrid
9480 ImQsort(tab_bar->Tabs.Data, tab_bar->Tabs.Size, sizeof(ImGuiTabItem), TabItemComparerByBeginOrder);
9481 tab_bar->TabsAddedNew = false;
9482
9483 // Flags
9484 if ((flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyMask_) == 0)
9485 flags |= ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyDefault_;
9486
9487 tab_bar->Flags = flags;
9488 tab_bar->BarRect = tab_bar_bb;
9489 tab_bar->WantLayout = true; // Layout will be done on the first call to ItemTab()
9490 tab_bar->PrevFrameVisible = tab_bar->CurrFrameVisible;
9491 tab_bar->CurrFrameVisible = g.FrameCount;
9492 tab_bar->PrevTabsContentsHeight = tab_bar->CurrTabsContentsHeight;
9493 tab_bar->CurrTabsContentsHeight = 0.0f;
9494 tab_bar->ItemSpacingY = g.Style.ItemSpacing.y;
9495 tab_bar->FramePadding = g.Style.FramePadding;
9496 tab_bar->TabsActiveCount = 0;
9497 tab_bar->LastTabItemIdx = -1;
9498 tab_bar->BeginCount = 1;
9499
9500 // Set cursor pos in a way which only be used in the off-chance the user erroneously submits item before BeginTabItem(): items will overlap
9501 window->DC.CursorPos = ImVec2(tab_bar->BarRect.Min.x, tab_bar->BarRect.Max.y + tab_bar->ItemSpacingY);
9502
9503 // Draw separator
9504 // (it would be misleading to draw this in EndTabBar() suggesting that it may be drawn over tabs, as tab bar are appendable)
9505 const ImU32 col = GetColorU32((flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_IsFocused) ? ImGuiCol_TabSelected : ImGuiCol_TabDimmedSelected);
9506 if (g.Style.TabBarBorderSize > 0.0f)
9507 {
9508 const float y = tab_bar->BarRect.Max.y;
9509 window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(tab_bar->SeparatorMinX, y - g.Style.TabBarBorderSize), ImVec2(tab_bar->SeparatorMaxX, y), col);
9510 }
9511 return true;
9512}
9513
9514void ImGui::EndTabBar()
9515{
9516 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9517 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9518 if (window->SkipItems)
9519 return;
9520
9521 ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar = g.CurrentTabBar;
9522 if (tab_bar == NULL)
9523 {
9524 IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(tab_bar != NULL, "Mismatched BeginTabBar()/EndTabBar()!");
9525 return;
9526 }
9527
9528 // Fallback in case no TabItem have been submitted
9529 if (tab_bar->WantLayout)
9530 TabBarLayout(tab_bar);
9531
9532 // Restore the last visible height if no tab is visible, this reduce vertical flicker/movement when a tabs gets removed without calling SetTabItemClosed().
9533 const bool tab_bar_appearing = (tab_bar->PrevFrameVisible + 1 < g.FrameCount);
9534 if (tab_bar->VisibleTabWasSubmitted || tab_bar->VisibleTabId == 0 || tab_bar_appearing)
9535 {
9536 tab_bar->CurrTabsContentsHeight = ImMax(window->DC.CursorPos.y - tab_bar->BarRect.Max.y, tab_bar->CurrTabsContentsHeight);
9537 window->DC.CursorPos.y = tab_bar->BarRect.Max.y + tab_bar->CurrTabsContentsHeight;
9538 }
9539 else
9540 {
9541 window->DC.CursorPos.y = tab_bar->BarRect.Max.y + tab_bar->PrevTabsContentsHeight;
9542 }
9543 if (tab_bar->BeginCount > 1)
9544 window->DC.CursorPos = tab_bar->BackupCursorPos;
9545
9546 tab_bar->LastTabItemIdx = -1;
9547 if ((tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_DockNode) == 0)
9548 PopID();
9549
9550 g.CurrentTabBarStack.pop_back();
9551 g.CurrentTabBar = g.CurrentTabBarStack.empty() ? NULL : GetTabBarFromTabBarRef(g.CurrentTabBarStack.back());
9552}
9553
9554// Scrolling happens only in the central section (leading/trailing sections are not scrolling)
9555static float TabBarCalcScrollableWidth(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, ImGuiTabBarSection* sections)
9556{
9557 return tab_bar->BarRect.GetWidth() - sections[0].Width - sections[2].Width - sections[1].Spacing;
9558}
9559
9560// This is called only once a frame before by the first call to ItemTab()
9561// The reason we're not calling it in BeginTabBar() is to leave a chance to the user to call the SetTabItemClosed() functions.
9562static void ImGui::TabBarLayout(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar)
9563{
9564 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9565 tab_bar->WantLayout = false;
9566
9567 // Garbage collect by compacting list
9568 // Detect if we need to sort out tab list (e.g. in rare case where a tab changed section)
9569 int tab_dst_n = 0;
9570 bool need_sort_by_section = false;
9571 ImGuiTabBarSection sections[3]; // Layout sections: Leading, Central, Trailing
9572 for (int tab_src_n = 0; tab_src_n < tab_bar->Tabs.Size; tab_src_n++)
9573 {
9574 ImGuiTabItem* tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[tab_src_n];
9575 if (tab->LastFrameVisible < tab_bar->PrevFrameVisible || tab->WantClose)
9576 {
9577 // Remove tab
9578 if (tab_bar->VisibleTabId == tab->ID) { tab_bar->VisibleTabId = 0; }
9579 if (tab_bar->SelectedTabId == tab->ID) { tab_bar->SelectedTabId = 0; }
9580 if (tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId == tab->ID) { tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId = 0; }
9581 continue;
9582 }
9583 if (tab_dst_n != tab_src_n)
9584 tab_bar->Tabs[tab_dst_n] = tab_bar->Tabs[tab_src_n];
9585
9586 tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[tab_dst_n];
9587 tab->IndexDuringLayout = (ImS16)tab_dst_n;
9588
9589 // We will need sorting if tabs have changed section (e.g. moved from one of Leading/Central/Trailing to another)
9590 int curr_tab_section_n = TabItemGetSectionIdx(tab);
9591 if (tab_dst_n > 0)
9592 {
9593 ImGuiTabItem* prev_tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[tab_dst_n - 1];
9594 int prev_tab_section_n = TabItemGetSectionIdx(prev_tab);
9595 if (curr_tab_section_n == 0 && prev_tab_section_n != 0)
9596 need_sort_by_section = true;
9597 if (prev_tab_section_n == 2 && curr_tab_section_n != 2)
9598 need_sort_by_section = true;
9599 }
9600
9601 sections[curr_tab_section_n].TabCount++;
9602 tab_dst_n++;
9603 }
9604 if (tab_bar->Tabs.Size != tab_dst_n)
9605 tab_bar->Tabs.resize(tab_dst_n);
9606
9607 if (need_sort_by_section)
9608 ImQsort(tab_bar->Tabs.Data, tab_bar->Tabs.Size, sizeof(ImGuiTabItem), TabItemComparerBySection);
9609
9610 // Calculate spacing between sections
9611 sections[0].Spacing = sections[0].TabCount > 0 && (sections[1].TabCount + sections[2].TabCount) > 0 ? g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x : 0.0f;
9612 sections[1].Spacing = sections[1].TabCount > 0 && sections[2].TabCount > 0 ? g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x : 0.0f;
9613
9614 // Setup next selected tab
9615 ImGuiID scroll_to_tab_id = 0;
9616 if (tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId)
9617 {
9618 tab_bar->SelectedTabId = tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId;
9619 tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId = 0;
9620 scroll_to_tab_id = tab_bar->SelectedTabId;
9621 }
9622
9623 // Process order change request (we could probably process it when requested but it's just saner to do it in a single spot).
9624 if (tab_bar->ReorderRequestTabId != 0)
9625 {
9626 if (TabBarProcessReorder(tab_bar))
9627 if (tab_bar->ReorderRequestTabId == tab_bar->SelectedTabId)
9628 scroll_to_tab_id = tab_bar->ReorderRequestTabId;
9629 tab_bar->ReorderRequestTabId = 0;
9630 }
9631
9632 // Tab List Popup (will alter tab_bar->BarRect and therefore the available width!)
9633 const bool tab_list_popup_button = (tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_TabListPopupButton) != 0;
9634 if (tab_list_popup_button)
9635 if (ImGuiTabItem* tab_to_select = TabBarTabListPopupButton(tab_bar)) // NB: Will alter BarRect.Min.x!
9636 scroll_to_tab_id = tab_bar->SelectedTabId = tab_to_select->ID;
9637
9638 // Leading/Trailing tabs will be shrink only if central one aren't visible anymore, so layout the shrink data as: leading, trailing, central
9639 // (whereas our tabs are stored as: leading, central, trailing)
9640 int shrink_buffer_indexes[3] = { 0, sections[0].TabCount + sections[2].TabCount, sections[0].TabCount };
9641 g.ShrinkWidthBuffer.resize(tab_bar->Tabs.Size);
9642
9643 // Compute ideal tabs widths + store them into shrink buffer
9644 ImGuiTabItem* most_recently_selected_tab = NULL;
9645 int curr_section_n = -1;
9646 bool found_selected_tab_id = false;
9647 for (int tab_n = 0; tab_n < tab_bar->Tabs.Size; tab_n++)
9648 {
9649 ImGuiTabItem* tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[tab_n];
9650 IM_ASSERT(tab->LastFrameVisible >= tab_bar->PrevFrameVisible);
9651
9652 if ((most_recently_selected_tab == NULL || most_recently_selected_tab->LastFrameSelected < tab->LastFrameSelected) && !(tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_Button))
9653 most_recently_selected_tab = tab;
9654 if (tab->ID == tab_bar->SelectedTabId)
9655 found_selected_tab_id = true;
9656 if (scroll_to_tab_id == 0 && g.NavJustMovedToId == tab->ID)
9657 scroll_to_tab_id = tab->ID;
9658
9659 // Refresh tab width immediately, otherwise changes of style e.g. style.FramePadding.x would noticeably lag in the tab bar.
9660 // Additionally, when using TabBarAddTab() to manipulate tab bar order we occasionally insert new tabs that don't have a width yet,
9661 // and we cannot wait for the next BeginTabItem() call. We cannot compute this width within TabBarAddTab() because font size depends on the active window.
9662 const char* tab_name = TabBarGetTabName(tab_bar, tab);
9663 const bool has_close_button_or_unsaved_marker = (tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoCloseButton) == 0 || (tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_UnsavedDocument);
9664 tab->ContentWidth = (tab->RequestedWidth >= 0.0f) ? tab->RequestedWidth : TabItemCalcSize(tab_name, has_close_button_or_unsaved_marker).x;
9665
9666 int section_n = TabItemGetSectionIdx(tab);
9667 ImGuiTabBarSection* section = &sections[section_n];
9668 section->Width += tab->ContentWidth + (section_n == curr_section_n ? g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x : 0.0f);
9669 curr_section_n = section_n;
9670
9671 // Store data so we can build an array sorted by width if we need to shrink tabs down
9672 IM_MSVC_WARNING_SUPPRESS(6385);
9673 ImGuiShrinkWidthItem* shrink_width_item = &g.ShrinkWidthBuffer[shrink_buffer_indexes[section_n]++];
9674 shrink_width_item->Index = tab_n;
9675 shrink_width_item->Width = shrink_width_item->InitialWidth = tab->ContentWidth;
9676 tab->Width = ImMax(tab->ContentWidth, 1.0f);
9677 }
9678
9679 // Compute total ideal width (used for e.g. auto-resizing a window)
9680 tab_bar->WidthAllTabsIdeal = 0.0f;
9681 for (int section_n = 0; section_n < 3; section_n++)
9682 tab_bar->WidthAllTabsIdeal += sections[section_n].Width + sections[section_n].Spacing;
9683
9684 // Horizontal scrolling buttons
9685 // (note that TabBarScrollButtons() will alter BarRect.Max.x)
9686 if ((tab_bar->WidthAllTabsIdeal > tab_bar->BarRect.GetWidth() && tab_bar->Tabs.Size > 1) && !(tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_NoTabListScrollingButtons) && (tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyScroll))
9687 if (ImGuiTabItem* scroll_and_select_tab = TabBarScrollingButtons(tab_bar))
9688 {
9689 scroll_to_tab_id = scroll_and_select_tab->ID;
9690 if ((scroll_and_select_tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_Button) == 0)
9691 tab_bar->SelectedTabId = scroll_to_tab_id;
9692 }
9693
9694 // Shrink widths if full tabs don't fit in their allocated space
9695 float section_0_w = sections[0].Width + sections[0].Spacing;
9696 float section_1_w = sections[1].Width + sections[1].Spacing;
9697 float section_2_w = sections[2].Width + sections[2].Spacing;
9698 bool central_section_is_visible = (section_0_w + section_2_w) < tab_bar->BarRect.GetWidth();
9699 float width_excess;
9700 if (central_section_is_visible)
9701 width_excess = ImMax(section_1_w - (tab_bar->BarRect.GetWidth() - section_0_w - section_2_w), 0.0f); // Excess used to shrink central section
9702 else
9703 width_excess = (section_0_w + section_2_w) - tab_bar->BarRect.GetWidth(); // Excess used to shrink leading/trailing section
9704
9705 // With ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyScroll policy, we will only shrink leading/trailing if the central section is not visible anymore
9706 if (width_excess >= 1.0f && ((tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyResizeDown) || !central_section_is_visible))
9707 {
9708 int shrink_data_count = (central_section_is_visible ? sections[1].TabCount : sections[0].TabCount + sections[2].TabCount);
9709 int shrink_data_offset = (central_section_is_visible ? sections[0].TabCount + sections[2].TabCount : 0);
9710 ShrinkWidths(g.ShrinkWidthBuffer.Data + shrink_data_offset, shrink_data_count, width_excess);
9711
9712 // Apply shrunk values into tabs and sections
9713 for (int tab_n = shrink_data_offset; tab_n < shrink_data_offset + shrink_data_count; tab_n++)
9714 {
9715 ImGuiTabItem* tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[g.ShrinkWidthBuffer[tab_n].Index];
9716 float shrinked_width = IM_TRUNC(g.ShrinkWidthBuffer[tab_n].Width);
9717 if (shrinked_width < 0.0f)
9718 continue;
9719
9720 shrinked_width = ImMax(1.0f, shrinked_width);
9721 int section_n = TabItemGetSectionIdx(tab);
9722 sections[section_n].Width -= (tab->Width - shrinked_width);
9723 tab->Width = shrinked_width;
9724 }
9725 }
9726
9727 // Layout all active tabs
9728 int section_tab_index = 0;
9729 float tab_offset = 0.0f;
9730 tab_bar->WidthAllTabs = 0.0f;
9731 for (int section_n = 0; section_n < 3; section_n++)
9732 {
9733 ImGuiTabBarSection* section = &sections[section_n];
9734 if (section_n == 2)
9735 tab_offset = ImMin(ImMax(0.0f, tab_bar->BarRect.GetWidth() - section->Width), tab_offset);
9736
9737 for (int tab_n = 0; tab_n < section->TabCount; tab_n++)
9738 {
9739 ImGuiTabItem* tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[section_tab_index + tab_n];
9740 tab->Offset = tab_offset;
9741 tab->NameOffset = -1;
9742 tab_offset += tab->Width + (tab_n < section->TabCount - 1 ? g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x : 0.0f);
9743 }
9744 tab_bar->WidthAllTabs += ImMax(section->Width + section->Spacing, 0.0f);
9745 tab_offset += section->Spacing;
9746 section_tab_index += section->TabCount;
9747 }
9748
9749 // Clear name buffers
9750 tab_bar->TabsNames.Buf.resize(0);
9751
9752 // If we have lost the selected tab, select the next most recently active one
9753 if (found_selected_tab_id == false)
9754 tab_bar->SelectedTabId = 0;
9755 if (tab_bar->SelectedTabId == 0 && tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId == 0 && most_recently_selected_tab != NULL)
9756 scroll_to_tab_id = tab_bar->SelectedTabId = most_recently_selected_tab->ID;
9757
9758 // Lock in visible tab
9759 tab_bar->VisibleTabId = tab_bar->SelectedTabId;
9760 tab_bar->VisibleTabWasSubmitted = false;
9761
9762 // CTRL+TAB can override visible tab temporarily
9763 if (g.NavWindowingTarget != NULL && g.NavWindowingTarget->DockNode && g.NavWindowingTarget->DockNode->TabBar == tab_bar)
9764 tab_bar->VisibleTabId = scroll_to_tab_id = g.NavWindowingTarget->TabId;
9765
9766 // Apply request requests
9767 if (scroll_to_tab_id != 0)
9768 TabBarScrollToTab(tab_bar, scroll_to_tab_id, sections);
9769 else if ((tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyScroll) && IsMouseHoveringRect(tab_bar->BarRect.Min, tab_bar->BarRect.Max, true) && IsWindowContentHoverable(g.CurrentWindow))
9770 {
9771 const float wheel = g.IO.MouseWheelRequestAxisSwap ? g.IO.MouseWheel : g.IO.MouseWheelH;
9772 const ImGuiKey wheel_key = g.IO.MouseWheelRequestAxisSwap ? ImGuiKey_MouseWheelY : ImGuiKey_MouseWheelX;
9773 if (TestKeyOwner(wheel_key, tab_bar->ID) && wheel != 0.0f)
9774 {
9775 const float scroll_step = wheel * TabBarCalcScrollableWidth(tab_bar, sections) / 3.0f;
9776 tab_bar->ScrollingTargetDistToVisibility = 0.0f;
9777 tab_bar->ScrollingTarget = TabBarScrollClamp(tab_bar, tab_bar->ScrollingTarget - scroll_step);
9778 }
9779 SetKeyOwner(wheel_key, tab_bar->ID);
9780 }
9781
9782 // Update scrolling
9783 tab_bar->ScrollingAnim = TabBarScrollClamp(tab_bar, tab_bar->ScrollingAnim);
9784 tab_bar->ScrollingTarget = TabBarScrollClamp(tab_bar, tab_bar->ScrollingTarget);
9785 if (tab_bar->ScrollingAnim != tab_bar->ScrollingTarget)
9786 {
9787 // Scrolling speed adjust itself so we can always reach our target in 1/3 seconds.
9788 // Teleport if we are aiming far off the visible line
9789 tab_bar->ScrollingSpeed = ImMax(tab_bar->ScrollingSpeed, 70.0f * g.FontSize);
9790 tab_bar->ScrollingSpeed = ImMax(tab_bar->ScrollingSpeed, ImFabs(tab_bar->ScrollingTarget - tab_bar->ScrollingAnim) / 0.3f);
9791 const bool teleport = (tab_bar->PrevFrameVisible + 1 < g.FrameCount) || (tab_bar->ScrollingTargetDistToVisibility > 10.0f * g.FontSize);
9792 tab_bar->ScrollingAnim = teleport ? tab_bar->ScrollingTarget : ImLinearSweep(tab_bar->ScrollingAnim, tab_bar->ScrollingTarget, g.IO.DeltaTime * tab_bar->ScrollingSpeed);
9793 }
9794 else
9795 {
9796 tab_bar->ScrollingSpeed = 0.0f;
9797 }
9798 tab_bar->ScrollingRectMinX = tab_bar->BarRect.Min.x + sections[0].Width + sections[0].Spacing;
9799 tab_bar->ScrollingRectMaxX = tab_bar->BarRect.Max.x - sections[2].Width - sections[1].Spacing;
9800
9801 // Actual layout in host window (we don't do it in BeginTabBar() so as not to waste an extra frame)
9802 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9803 window->DC.CursorPos = tab_bar->BarRect.Min;
9804 ItemSize(ImVec2(tab_bar->WidthAllTabs, tab_bar->BarRect.GetHeight()), tab_bar->FramePadding.y);
9805 window->DC.IdealMaxPos.x = ImMax(window->DC.IdealMaxPos.x, tab_bar->BarRect.Min.x + tab_bar->WidthAllTabsIdeal);
9806}
9807
9808// Dockable windows uses Name/ID in the global namespace. Non-dockable items use the ID stack.
9809static ImU32 ImGui::TabBarCalcTabID(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, const char* label, ImGuiWindow* docked_window)
9810{
9811 if (docked_window != NULL)
9812 {
9813 IM_UNUSED(tab_bar);
9814 IM_ASSERT(tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_DockNode);
9815 ImGuiID id = docked_window->TabId;
9816 KeepAliveID(id);
9817 return id;
9818 }
9819 else
9820 {
9821 ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
9822 return window->GetID(label);
9823 }
9824}
9825
9826static float ImGui::TabBarCalcMaxTabWidth()
9827{
9828 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9829 return g.FontSize * 20.0f;
9830}
9831
9832ImGuiTabItem* ImGui::TabBarFindTabByID(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, ImGuiID tab_id)
9833{
9834 if (tab_id != 0)
9835 for (int n = 0; n < tab_bar->Tabs.Size; n++)
9836 if (tab_bar->Tabs[n].ID == tab_id)
9837 return &tab_bar->Tabs[n];
9838 return NULL;
9839}
9840
9841// Order = visible order, not submission order! (which is tab->BeginOrder)
9842ImGuiTabItem* ImGui::TabBarFindTabByOrder(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, int order)
9843{
9844 if (order < 0 || order >= tab_bar->Tabs.Size)
9845 return NULL;
9846 return &tab_bar->Tabs[order];
9847}
9848
9849// FIXME: See references to #2304 in TODO.txt
9850ImGuiTabItem* ImGui::TabBarFindMostRecentlySelectedTabForActiveWindow(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar)
9851{
9852 ImGuiTabItem* most_recently_selected_tab = NULL;
9853 for (int tab_n = 0; tab_n < tab_bar->Tabs.Size; tab_n++)
9854 {
9855 ImGuiTabItem* tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[tab_n];
9856 if (most_recently_selected_tab == NULL || most_recently_selected_tab->LastFrameSelected < tab->LastFrameSelected)
9857 if (tab->Window && tab->Window->WasActive)
9858 most_recently_selected_tab = tab;
9859 }
9860 return most_recently_selected_tab;
9861}
9862
9863ImGuiTabItem* ImGui::TabBarGetCurrentTab(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar)
9864{
9865 if (tab_bar->LastTabItemIdx < 0 || tab_bar->LastTabItemIdx >= tab_bar->Tabs.Size)
9866 return NULL;
