9867 return &tab_bar->Tabs[tab_bar->LastTabItemIdx];
9868}
9869
9870const char* ImGui::TabBarGetTabName(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, ImGuiTabItem* tab)
9871{
9872 if (tab->Window)
9873 return tab->Window->Name;
9874 if (tab->NameOffset == -1)
9875 return "N/A";
9876 IM_ASSERT(tab->NameOffset < tab_bar->TabsNames.Buf.Size);
9877 return tab_bar->TabsNames.Buf.Data + tab->NameOffset;
9878}
9879
9880// The purpose of this call is to register tab in advance so we can control their order at the time they appear.
9881// Otherwise calling this is unnecessary as tabs are appending as needed by the BeginTabItem() function.
9882void ImGui::TabBarAddTab(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, ImGuiTabItemFlags tab_flags, ImGuiWindow* window)
9883{
9884 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9885 IM_ASSERT(TabBarFindTabByID(tab_bar, window->TabId) == NULL);
9886 IM_ASSERT(g.CurrentTabBar != tab_bar); // Can't work while the tab bar is active as our tab doesn't have an X offset yet, in theory we could/should test something like (tab_bar->CurrFrameVisible < g.FrameCount) but we'd need to solve why triggers the commented early-out assert in BeginTabBarEx() (probably dock node going from implicit to explicit in same frame)
9887
9888 if (!window->HasCloseButton)
9889 tab_flags |= ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoCloseButton; // Set _NoCloseButton immediately because it will be used for first-frame width calculation.
9890
9891 ImGuiTabItem new_tab;
9892 new_tab.ID = window->TabId;
9893 new_tab.Flags = tab_flags;
9894 new_tab.LastFrameVisible = tab_bar->CurrFrameVisible; // Required so BeginTabBar() doesn't ditch the tab
9895 if (new_tab.LastFrameVisible == -1)
9896 new_tab.LastFrameVisible = g.FrameCount - 1;
9897 new_tab.Window = window; // Required so tab bar layout can compute the tab width before tab submission
9898 tab_bar->Tabs.push_back(new_tab);
9899}
9900
9901// The *TabId fields are already set by the docking system _before_ the actual TabItem was created, so we clear them regardless.
9902void ImGui::TabBarRemoveTab(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, ImGuiID tab_id)
9903{
9904 if (ImGuiTabItem* tab = TabBarFindTabByID(tab_bar, tab_id))
9905 tab_bar->Tabs.erase(tab);
9906 if (tab_bar->VisibleTabId == tab_id) { tab_bar->VisibleTabId = 0; }
9907 if (tab_bar->SelectedTabId == tab_id) { tab_bar->SelectedTabId = 0; }
9908 if (tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId == tab_id) { tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId = 0; }
9909}
9910
9911// Called on manual closure attempt
9912void ImGui::TabBarCloseTab(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, ImGuiTabItem* tab)
9913{
9914 if (tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_Button)
9915 return; // A button appended with TabItemButton().
9916
9917 if ((tab->Flags & (ImGuiTabItemFlags_UnsavedDocument | ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoAssumedClosure)) == 0)
9918 {
9919 // This will remove a frame of lag for selecting another tab on closure.
9920 // However we don't run it in the case where the 'Unsaved' flag is set, so user gets a chance to fully undo the closure
9921 tab->WantClose = true;
9922 if (tab_bar->VisibleTabId == tab->ID)
9923 {
9924 tab->LastFrameVisible = -1;
9925 tab_bar->SelectedTabId = tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId = 0;
9926 }
9927 }
9928 else
9929 {
9930 // Actually select before expecting closure attempt (on an UnsavedDocument tab user is expect to e.g. show a popup)
9931 if (tab_bar->VisibleTabId != tab->ID)
9932 TabBarQueueFocus(tab_bar, tab);
9933 }
9934}
9935
9936static float ImGui::TabBarScrollClamp(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, float scrolling)
9937{
9938 scrolling = ImMin(scrolling, tab_bar->WidthAllTabs - tab_bar->BarRect.GetWidth());
9939 return ImMax(scrolling, 0.0f);
9940}
9941
9942// Note: we may scroll to tab that are not selected! e.g. using keyboard arrow keys
9943static void ImGui::TabBarScrollToTab(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, ImGuiID tab_id, ImGuiTabBarSection* sections)
9944{
9945 ImGuiTabItem* tab = TabBarFindTabByID(tab_bar, tab_id);
9946 if (tab == NULL)
9947 return;
9948 if (tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_SectionMask_)
9949 return;
9950
9951 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9952 float margin = g.FontSize * 1.0f; // When to scroll to make Tab N+1 visible always make a bit of N visible to suggest more scrolling area (since we don't have a scrollbar)
9953 int order = TabBarGetTabOrder(tab_bar, tab);
9954
9955 // Scrolling happens only in the central section (leading/trailing sections are not scrolling)
9956 float scrollable_width = TabBarCalcScrollableWidth(tab_bar, sections);
9957
9958 // We make all tabs positions all relative Sections[0].Width to make code simpler
9959 float tab_x1 = tab->Offset - sections[0].Width + (order > sections[0].TabCount - 1 ? -margin : 0.0f);
9960 float tab_x2 = tab->Offset - sections[0].Width + tab->Width + (order + 1 < tab_bar->Tabs.Size - sections[2].TabCount ? margin : 1.0f);
9961 tab_bar->ScrollingTargetDistToVisibility = 0.0f;
9962 if (tab_bar->ScrollingTarget > tab_x1 || (tab_x2 - tab_x1 >= scrollable_width))
9963 {
9964 // Scroll to the left
9965 tab_bar->ScrollingTargetDistToVisibility = ImMax(tab_bar->ScrollingAnim - tab_x2, 0.0f);
9966 tab_bar->ScrollingTarget = tab_x1;
9967 }
9968 else if (tab_bar->ScrollingTarget < tab_x2 - scrollable_width)
9969 {
9970 // Scroll to the right
9971 tab_bar->ScrollingTargetDistToVisibility = ImMax((tab_x1 - scrollable_width) - tab_bar->ScrollingAnim, 0.0f);
9972 tab_bar->ScrollingTarget = tab_x2 - scrollable_width;
9973 }
9974}
9975
9976void ImGui::TabBarQueueFocus(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, ImGuiTabItem* tab)
9977{
9978 tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId = tab->ID;
9979}
9980
9981void ImGui::TabBarQueueFocus(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, const char* tab_name)
9982{
9983 IM_ASSERT((tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_DockNode) == 0); // Only supported for manual/explicit tab bars
9984 ImGuiID tab_id = TabBarCalcTabID(tab_bar, tab_name, NULL);
9985 tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId = tab_id;
9986}
9987
9988void ImGui::TabBarQueueReorder(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, ImGuiTabItem* tab, int offset)
9989{
9990 IM_ASSERT(offset != 0);
9991 IM_ASSERT(tab_bar->ReorderRequestTabId == 0);
9992 tab_bar->ReorderRequestTabId = tab->ID;
9993 tab_bar->ReorderRequestOffset = (ImS16)offset;
9994}
9995
9996void ImGui::TabBarQueueReorderFromMousePos(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, ImGuiTabItem* src_tab, ImVec2 mouse_pos)
9997{
9998 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9999 IM_ASSERT(tab_bar->ReorderRequestTabId == 0);
10000 if ((tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable) == 0)
10001 return;
10002
10003 const bool is_central_section = (src_tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_SectionMask_) == 0;
10004 const float bar_offset = tab_bar->BarRect.Min.x - (is_central_section ? tab_bar->ScrollingTarget : 0);
10005
10006 // Count number of contiguous tabs we are crossing over
10007 const int dir = (bar_offset + src_tab->Offset) > mouse_pos.x ? -1 : +1;
10008 const int src_idx = tab_bar->Tabs.index_from_ptr(src_tab);
10009 int dst_idx = src_idx;
10010 for (int i = src_idx; i >= 0 && i < tab_bar->Tabs.Size; i += dir)
10011 {
10012 // Reordered tabs must share the same section
10013 const ImGuiTabItem* dst_tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[i];
10014 if (dst_tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoReorder)
10015 break;
10016 if ((dst_tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_SectionMask_) != (src_tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_SectionMask_))
10017 break;
10018 dst_idx = i;
10019
10020 // Include spacing after tab, so when mouse cursor is between tabs we would not continue checking further tabs that are not hovered.
10021 const float x1 = bar_offset + dst_tab->Offset - g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x;
10022 const float x2 = bar_offset + dst_tab->Offset + dst_tab->Width + g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x;
10023 //GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(ImVec2(x1, tab_bar->BarRect.Min.y), ImVec2(x2, tab_bar->BarRect.Max.y), IM_COL32(255, 0, 0, 255));
10024 if ((dir < 0 && mouse_pos.x > x1) || (dir > 0 && mouse_pos.x < x2))
10025 break;
10026 }
10027
10028 if (dst_idx != src_idx)
10029 TabBarQueueReorder(tab_bar, src_tab, dst_idx - src_idx);
10030}
10031
10032bool ImGui::TabBarProcessReorder(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar)
10033{
10034 ImGuiTabItem* tab1 = TabBarFindTabByID(tab_bar, tab_bar->ReorderRequestTabId);
10035 if (tab1 == NULL || (tab1->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoReorder))
10036 return false;
10037
10038 //IM_ASSERT(tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable); // <- this may happen when using debug tools
10039 int tab2_order = TabBarGetTabOrder(tab_bar, tab1) + tab_bar->ReorderRequestOffset;
10040 if (tab2_order < 0 || tab2_order >= tab_bar->Tabs.Size)
10041 return false;
10042
10043 // Reordered tabs must share the same section
10044 // (Note: TabBarQueueReorderFromMousePos() also has a similar test but since we allow direct calls to TabBarQueueReorder() we do it here too)
10045 ImGuiTabItem* tab2 = &tab_bar->Tabs[tab2_order];
10046 if (tab2->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoReorder)
10047 return false;
10048 if ((tab1->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_SectionMask_) != (tab2->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_SectionMask_))
10049 return false;
10050
10051 ImGuiTabItem item_tmp = *tab1;
10052 ImGuiTabItem* src_tab = (tab_bar->ReorderRequestOffset > 0) ? tab1 + 1 : tab2;
10053 ImGuiTabItem* dst_tab = (tab_bar->ReorderRequestOffset > 0) ? tab1 : tab2 + 1;
10054 const int move_count = (tab_bar->ReorderRequestOffset > 0) ? tab_bar->ReorderRequestOffset : -tab_bar->ReorderRequestOffset;
10055 memmove(dst_tab, src_tab, move_count * sizeof(ImGuiTabItem));
10056 *tab2 = item_tmp;
10057
10058 if (tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_SaveSettings)
10059 MarkIniSettingsDirty();
10060 return true;
10061}
10062
10063static ImGuiTabItem* ImGui::TabBarScrollingButtons(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar)
10064{
10065 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10066 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
10067
10068 const ImVec2 arrow_button_size(g.FontSize - 2.0f, g.FontSize + g.Style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f);
10069 const float scrolling_buttons_width = arrow_button_size.x * 2.0f;
10070
10071 const ImVec2 backup_cursor_pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
10072 //window->DrawList->AddRect(ImVec2(tab_bar->BarRect.Max.x - scrolling_buttons_width, tab_bar->BarRect.Min.y), ImVec2(tab_bar->BarRect.Max.x, tab_bar->BarRect.Max.y), IM_COL32(255,0,0,255));
10073
10074 int select_dir = 0;
10075 ImVec4 arrow_col = g.Style.Colors[ImGuiCol_Text];
10076 arrow_col.w *= 0.5f;
10077
10078 PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Text, arrow_col);
10079 PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Button, ImVec4(0, 0, 0, 0));
10080 PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags_ButtonRepeat, true);
10081 const float backup_repeat_delay = g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay;
10082 const float backup_repeat_rate = g.IO.KeyRepeatRate;
10083 g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay = 0.250f;
10084 g.IO.KeyRepeatRate = 0.200f;
10085 float x = ImMax(tab_bar->BarRect.Min.x, tab_bar->BarRect.Max.x - scrolling_buttons_width);
10086 window->DC.CursorPos = ImVec2(x, tab_bar->BarRect.Min.y);
10087 if (ArrowButtonEx("##<", ImGuiDir_Left, arrow_button_size, ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClick))
10088 select_dir = -1;
10089 window->DC.CursorPos = ImVec2(x + arrow_button_size.x, tab_bar->BarRect.Min.y);
10090 if (ArrowButtonEx("##>", ImGuiDir_Right, arrow_button_size, ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClick))
10091 select_dir = +1;
10092 PopItemFlag();
10093 PopStyleColor(2);
10094 g.IO.KeyRepeatRate = backup_repeat_rate;
10095 g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay = backup_repeat_delay;
10096
10097 ImGuiTabItem* tab_to_scroll_to = NULL;
10098 if (select_dir != 0)
10099 if (ImGuiTabItem* tab_item = TabBarFindTabByID(tab_bar, tab_bar->SelectedTabId))
10100 {
10101 int selected_order = TabBarGetTabOrder(tab_bar, tab_item);
10102 int target_order = selected_order + select_dir;
10103
10104 // Skip tab item buttons until another tab item is found or end is reached
10105 while (tab_to_scroll_to == NULL)
10106 {
10107 // If we are at the end of the list, still scroll to make our tab visible
10108 tab_to_scroll_to = &tab_bar->Tabs[(target_order >= 0 && target_order < tab_bar->Tabs.Size) ? target_order : selected_order];
10109
10110 // Cross through buttons
10111 // (even if first/last item is a button, return it so we can update the scroll)
10112 if (tab_to_scroll_to->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_Button)
10113 {
10114 target_order += select_dir;
10115 selected_order += select_dir;
10116 tab_to_scroll_to = (target_order < 0 || target_order >= tab_bar->Tabs.Size) ? tab_to_scroll_to : NULL;
10117 }
10118 }
10119 }
10120 window->DC.CursorPos = backup_cursor_pos;
10121 tab_bar->BarRect.Max.x -= scrolling_buttons_width + 1.0f;
10122
10123 return tab_to_scroll_to;
10124}
10125
10126static ImGuiTabItem* ImGui::TabBarTabListPopupButton(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar)
10127{
10128 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10129 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
10130
10131 // We use g.Style.FramePadding.y to match the square ArrowButton size
10132 const float tab_list_popup_button_width = g.FontSize + g.Style.FramePadding.y;
10133 const ImVec2 backup_cursor_pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
10134 window->DC.CursorPos = ImVec2(tab_bar->BarRect.Min.x - g.Style.FramePadding.y, tab_bar->BarRect.Min.y);
10135 tab_bar->BarRect.Min.x += tab_list_popup_button_width;
10136
10137 ImVec4 arrow_col = g.Style.Colors[ImGuiCol_Text];
10138 arrow_col.w *= 0.5f;
10139 PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Text, arrow_col);
10140 PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Button, ImVec4(0, 0, 0, 0));
10141 bool open = BeginCombo("##v", NULL, ImGuiComboFlags_NoPreview | ImGuiComboFlags_HeightLargest);
10142 PopStyleColor(2);
10143
10144 ImGuiTabItem* tab_to_select = NULL;
10145 if (open)
10146 {
10147 for (int tab_n = 0; tab_n < tab_bar->Tabs.Size; tab_n++)
10148 {
10149 ImGuiTabItem* tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[tab_n];
10150 if (tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_Button)
10151 continue;
10152
10153 const char* tab_name = TabBarGetTabName(tab_bar, tab);
10154 if (Selectable(tab_name, tab_bar->SelectedTabId == tab->ID))
10155 tab_to_select = tab;
10156 }
10157 EndCombo();
10158 }
10159
10160 window->DC.CursorPos = backup_cursor_pos;
10161 return tab_to_select;
10162}
10163
10164//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
10165// [SECTION] Widgets: BeginTabItem, EndTabItem, etc.
10166//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
10167// - BeginTabItem()
10168// - EndTabItem()
10169// - TabItemButton()
10170// - TabItemEx() [Internal]
10171// - SetTabItemClosed()
10172// - TabItemCalcSize() [Internal]
10173// - TabItemBackground() [Internal]
10174// - TabItemLabelAndCloseButton() [Internal]
10175//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
10176
10177bool ImGui::BeginTabItem(const char* label, bool* p_open, ImGuiTabItemFlags flags)
10178{
10179 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10180 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
10181 if (window->SkipItems)
10182 return false;
10183
10184 ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar = g.CurrentTabBar;
10185 if (tab_bar == NULL)
10186 {
10187 IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(tab_bar, "Needs to be called between BeginTabBar() and EndTabBar()!");
10188 return false;
10189 }
10190 IM_ASSERT((flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_Button) == 0); // BeginTabItem() Can't be used with button flags, use TabItemButton() instead!
10191
10192 bool ret = TabItemEx(tab_bar, label, p_open, flags, NULL);
10193 if (ret && !(flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoPushId))
10194 {
10195 ImGuiTabItem* tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[tab_bar->LastTabItemIdx];
10196 PushOverrideID(tab->ID); // We already hashed 'label' so push into the ID stack directly instead of doing another hash through PushID(label)
10197 }
10198 return ret;
10199}
10200
10201void ImGui::EndTabItem()
10202{
10203 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10204 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
10205 if (window->SkipItems)
10206 return;
10207
10208 ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar = g.CurrentTabBar;
10209 if (tab_bar == NULL)
10210 {
10211 IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(tab_bar != NULL, "Needs to be called between BeginTabBar() and EndTabBar()!");
10212 return;
10213 }
10214 IM_ASSERT(tab_bar->LastTabItemIdx >= 0);
10215 ImGuiTabItem* tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[tab_bar->LastTabItemIdx];
10216 if (!(tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoPushId))
10217 PopID();
10218}
10219
10220bool ImGui::TabItemButton(const char* label, ImGuiTabItemFlags flags)
10221{
10222 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10223 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
10224 if (window->SkipItems)
10225 return false;
10226
10227 ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar = g.CurrentTabBar;
10228 if (tab_bar == NULL)
10229 {
10230 IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(tab_bar != NULL, "Needs to be called between BeginTabBar() and EndTabBar()!");
10231 return false;
10232 }
10233 return TabItemEx(tab_bar, label, NULL, flags | ImGuiTabItemFlags_Button | ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoReorder, NULL);
10234}
10235
10236void ImGui::TabItemSpacing(const char* str_id, ImGuiTabItemFlags flags, float width)
10237{
10238 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10239 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
10240 if (window->SkipItems)
10241 return;
10242
10243 ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar = g.CurrentTabBar;
10244 if (tab_bar == NULL)
10245 {
10246 IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(tab_bar != NULL, "Needs to be called between BeginTabBar() and EndTabBar()!");
10247 return;
10248 }
10249 SetNextItemWidth(width);
10250 TabItemEx(tab_bar, str_id, NULL, flags | ImGuiTabItemFlags_Button | ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoReorder | ImGuiTabItemFlags_Invisible, NULL);
10251}
10252
10253bool ImGui::TabItemEx(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, const char* label, bool* p_open, ImGuiTabItemFlags flags, ImGuiWindow* docked_window)
10254{
10255 // Layout whole tab bar if not already done
10256 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10257 if (tab_bar->WantLayout)
10258 {
10259 ImGuiNextItemData backup_next_item_data = g.NextItemData;
10260 TabBarLayout(tab_bar);
10261 g.NextItemData = backup_next_item_data;
10262 }
10263 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
10264 if (window->SkipItems)
10265 return false;
10266
10267 const ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
10268 const ImGuiID id = TabBarCalcTabID(tab_bar, label, docked_window);
10269
10270 // If the user called us with *p_open == false, we early out and don't render.
10271 // We make a call to ItemAdd() so that attempts to use a contextual popup menu with an implicit ID won't use an older ID.
10272 IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_INFO(id, label, g.LastItemData.StatusFlags);
10273 if (p_open && !*p_open)
10274 {
10275 ItemAdd(ImRect(), id, NULL, ImGuiItemFlags_NoNav);
10276 return false;
10277 }
10278
10279 IM_ASSERT(!p_open || !(flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_Button));
10280 IM_ASSERT((flags & (ImGuiTabItemFlags_Leading | ImGuiTabItemFlags_Trailing)) != (ImGuiTabItemFlags_Leading | ImGuiTabItemFlags_Trailing)); // Can't use both Leading and Trailing
10281
10282 // Store into ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoCloseButton, also honor ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoCloseButton passed by user (although not documented)
10283 if (flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoCloseButton)
10284 p_open = NULL;
10285 else if (p_open == NULL)
10286 flags |= ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoCloseButton;
10287
10288 // Acquire tab data
10289 ImGuiTabItem* tab = TabBarFindTabByID(tab_bar, id);
10290 bool tab_is_new = false;
10291 if (tab == NULL)
10292 {
10293 tab_bar->Tabs.push_back(ImGuiTabItem());
10294 tab = &tab_bar->Tabs.back();
10295 tab->ID = id;
10296 tab_bar->TabsAddedNew = tab_is_new = true;
10297 }
10298 tab_bar->LastTabItemIdx = (ImS16)tab_bar->Tabs.index_from_ptr(tab);
10299
10300 // Calculate tab contents size
10301 ImVec2 size = TabItemCalcSize(label, (p_open != NULL) || (flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_UnsavedDocument));
10302 tab->RequestedWidth = -1.0f;
10303 if (g.NextItemData.HasFlags & ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_HasWidth)
10304 size.x = tab->RequestedWidth = g.NextItemData.Width;
10305 if (tab_is_new)
10306 tab->Width = ImMax(1.0f, size.x);
10307 tab->ContentWidth = size.x;
10308 tab->BeginOrder = tab_bar->TabsActiveCount++;
10309
10310 const bool tab_bar_appearing = (tab_bar->PrevFrameVisible + 1 < g.FrameCount);
10311 const bool tab_bar_focused = (tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_IsFocused) != 0;
10312 const bool tab_appearing = (tab->LastFrameVisible + 1 < g.FrameCount);
10313 const bool tab_just_unsaved = (flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_UnsavedDocument) && !(tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_UnsavedDocument);
10314 const bool is_tab_button = (flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_Button) != 0;
10315 tab->LastFrameVisible = g.FrameCount;
10316 tab->Flags = flags;
10317 tab->Window = docked_window;
10318
10319 // Append name _WITH_ the zero-terminator
10320 // (regular tabs are permitted in a DockNode tab bar, but window tabs not permitted in a non-DockNode tab bar)
10321 if (docked_window != NULL)
10322 {
10323 IM_ASSERT(tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_DockNode);
10324 tab->NameOffset = -1;
10325 }
10326 else
10327 {
10328 tab->NameOffset = (ImS32)tab_bar->TabsNames.size();
10329 tab_bar->TabsNames.append(label, label + ImStrlen(label) + 1);
10330 }
10331
10332 // Update selected tab
10333 if (!is_tab_button)
10334 {
10335 if (tab_appearing && (tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_AutoSelectNewTabs) && tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId == 0)
10336 if (!tab_bar_appearing || tab_bar->SelectedTabId == 0)
10337 TabBarQueueFocus(tab_bar, tab); // New tabs gets activated
10338 if ((flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_SetSelected) && (tab_bar->SelectedTabId != id)) // _SetSelected can only be passed on explicit tab bar
10339 TabBarQueueFocus(tab_bar, tab);
10340 }
10341
10342 // Lock visibility
10343 // (Note: tab_contents_visible != tab_selected... because CTRL+TAB operations may preview some tabs without selecting them!)
10344 bool tab_contents_visible = (tab_bar->VisibleTabId == id);
10345 if (tab_contents_visible)
10346 tab_bar->VisibleTabWasSubmitted = true;
10347
10348 // On the very first frame of a tab bar we let first tab contents be visible to minimize appearing glitches
10349 if (!tab_contents_visible && tab_bar->SelectedTabId == 0 && tab_bar_appearing && docked_window == NULL)
10350 if (tab_bar->Tabs.Size == 1 && !(tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_AutoSelectNewTabs))
10351 tab_contents_visible = true;
10352
10353 // Note that tab_is_new is not necessarily the same as tab_appearing! When a tab bar stops being submitted
10354 // and then gets submitted again, the tabs will have 'tab_appearing=true' but 'tab_is_new=false'.
10355 if (tab_appearing && (!tab_bar_appearing || tab_is_new))
10356 {
10357 ItemAdd(ImRect(), id, NULL, ImGuiItemFlags_NoNav);
10358 if (is_tab_button)
10359 return false;
10360 return tab_contents_visible;
10361 }
10362
10363 if (tab_bar->SelectedTabId == id)
10364 tab->LastFrameSelected = g.FrameCount;
10365
10366 // Backup current layout position
10367 const ImVec2 backup_main_cursor_pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
10368
10369 // Layout
10370 const bool is_central_section = (tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_SectionMask_) == 0;
10371 size.x = tab->Width;
10372 if (is_central_section)
10373 window->DC.CursorPos = tab_bar->BarRect.Min + ImVec2(IM_TRUNC(tab->Offset - tab_bar->ScrollingAnim), 0.0f);
10374 else
10375 window->DC.CursorPos = tab_bar->BarRect.Min + ImVec2(tab->Offset, 0.0f);
10376 ImVec2 pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
10377 ImRect bb(pos, pos + size);
10378
10379 // We don't have CPU clipping primitives to clip the CloseButton (until it becomes a texture), so need to add an extra draw call (temporary in the case of vertical animation)
10380 const bool want_clip_rect = is_central_section && (bb.Min.x < tab_bar->ScrollingRectMinX || bb.Max.x > tab_bar->ScrollingRectMaxX);
10381 if (want_clip_rect)
10382 PushClipRect(ImVec2(ImMax(bb.Min.x, tab_bar->ScrollingRectMinX), bb.Min.y - 1), ImVec2(tab_bar->ScrollingRectMaxX, bb.Max.y), true);
10383
10384 ImVec2 backup_cursor_max_pos = window->DC.CursorMaxPos;
10385 ItemSize(bb.GetSize(), style.FramePadding.y);
10386 window->DC.CursorMaxPos = backup_cursor_max_pos;
10387
10388 if (!ItemAdd(bb, id))
10389 {
10390 if (want_clip_rect)
10391 PopClipRect();
10392 window->DC.CursorPos = backup_main_cursor_pos;
10393 return tab_contents_visible;
10394 }
10395
10396 // Click to Select a tab
10397 ImGuiButtonFlags button_flags = ((is_tab_button ? ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClickRelease : ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClick) | ImGuiButtonFlags_AllowOverlap);
10398 if (g.DragDropActive && !g.DragDropPayload.IsDataType(IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_WINDOW)) // FIXME: May be an opt-in property of the payload to disable this
10399 button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnDragDropHold;
10400 bool hovered, held, pressed;
10401 if (flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_Invisible)
10402 hovered = held = pressed = false;
10403 else
10404 pressed = ButtonBehavior(bb, id, &hovered, &held, button_flags);
10405 if (pressed && !is_tab_button)
10406 TabBarQueueFocus(tab_bar, tab);
10407
10408 // Transfer active id window so the active id is not owned by the dock host (as StartMouseMovingWindow()
10409 // will only do it on the drag). This allows FocusWindow() to be more conservative in how it clears active id.
10410 if (held && docked_window && g.ActiveId == id && g.ActiveIdIsJustActivated)
10411 g.ActiveIdWindow = docked_window;
10412
10413 // Drag and drop a single floating window node moves it
10414 ImGuiDockNode* node = docked_window ? docked_window->DockNode : NULL;
10415 const bool single_floating_window_node = node && node->IsFloatingNode() && (node->Windows.Size == 1);
10416 if (held && single_floating_window_node && IsMouseDragging(0, 0.0f))
10417 {
10418 // Move
10419 StartMouseMovingWindow(docked_window);
10420 }
10421 else if (held && !tab_appearing && IsMouseDragging(0))
10422 {
10423 // Drag and drop: re-order tabs
10424 int drag_dir = 0;
10425 float drag_distance_from_edge_x = 0.0f;
10426 if (!g.DragDropActive && ((tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable) || (docked_window != NULL)))
10427 {
10428 // While moving a tab it will jump on the other side of the mouse, so we also test for MouseDelta.x
10429 if (g.IO.MouseDelta.x < 0.0f && g.IO.MousePos.x < bb.Min.x)
10430 {
10431 drag_dir = -1;
10432 drag_distance_from_edge_x = bb.Min.x - g.IO.MousePos.x;
10433 TabBarQueueReorderFromMousePos(tab_bar, tab, g.IO.MousePos);
10434 }
10435 else if (g.IO.MouseDelta.x > 0.0f && g.IO.MousePos.x > bb.Max.x)
10436 {
10437 drag_dir = +1;
10438 drag_distance_from_edge_x = g.IO.MousePos.x - bb.Max.x;
10439 TabBarQueueReorderFromMousePos(tab_bar, tab, g.IO.MousePos);
10440 }
10441 }
10442
10443 // Extract a Dockable window out of it's tab bar
10444 const bool can_undock = docked_window != NULL && !(docked_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove) && !(node->MergedFlags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoUndocking);
10445 if (can_undock)
10446 {
10447 // We use a variable threshold to distinguish dragging tabs within a tab bar and extracting them out of the tab bar
10448 bool undocking_tab = (g.DragDropActive && g.DragDropPayload.SourceId == id);
10449 if (!undocking_tab) //&& (!g.IO.ConfigDockingWithShift || g.IO.KeyShift)
10450 {
10451 float threshold_base = g.FontSize;
10452 float threshold_x = (threshold_base * 2.2f);
10453 float threshold_y = (threshold_base * 1.5f) + ImClamp((ImFabs(g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceAbs[0].x) - threshold_base * 2.0f) * 0.20f, 0.0f, threshold_base * 4.0f);
10454 //GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(ImVec2(bb.Min.x - threshold_x, bb.Min.y - threshold_y), ImVec2(bb.Max.x + threshold_x, bb.Max.y + threshold_y), IM_COL32_WHITE); // [DEBUG]
10455
10456 float distance_from_edge_y = ImMax(bb.Min.y - g.IO.MousePos.y, g.IO.MousePos.y - bb.Max.y);
10457 if (distance_from_edge_y >= threshold_y)
10458 undocking_tab = true;
10459 if (drag_distance_from_edge_x > threshold_x)
10460 if ((drag_dir < 0 && TabBarGetTabOrder(tab_bar, tab) == 0) || (drag_dir > 0 && TabBarGetTabOrder(tab_bar, tab) == tab_bar->Tabs.Size - 1))
10461 undocking_tab = true;
10462 }
10463
10464 if (undocking_tab)
10465 {
10466 // Undock
10467 // FIXME: refactor to share more code with e.g. StartMouseMovingWindow
10468 DockContextQueueUndockWindow(&g, docked_window);
10469 g.MovingWindow = docked_window;
10470 SetActiveID(g.MovingWindow->MoveId, g.MovingWindow);
10471 g.ActiveIdClickOffset -= g.MovingWindow->Pos - bb.Min;
10472 g.ActiveIdNoClearOnFocusLoss = true;
10473 SetActiveIdUsingAllKeyboardKeys();
10474 }
10475 }
10476 }
10477
10478#if 0
10479 if (hovered && g.HoveredIdNotActiveTimer > TOOLTIP_DELAY && bb.GetWidth() < tab->ContentWidth)
10480 {
10481 // Enlarge tab display when hovering
10482 bb.Max.x = bb.Min.x + IM_TRUNC(ImLerp(bb.GetWidth(), tab->ContentWidth, ImSaturate((g.HoveredIdNotActiveTimer - 0.40f) * 6.0f)));
10483 display_draw_list = GetForegroundDrawList(window);
10484 TabItemBackground(display_draw_list, bb, flags, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_TitleBgActive));
10485 }
10486#endif
10487
10488 // Render tab shape
10489 const bool is_visible = (g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Visible) && !(flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_Invisible);
10490 if (is_visible)
10491 {
10492 ImDrawList* display_draw_list = window->DrawList;
10493 const ImU32 tab_col = GetColorU32((held || hovered) ? ImGuiCol_TabHovered : tab_contents_visible ? (tab_bar_focused ? ImGuiCol_TabSelected : ImGuiCol_TabDimmedSelected) : (tab_bar_focused ? ImGuiCol_Tab : ImGuiCol_TabDimmed));
10494 TabItemBackground(display_draw_list, bb, flags, tab_col);
10495 if (tab_contents_visible && (tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_DrawSelectedOverline) && style.TabBarOverlineSize > 0.0f)
10496 {
10497 // Might be moved to TabItemBackground() ?
10498 ImVec2 tl = bb.GetTL() + ImVec2(0, 1.0f * g.CurrentDpiScale);
10499 ImVec2 tr = bb.GetTR() + ImVec2(0, 1.0f * g.CurrentDpiScale);
10500 ImU32 overline_col = GetColorU32(tab_bar_focused ? ImGuiCol_TabSelectedOverline : ImGuiCol_TabDimmedSelectedOverline);
10501 if (style.TabRounding > 0.0f)
10502 {
10503 float rounding = style.TabRounding;
10504 display_draw_list->PathArcToFast(tl + ImVec2(+rounding, +rounding), rounding, 7, 9);
10505 display_draw_list->PathArcToFast(tr + ImVec2(-rounding, +rounding), rounding, 9, 11);
10506 display_draw_list->PathStroke(overline_col, 0, style.TabBarOverlineSize);
10507 }
10508 else
10509 {
10510 display_draw_list->AddLine(tl - ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f), tr - ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f), overline_col, style.TabBarOverlineSize);
10511 }
10512 }
10513 RenderNavCursor(bb, id);
10514
10515 // Select with right mouse button. This is so the common idiom for context menu automatically highlight the current widget.
10516 const bool hovered_unblocked = IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup);
10517 if (tab_bar->SelectedTabId != tab->ID && hovered_unblocked && (IsMouseClicked(1) || IsMouseReleased(1)) && !is_tab_button)
10518 TabBarQueueFocus(tab_bar, tab);
10519
10520 if (tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_NoCloseWithMiddleMouseButton)
10521 flags |= ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoCloseWithMiddleMouseButton;
10522
10523 // Render tab label, process close button
10524 const ImGuiID close_button_id = p_open ? GetIDWithSeed("#CLOSE", NULL, docked_window ? docked_window->ID : id) : 0;
10525 bool just_closed;
10526 bool text_clipped;
10527 TabItemLabelAndCloseButton(display_draw_list, bb, tab_just_unsaved ? (flags & ~ImGuiTabItemFlags_UnsavedDocument) : flags, tab_bar->FramePadding, label, id, close_button_id, tab_contents_visible, &just_closed, &text_clipped);
10528 if (just_closed && p_open != NULL)
10529 {
10530 *p_open = false;
10531 TabBarCloseTab(tab_bar, tab);
10532 }
10533
10534 // Forward Hovered state so IsItemHovered() after Begin() can work (even though we are technically hovering our parent)
10535 // That state is copied to window->DockTabItemStatusFlags by our caller.
10536 if (docked_window && (hovered || g.HoveredId == close_button_id))
10537 g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredWindow;
10538
10539 // Tooltip
10540 // (Won't work over the close button because ItemOverlap systems messes up with HoveredIdTimer-> seems ok)
10541 // (We test IsItemHovered() to discard e.g. when another item is active or drag and drop over the tab bar, which g.HoveredId ignores)
10542 // FIXME: This is a mess.
10543 // FIXME: We may want disabled tab to still display the tooltip?
10544 if (text_clipped && g.HoveredId == id && !held)
10545 if (!(tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_NoTooltip) && !(tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoTooltip))
10546 SetItemTooltip("%.*s", (int)(FindRenderedTextEnd(label) - label), label);
10547 }
10548
10549 // Restore main window position so user can draw there
10550 if (want_clip_rect)
10551 PopClipRect();
10552 window->DC.CursorPos = backup_main_cursor_pos;
10553
10554 IM_ASSERT(!is_tab_button || !(tab_bar->SelectedTabId == tab->ID && is_tab_button)); // TabItemButton should not be selected
10555 if (is_tab_button)
10556 return pressed;
10557 return tab_contents_visible;
10558}
10559
10560// [Public] This is call is 100% optional but it allows to remove some one-frame glitches when a tab has been unexpectedly removed.
10561// To use it to need to call the function SetTabItemClosed() between BeginTabBar() and EndTabBar().
10562// Tabs closed by the close button will automatically be flagged to avoid this issue.
10563void ImGui::SetTabItemClosed(const char* label)
10564{
10565 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10566 bool is_within_manual_tab_bar = g.CurrentTabBar && !(g.CurrentTabBar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_DockNode);
10567 if (is_within_manual_tab_bar)
10568 {
10569 ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar = g.CurrentTabBar;
10570 ImGuiID tab_id = TabBarCalcTabID(tab_bar, label, NULL);
10571 if (ImGuiTabItem* tab = TabBarFindTabByID(tab_bar, tab_id))
10572 tab->WantClose = true; // Will be processed by next call to TabBarLayout()
10573 }
10574 else if (ImGuiWindow* window = FindWindowByName(label))
10575 {
10576 if (window->DockIsActive)
10577 if (ImGuiDockNode* node = window->DockNode)
10578 {
10579 ImGuiID tab_id = TabBarCalcTabID(node->TabBar, label, window);
10580 TabBarRemoveTab(node->TabBar, tab_id);
10581 window->DockTabWantClose = true;
10582 }
10583 }
10584}
10585
10586ImVec2 ImGui::TabItemCalcSize(const char* label, bool has_close_button_or_unsaved_marker)
10587{
10588 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10589 ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
10590 ImVec2 size = ImVec2(label_size.x + g.Style.FramePadding.x, label_size.y + g.Style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f);
10591 if (has_close_button_or_unsaved_marker)
10592 size.x += g.Style.FramePadding.x + (g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x + g.FontSize); // We use Y intentionally to fit the close button circle.
10593 else
10594 size.x += g.Style.FramePadding.x + 1.0f;
10595 return ImVec2(ImMin(size.x, TabBarCalcMaxTabWidth()), size.y);
10596}
10597
10598ImVec2 ImGui::TabItemCalcSize(ImGuiWindow* window)
10599{
10600 return TabItemCalcSize(window->Name, window->HasCloseButton || (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_UnsavedDocument));
10601}
10602
10603void ImGui::TabItemBackground(ImDrawList* draw_list, const ImRect& bb, ImGuiTabItemFlags flags, ImU32 col)
10604{
10605 // While rendering tabs, we trim 1 pixel off the top of our bounding box so they can fit within a regular frame height while looking "detached" from it.
10606 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10607 const float width = bb.GetWidth();
10608 IM_UNUSED(flags);
10609 IM_ASSERT(width > 0.0f);
10610 const float rounding = ImMax(0.0f, ImMin((flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_Button) ? g.Style.FrameRounding : g.Style.TabRounding, width * 0.5f - 1.0f));
10611 const float y1 = bb.Min.y + 1.0f;
10612 const float y2 = bb.Max.y - g.Style.TabBarBorderSize;
10613 draw_list->PathLineTo(ImVec2(bb.Min.x, y2));
10614 draw_list->PathArcToFast(ImVec2(bb.Min.x + rounding, y1 + rounding), rounding, 6, 9);
10615 draw_list->PathArcToFast(ImVec2(bb.Max.x - rounding, y1 + rounding), rounding, 9, 12);
10616 draw_list->PathLineTo(ImVec2(bb.Max.x, y2));
10617 draw_list->PathFillConvex(col);
10618 if (g.Style.TabBorderSize > 0.0f)
10619 {
10620 draw_list->PathLineTo(ImVec2(bb.Min.x + 0.5f, y2));
10621 draw_list->PathArcToFast(ImVec2(bb.Min.x + rounding + 0.5f, y1 + rounding + 0.5f), rounding, 6, 9);
10622 draw_list->PathArcToFast(ImVec2(bb.Max.x - rounding - 0.5f, y1 + rounding + 0.5f), rounding, 9, 12);
10623 draw_list->PathLineTo(ImVec2(bb.Max.x - 0.5f, y2));
10624 draw_list->PathStroke(GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border), 0, g.Style.TabBorderSize);
10625 }
10626}
10627
10628// Render text label (with custom clipping) + Unsaved Document marker + Close Button logic
10629// We tend to lock style.FramePadding for a given tab-bar, hence the 'frame_padding' parameter.
10630void ImGui::TabItemLabelAndCloseButton(ImDrawList* draw_list, const ImRect& bb, ImGuiTabItemFlags flags, ImVec2 frame_padding, const char* label, ImGuiID tab_id, ImGuiID close_button_id, bool is_contents_visible, bool* out_just_closed, bool* out_text_clipped)
10631{
10632 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10633 ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
10634
10635 if (out_just_closed)
10636 *out_just_closed = false;
10637 if (out_text_clipped)
10638 *out_text_clipped = false;
10639
10640 if (bb.GetWidth() <= 1.0f)
10641 return;
10642
10643 // In Style V2 we'll have full override of all colors per state (e.g. focused, selected)
10644 // But right now if you want to alter text color of tabs this is what you need to do.
10645#if 0
10646 const float backup_alpha = g.Style.Alpha;
10647 if (!is_contents_visible)
10648 g.Style.Alpha *= 0.7f;
10649#endif
10650
10651 // Render text label (with clipping + alpha gradient) + unsaved marker
10652 ImRect text_ellipsis_clip_bb(bb.Min.x + frame_padding.x, bb.Min.y + frame_padding.y, bb.Max.x - frame_padding.x, bb.Max.y);
10653
10654 // Return clipped state ignoring the close button
10655 if (out_text_clipped)
10656 {
10657 *out_text_clipped = (text_ellipsis_clip_bb.Min.x + label_size.x) > text_ellipsis_clip_bb.Max.x;
10658 //draw_list->AddCircle(text_ellipsis_clip_bb.Min, 3.0f, *out_text_clipped ? IM_COL32(255, 0, 0, 255) : IM_COL32(0, 255, 0, 255));
10659 }
10660
10661 const float button_sz = g.FontSize;
10662 const ImVec2 button_pos(ImMax(bb.Min.x, bb.Max.x - frame_padding.x - button_sz), bb.Min.y + frame_padding.y);
10663
10664 // Close Button & Unsaved Marker
10665 // We are relying on a subtle and confusing distinction between 'hovered' and 'g.HoveredId' which happens because we are using ImGuiButtonFlags_AllowOverlapMode + SetItemAllowOverlap()
10666 // 'hovered' will be true when hovering the Tab but NOT when hovering the close button
10667 // 'g.HoveredId==id' will be true when hovering the Tab including when hovering the close button
10668 // 'g.ActiveId==close_button_id' will be true when we are holding on the close button, in which case both hovered booleans are false
10669 bool close_button_pressed = false;
10670 bool close_button_visible = false;
10671 bool is_hovered = g.HoveredId == tab_id || g.HoveredId == close_button_id || g.ActiveId == tab_id || g.ActiveId == close_button_id; // Any interaction account for this too.
10672
10673 if (close_button_id != 0)
10674 {
10675 if (is_contents_visible)
10676 close_button_visible = (g.Style.TabCloseButtonMinWidthSelected < 0.0f) ? true : (is_hovered && bb.GetWidth() >= ImMax(button_sz, g.Style.TabCloseButtonMinWidthSelected));
10677 else
10678 close_button_visible = (g.Style.TabCloseButtonMinWidthUnselected < 0.0f) ? true : (is_hovered && bb.GetWidth() >= ImMax(button_sz, g.Style.TabCloseButtonMinWidthUnselected));
10679 }
10680
10681 // When tabs/document is unsaved, the unsaved marker takes priority over the close button.
10682 const bool unsaved_marker_visible = (flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_UnsavedDocument) != 0 && (button_pos.x + button_sz <= bb.Max.x) && (!close_button_visible || !is_hovered);
10683 if (unsaved_marker_visible)
10684 {
10685 const ImRect bullet_bb(button_pos, button_pos + ImVec2(button_sz, button_sz));
10686 RenderBullet(draw_list, bullet_bb.GetCenter(), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text));
10687 }
10688 else if (close_button_visible)
10689 {
10690 ImGuiLastItemData last_item_backup = g.LastItemData;
10691 if (CloseButton(close_button_id, button_pos))
10692 close_button_pressed = true;
10693 g.LastItemData = last_item_backup;
10694
10695 // Close with middle mouse button
10696 if (is_hovered && !(flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoCloseWithMiddleMouseButton) && IsMouseClicked(2))
10697 close_button_pressed = true;
10698 }
10699
10700 // This is all rather complicated
10701 // (the main idea is that because the close button only appears on hover, we don't want it to alter the ellipsis position)
10702 // FIXME: if FramePadding is noticeably large, ellipsis_max_x will be wrong here (e.g. #3497), maybe for consistency that parameter of RenderTextEllipsis() shouldn't exist..
10703 float ellipsis_max_x = text_ellipsis_clip_bb.Max.x;
10704 if (close_button_visible || unsaved_marker_visible)
10705 {
10706 const bool visible_without_hover = unsaved_marker_visible || (is_contents_visible ? g.Style.TabCloseButtonMinWidthSelected : g.Style.TabCloseButtonMinWidthUnselected) < 0.0f;
10707 if (visible_without_hover)
10708 {
10709 text_ellipsis_clip_bb.Max.x -= button_sz * 0.90f;
10710 ellipsis_max_x -= button_sz * 0.90f;
10711 }
10712 else
10713 {
10714 text_ellipsis_clip_bb.Max.x -= button_sz * 1.00f;
10715 }
10716 }
10717 LogSetNextTextDecoration("/", "\\");
10718 RenderTextEllipsis(draw_list, text_ellipsis_clip_bb.Min, text_ellipsis_clip_bb.Max, ellipsis_max_x, label, NULL, &label_size);
10719
10720#if 0
10721 if (!is_contents_visible)
10722 g.Style.Alpha = backup_alpha;
10723#endif
10724
10725 if (out_just_closed)
10726 *out_just_closed = close_button_pressed;
10727}
10728
10729
10730#endif // #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE
KeyCode::V
@ V
KeyCode::S
@ S
KeyCode::End
@ End
KeyCode::T
@ T
KeyCode::H
